<< Back to Search Results

3D Visualization Specialist
Req. ID: 40340
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Los Angeles-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.
 

The Role

The 3D Visualization Specialist is responsible for the creation of computer generated imagery. Primary tasks will involve creating pre-rendered assets for use in marketing materials and in-vehicle interfaces and maintaining vehicle master files for use in real-time review sessions, but will also be called upon for other visualization tasks based on the skillset. This position may also involve R&D in virtual reality.

The ability to interact well and fit into a small, highly motivated, multi-functional team that is working in a rapid, simultaneous engineering environment is essential. The role offers the rare opportunity to take ownership in the development of new and genuinely cutting edge vehicles, so enthusiasm and knowledge of cars is advantageous. You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles in the world.  

You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products -- not presentations. This must excite you. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned Designers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.
 

Responsibilities

The successful candidate must have the ability to meet tight deadlines, have strong interpersonal and communication skills, be detail oriented, and have the ability to work independently.  He/she must establish and maintain a professional working relationship with external and internal teams at all levels across the company.  Typical job duties may include but are not limited to the following:
 

  • Shading / Lighting / Texturing.
  • Compositing / Post-processing.
  • Maintaining vehicle master files for real-time use.
  • Rigging mechanical systems.
  • Animating cameras / vehicles.
  • Researching and developing pipeline solutions and techniques.
  • Interfacing with design, engineering, web, stores and manufacturing to provide visualization solutions.
  • Supporting legacy projects.
  • Troubleshooting.
  • Modeling of digital assets.
     

Qualifications

  • Bachelor Degree in visualization for film, tv, digital media, or design or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • Must be proficient in Maya, Vray, and Nuke.
  • Experience with VRED, Deltagen, Unreal or any real-time engine ideal.
  • Scripting and automotive experience a plus.
  • Receptive to learning new tools and exchanging knowledge.
  • Accustomed to going above and beyond.
  • Excellent communicator, team player, resourceful, organized and mindful of time management.

5 Axis Laser Programmer/Operator
Req. ID: 40714
Office Location: NA-US-MI-Grand Rapids
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

Create and write programs for 5 axis laser as well as operation.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Promote and ensure safe working practices and healthy work environment
  • Promote team work
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area
  • Any other duties that may be assigned by department Manager
  • Create programs for 5 axis laser using Work NC software
  • Operate 5 axis laser
  • Design and build laser cutting fixtures
  • Create and compile necessary documents to aid setting up machine
  • Responsible for ensuring quality standards
  • Report all safety issues in writing to the appropriate department Supervisor, Operations Managers and Health and Safety Specialists
  • Report all maintenance issues in writing to the appropriate department Supervisor, Operations Managers and the Associate Manager of Maintenance

 

Requirements:

  • High School diploma or GED
  • At least 3 years’ experience on laser machines
  • At least 1 year of experience with a 5 axis laser
  • Knowledge of Work NC 5 axis laser programming
  • Strong computer skills, knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Able to work with and give feedback to department Supervisors to resolve issues on the shop floor
  • Working knowledge of 5S and Lean Manufacturing
  • Ability to work with different types of people
  • Must be organized and self-motivated
  • Must have strong verbal nd written communication skills
  • Strong decision making skills
  • Basic math skills
  • Must have attention to detail
  • Able to lift at 50 lbs.

<< Back to Search Results

Application Engineer
Req. ID: 38824
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

Be a key technical member of a cross functional business team that focuses on evaluating and defining new Tesla Energy opportunities, and working to deploy product against them. You will be the bridge between business development and Tesla’s technology as it applies to large scale utility projects and larger (100kWh+) behind the meter projects.  

Responsibilities

  • Act as the technical point of contact both internally and externally with customers to describe and articulate how Tesla’s technology can/would be deployed in various applications
  • Evaluate integration context for battery systems (electrical, mechanical, permitting) and make integration recommendations
  • Work with external counterparties to identify best technical fit of Tesla’s battery systems
  • Develop technical or process documentation in support of project evaluation and deployments
  • Manage integration and first stage deployment process, both on site and remotely
  • Understand, define, and disseminate functional requirements from the market, coordinating with internal business team members

Requirements

  • BS/MS Electrical Engineering
  • Demonstrated application of analysis, design and testing to solve complex engineering problems
  • Strong knowledge of engineering fundamentals – mechanical, electrical, and thermal – is expected.
  • Besides a rock-solid work ethic and a strong team oriented personality, members of our team display creativity, passion, and a desire to break new ground in a constantly shifting technology landscape.

Application Software Engineer
Req. ID: 40710
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Job description

As an application software engineer on the Firmware Platforms and Infrastructure team, you’ll apply software engineering skills to develop continuous integration infrastructure, GUI tools, web apps, and automatic code generation tools for embedded software systems used In Tesla vehicles and Tesla Energy systems. You will be building tools that enhance the efficiency of the entire embedded software development organization through improved code reuse, eliminating redundancy, and automation.

Requirements

  • Proven track record in developing solutions quickly in a variety of programming and scripting languages
    • Experience with Java and Python programming languages
    • Experience with web application development (Javascript, HTML)
    • Familiarity with database concepts and SQL
  • Experience with standard version control systems (Git), build systems (Makefiles/Scons), and release management tools (Jenkins, Jira)
  • Familiarity with agile build and development process
  • Ability to integrate, synthesize and prioritize user demands and resolve ambiguity
  • Ability to quickly shift to a variety of development environments and manage multiple on-going projects
  • A proven track record of delivering high-quality reliable build / testing systems
Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Assembly Technician- Cell Engineering
Req. ID: 38580
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Assembly Technician - Cell Engineering

  1. The Role
  • Utilize specialized equipment to make cells of different sizes and form factors and chemistry.
  1. Responsibilities
  • Assembly of a variety of different lithium ion cell prototypes
  • Document build data with the use of travelers and process documents
  • Assist in the optimization of process parameters to improve yield and consistency
  • Above average manual dexterity and average visual acuity are required in order to perform delicate assembly tasks
  1. Requirements
  • Hands on builder type personality
  • Familiar with the quality control methods to evaluate the repeatability of assembly processes
  • Performed maintenance and calibration of  process equipment
  • Must be able to work successfully in a multicultural environment
  • Very detailed oriented personality required
  • Understanding of lithium ion battery safety and dangers
  • Experience operating mixing, coating, pressing,  slitting, winding operations in building lithium ion cells is preferred

<< Back to Search Results

Associate Design Engineer- Body Systems
Req. ID: 42570
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

The Associate Design Engineer for Body-in-White is responsible for engineering best-in-class body structure architectures and systems for Tesla’s premium vehicle programs. You will Conceptualize, Design, Engineer, Release, Develop and Launch Body Structure components and systems.

 

The Responsibilities

  • Create and develop Body-in-White component and system requirements and specifications to achieve best-in-class structural, NVH and crash performance.
  • Create vehicle-aligned component and system targets for function, cost, weight and investment.
  • Establish system architecture and functional feasibility.
  • Develop design concepts and production designs in both CATIA V5 and CATIA V6.
  • Optimize the concepts and designs with analytical and physical assessments, ensuring conformation to federal regulations governing assigned systems.
  • Complete and release system, sub-system and detail designs.
  • Deliver world-class craftsmanship and fit/finish.
  • Support creation of component specification, component DFMEA, DVP&R and other technical design documents.
  • Release parts for production in the PLM system.
  • Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, validation, and other engineering activities as specified for the assigned commodity. Note that in most cases, Tesla Vehicle Engineering will design commodities for the Model S in-house.
  • Create (with component/system supplier) component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods.
  • Complete component and system validation as required, insuring system targets are met and optimized.

 

The Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science or higher in mechanical engineering; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 1-4 years experience in automotive body design and engineering
  • Minimum of 1 full development BIW life cycle through design, development, release and launch
  • Proficiency in both CATIA V5 and CATIA V6.
  • Understanding of GD&T in design engineering
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs
  • Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs
  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects with tight timing constraints
  • Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes and lightweight, recyclable and sustainable materials (aluminum preferred)
  • Ability to flexibly work in vague and constantly changing design direction and conditions.
  • Experience in DFSS highly preferred.

 

 

 

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Associate Manager (Battery Pack & Module Line) Night Shift
Req. ID: 40066
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Employee

Description

Associate Manager, Powertrain Production

 

About Tesla:

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role: Responsible for meeting production demand and improving operations by hiring and training associates, driving continuous improvements to meet quality standards and optimizing flow, capacity, ergonomics, safety, etc.


Responsibilities:

  • Drive production output, efficiency & cost improvements through bottleneck management
  • Create, track & use metrics that emphasizes safety, quality, efficiency & cost
  • Setting up quality gates and quality assurances in line
  • Maintain and ensure compliance with process documentation for standardized work
  • Promote cross training, job flexibility and versatility of staff, including development of training schedule
  • Work with cross functional team to create efficient job station layouts
  • Understand machine capacity, create machine line loads and implement equipment contingency plans
  • Partner with Powertrain Management, Maintenance, and Engineering teams to develop and execute production ramps
  • Complete new job time studies using prototype, conceptual and/or final parts
  • Utilize systems like MES to ensure accuracy of product builds and consumption
  • Work with production Control to improve logistic methods and control inventory levels
  • Ensure all safety rules are enforced, including an understanding of OSHA safety requirements
  • Manage team of 100+ associates plus 4+ supervisors.
  • Responsible for improving Production KPIs including quality, yield, and productivity

Requirements:

  • Possess and demonstrate leadership skills in a production environment.
  • Experience supervising large teams.
  • Experience resolving conflict.
  • Experience in hiring and developing team members and leaders.
  • Experience in new product development and launch activities.
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  • Effectively communicate to all levels in the organization, including large group presentations and translate complex ideas into a simple easy to understand format.
  • Foster a professional atmosphere of respect and growth.
  • Demonstrate problem solving skills (man, method, machine, material, etc...).
  • Knowledge of daily startup qualification procedures and SPC
  • Able to effectively multitask
  • Minimum Bachelor’s Degree Required.
  • Minimum of 7-10 years of related experience.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Associate Manager (Small & Large Drive Unit)
Req. ID: 40067
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Employee

Description

Associate Manager, Powertrain Production

 

About Tesla:

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role: Responsible for meeting production demand and improving operations by hiring and training associates, driving continuous improvements to meet quality standards and optimizing flow, capacity, ergonomics, safety, etc.


Responsibilities:

  • Drive production output, efficiency & cost improvements through bottleneck management
  • Create, track & use metrics that emphasizes safety, quality, efficiency & cost
  • Setting up quality gates and quality assurances in line

Associate Manager - General Assembly,
Req. ID: 37673
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

Role: Associate Manager – Production, General Assembly

Responsibilities

  • Develop & maintain standardized work Instructions used in production by the production associates.
  • Support the development of Process Failure Modes Effects Analysis (PFMEA) to identify critical risks in the production processes with the Manufacturing Process Engineers.
  • Develop training programs and hiring plans for production associates.
  • Support of control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the production process.
  • Manage Supervisors, Leads and Production Associates and develop the team structures used in the Tesla Factory.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.

Requirements

  • BS or higher degree or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 10+ years experience working in a fast paced, high volume manufacturing environment.
  • Experience and thorough knowledge of production systems and processes.
  • Experience managing teams of people in a production environment.
  • Experience in new product development and launch activities.
  • Experience with broad variety of measurement and inspection techniques.
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs).
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills.
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success.
  • Experience in hiring and developing new team members in a production environment.
  • Work efficiently and productively in independent and team settings.
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills.
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project).

<< Back to Search Results

Associate Manager, Bumper Fascia & Underbody Aeroshields – Vehicle Exterior Systems
Req. ID: 41540
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Req: Associate Manager, Bumper Fascia & Underbody Aeroshields – Vehicle Exterior Systems

The Role

The Associate Manager will lead the team of Engineers to deliver Front and Rear Fascia assemblies for the Vehicle Exterior group. You will be responsible for leading the design direction and signing off on Engineering of  ‘A class’ plastic moldings, including painted, mold in color, chromed components for future vehicle lines including, but not limited to:

·        Front & Rear Fascia Moldings, including all decorative trims, chromes, painted, mold in color

·        Integration to vehicle

·        Ultrasonic parking sensor brackets

·        Fog lamp mounting brackets & ducting

·        Underbody Aero Shields

The successful candidate will have several years experience with large plastic moldings, as well as a proven ability to lead a team of Engineers to deliver all projects across current model engineering and future model engineering. The manager will give technical input to the team relating to design for injection molding, vehicle datum strategies, designing out cosmetic defects, ensuring Craftsmanship fit and finish. The Associate Manager will be the point of contact for the team and will broadly manage the workload of team members, whilst encouraging autonomous working.

You will be part of the team that creates and executes world class systems in terms of styling, function and customer quality. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering entire systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Engineering Manager of Exterior Systems.

Responsibilities

As part of Tesla’s Vehicle engineering team you will design release and launch Exterior components and subsystems, aligned with program product profile with responsibilities to include:

·        Concept Engineering & feasibility

·        Packaging & layout within vehicle architecture

·        Design to deliver customer-driven Exterior system targets for Craftsmanship, function, cost and weight.

·        Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost.

·        Detail Design including datum & fixation strategy, GD&T

·        Complete and release component & sub system design, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (In-house designs are planned for most major commodities).

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program.

·        Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design

·        Collaborate with key suppliers & tool makers to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.

·        Collaborate with cross functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.

·        Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

·        Approve tooling, material injection and gating strategy

Requirements

• Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

• Evidence of following the design process from initial concept stages through tooling release and production launch, having completed 3D and 2D CAD in Catia V5. Other CAD experience will be considered but ultimately Catia V5 will be used.

• Automotive Engineering with components in the Exterior environment preferred

• Experience managing suppliers for product development.

• Have a good mix of designing a variety of materials (stamped, injection mold, cast, etc.) and designing kinematics/ mechanisms.

• Understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering between low/high volume, entry/premium vehicle systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.

• Have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.

• Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.

•Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.

• Strong familiarity with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents.

• Demonstrate an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout your career.

<< Back to Search Results

Associate Manager, Production Planning
Req. ID: 41817
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable Production Planning, Associate Manager to work in Production Control Scheduling.   The ideal candidate will have experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products.  The Planner will work with Manufacturing and Master Scheduling to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals including LEAN manufacturing principals.  This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate production plans, and executing successfully against those plans.  

Responsibilities

·         Lead a team of Production Planners responsible for planning, scheduling, and managing production output to delivering time-critical components to support all production areas in a 24x7 operation.

·         Work with manufacturing to establish the appropriate production quantity and frequency for Just-In-Time delivery and line-side kanban; coordinate with Material Planners and Conveyance as needed.

·         Maintain accurate open Work Order lines to define target build quantities, identify system demand or BOM issues, and resolve inventory discrepancies.

·         Generate and provide forecasts on a regular basis to support production build plan, minimize overtime, and optimize inventory levels.

·         Provide & generate ideas & insight into production methodologies, improvement activities & relevant benchmarking in support of efficient production across production lines & support processes.

·         Support maintenance of MRP master data parameters to ensure accurate signals for quantity and dates generated by MRP (i.e. production lead times, lot sizing, and safety stock) to minimize excess.

·         Develop & maintain metrics on departmental responsibilities as defined above.

·         Collaborate with Purchasing and Engineering to coordinate Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) to plan for material and product end of life (EoL) and minimize obsolescence.

·         Identify potential production risks to align processes with production plan milestones, and support resolution of the same through creative planning.

·         Drive implementation of systematic solutions to control inventory flow, minimize shortages, and maintain inventory accuracy.

·         Provide ongoing transparency of inventory levels and ensure continuous inventory accuracy.

·         Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as material planners, manufacturing engineers, and conveyance personnel.

·         Assist with inventory control activities.

·         Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

·         Bachelor’s degree.

·         5 - 10+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company.

·         2-5+ years’ experience in a leadership role.

·         Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize production costs and inventory levels.

·         Proficiency in MS Excel required (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, etc.).

·         Proficiency in SAP, or other ERP system desired.

·         Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One a bonus.

·         Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand.

·         Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment.

·         Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude.

·         Strong work ethics.

Associate Manufacturing Engineer
Req. ID: 39788
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Job Description:

 

Essential Functions and Duties:

  • Develop, design and qualify high-precision BIW Process and Tooling
  • Directly responsible for the manufacturability of a world class BIW, from design concept to the mass production ramp
  • Directly responsible for achieving BIW quality targets and leading all activities towards this objective
  • Specify BIW quality targets that support Tesla world class Vehicle build objectives
  • Develop and implement strategy and plan to achieve these targets – Quality control plans, Dimensional improvement plans
  • Develop GD&T strategy to ensure a world class quality level BIW
  • Drive Tooling design and development in accordance with process plan and GD&T strategy
  • Provide detailed assessments and critical Design For Manufacture (DFM) reviews of Product, Process and Tooling designs
  • Develop and implement Processes, Equipment and Tooling for Prototype builds
  • Manage Prototype builds with the goal of identifying and highlighting manufacturability issues during these builds to ensure that established product quality targets are met at the start of production
  • Interact with and manage outside vendors as necessary based on project scope
  • Provide leadership and supervision to manufacturing engineers and cross-functional teams

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of related experience developing and launching complex assembly processes or designing high-precision assembly Fixtures
  • Should be able to function independently, be a strong team player, detail oriented, organized, hands-on and able to make strong decisions
  • Must have a solid working knowledge of Design For Manufacturability
  • Strong ability to conceptualize and develop GD&T schemes
  • Work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Maintain flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments, coping with rapidly changing information
  • Results and data driven; able to effect change based on data
  • Proficiency in CATIA and DELMIA
  • Extensive proficiency in documentation of manufacturing processes
  • Communicate clearly using written and verbal skills
  • Willingness to travel to different vendor sites – 5% travel

Associate Materials Manager
Req. ID: 41145
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Livermore-201-Discovery-Dr-Warehouse
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Associate Materials Manager will be part of the Production Control Team within the Material Handling and Inventory Control group and will be responsible for designing and developing inventory movement and storage systems from storage or staging to production line side locations, for improving productivity and efficiency of operations, and for managing conveyance staff.  These activities will take place primarily at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but can also include operations at our Deer Creek facility.  The primary objective of the Material Handling and Inventory Control Group is to implement an efficient receiving, warehouse, material handling, and conveyance solution to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates. This position will report to the Materials Manager, depending on Warehouse or Conveyance needs.

 

Responsibilities:

·         Design, develop, and implement solutions for dramatically improving material flows through the factory using Lean Principles.  The design includes material arrival at docks through staging for delivery to line-side locations.  The focus will be on developing innovative new solutions for manufacturing that leverage automated systems.

·         Ability to foster and develop a strong team of material handling personnel through selective recruitment, thorough and consistent on-boarding process, training, and coaching, and identification and addressing of competency gaps within team.  Management of team includes proactively planning for labor needs in light of production ramp up, communicating job expectations, performing employee performance and objectives reviews, and managing team in alignment of company policies and procedures.

·         Ability to meet materials operations financial objectives by preparing budgets, forecasting requirements, planning for capital expenditures, securing company property and assets, and analyzing and resolving inventory variances.

·         Capable of defining material  operations systems to include:  developing processes for materials related activities, defining materials related aspects of new production lines, determining equipment needs and utilization, defining storage and material handling requirements, and ability to integrate and align physical processes with systematic processes.

·         Drive improvements within material flow by planning layout and space requirements, reducing line impact, analyzing and reviewing product flow, and evaluating and proposing new equipment options.

·         Maintains safe work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures.  It also requiring coaching and motivating team to proactively address potential safety issues and concerns.

·         Support advanced trouble-shooting and improvement of existing warehouse management, inventory control, and material flow systems.

·         Targeted goals include but not limited to:

·         Safety focus

·         People Management (Systematic and physically)

·         5S standards

·         Line down time / Productivity / hours per car

·         Reduction in material handling waste

·         Reduction of in-house receiving lead-time

·         Significant improvement in labor efficiency

·         Optimized space utilization

·         Highly accurate part selection resulting in inventory accuracy levels above 99%

·         Reduction of information system transactional needs

 

Minimum Requirements:

·         Minimum 4 year degree in related field

·         5+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics experience desirable

·         Minimum of 3 years in a Supervisory/Management role

·         Demonstrated excellent communication skills, including ability to express well-reasoned, independent thought.  Natural ability to speak and write effectively at all organizational levels

·         Demonstrated ability to be a resilient change agent capable of leading organization through paradigm shifts

·         Strong knowledge of Production and Inventory Control within manufacturing environment with the ability to teach and coach others on best practices

·         Strong project management skills

·         Strong knowledge of material flow methodologies including sequencing, kitting, repack, etc.

·         Strong analytical and organizational skills. Ability to manage several complex projects at the same time with high degrees of variation and uncertainty.  Ability to understand and navigate through the intricacies of multiple systems

·         PC proficiency at an intermediate level

·         Understanding of lean manufacturing concepts with the ability to lead 5S and kaizen efforts for continuous improvement

 

Preferred Qualifications:

·         Master’s Degree in Engineering, Business or related program preferred

·         Experience applying and using material flow analysis tools, including simulation, time study analysis (dynamic and static)

·         Understanding of FTZ (foreign trade zone) and how to maintain required control of related inventory

·         Strong knowledge of material handling systems in a manufacturing or distribution system environment

·         Lean manufacturing principles implementation experience

Associate Materials Manager
Req. ID: 41146
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Associate Materials Manager will be part of the Production Control Team within the Material Handling and Inventory Control group and will be responsible for designing and developing inventory movement and storage systems from storage or staging to production line side locations, for improving productivity and efficiency of operations, and for managing conveyance staff.  These activities will take place primarily at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but can also include operations at our Deer Creek facility.  The primary objective of the Material Handling and Inventory Control Group is to implement an efficient receiving, warehouse, material handling, and conveyance solution to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates. This position will report to the Materials Manager, depending on Warehouse or Conveyance needs.

 

Responsibilities:

·         Design, develop, and implement solutions for dramatically improving material flows through the factory using Lean Principles.  The design includes material arrival at docks through staging for delivery to line-side locations.  The focus will be on developing innovative new solutions for manufacturing that leverage automated systems.

·         Ability to foster and develop a strong team of material handling personnel through selective recruitment, thorough and consistent on-boarding process, training, and coaching, and identification and addressing of competency gaps within team.  Management of team includes proactively planning for labor needs in light of production ramp up, communicating job expectations, performing employee performance and objectives reviews, and managing team in alignment of company policies and procedures.

·         Ability to meet materials operations financial objectives by preparing budgets, forecasting requirements, planning for capital expenditures, securing company property and assets, and analyzing and resolving inventory variances.

·         Drive improvements within material flow by planning layout and space requirements, reducing line impact, analyzing and reviewing product flow, and evaluating and proposing new equipment options.

·         Maintains safe work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures.  It also requiring coaching and motivating team to proactively address potential safety issues and concerns.

·         Safety focus

Associate Process Engineer, Powertrain Manufacturing Operations
Req. ID: 41944
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Associate Process Engineer, Powertrain Manufacturing Operations

About Tesla Motors

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.                                          

Position Description

Perform process sustaining and improvement activities for the Stator manufacturing lines and any other powertrain lines which may need assistance.  Tasks include such things as: disposition of non-conformant material, identification and execution of yield improvement, cost reductions, and process improvement projects. Sustaining of the line must also be done through the creation of meaningful metrics to ensure the stability of the process through the use of tools such as SPC.  You must also be able to provide process feedback to cross-functional teams as changes are made to the line’s product, equipment, and manufacturing instructions.  In addition to these tasks, the role supports the production team by providing knowledgeable feedback on part defects and specification conformance, correct process procedures, and the proper tooling and gauges to perform all necessary manufacturing tasks.

Candidates must be able to manage workload with a positive attitude and detailed thoroughness.  Many projects span across multiple teams so great communication and a team player mindset is a must.   

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • Establish real time SPC for all critical process parameters and drive Cpk >1.33
  • Responsible for yield improvement and sustained performance of the production line
  • Ensure that all non-conformant materials which are produced by manufacturing lines are dispositioned in real time
  • Maintain and help develop up-to-date process qualification to ensure the process baseline is available to production
  • Work with Equipment, Manufacturing, and Industrial Engineering teams to ensure manufacturing instructions and standard works are always accurate and representative of the actual processes on the floor.
  • Work with process sustaining technicians to support day to day coverage of production line process, including rapid response to out-of-control processes to minimize cost and maximize productivity.
  • Lead Lean Manufacturing and 5S initiatives.  Support the growth of the line by spreading and reinforcing these ideas.
  • Assist in the training of operators as needed.
  • Keep an up to date knowledge of processes, specifications, and quality criteria with respects to owned lines

The ideal candidate takes pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  They appreciate an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  They look forward to learning an incredible amount on the job through practice and constant observation.

Qualifications/Skills

  • BS/MS Degree on Chemical/Material/Electrical/Industrial/Mechanical Engineering.
  • Ability to manage projects across multiple different groups.
  • 1-3 years of experience in a manufacturing/industrial environment is preferred but not required.
  • Experience in electronic/mechanical assembly desired.
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, Power point, Visio, Access, JMP, etc).
  • CAD skills for the creation of fixtures, tools, and tooling modifications a strong plus
  • Knowledgeable about production quality metrics is a plus
  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of process development, Statistical Process Control (SPC), Design of Experiments (DOE), & FMEA fundamentals are required.
  • Electric drive-train operation knowledge desired
  • Intelligent Risk taking, Integrated thinking, strong leadership, strong problem solving, and technical communication skills a MUST.

Associate Production Planner
Req. ID: 39550
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable individual to work on our Production Planning team within the larger Production Control department. The ideal candidate will have experience in a fast-paced manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products. The Production Coordinator will work with Manufacturing and both the Materials and Demand Planning teams to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals including LEAN manufacturing principals. This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate production plans, coordinating the necessary functional pieces and executing successfully against those plans. Additionally, this role will involve working in a developing electronic-build-signal environment and contributing to the expansion of the e-signal JIT program.

Responsibilities

  • Support manufacturing by managing production output and delivering time-critical components to execute on master schedule as well as respond to unanticipated changes in production schedule.
  • Work with manufacturing teams to establish the appropriate production quantity and frequency for Just In Time delivery and line-side kanban; coordinate with Material Planner and Materials Conveyance teams as needed.
  • Maintain accurate open Work Order lines to define target build quantities, identify system demand or BOM issues, and resolve inventory discrepancies.
  • Support maintenance of MRP master data parameters to ensure accurate signals for quantity and dates generated by MRP (i.e. production lead times, lot sizing, and safety stock) to minimize excess.
  • Monitor KPIs for assigned areas of production in order to track materials and prevent excess inventory.
  • Collaborate with Purchasing and Engineering to coordinate Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) to plan for material and product end of life (EoL) and minimize obsolescence.
  • Identify potential production risks to align processes with production plan milestones.
  • Assist in implementing systematic solutions to control inventory flow, minimize shortages, and maintain inventory accuracy.
  • Provide ongoing transparency of inventory levels and ensure continuous inventory accuracy.
  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as material planners, manufacturing engineers, and conveyance personnel.
  • Assist with inventory control activities.
  • Generate and publish metrics of performance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or a related field OR equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 1 - 3+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company.
  • Experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment subject to rapid changes.
  • Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize delivery costs and inventory levels.
  • Experience in transitioning from a manual to automated production planning environment.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel required (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, etc.).
  • Maintains critical attention detail despite changes in work scope or focus.
  • Proficiency in SAP or other ERP system desired.
  • Working experience with Tableau a huge plus.
  • Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand.
  • Proficient in operations and/or project management.
  • Ability to strategically plan on a high level and execute on tactical implementation while solving for the challenge at hand.
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment.
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude with the ability to think outside the box for solutions to complex challenges.
  • Self-motivating and strong work ethics with a passion for being hands-on in their work.

Autopilot, Mechanical Design Engineer
Req. ID: 31852
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a mechanical design engineer with a minimum of 5-10 years of experience designing products for high-volume production. This engineer will have design and release responsibility for electro-mechanical assemblies in Tesla’s world-leading production EV’s.

Will be responsible for design and release of enclosures for Instrument Cluster, Media Control Unit, custom modules, brackets, user controls (switches, buttons, actuating mechanisms), etc., using your breadth in packaging of electronics devices and equipment and in selection of hardware.

Responsibilities

  • Assessing and documenting the requirements for a particular system.
  • Gathering input from team members and synthesizing inputs into a preferred concept.
  • Developing in CAD: system interfaces, master model and detailed part models, (Catia v5 preferred but not required).
  • Designing metal and plastic parts (formed, injection molded or die cast, machined, extruded, etc).
  • Creating 2-d part documentation appropriate for high-volume production methods and inspection methods (including GD&T).
  • Working with product lifecycle management software for managing and releasing structured bills-of-materials.
  • Fabricating proof-of-concept prototypes to validate feasibility of new designs.
  • Managing prototype vendors for parts fabrication.
  • Assembling prototype systems and testing these to validate design.

Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of materials properties and applications, fabrication methods.
  • Basic sense for thermal issues and cooling flow and methods.
  • Experience includes multiple projects taking parts from initial concept and design through to production.
  • Have a passion about electro-mechanical product design, inventing solutions, and finding better and simpler ways to meet product requirements.
  • Be able to perform required analysis to ensure a successful design (stress, strain, thermal, tolerance, cost and mass optimization, etc) or to direct resources for this work.
  • Have experience designing mechanical control outline drawings for PCBA’s, in specifying electrical connectors, in considering wiring and EM shielding, in managing heat within electronic assemblies, and in creating enclosures and structures to make a physical module which can be deployed into real-world customer applications.
  • Be able to present data/trade-offs to management to facilitate the making of decisions.
  • Have had primary technical and design responsibility for all aspects of small mechanical or electro-mechanical assemblies which were successfully produced in moderate to high volume.
  • Experience in safety critical industries (automotive, medical, aero-space) and in cost/weight critical applications is preferred.

Backend Maps Engineer - Navigation & Autopilot
Req. ID: 38675
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

We are looking for a motivated software engineer to help us advance the navigation and autopilot experience in our cars. As a backend maps engineer, your role will involve using sensor and telemetry data from our entire fleet combined with prorietary and open source data to create maps that will be directly utilized by autopilot, navigation, and our supercharger team. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated software engineer specializing in server-side software and backend development, preferably with some experience working with GIS data and conflation of multiple data sources. 

Responsibilities:

  • Build products and services such as directions, traffic, and vector tiles for autopilot and display.
  • Create algorithms and techniques for conflating data sources to create sensor-enriched map data for our fleet. 
  • Design and implement client-server protocols for transmitting map data to the car.
  • Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/Validation, and designers.

Requirements:

  • Proficient in Python.
  • Proficient in SQL, spatial databases (PostGIS).
  • High standards for code quality, maintainability, and performance.
  • Experience working with map data like OSM, TomTom, HERE, is a plus.
  • Experience with machine learning and clustering algorithms is a plus.

Battery Test Technician
Req. ID: 42032
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Battery Test Technician
 
The Role
The Cell Characterization Lab is expanding. We are looking for a test technician to help setup, run, and maintain the cell level cycle and storage testing of lithium ion cells.  This technician will assist in the upkeep and general maintenance of the lab.  This technician will be a hands-on builder type personality who has strict attention to detail.  Ideally, the candidate will have some testing experience in a lab setting as well as basic machine shop skills.
 
Responsibilities
•          Maintain and execute lithium ion cell tests using specialized test equipment.
•          Organization of test data into public database.
•          Design and build fixtures for battery testing.
•          Maintain ovens and temperatures chambers in battery lab
 
Requirements
•          Strict attention to detail
•          Understanding of lithium ion battery safety and dangers
•          Demonstrate exceptional organizational skills particularly with large amounts of electronic data
•          Working knowledge of Excel
•          Previous use of ARBIN or MACCOR equipment or similar electrical test equipment
•          Soldering, crimping, small fixture building and design
•          Familiarity with electronic circuits
•          Above average manual dexterity and average visual acuity are required in order to perform delicate assembly tasks.
•          Experience working with and testing lithium ion batteries a plus

CAD Engineer- Interior Systems
Req. ID: 37409
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered more than 2,400 Roadsters to customers worldwide and received more than 13,000 reservations for Model S. Model S, the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle, began deliveries to U.S. customers in June of this year and was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year.

The Role

As an Engineer – Soft/Hard Trim in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will be responsible for design, release and launch of the complete interior system for future Tesla vehicle product lines.  You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class interiors in terms of form, function and luxury. 

 

Commodities of particular importance include IP, Console, X Car Beam, Door Trim Panels, Hard Trim, Headliner Systems, Carpets, Insulators, Seats and Luggage Compartment Trim and the integration of these commodities into the vehicle. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Director of Body Engineering and this position resides in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team.

Responsibilities

  • Design of automotive component parts in CATIA V5.
  • Develop and execute interior system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned interior commodities.
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost
  • Implement processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive interior craftsmanship and fit & finish.
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments.
  • Complete and release interior components, sub-system and detail designs, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (in-house designs are planned for most major commodities).
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design.
  • Collaborate with key exterior system and plastic component suppliers and support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure exterior system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.
  • Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) with a minimum of 4 years of experience in automotive exterior trim component and subsystem engineering, demonstrating technical aptitude from concept through release and launch for production and 3D modeling proficiency in CATIA V5 and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Must understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering of premium luxury trim and systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.
  • Must have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling utilizing CATIA V5 (minimum of 5,000 hours or 3 years) within an automotive product development environment. 
  • Must be self-motivated.
  • Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.
  • Experience with technical documentation in at least 1 full lifecycle vehicle programs to include DVP&R and DFMEA.
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.
  • Demonstrated an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout career.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

CAE Engineer
Req. ID: 16772
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

We are looking for a CAE Engineer for our Powertrain Engineering Hardware Test and Analysis Team.

Responsibilities

  • Develop finite element models for analysis and optimization in collaboration with a small team of multi-disciplinary engineers.
  • Perform finite element modeling, modal linear/non-linear analysis on powertrain systems including battery enclosures, battery modules, electronic circuit boards and cooling systems to meet performance requirements, which include safety, reliability, weight and cost.
  • Develop and coordinate material testing procedures to carry out experiments to obtain model inputs in the support of finite element analysis.
  • Develop and cascade load cases that satisfy program and industry requirements.
  • Support body engineering team meetings with design direction based on analysis highlighting areas of concern and recommend solutions for changes to meet the requirements, and also recommend solutions for minimizing weight and cost.
  • Provide input in the creation of component specification, component DFMEA, and other technical design documents where analysis plays a central role.
  • Document technical data generated in performing the design analysis, supporting the project design reviews.

 

Requirements

  • BS, preferably MS or higher degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • 5+ years of experience in industry using finite element analysis techniques, solid mechanics, structural dynamics and numerical methods.
  • Automotive component/system design analysis including mechanical structure and crash analysis and fatigue durability analysis.
  • Interface with team to define scope of FEA needs for road load cases, FMVSS crash cases and durability cases to verify vehicle integrity.
  • Experience with LS-DYNA, NASTRAN, ANSYS, ABACUS or other similar FEM codes.  Knowledge of CATIA V5, a plus.
  • Experience with aluminum structures modeling, plastic component modeling and adhesive modeling (a plus)
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills and experience working with tight timing constraints.
  • Strong communication, organization and documentation skills.

Cafe Assistant, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 40997
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Position: Café Assistant, Gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Sweep and mop floors.
  • Clean building by emptying trash, sweeping, and cleaning surfaces.
  • Sort garbage and manage waste streams.
  • Clean café area, maintain counters, clean refrigerators, microwaves and other equipment.
  • Restock café area including refrigerators, brew coffee, and restock snacks, teas and condiments.
  • Steam-clean carpets.
  • Use cleaning solutions to remove stains and clean surfaces.
  • Use various abrasive cleaning agents.
  • Clean windows, glass partitions, and mirrors, using soapy water or other cleaners, sponges, and squeegees.
  • Dust furniture and scrub surfaces clean.
  • Apply wax to coat floors and buff.
  • Apply sealant to floors.
  • Clean and service restrooms with mops and disinfectants.
  • Move heavy equipment and furniture.
  • Identify and report possible repairs.
  • Fix minor plumbing leaks.
  • Shovel snow from sidewalks and sprinkle salt on surface.
  • Operate janitorial equipment including floor cleaners and ride-on carts.

Requirements

  • Excellent communication skills, must be fluent in English.
  • Minimum 1-2 years’ experience as a janitor/cleaner or other related field.
  • Previous food handling experience preferred.
  • Energetic and flexible with ability to work in a fast paced environment.
  • High school diploma preferred.

Castings Production Associate
Req. ID: 39669

Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role


Production Associate - Castings


The successful candidate has a proven record of success in the application of production systems in any type of manufacturing environment.  They will participate in the development and application of Tesla’s Production System for the stamping of the Tesla Model S.  Excellent attendance is crucial for team to achieve success. He/she must have the ability to work with various teams in assembly including engineering, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues/ corrective actions identified in production and field performance. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla and outside. The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded. 


Responsibilities

·         Demonstrated ability to perform standardized work process and defined work instructions.

·         Understands and ensures adherence to required procedures and processes.

·         Evaluates the assembly processes and equipment to look for continuous improvement opportunities.

·         Acts as a consultant to other production/engineering groups on quality issues.

·         Analyze quality data to determine and drive the desired outcome.

·         Excellent written and verbal communication skills and people skills, comfortable presenting ideas and issues to peer groups and leaders.

·         Escalates functional and process failures to the appropriate support groups and leaders.

·         Capable to develop and follow non-verbal communication (visual management: signs, work place organization, and pictures).

·         Assist in the process design and tooling improvements – comfortable in suggesting and implementing new ideas that improve quality, reduce cost, support production work environment.

·         Understands that there are always new opportunities for improvement and eliminate waste.

·         Ability to learn quickly and self-motivated.

·         Positive energy and attitude, happy

·         Poise when confronted with sudden setback or stressful situations.

·         Willingness to operate in a dynamic environment and team structure.

·         Working  for extended periods of time

·         Lifting objects up to 30lbs

·         Use of tools that may produce vibration during use

·         Use of complex tooling that requires specialized training

·         Wearing Personal Protective Equipment: safety glasses, vests, shoes, hard hats

·         Physical work including but not limited to pushing, pulling, gripping, twisting, reaching, etc.

·         Working in a manufacturing environment

·         Ability to follow a required specific sequence of steps in a process repetitively for an extended period of time

·         Ability to adjust to immediate process change due to process/shop improvement

·         Perseverance in extensive process root cause analysis and countermeasure implementation

Requirements

·         The candidate should have hands-on experience and proven track record in production in any high quality cutting edge products.

·         MS Office programs (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) experience

·         May provide functional supervision in the absence of the supervisor.

·         Production environment with team involvement

·         Use of assembly equipment and tooling (power tools, automated equipment)

·         Must stand for long periods of time on the production floor

·         Experience with manufacturing in consumer electronics, medical device and solar industry

·         Possible weekend work and overtime required

Chassis Controls System Design Engineer
Req. ID: 38659
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla
Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.
 
Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.
 
The Role
The Chassis Controls System Design Engineer will drive chassis controls software design to meet high-level program functional requirements and integrate sub-system components seamlessly into the vehicle system. The incumbent will work independently and with other Tesla teams to develop and verify system function, as well as support validation team in design and execution of regression tests.
 
Responsibilities
  • Own system software functional requirements and interface specification
  • Lead functional safety analysis ensure goals are met by design and implementation
  • Contribute to overall system architecture and design
  • Develop deep understanding of sub-systems and related ECUs
  • Manage internal and external development tickets and work flow in the context of broader FW releases and initiatives
  • Own high-level system and sub-system test strategy and ensure good coverage at all levels
  • Interact with all levels of engineering to gather best possible system understanding
  • Test new features and feedback results to development teams
Functional Scope
  • Stability control
  • Traction control
  • Steering controller
  • Brakes controller
  • Suspension controller
Requirements
  • BS or higher degree in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience with evidence of exceptional ability
  • Meticulous, methodical and thorough
  • Self-directing and independent; capable of prioritizing work
  • Desire to develop, manage and execute work plans
  • Desire and ability to travel as required

Chassis Dynamics Engineer
Req. ID: 29014
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Title: Chassis Dynamics Engineer

About the Team

The Vehicle Dynamics team is responsible for developing the unparalleled ride, handling and performance attributes of all Tesla vehicles. In a fast-paced and constantly changing environment we deliver performance characteristics that help define the brand. We are looking for a skilled and passionate group members who will provide innovative and efficient solutions while meeting demanding timelines and superior performance requirements.

The Role

As part of the Vehicle Engineering team, the Engineer, Vehicle Dynamics will be responsible for qualitative and quantitative on-vehicle dynamics development. Technical investigations will include ride and handling drives, data acquisition and analysis as well as application of vehicle models. Duties include working within Vehicle Dynamics team but also cross-functionally at Tesla to meet performance goals and communicate results within demanding timelines. This is a hands-on role requiring a high level of self-direction, proven ability and flexibility.

Responsibilities

  • Perform ride and handling development and system checks
    • Active and passive
    • Road and track
  • Generate engineering data for all activities
  • Clearly communicate findings in a timely manor
  • Meet timing goals while maintaining flexibility
  • Participate in rig testing
  • Participate in design, program and product reviews and provide supported feedback.

Requirements & Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Physics or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • 5+ years proven success in passive and active Vehicle development.
  • Knowledge in vehicle instrumentation and data analysis.
  • Expertise in performance vehicle drive and tuning, with a desire to improve.
  • An insatiable desire to develop ultimate vehicle performance characteristics.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Experience working in a complex, dynamic and fast-paced environment.
  • Creative problem solver interested in new ideas and approaches.
  • Experience developing performance goals for different specifications of vehicle, markets, controls and autonomous vehicles a plus.
  • Desire for continued learning.

Chassis Systems Firmware Manager
Req. ID: 38020
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role
Tesla is looking for a strong leader to design and develop firmware for its current and next generations of chassis control systems. We have some exciting new projects in the areas of suspension, steering, and braking -- and are staffing aggressively to develop capabilities in these areas. You will need to be able to contribute to cross-functional system architecture, software system design, and rapid prototyping before developing a production solution. Most importantly, as the leader of a group that is growing quickly, you must be able to hire top talent and grow a high-performing team while developing and championing your vision for the technology.
 
Responsibilities
  • Grow a team of highly effective, highly innovative embedded firmware engineers
  • Set the technology vision and strategy for chassis control firmware systems, in collaboration with the chassis hardware, system engineering, vehicle dynamics, modeling, and system integration teams
  • Lead, and contribute to, technical requirements, architecture, and interface design documents
  • Design and lead development of real-time embedded firmware that implements control and safety management of the chassis control functions
  • Evaluate control strategies and algorithms
  • Develop, and lead execution of, test strategies and test plans
Requirements
  • Extensive experience leading development of complex real-time embedded software systems
  • Understanding of digital control systems fundamentals
  • Understanding of vehicle dynamics fundamentals
  • Experience with failure/safety analysis and decomposition (eg. DFMEA, fault tree, ASIL analysis)
  • Strong intuition for, and interest in, designing systems for testability and scalability
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Experience writing and reviewing technical specifications
  • 5 years experience in engineering management
  • BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or Mechanical Engineering, or the equivalent in experience with evidence of exceptional ability
