Compliance Engineer
Req. ID: 24367
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

 

Tesla’s Stationary Storage group is looking for a Compliance Engineer for their residential and industrial scale battery and inverter products. As a Compliance expert for Tesla you will be responsible for product and system level compliance, ensuring all regulatory requirements are met to facilitate global market access, brand protection and consumer safety. In addition you will have the unique opportunity to contribute to the building of Tesla’s Compliance Team, which is still in its infancy.

Networking with internal Tesla groups, external NRTLs and committees in all matters of regulatory compliance including Safety, EMC, and Environmental testing to achieve product conformity. A hands on role with full responsibility.

You will create test plans, execute tests and manage NRTLs to ensure the successful completion of products in line with their program schedules.    

 

Responsibilities

·         Ensure all product regulatory requirements are identified and met.

·         Make decisions regarding the most appropriate test conditions and setups.

·         Generate test plans, document results and present findings.

·         Compliance testing to UL, IEC, FCC, CSA and other applicable standards.

·         Maintain product technical files.

·         Organization and prioritization of product testing to meet program schedules.

·         Manage third party NRTL’s.

·         Utilize technical rational and influence NRTL decisions.

·         Ensure the availability of test equipment, chambers, and 3 rd  party test labs to meet the schedule.

·         Maintain and enhance knowledge base utilizing committee memberships, subscriptions, and attending conferences.

·         Site test and customer support.

·         Developing compliance documentation.

·         Support the setup and maintenance of an internal satellite test program.

·         Identify creative ways to overcome compliance obstacles.

·         Drive root cause analysis of failures and participate in finding solutions.

 

Requirements

·         3-5 years of experience testing complex electro-mechanical products for safety, EMC and environmental compliance

·         Worked within the guidelines of ISO 17025

·         Comfort defining, instrumenting, and working with high voltage, high power AC and DC test setups

·         Demonstrated experience creating, maintaining and communicating schedules

·         Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills

·         Strong engineering fundamentals and intuition, and the ability to drive root cause analysis of failures

·         Experience certifying products (preferably a battery or inverter product) to UL and IEC standards

·         The ideal candidate has worked with a multitude of energy storage and grid connection standards. Ideally drawn from the list below.

Battery: - UL 1973, UN38.3, UN 3481, IEC 62619

Product: - CSA 22.2 No.107.1, UL 1741, IEC 62109-1 & -2, FCC Part 15, IEC 61000-6-x, UL 9540, VDE 0124

Global grid codes: - Inc. IEEE 1547, RD, CEI, G59 / G83, VDE 4105, UL 1998

Install Codes: - Inc. NEC NFPA 70, IEC 60364-x, CEC

Environmental: - REACH, RoHS, WEEE, Battery Directive

EU Directives: - LVD, EMCD, PED

·         Experience working with 3 rd  party test labs

·         Degree or MS in an electrical engineering discipline

Component Validation Engineer
Req. ID: 26624
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

?About Tesla Energy

Tesla Energy is bringing battery technology to the grid to facilitate a renewable energy ecosystem and increase grid reliability in places where it is lacking.  Tesla is leveraging its breakthrough powertrain technology and manufacturing scale to develop and deploy grid connected storage at residential, industrial, and utility scales. The Energy team is small, committed, and fast moving.  As a member of our team, you will help to shape the direction of our products.  You must have a genuine passion for engineering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. 

 
Role
As a Component Validation Engineer, you will have the opportunity to accelerate the delivery of quality Tesla products to consumer markets.  You will be responsible for designing and implementing methods for validating component firmware (communication, power and systems controllers).  This team is extremely focused on the quality of Tesla products and is the driving force behind our high quality firmware.  You will work within the development team to automate testing, implement new tests, and create innovative automated test systems.  These systems explore and validate the performance capabilities of our hardware and firmware. You will be the gatekeeper before the product makes it to the customer.
 
Responsibilities
  • Identify effective test strategies for a given feature and craft test plans accordingly.
  • Run manual and automated black/white box tests, and analyze and report results.
  • Work alongside the development team to create automated regression tests
  • Understand and deconstruct complicated software systems and devise strategies to test these systems
  • Create and execute test plans designed to expose weakness or faults in components
  • Cohesively work with developers to optimize the acceleration of component validation with the use of metric driven data
Requirements
  • 1-2 years of relevant experience in either development or test automation
  • Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
  • Experience in defining manual and automated white/black box test cases
  • Great troubleshooting skills on both software and hardware level
  • Proficiency in C or C++
  • Strong scripting skills in at least one common language (Python, Perl, Shell)
  • Knowledge of source control (Git) and continuous integration (Jenkins)
Desired
  • Familiarity with National Instrument Testing Software ( LabView, TestStand, VeriStand)
  • Linux working experience a plus

 

 

 
Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Computational Materials Engineer - Metals
Req. ID: 41294
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Computational Materials Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The team is seeking a Materials Engineer who will focus on the use of computational materials engineering tools to shorten product development cycles, trouble shoot issues and create new differentiating alloys; particularly aluminum high pressure die casting alloys. 

Responsibilities:

  • Establish Tesla’s computational materials engineering capabilities by identifying best in class tools, implementing them within Tesla and providing training to other users on the Materials Engineering team. 
  • Act as Tesla’s Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Integrated Computational Materials Engineering (ICME).
  • Shorten product development cycles by minimizing the degree of experimental characterization required to generate material properties (e.g. static, fatigue, electrical, thermal, magnetic), and define material & process specification limits.
  • Trouble shoot production issues (e.g. assess impact of out-of-spec heat treatment on structural performance of crash critical components).
  • Develop new material systems and processing techniques that differentiate Tesla’s product.  Initial focus will be on Aluminum High Pressure Die Casting alloys to implement in Tesla’s foundry.  Secondary focus on extruded “crush” alloys. 

Requirements :

  • Materials Engineering degree.  Advanced degrees and focus on metallurgical engineering are preferred. Comparable experience will be considered.
  • Knowledge of ICME use in process-structure and structure-property relationships and across length scales.
  • Expert user of ICME tools such as DFT, CALPHAD, ­ThermoCalc, TC-PRISMA, DICTRA, etc.
  • Demonstrated ability to implement solutions to industrial problems using ICME techniques.

<< Back to Search Results

Configuration Management Specialist
Req. ID: 40273
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

Configuration Management Specialist

 

Department: Production

Title: Configuration Management Specialist

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a Configuration Management Specialist to join our Production team in supporting Production, Remanufacturing, and Service changes and to ensure integrity of our production BOM and associated documentation. This person will work with many cross functional teams to ensure the integrity of the BOM and part attributes are accurate and supports each group’s business needs.

In addition, this position is responsible for initiating a broad range of activities surrounding Bill of Material creation, configuration, and management throughout the product lifecycle. The role will include Part and BOM creation and configuration, change management, and communication of relevant supporting data such as intended effectivity dates and material disposition.

Essential Job Functions

  • Review and implement ECO’s and Deviations to ensure that initial release and change ECOs are audited for conformity to Production BOM configuration
  • Work with Production, Finance, Supply Chain, Program Management, Remanufacturing, Engineering, Service, and other supporting functions in order to accurately structure new products and document product changes as part of the product development, continuous improvement, and sustaining processes.
  • Create, release, and configure Bill of Material structures based on input from Engineering and Manufacturing to represent appropriate multilevel structuring and groupings.
  • Advise on best practices for documenting changes on new and existing products.
  • Insure data integrity between systems (PLM, ERP, MES, etc…) throughout the change cycle.
  • Analyze, process and track ECO and Deviation submissions to minimize processing time between submission and implementation.
  • Participate in the development and continuous improvement of ECO and other related practices.
  • Assist in the communication of Production BoM requirements between Supply Chain and Production to facilitate material planning, order fulfillment and execution.

Qualifications/Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree and/or minimum 5 years’ experience in Configuration Control, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
  • Knowledge and experience in processing engineering, production, and document changes.
  • Hands-on PLM/MRP/ERP systems experience is mandatory. Knowledge with Enovia, MES is a plus.
  • Demonstrated understanding of multilevel Bill of Material hierarchy, including hardware and software components.
  • Demonstrated understanding of product release cycle as it relates to the creation and change management of parts and BOM structures.

Skills/Aptitudes

 

  • Logical problem solver
  • Excellent written, oral communication and organizational skills
  • Ability to work with a high work load with interruptions and deadlines in a open environment
  • Must present a service-oriented attitude to all levels of personnel
  • Must be assertive, yet diplomatic

Construction EHS Manager
Req. ID: 37366
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Reporting to the Director, Health and Safety the primary responsibility of this position is to assist with the development and execution of the Health and Safety Management System throughout multiple departments of the Fremont Factory.  This position will lead multiple, direct reports and is responsible for technical work in a wide range of Health and Safety disciplines in a fast-paced environment. 

 

The Health and Safety Manager is responsible for complex technical work in a wide range of H&S disciplines. By developing, implementing and maintaining programs, the H&S Manager will help create and streamline the systems and procedures necessary to ensure the overall health and safety of Tesla employees and contractors. The overall goal is achieving compliance within the company and regulatory agency standards in each of these disciplines. The ideal candidate works well on both self-initiated projects and those driven by concerns and issues reported by co-workers. The ideal candidate also takes pride in his/her analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He or She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure compliance with Local, State and Federal health and safety regulations.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain H&S policies, plans, and procedures.
  • Interface with Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies on complex permitting, reporting      and related issues.
  • Evaluate construction contractor’s corporate safety programs for compliance with Cal-OSHA and Tesla safety requirements.
  • Work with internal teams and contractors to provide technical expertise to health and safety    procedures in demolition and construction environments.
  • Participate in daily construction safety walks and toolbox talks.
  • Assist in preparation and performance of safety meetings and training programs to ensure the effective communication of Tesla’s company policy and safety standards.
  • Lead and document incident analyses to determine root cause(s), prevention and corrective measures.
  • Develop, implement, and manage safety programs such as LOTO, Hazard Communication, Emergency Response, Fall Protection, Respiratory Protection, Hearing Conservation, etc.
  • Conduct trainings on the safety programs listed above.
  • Recommend changes in policies, procedures, work environment and equipment to prevent accidents and illnesses.
  • Incorporate ergonomics in the workplace.
  • Conduct and review Job Hazard Analysis as required.
  • Be a daily change agent driving continuous improvement

 

 

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience in a similar construction/manufacturing environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Occupational Health & Safety or equivalent is required (Master’s degree preferred) or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Certifications – CSP, CHMM, CPE, CIH certifications highly preferred
  • Superior knowledge of Fed OSHA/CAL-OSHA Standards.
  • Minimum OSHA 510 and 511 recommended. OSHA 500/501 Certifications preferred.
  • An understanding of asbestos and lead abatement procedure a plus.
  • Knowledge of Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies and requirements.
  • Practical, hands-on experience with the following:
  • Contractor Safety Processes
  • Lockout /Tagout
  • Confined Space
  • Fall Protection
  • Compliance initiatives
  • Process implementation
  • Risk assessment / JHA’s
  • Root cause analysis
  • Developing and leading education and training
  • Leading Health and Safety professionals
  • Ability to give clear direction and provide leadership to large groups.
  • Experience with emergency preparedness and crisis management.
  • Exceptional presentation and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent Word, Excel, PowerPoint capabilities.
  • Bilingual in Spanish a plus

Construction Manager -West Region
Req. ID: 42152
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 100,000 electric vehicles to customers in over 30 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.


The Role

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to support the Supercharger deployment team in California and the western United States.  This person must have a construction background; general contractor’s experience is highly valued. The role will oversee multiple construction projects and enforce budget, timeline, fit, finish, and safety requirements. A get-it-done mentality for all situations is expected.


Responsibilities

  • Get the most world-class Supercharger sites built in the shortest amount of time for the least amount of money.
  • Provide related feedback to the deployment, development, and engineering team on how to design equipment and sites for better/faster/cheaper site builds. Help design and implement those improvements.
  • Coordinates the timely processing and approvals of all shop drawings to and from subcontractors and architects/engineers.
  • Coordinate with Project Managers to timely process change requests and change orders
  • Distribute drawing and design revisions, bulletins, etc. to Project Manager, Super and all trades.

·         Communicate effectively, both orally and written. Prepare weekly construction reports with photos, schedule, etc. 

  • Expedites project close-out requirements including municipal sign offs, as-built drawings, final project photos, etc.

·         Maintain a high level of productivity. Balance a large number of concurrent tasks. Effectively prioritize efforts.

·         Foresee necessary work, and organize and disseminate information as needed. Maintain project schedules.

 


Requirements

·         Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture or a related subject and 4-6 years of increasingly responsible estimating and project management experience, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

·         Thorough understanding of construction administration processes, including contracts, budgets, construction documents, change orders, schedules, RFIs, submittals, and material procurement.

·         Advanced knowledge of construction means and methods

·         Strong understanding of AC and DC power, transformers, circuit protection, single-line electrical and mechanical diagrams, and construction drawings.

·         Excellent written and spoken English. Must have the ability to discuss technical topics with a variety of audiences – contractors, engineers, and members of various divisions within Tesla.

·         Class A general contractor’s license a plus but not required

·         Available for extensive travel (50%+), often on short notice.

·         Ability to obtain an U.S. passport.

·         Must have valid driver’s license and clean driving record

Construction Purchasing Regional Supply Manager
Req. ID: 39507
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


Position: Construction Purchasing Regional Supply Manager

 

The Construction Purchasing Regional Supply Manager, will assist the Construction Purchasing Group Manager with strategic sourcing initiatives and contract administration.  This role is expected to develop strategic business relationships with external suppliers and internal business leaders as well as other internal key stakeholders, lead contract negotiations, drive cost savings initiatives and implement strategic sourcing best practices. The Construction Purchasing Regional Supply Manager’s role leverages the supplier market in the best way to support Tesla’s future needs.

Responsibilities

  • Together with stakeholder, determine list of potential bidders.
  • Generate and solicit Requests for Proposal (RFP).
  • Coordinate and lead bidder’s conferences and job walks.
  • Administrate Requests for Information (RFI’s).
  • Issue RFP Addenda.
  • Receive and aggregate bids.
  • Perform bid analysis, and make recommendations.
  • Conduct bid leveling sessions with contractors.
  • Lead contract negotiations.
  • Draft construction contracts.
  • Issue Work Orders for additional services.
  • Manage lien releases for contracted projects.
  • Develop strong stakeholder support and cooperation.
  • Design, conduct and synthesize supplier, industry and market research to develop sourcing strategy.
  • Ensure commodity spend is under management and contract compliance.
  • Support commodity business planning and savings.
  • Analyze historical spend as well as forecast spend and savings by commodity/business.
  • Develop solid understanding of cost drivers and contracts by commodity
  • Maintain day-to-day supplier relationships; act as the lead point of contact for all commercial issues.
  • Identify and negotiate commercial cost reduction opportunities.
  • Issue PO’s for assigned commodities.

 

Requirements

  • At least five (5) years experience in construction related Purchasing, or three (3) years of professional experience in management consulting, contracts administration, or strategic sourcing.
  • Hi-tech, consumer goods or automotive industry experience.
  • Excellent analytical and judgment skills.  Advanced excel skills a must have.
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in exceptional experience.
  • Strategic Sourcing, Opportunity Analyses, and Contract Negotiations.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify business process issues and drive process improvement.
  • Open-minded self-starter with the ability to adapt, improvise and problem solve.
  • Ability to work independently on multiple tasks and projects with various stakeholders
  • Organizational skills to manage and track transactional details.
  • Fluency in English.
  • APICS certification is a plus

Construction Purchasing Specialist, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 37817
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

Purchasing Specialist

The Purchasing Specialist will be a key liaison from purchasing to assisting with strategic sourcing initiatives.  This role is expected to develop strategic business relationships with external suppliers and internal business leaders, as well as, lead contract negotiations, drive cost savings initiatives and implement strategic sourcing best practices.  The Purchasing Specialist’s role is to leverage the supplier market in the best way to support Tesla’s future needs.

 

Responsibilities

·        Execute the Infrastructure Development sourcing strategy.

·        Develop strong stakeholder support and cooperation on assigned commodities which can range from  facilities and construction services along with  equipment, and material buyouts.

·        Pre-qualify and synthesize supplier, industry and market research for assigned commodities to develop sourcing strategy

·        Process of data collection and analyzes of spend data for assigned commodities.

·        Ensuring commodity spend is managed efficiently and effectively  and within contract compliance.

·        Supporting commodity business planning and savings.

·        Establish measurement metrics and tools to monitor progress, such as tracking labor productivity burn rates

·        Implementing Worldwide/Regional/Country agreements, as necessary, to consolidate suppliers/spend.

·        Provide analysis of existing requirements and pricing to ensure the most cost-effective options.

·        Analyze historical spend as well as forecast spend and savings by commodity/business.

·        Develop solid understanding of cost drivers and contracts by commodity

·        Maintain day-to-day supplier relationships; act as the lead point of contact for all commercial issues.

·        Identify and negotiate commercial cost reduction opportunities

·        Support Engineering to identify suppliers available for sourcing.

·        Issue RFx (RFQ, RFB, and RFP) for sourcing assigned commodities.

·        Review, analyze and clarify quote packages from suppliers and service providers.  Make and present recommendations to award.

·        Support/Lead a strategic sourcing approval process.

·        Work on “Lean” initiatives and identify other sourcing efficiencies via benchmarking, VA/VE, competitive quotes and resourcing.

·        Negotiate, evaluate and issue PO’s for assigned commodities.

·        Review change order proposals and make approval or rejection recommendations.

·        Support the purchase order closeout process including reconciliation of material receipts, billings, changes, and payments.

 

Requirements

·        At least two (2) to three (3) years’ experience in purchasing, preferably in the Infrastructure, Construction or Facilities space.

·        Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, Bluebeam and/or Acrobat.

·        Hi-tech, construction and/or automotive industry experience.

·        Excellent analytical and judgment skills.  Advanced excel skills a must have.

·        Bachelor’s degree  or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

·        Strategic Sourcing, Opportunity Analyses, and Contract Negotiations.

·        Demonstrated ability to identify business process issues and drive process improvement.

·        Open-minded self-starter with the ability to adapt, improvise and problem solve.

·        Ability to work independently on multiple tasks and projects with various stakeholders

·        Organizational skills to manage and track transactional details.

·        Fluency in English.

Tesla is looking for a Safety Engineer to assist in the construction and operation of advanced manufacturing facilities.  Like our products, these facilities must be innovative. This person must be highly motivated and organized with a clear focus on driving multiple projects with aggressive deadlines and budgets.  This role will help the infrastructure group design and construct leading edge facilities that target world-class efficient output and carbon neutrality.

 

This full time role requires adaptability and doing whatever it takes to achieve project objectives.

  • Promote and protect Tesla’s reputation as a cutting-edge company producing the world’s most exciting cars and shifting the paradigm of personal transportation worldwide.? Manage multiple construction projects through design, build and qualification.
  • Provide field safety oversight of work activities
  • Ensure compliance with Local, State and Federal health and safety regulations.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain EH&S policies, plans, and procedures.

  • Attend, coordinate, and conduct safety orientation and training programs

  • Perform frequent combined safety and environmental inspections and procedural audits in the field and have the skills, knowledge and ability to take immediate corrective action if required.

<< Back to Search Results

Controls Engineer
Req. ID: 36363
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a fast-moving and constantly-innovating young company in the San Francisco Bay Area.  We design and manufacture advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

 

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars.  Our cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy efficient cars on the road.

 

Department:

Powertrain Manufacturing Engineering

 

Job Title and Description:

 

Controls Engineer

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated Senior Controls Engineer to contribute to the design and development of new automation equipment and assembly lines for our advanced electric Powertrain production.  These are critical components of the Tesla electric drivetrain and contribute greatly to our powertrain business.  This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla Motors is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Controls Engineer will work to develop machine and process concepts along with several Manufacturing Engineering peers. Candidate will create a robust system architecture to support the concept, and then layout electrical/pneumatic schematics. Once the electrical panel is built, he/she will program all controls components such as PLC, safety devices, HMI, servo drives, process hardware and robots from power-on to debug, and finally to process fine tuning and validation.

The Controls Engineer will also work with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product and processes.  He/She will work closely with Design Engineering, Quality and Production to bring Drivetrain components from initial design, through prototype development and finally into full production.

 

In-house equipment development:

 

  • Participate in initial equipment conceptual development and carefully balance product specifications, process requirements, layout complexity, cost, and lead-time limits.
  • Lay out new industrial electrical control panels which are NFPA79/NEC/UL508A compliant, and create electrical, pneumatic and fluid schematics.
  • Architect, write, and debug PLC ladder logic with an emphasis on generating code that is organized, structured, documented, maintainable and reusable. PLC code will interact with subsystems such as conveyors, robots, Manufacturing Execution System (MES), LabView, machine vision, and 3rd party equipment.
  • Implement (ANSI/RIA15.06/OSHA compliant) control reliable safety systems for safeguarding robots, gantries, conveyors, and other high volume manufacturing equipment.
  • Generate aesthetically simple HMI screens for complex machinery while providing sufficient feedback for troubleshooting.
  • Manage electrical cabinet builds, field wiring, pneumatic and fluid plumbing.
  • Select and size electrical and electromechanical components such as servos.
  • Introduce automated processes into production, and train and equip Sustaining Team to support automated equipment after deployment into production
  • Create machine interactions with plant-wide Manufacturing Execution System (MES) to communicate product acceptability, machine status, and process variables.

 

Outsourced automation equipment development:

 

  • Participate in specification creation, release to Vendor and quote technical evaluation
  • Manage suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of automated manufacturing equipment
  • Establish test plans and control test plan execution
  • Characterize and validate new automated equipment and fixturing for deployment into production

 

Existing automation equipment refinement:

 

  • Debug and optimize automated processes to maximize cycle time and uptime.
  • Characterize and validate automated processes using a data driven statistical approach such as Capacity test, Capability test (Gage Repeatability and Reproducibility test, Cpk, etc),

 

Assembly Line Development and Implementation

 

  • Create detailed utility layouts for entire assembly lines and interface with facilities teams for implementation
  • Create data management and tracking communications network architecture and interface with cross-functional teams for product, porocesses and quality traceability control implementation

 

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  He/She looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

 

 

Skills and Experience:

  • Proficiency with process integration and electromechanical / mechatronic systems
  • In depth knowledge of Electrical Standards (NFPA79, National Electric code, UL508A).
  • In depth knowledge of Safety standards (ANSI/RIA15.06, OSHA).
  • Advanced proficiency programming industrial equipment:
    1. Ladder logic PLCs (Allen Bradley ControlLogix, Mitsubishi Q series, GE Fanuc) and RSLogix 5000
    2. Safety PLCs (Allen Bradley ControlLogix, SmartGuard, Omron, Pilz)
    3. Human Machine Interface (HMI / GUI - AB Panelview, Mitsubishi GOT, LabView)
    4. Field bus Networks (AB DeviceNet, Ethernet IP, Safety rated field bus networks)
    5. Serial communication  (RS-232) between PLCs and instruments
    6. Ethernet communications between machine PLCs and database systems
  • Demonstrated excellence in programming PLCs. Must have a well-defined methodology for maintaining code structure and organization. Ability to program state machines for complex processes which involve multi-station parallel processing, pick and place automation, data acquisition, and PID control.  Proven ability to design fault-tolerant systems with error handling and recovery.
  • Proficiency selecting appropriate circuit protectors, wire and cable, sensors, safety hardware, PLC hardware, remote I/O, VFD and servo systems.
  • Proficiency creating detailed electrical and fluid schematics in CAD (AutoCAD Electrical preferred)
  • Proficiency programming variable frequency drives
  • Exposure to a wide variety of production machinery, industrial sensors, and equipment (LVDT and pressure transducers, dispense systems, temperature controllers, DC nutrunner torque controllers, current and power meters, etc)
  • Experience programming Cartesian, SCARA and Articulated robots is highly desired (Fanuc, Kuka, Motoman, Epson)
  • Experience with Vision systems (Cognex, Keyence, Fanuc)
  • Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment is highly desired
  • Experience transitioning products and processes from prototype to production desired
  • Knowledge of production quality metrics is a plus
  • Proficiency with 3D CAD packages such as with SolidWorks and CATIA is a plus

 

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS Electrical Engineering (or equivalent – Majors in: Controls and Computer Control Systems, Mechatronic Engineering, Automation Engineering, etc.)
  • 5+ years of experience as a hands-on Controls Engineer or Applications Engineer working on automation and/or electromechanical systems.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Previous Applicants:

Controls Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 38825
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Controls Engineer, Gigafactory 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop I&C drawings, construction specifications, specify instruments and write control narratives for building automation systems such as HVAC, Compressed Air, Chemical Storage and Delivery etc.
  • Design, configure and program PLC and SCADA systems
  • Plan and participate in the execution of start-up and commissioning activities 
  • Review I&C equipment submittals
  • Participate in HAZOPS and risk and reliability assessments
  • Optimize control schemes to maximize energy efficiency
  • Develop and maintain programming and engineering standards

 

Qualifications and Skills:

  • BS Engineering or equivalent in exceptional experience
  • 3+ years of experience as a hands-on Controls Engineer
  • Hands-on experience with electrical and mechanical troubleshooting of field installations
  • Strong PLC programming abilities with both Ladder Logic and Structured Text
  • Experience with HMI design and programming
  • Understanding of fundamental thermodynamics principles
  • Knowledge of various actuator technologies – motors, drives, solenoids, pneumatic valves, etc.
  • Knowledge of industrial communication protocols such as Profinet, Profibus, BACnet, Modbus
  • Strong communication skills, highly motivated with strong work ethic
  • Experience with Induction Automation Ignition and Siemens TIA Portal
  • Experience with model development and simulation of industrial processes in Aspen/Matlab/UML or Simulink
  • Knowledge of system theory including MIMO systems, linear and nonlinear stability, state space methods, full state feedback control, state estimation, adaptive control
  • Proficiency with AutoCAD or similar design software
  • Prior involvement in the design or commissioning of large capital projects
  • Expertise selecting and configuring TCP/IP-based network switches and routers

Controls Engineer-Seat Manufacturing
Req. ID: 40960
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont-901 Page
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Controls Engineer is an integral part of the engineering and development team and will be responsible for executing a broad range of varied internal projects within General Assembly.

Summary:

Seeking a Controls Engineering that can execute a variety of engineering, robotic, process, and material handling projects within the bounds of an existing production facility.  Must be knowledgeable of and apply operational and technical maturity of industry best practices with flexibility at a rapid fire pace across a factory with a variety of processes, equipment and operational constraints.  Safety and quality of the personnel, equipment, methods, and processes must be pushed to theoretical limits while maintaining absolute control over variation. 

The right individual will be an engineer capable of handling multiple responsibilities, driving progress on projects while managing obstacles and make calculated decision based on incomplete data sets. Must be adept at working side by side with equipment engineering, maintenance, operations staff and support personnel.  Capable of quickly learning and operating among a variety of internal systems, policies and cultures.

Ideal candidate will be comfortable leading projects while cooperating with a number of cross functional teams inside and outside of the home organization.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Drive projects in support of business, safety, and operational objectives
  • Oversee the installation of major capital equipment projects for the end using organization
  • Work collaboratively with operations, engineering leads and managers to set goals and track deliverables.
  • Provide clear input to the management team on schedules, issues, and deliverables related to subsystem and vehicle development.
  • Work with established  programming standards for PLC and automated systems
  • Oversee maintenance, electrical and PLC projects, verify proper documentation
  • Plan and manage supplier and equipment buyoffs
  • Conduct risk assessments and implement finding
  • HMI programming and system development
  • Generate, develop electrical drawings. Buyoff on electrical drawings from contractors
  • Ensure proper stakeholder management, communications, and escalation for all facets of various scale projects

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of extensive experience with industrial equipment controls, interfaces, and communication protocols. Prefer exposure to automated assembly environments
  • Familiarity with systems engineering, electrical engineering, and software development process.
  • Proven team player, skilled at partnering with development engineers, project managers, and technicians across various career trajectories.
  • Must be proficient in PLC programming, troubleshooting, and configuration.
    • Experience with various Allen-Bradley platforms is highly desirable.
  • Experience with complex servo motion control systems, integrated into PLC / Robot controls
  • Experience with machine safety systems design, operation, and regulatory compliance
  • Previous experience / fluency with one or more of the following programs / software systems;
    •  RS Logix, Kepware, Ignition, Allen Bradley PLC, Wonderware,  VBasic, C++
  • HMI programming skills, including; Design / Build, Troubleshooting & Modification
  • Some experience with robot programming, backup and restoration
    • Fanuc and/or Universal Robots a plus
  • Experience creating various reports and database tools for management
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs. CAD is a plus
    • Prefer Solidworks, Catia or AutoCAD
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Experience in automotive manufacturing is highly desired.
  • Solid experience in developing electrical schematics.
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering

Conveyor & Controls Engineer
Req. ID: 38365
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

The Conveyor & Controls Engineer will be responsible for designing, specifying and recommending implementation of the best technologies and approaches for quick and efficient loading and unloading of Materials from Supplier through intermediate points to the the Factory. These technologies will initially be planned and implemented at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but will eventually be implemented in all factories built by Tesla globally.  The primary objectives of the Material Flow Engineering team will be to reduce overall vehicle build cycle time while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates.  The Sr. Controls Engineer will be instrumental in the design and development of the next generation material flow strategies for Tesla Motors.  The Sr. Controls Engineer will be a part of the Technical Services team which  will include specialists in advanced computer modeling and simulation tools as well as material handling system and equipment experts.  This position will report to the Material Flow Engineering Manager of Technical Services.

 

Responsibilities:

· Control system design in support of conveying applications where specific features of conveyor equipment are enhanced (enabled) by electronic controls.

· Specify Requirements to manufacturers on the best, cost-efficient technology platforms related to Mechanical/Electrical Controls and Systems

· Develop novel, cost efficient and robust approaches to Material handling as Vehicle Production requirements evolve.

· Write, implement, document and debug software for equipment.

· Budgeting, estimating and pricing of control systems.

· Procurement of electrical and control components for control systems.

· Value engineering of design, components and materials.

· Manage and direct on-site (in-plant) installation and commissioning of control systems in conjunction with equipment installations.

· Provide remote and on-site (in-plant) troubleshooting of control systems.

· Successfully complete assigned projects to quality standards, on time, and within budget.

· Prepare “As-built” drawings, controls schematics and bill of materials.

 

Require ments:

· 5-10 Years of relevant experience in control systems

· Master of Science degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Manufacturing Engineering Systems or related field of study)

· Ability to understand Master’s-level Electrical & Mechanical Engineering concepts. Ability to take those concepts and apply them to real world electromechanical challenges

· Proficiency in PLC and HMI programming.

· Expertise in industrial control circuit design and electrical panel design

· Experience in VFD programming.

· Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and strong presentation skills

 

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or related program
  • Expericence with PLC Control System
  • Experience with Electro-Mechanical Systems – Servomotors and Servomotor Applications
  • Knowledge of material handling systems in a manufacturing or distribution system environment
  • Solid modeling software package experience a plus

Data Engineer
Req. ID: 37968
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company in the San Francisco Bay Area.  We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

Job Title:

Data Engineer

Department:

Manufacturing Engineering

Job Title and Summary:

Manufacturing Engineering is responsible for designing the equipment and processes that make up Tesla’s production lines.  Informing the design with well-analyzed data is crucial for Manufacturing Engineering to continue to make the right decisions on increasingly-complicated and increasingly-tuned production lines. 

This role collaborates with other members of Manufacturing Engineering to architect and build our manufacturing data systems.  The problems’ inputs are gigabytes per day of in-process data.  The outputs are automated data pipelines feeding a variety of data storage structures that enable broad data consumption.

In addition to building out the backbone of our manufacturing data architecture, the data engineer creates tools and documentation for others to access the data.  The data engineer researches new data system technologies (e.g. NoSQL) to both build new infrastructures and to train others in these new technologies.

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Design and maintain well-structured relational database schemas.
  • Create automated ETL pipelines for a variety of raw manufacturing data sources.
  • Research and develop new data storage architectures for growing data volumes.
  • Maintain excellent documentation for understanding and accessing data storage.
  • Analyze existing in-process data to inform process development.
  • Collaborate daily with other members of Manufacturing Engineering.

This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of an incredibly exciting product.

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her work, analytical ability, ability to explain technical issues to non-technical people, and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  

Skills and Experience:

  • Proficiency in SQL and relational database design.
  • Proficiency in engineering investigation.
  • Proficiency in data ETL workflows with programming/scripting languages such as Python, C, Ruby.
  • Proficiency creating process documentation.
  • Experience in the factory environment.
  • Experience with multiple data storage architecture paradigms.
  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills.
  • Exemplary written communication skills.
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.

Qualifications:

  • MS in engineering, mathematics, or equivalent.
  • 4+ years pertinent experience.

Data Engineer, Autopilot Maps
Req. ID: 38674
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

With software version 7.0, the Tesla Model S and Model X can use their unique combination of cameras, radar, ultrasonic sensors, and fleet data to autonomously navigate highways, change lanes, and adjust speeds in response to traffic. We are building the world's best Autopilot experience by taking advantage of network connectivity and fleet data.

We are looking for a motivated data engineer to help us advance our maps for Autopilot and navigation. The ideal candidate is self-driven, excited to learn new technologies, and interested in solving challenging problems using real-world data gathered from our fleet of autonomous vehicles. The candidate will work on our autonomous telemetry pipelines and design machine learning algorithms to enhance the quality of our autonomous driving experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement scalable algorithms and data models that ingest geospatial telemetry data and output features such as traffic speeds and road geometry
  • Design and implement big data workflows using Spark and Python
  • Devise visualization, debugging, and simulation tools for validation
  • Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/Validation, and designers

Requirements:

  • Strong programming skills with a solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Experience with big data frameworks such as Hadoop/Spark 
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with data analysis libraries such as pandas, numpy, scipy, and scikit-learn
  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux environments and version control systems (e.g. Git)
  • High standards for code quality, maintainability, testing, and performance
  • No prior experience with car software required

Req. ID: 39430
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

With software version 7.0, the Tesla Model S and Model X can use their unique combination of cameras, radar, ultrasonic sensors, and fleet data to autonomously navigate highways, change lanes, and adjust speeds in response to traffic. We are building the world's best Autopilot experience by applying machine learning techniques and learning from real-world fleet data. 

We are looking for a motivated data scientist to help us advance our maps for Autopilot and navigation. The ideal candidate is self-driven, excited to learn new technologies, and interested in solving challenging problems using real-world data gathered from our fleet of autonomous vehicles. The candidate will design and implement machine learning algorithms to extract features that can be consumed by our autonomous vehicles.
 

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement scalable machine learning algorithms that ingest geospatial telemetry data and output features such as traffic speeds and road geometry
  • Design and implement highly efficient and scalable big data algorithms using Spark and Python
  • Perform exploratory data analysis and data visualization
  • Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/Validation, and designers

?Requirements:

  • Strong programming skills with a solid foundation in data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning and data analysis libraries such as pandas, numpy, scipy, and scikit-learn
  • Knowledge of Unix/Linux environments and version control systems (e.g. Git)
  • High standards for code quality, maintainability, testing, and performance
  • Experience with big data systems such as Hadoop or Spark is a plus
  • No prior experience with car software required

Design Engineer - Test Facilities Capability Development
Req. ID: 39920
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Design Engineer - Test Facilities - Capabilities Development

 

We are looking for an exceptional Design Engineer to impact the Test Facilities and Equipment Engineering Team within the Engineering Test Organization. 

 

He/she will lead the development, implementation and initial application of advanced automated test suites and other hardware to test various automotive systems and components. The ideal candidate has a proven record of success in the design and development of mechanical test equipment and controls as well as their application in an engineering/ manufacturing environment. He/she must have a broad technical background with the ability to work with engineering, manufacturing and quality personnel across a wide variety of issues. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within and outside of Tesla.

 

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

  

Responsibilities:

 

  • Support Test Engineering team in the development of required capability for future validation activity
  • Development/design, implementation and initial application of robust systems for static and dynamic testing of vehicles and their subsystems. This can include hydraulic systems (i.e. closed loop force controlled hydraulic ram), electro-mechanical systems (i.e. dynamic deceleration sleds to simulate the forces of a crash), pneumatic systems (i.e. multi-sample actuation device) and static structures (i.e. barriers or restraints to secure test samples).
  • Improve current test suites and setups for reliability and ease of use
  • Support Test Engineering team in root cause and problem resolution activities on test equipment issues found during tests as required
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to less experienced engineers in the area of test equipment design and validation best practices

 

Requirements:

 

  • BS or higher degree in in Mechanical Engineering (MSEE preferred.) Relevant coursework and work experience is essential.
  • 8+ years experience working in an equipment engineering/manufacturing environment
  • 3+ years experience in test equipment development preferred
  • Prior experience in automotive/aerospace testing environment a big plus
  • Experience with hydraulic, pneumatic as well as electro-mechanical systems
  • Ability to design, from scratch if necessary, test equipment and fixturing capable of producing high static loads (>50tons), reliable dynamic long duration cyclic loading (i.e. 24/7 with minimal user interaction), simulating real time vehicle inputs as well as vehicle safety related load cases.
  • Proven ability to CAD design (CATIA preferred) for fabrication/manufacturing and material handling; Awareness of industry standard techniques and methods (i.e. cutting, welding, machining, and rigging).
  • Familiarity with controls and data acquisition programs and software
  • (i.e. Matlab, Labview, MTS Systems)
  • Familiarity with strain-gage based instruments (e.g. load cells and pressure sensors)
  • Ability to select the most appropriate method of test, instrumentation, materials, and fabrication techniques to meet deadlines and budgets while achieving first-rate test results
  • Hands on capabilities and knowledge of machining and fabrication techniques preferred
  • Understanding of basic electronics principles and measurement systems
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Maintain flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments, coping with rapidly changing information
  • Work efficiently and productively in independent and team settings
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work, including the public
  • Ability to train and mentor other team members.
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Self-initiative and strong desire to learn new skills and/or create innovative test methods
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Design Engineer- Body Systems
Req. ID: 38114
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla is looking for engineers who understand the underlying physics of challenging problems at an exceptional level, have the experience to work fast and efficiently, and who relentlessly seek alternative solutions. Everyone at Tesla shows leadership and challenges the norm to get our products to the next level. The ability to work quickly and effectively on open ended problems is far more important than familiarity with specific analysis tools. Unrivaled range, ludicrous performance, top-of-the-line comfort and long-term reliability depend on an excellent systems-level architecture.

The Role

The Design Engineer for Body-in-White is responsible for engineering best-in-class body structure architectures and systems for Tesla’s premium vehicle programs.

Responsibilities

  • Create and develop Body-in-White component and system requirements and specifications to achieve best-in-class structural, NVH and crash performance

  • Create vehicle-aligned component and system targets for function, cost, weight and investment

  • Establish system architecture and functional feasibility

  • Develop design concepts and production designs in CATIA V5 or V6

  • Optimize the concepts and designs with analytical and physical assessments, ensuring conformation to federal regulations governing assigned systems

  • Complete and release system, sub-system and detail designs

  • Deliver world-class craftsmanship and fit/finish

  • Support creation of component specification, component DFMEA, DVP&R and other technical design documents

  • Release parts for production in the PLM system

  • Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, validation, and other engineering activities as specified for the assigned commodity. Note that in most cases, Tesla Vehicle Engineering will design commodities in-house.

  • Create (with component/system supplier) component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods

  • Complete component and system validation as required, insuring system targets are met and optimized

  • Support vehicle milestones, build events, and launch the product successfully

Requirements

  • B.S. or higher in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

  • 3+ years minimum experience in Automotive Body Design and Engineering 

  • Completed multiple full development BIW life cycles through design, development, release and launch

  • High proficiency in CATIA V5 or V6

  • Understanding of GD&T in Design Engineering

  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs

  • Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs

  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects with tight timing constraints

  • Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes and lightweight, recyclable and sustainable materials (aluminum preferred)

  • Experience in DFSS highly preferred

Design for Reliability Engineer
Req. ID: 35552
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Design for Reliability Engineer

Palo Alto, CA

 

Design-for-Reliability Engineer (various levels)? We’re looking for exceptional Reliability Engineers

that will focus on the Design for Reliability activities for Tesla Products.

 

  • Analyze usage and environmental conditions from the field in order to improve requirement setting and testing methods
  • Influence reliability early in the design process by facilitating DFMEAs and participating in design reviews
  • Specify reliability risk and validation plans for components and subsystems using a physics of failure approach
  • Provide guidance on sample size requirements and durations for reliability testing using reliability statistics
  • Facilitate failure analysis to understand root cause and drive resolution of failures occurring during product development
  • Assess and clearly communicate risk at each phase of the reliability program
  • Research failure mechanisms to build more robust validation plans and influence design choices
  • Influence supplier selection for higher reliability and provide clear guidance on reliability requirements and demonstration to suppliers
  • Apply lessons learned from previous designs to new products

 

Desired skills:

  • Understanding of accelerated testing methods, governing equations, and physics of failure for different failure mechanisms
  • Experience facilitating FMEAs and leading cross functional teams 
  • Working knowledge of coding language, preferable Python
  • Working knowledge of applied statistics and reliability statistics is a plus, including Weibull Analysis
  • Minimum requirement is a Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Science, or Statistics. Level of role depends on experience and qualifications

   

Domain Knowledge:

Depending on the subsystem of focus, knowledge of methods to design-in reliability for one or more of the following:

  • Power Electronics
  • Charging Systems
  • Chassis, Suspension, Steering, Brakes
  • EV Batteries
  • Drive Inverters
  • Electric Motors and Gearboxes
  • Vehicle Interiors
  • Vehicle Closures and Body in White
  • Infotainment
  • Driver Assistance and Autonomous Driving
  • Low Voltage Electronics (board controls, harnesses, sensors)
  • Thermal Management
  • Energy Storage

DevOps
Req. ID: 35778
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Job description

As a DevOps engineer on the Firmware Platforms and Infrastructure team, you will be building best-in-class embedded software build and release infrastructure used by Tesla vehicle and Tesla Energy systems.  You will be responsible for architecting scalable systems that grow with the expansion of the development organization.  The systems you build have the ability to greatly enhance the efficiency and quality of the entire embedded software development organization.

  • Responsible for infrastructure scaling
    • Proactively identify potential build/release pipeline bottlenecks, recommend and implement solutions
    • Develop load tests and perform end-to-end benchmarking
  • System administration
    • Coordination with IT for machine provisioning and related tooling
    • OS and application upgrade planning and execution
  • Build and release
    • Triage and diagnose build failures 
    • Coordinate with the release management to define tools that will improve efficiency
    • Work with the infrastructure, release management and program management teams to define repository management strategies

Requirements

  • Highly proficient in Python and shell scripting
  • Comfortable with Java and C
  • Proficient in UNIX administration and CLI tools
  • Proficient in Git and repository management
  • Experience with build systems (Makefiles/Scons), and release management tools (Jenkins, Jira)
  • Experience with Linux management tools such as automated provisioning (puppet, razor), containers (docker), virtualization (VMware, KVM), etc.
  • Familiar with Linux resource monitoring and performance analysis tools.
  • Familiar with database concepts and SQL

Dimensional Engineer
Req. ID: 37055
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont-901 Page
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla:

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role :

The Dimensional Engineer will ensure that all products meet customer and company requirements.  The successful candidate will have 1+ year in design engineering of complex mechanical or structural systems, with at least 1 year experience as a dimensional engineer.

Responsibilities:

The effective candidate must have the ability to meet tight deadlines, have strong interpersonal and communication skills, be detail oriented, and have the ability to work independently.  He/she must establish and maintain a professional working relationship with external and internal teams at all levels across the company. The candidate will have completed, as a dimensional engineer, at least one full production cycle from production inception to post launch evaluation/support. Candidates need to be able to balance multiple projects requiring varying skill sets in highly dynamic and diverse working environment. They must be able to work independently, but also be a top contributor in small and large groups. They must be comfortable with representing the dimensional engineering agenda in meetings that frequently include senior managers.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or other technical discipline.
  • 1-10+ years’ experience in a dimensional engineering role.
  • Completed at least 1 product launch cycle as a dimensional engineer.
  • Experienced with 1D and 3D dimensional variation analysis.
  • Current with ASME Y14.5-2009.
  • Comfortable with multi-variable capability analysis and statistical testing.
  • Catia or similar CAD system experience is required; Enovia experience is a plus.
  • Proof of proficiency in dimensional variation root cause analysis; JMP experience is preferred to Minitab.
  • Six Sigma Black Belt is a plus.
  • APQP part validation experience is a plus.
  • Confident, well-spoken and orderly while presenting data to large groups.
  • Experience working with CM4D database.
  • Experience in Seat manufacturing a plus.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Dimensional Engineer, Stamping
Req. ID: 35969
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Tesla Motors

Dimensional Engineer – Manufacturing Engineering, Stamping

 

As a Dimensional Engineer in Tesla Motors, you will be responsible for coordinating body, interior fit and dimensional control activities. You will review and recommend dimensional requirements for body engineering components, sub-systems and major vehicle systems.  You will also support the resolution of body build issues and direct shop layout inspections, incoming supplier quality issues, review dimensional data from CMM inspections, and implement corrective actions.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Support developmental studies establishing allowable limits in build variation that will produce products meeting fit & finish build objectives between Design, Stamping Engineering and BIW.
  • DFM/DFA Logic - Conduct assembly logic studies to support build objectives and dimensional studies to support assembly process
  • Identify variation for assembly interference and recommend design clearances for assembly
  • Develop 3-D models to support Tool & Die engineering and conduct root cause analysis for build issues
  • Support technical interface in issues related to dimensional characteristics with body engineering suppliers
  • Analyze and resolve dimensional issues related to individual components, assemblies and interfacing systems

 

Skills and Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in automotive (or relevant industry) body design and engineering (body-in-white, closures and/or interior system development experience)
  • Experience with GD&T technology toolsets required to include the following or similar: 1DCS, 3DCS, GDM, CATIA FDT (Required)
  • Experience in CATIA V5 (required)
  • Strong preference for experience in Functional Tolerance & Annotation (FT&A)
  • Knowledge of Stat graphics and/or Minitab (Preferred)
  • Knowledge of CMM programming. (Preferred)
  • Proficiency in using Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio & Project)
  • Extensive experience applying mechanical engineering principles, practices and formal review procedures including ANSI dimensioning and geometric tolerances.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and application of ANSI dimensioning and geometric tolerancing.
  • Ability to work in diverse and co-located teams
  • Demonstrated ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints

Minimum Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering, or related field, MSME preferred
 

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status or genetic information.

Dock Unloading Engineer
Req. ID: 41600
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Conveyor & Controls Engineer will be responsible for designing, specifying and recommending implementation of the best technologies and approaches for quick and efficient loading and unloading of Materials from Supplier through intermediate points to the the Factory. These technologies will initially be planned and implemented at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but will eventually be implemented in all factories built by Tesla globally.  The primary objectives of the Material Flow Engineering team will be to reduce overall vehicle build cycle time while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates.  The Sr. Controls Engineer will be instrumental in the design and development of the next generation material flow strategies for Tesla Motors.  The Sr. Controls Engineer will be a part of the Technical Services team which  will include specialists in advanced computer modeling and simulation tools as well as material handling system and equipment experts.  This position will report to the Material Flow Engineering Manager of Technical Services.

 

Responsibilities:

· Control system design in support of conveying applications where specific features of conveyor equipment are enhanced (enabled) by electronic controls.

· Specify Requirements to manufacturers on the best, cost-efficient technology platforms related to Mechanical/Electrical Controls and Systems

· Develop novel, cost efficient and robust approaches to Material handling as Vehicle Production requirements evolve.

· Write, implement, document and debug software for equipment.

· Budgeting, estimating and pricing of control systems.

· Procurement of electrical and control components for control systems.

· Value engineering of design, components and materials.

· Manage and direct on-site (in-plant) installation and commissioning of control systems in conjunction with equipment installations.

· Provide remote and on-site (in-plant) troubleshooting of control systems.

· Successfully complete assigned projects to quality standards, on time, and within budget.

· Prepare “As-built” drawings, controls schematics and bill of materials.

 

Requirements:

· 5-10 Years of relevant experience in control systems

· Master of Science degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Manufacturing Engineering Systems or related field of study)

· Ability to understand Master’s-level Electrical & Mechanical Engineering concepts. Ability to take those concepts and apply them to real world electromechanical challenges

· Proficiency in PLC and HMI programming.

· Expertise in industrial control circuit design and electrical panel design

· Experience in VFD programming.

· Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and strong presentation skills

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering or related program
  • Experience with PLC Control System
  • Experience with Electro-Mechanical Systems – Servomotors and Servomotor Applications
  • Knowledge of material handling systems in a manufacturing or distribution system environment
  • Solid modeling software package experience a plus

Dynamometer Lab Engineer
Req. ID: 40166
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

To be considered for this position, please submit your resume AND cover letter to Mechanicaldrivesystems@tesla.com 

Your cover letter should include the following: 

1.            Why are you the right fit for this position at Tesla?  What makes you an exceptional candidate?

2.            Tell us about your favorite achievement.  This could be something you accomplished at work or personal, but should be technical in nature.

 

The Role- Dyno Lab Engineer 
Designing, building, and using motor and vehicle dynamometers, data acquisition systems, and associated software

Responsibilities
·         Design of dynamometer control software, communication networks, and data acquisition systems.
·         Independent implementation of all aspects of electrical and mechanical test hardware.
·         Timely implementation of new control software, test profiles, and test reports.
·         Analysis and post processing of test data, requiring an in depth understanding of subjects such as efficiency, inertia simulation, and road load equations.  
·         Collaborative work with electrical, mechanical, thermal, QA, and other firmware teams.
·         Getting quotes from vendors, negotiating prices, maintaining and communicating schedule.

Requirements
·         Ability to understand, test, and troubleshoot complicated system interactions in a fast pace environment.
·         Experience with electromechanical systems, with a solid understanding of electric motor control basics.
·         Understanding of high voltage and electrical principles.
·         Understanding of typical sensor fundamentals.
·         Passion for electrical powertrains.
·         Ability to drive problems to solutions across different groups.
·         Excellent communication skills.
·         Experience with CAN, Ethernet, RS232, MODBUS communication.
·         Experience working in an automotive environment.
·         2 years of relevant experience
·         2 years of NI LabVIEW/VeriStand experience.
·         BS degree in EE/ME or equivalent, Masters preferred.
