Dyno Lab Technician
Req. ID: 35307
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

This position will work as a member of the ADAS and Performance Test team (within Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Test Group) with the primary objectives of developing and managing the group’s dynamometer resources while maintaining safe and reliable performance, and conducting tests in accordance with Tesla test procedures. The successful candidate for this position must have a strong background in vehicle-level dynamometer testing, and familiarity with typical dynamometer test procedures.

Responsibilities

  • Configure, maintain, diagnose and sign off test vehicles for safe dynamometer testing
  • Instrument vehicles with data acquisition and automated-driving robot systems
  • Conduct standard homologation tests according to the official test procedures, and witnessed by agency officials
  • Conduct custom tests according to the test plan specified by the test engineer
  • Follow Tesla test plans and procedures to record & analyze data, document and report results
  • Design and create custom test fixtures and sensors for data acquisition equipment
  • Design, develop and validate Tesla vehicle-level dynamometer test procedures
  • Schedule tests on multiple dynamometers and prioritize resources to meet tight, changing deadlines
  • Work with external test labs to coordinate successful dynamometer tests in cases where internal test capacity is exceeded

Requirements

  • Ability to lead the operation and development of in-house dynamometer test capabilities, including maintenance, upgrades and improvements (mechanical, electrical or software-based).
  • Ability to read wiring schematics and instrument vehicles with driving robots/accelerometers/ sensors/etc., and operate data acquisition systems (such as National Instruments or SoMAT eDAQ) for data collection
  • Ability to operate and use diagnostic scan tools, scopes, meters, and other test equipment
  • Ability to train others in the safe operation of vehicle dynamometers and test execution
  • Extensive knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of dynamometers
  • Experience with Dynamometer hardware and software from companies such as AVL, Horiba and Stähle
  • Experience with MS office tools (Outlook/Excel/Word/PowerPoint), and Adobe products
  • Ability to follow oral, written, email, and text message instructions
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work, including the public
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment to achieve common goals
  • An Associate Degree in Engineering/Engineering Technology, or an Automotive Technology degree from an institution, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • A minimum of 1 year of automotive experience as a Dynamometer Test Technician, 
  • Must have valid driver’s license
  • Experience with high-precision data acquisition and test equipment preferred
  • Experience with EPA and ECE coastdown and dyno test procedures preferred
  • Candidates must have the ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally (Up to 25%)

EHS Manager - Factory Departments
Req. ID: 37364
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

 

The Role

Reporting to the Director, Health and Safety the primary responsibility of this position is to assist with the development and execution of the Health and Safety Management System throughout multiple departments of the Fremont Factory.  This position will lead multiple, direct reports and is responsible for technical work in a wide range of Health and Safety disciplines in a fast-paced environment. 

 

The candidate must have successful management system implementation experience and have effectively led and developed health and safety leaders.  This role will require working closely with management, line supervisors, associates, and health and safety team members to ensure roles and responsibilities are well defined and understood.  The candidate must work well on both self-initiated projects and those driven by concerns and issues reported by employees. The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop, implement, and execute short and long-term plans and the Tesla Health and Safety Management System ensuring compliance with VPP, OHSAS 18001, Tesla defined best practices, and all local, state and federal health and safety regulations.
  • Develop, lead, and mentor Health and Safety professionals.
  • Interface with Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies on complex permitting, reporting    and related issues.
  • Work with internal teams to provide technical expertise.
  • Assist management with the incident reporting and analysis process and the implementation of corrective actions to prevent reoccurrence of injuries. .
  • Develop, implement, and manage safety programs such as LOTO, Hazard Communication, Emergency Response, Fall Protection, Ergonomics, Respiratory Protection, Hearing Conservation, etc.
  • Conduct education and training for health and safety required within the Health and Safety Management System.
  • Analyzes Health and Safety data and reports trends; recommends / supports plans for corrective actions.
  • Complete monthly reports and maintain OSHA injury logs.
  • Conduct Risk Assessments and establish JSA’s / JHA’s / SWP’s.
  • Be a daily change agent driving continuous improvement.

Requirements

  • 10 plus years of experience in a similar manufacturing/industrial environment.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Occupational Safety, Industrial Safety, Environmental Health, Industrial Hygiene, or Safety-related discipline (Master’s degree preferred) or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • Certifications – CSP, CHMM, CPE, CIH certifications highly preferred.
  • Competence and experience with lean manufacturing.
  • Superior knowledge of CAL-OSHA policies.
  • Knowledge of Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies and requirements..
  • Practical, hands-on experience with the following:.
  • Equipment safety and machine guarding.
  • Compliance initiatives.
  • Process implementation.
  • Risk assessment.
  • Root cause analysis.
  • Leading Health and Safety professionals.
  • Able to influence and communicate effectively with all levels of management.
  • Effective experience with training and education.
  • Ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

.

EHS Specialist - Performance Improvement
Req. ID: 26470
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Reporting to the Director, Health and Safety the primary responsibility of this position is to develop, implement, and maintain an effective factory-wide health and safety performance management system within Tesla’s internal database.  This candidate will create and/or enhance and maintain effective data, record keeping, budget, and procurement processes.  He/she will develop Level II policies for these processes which will be incorporated into the Health and Safety Management System being implemented throughout the Fremont Factory.      

This role will require working closely with management and health and safety team members to ensure roles and responsibilities are well defined and understood.  The candidate must work well on both self-initiated projects and those driven by concerns and issues reported by employees. The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded. 

Responsibilities

 

  • Build, direct, and ensure effective implementation of a performance management system.

    • Includes, but is not limited to tracking leading and lagging indicators, corrective and preventing actions, and internal reports.

  • Provides data analysis that ensures focus and priorities are aligned appropriately.

  • Verify data integrity and timeliness of reports provided by Health and Safety Team members.

  • Maintains OSHA logs and posts summaries.

  • Assists, as necessary, with document requests from regulatory agencies.

  • Recommend benchmarks, metrics, and reporting structure practices.

  • Develop and maintain record keeping process.

  • Customize, coordinate, and conduct training related to processes developed; assist, as necessary, with the coordination and/or development of department training materials.

  • Tracks weekly incident reporting process to determine department incident reviews.

  • Proof, revise, circulate and maintain files of Safety Alerts, daily communication flow down messages, Health and Safety Newsletter, and website.

  • Develop and maintain department budget and procurement process.

  • Proof, revise, and upload Level II policies.

  • Support recruiting efforts for all Health and Safety Team applicants, including participation in interviewing process.

  • Stay abreast of open workers’ compensation claims and ensure cases are managed appropriately.

  • Oversees Health and Safety Intern program.

  • Be a daily change agent driving continuous improvement.

Requirements

  • Experience with health and safety through an internship is required.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Occupational Safety, Industrial Safety, Environmental Health, Industrial Hygiene, or Safety-related discipline (Master’s degree preferred)  or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

  • Certifications – CSP and/or analytical certifications preferred.

  • Knowledge of Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies and requirements preferred.

  • Able to influence and communicate effectively with all levels of management.

  • Effective experience with training and education.

  • Ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.

  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Mastery of Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.

Electrical Engineer - Energy Product Engineering
Req. ID: 36101
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla Energy

 

Tesla Energy is bringing battery technology to the grid to facilitate a renewable energy ecosystem and increase grid reliability in places where it is lacking.  Tesla is leveraging its breakthrough powertrain technology and manufacturing scale to develop and deploy grid connected storage at residential, industrial, and utility scales. The Energy team is small, committed, and fast moving.  As a member of our team, you will help to shape the direction of our products. You must have a genuine passion for delivering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. 

 

The Role

Tesla Energy is committed to having industry-leading uptime in our deployed fleet of grid storage batteries, and we are using the data collected from our connected systems to find problems before the customer does. The Tesla Energy team is looking to hire a product engineer to identify and root cause design, process, or firmware failures in our fleet of energy storage systems. You will be leading the effort to develop the knowledgebase to be used by both internal and external parties to troubleshoot issues.

Responsibilities

  • Oversee the development of fleet analysis and failure identification database-driven tools
  • Troubleshoot and root cause failures and identify solutions as they are found in the field, and develop a diagnostics knowledgebase
  • Work with the engineering and manufacturing teams to drive design and manufacturing changes to improve product quality in both existing and future products
  • Provide technical support in order to minimize system downtime, through day to day coverage of internationally distributed service cases.
  • Work with the service team to create documentation to support field commissioning and service actions and ensure consistent and stable global service operations. 

Requirements

  • 2-3 years of experience in product development, reliability engineering, failure analysis, test, quality, or service engineering
  • Strong engineering fundamentals and intuition, applied to firmware/software-enabled mechatronic systems
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Prior experience troubleshooting mechanical, material, electrical, system, firmware, or process failure modes
  • Background in database management, analysis and presentation
  • Python, Matlab, and database skills a plus
  • Experience with battery and/or inverter systems a plus
  • BS or MS in an engineering discipline

Electrical Engineer, Infotainment
Req. ID: 28290
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Electrical Engineer - Infotainment

Responsibilities

  • Developing component-level requirements to meet the vehicle program requirements
  • Design of electrical architecture and electronic circuits, processor selection and integration, system timing and bus loading.
  • Designing hardware, sourcing components, developing schematics, managing layout, and testing prototypes to validate hardware
  • Broad expertise with Automotive communication networks (CAN,LIN,Ethernet) and modules (GPS, Bluetooth, Radio, Display)
  • Engineering analysis and design of electrical and electronic circuits, system timing and bus loading
  • Contributing to vehicle-level systems engineering: architecture issues relating to communications, functionality trade-offs, grounding and EMC strategy, user interface.

  This Engineer Should:

  • Have solid technical depth and breadth in analog and digital circuit analysis and design.
  • Have broad expertise with means of high-volume manufacturing and test methods
  • Have successfully managed suppliers through the specification of requirements, development of DFMEA, planning and execution of full validation, and to stable production.
  • Have experience with environmental constraints (temp, humidity, and vibration), regulatory compliance and product debug (EMC/EMI, ESD, transients, etc).
  • Be skilled driving team-members from multiple disciplines to reach fact-based decisions
  • Be able to work closely with Software, testing and manufacturing teams

Electrical Engineering Internship / Co-Op (Spring 2017)
Req. ID: 42198
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Intern

Description

 

The Role

You will design, test and prototype electrical systems.  Your scope of work will be electrical in nature and will challenge you to come up with creative solutions to affect rigorous quality and cost-down targets. Additionally, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional partners and external vendors and suppliers.

Your application to the Electrical Engineering Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Charging, Battery Engineering, Power Electronics, Infotainment, Body Controls, Integration, and Autopilot Hardware.

Responsibilities

  • Read, understand and draw schematics utilizing familiarity with at least one CAD tool for schematic capture, for example Eagle or Altium.
  • Use basic lab equipment including oscilloscope, function generator, counters and network analyzers, and tools to construct and modify circuits during design debug.
  • Utilize knowledge of circuit components to perform basic circuit analysis.
  • Design electrical control unit architecture and circuits and develop test cases and test equipment to test electronic assemblies.
  • Work with DSPs, microcontrollers, and programmable logic devices.

Requirements

Specific project assignments and required technical aptitude will vary based on the needs of the individual hiring team.

  • Currently working toward a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant program including, but not limited to: Electrical Engineering, Electrical Computer Engineering, Computer Engineering, and Robotics.
  • Hands-on experience, previous internship and/or project experience preferred.
  • Experience with automotive regulatory, environmental, reliability, and safety requirements is a plus.
  • Basic experience with automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet).
  • Experience with power electronics, power supplies, high and low voltage systems.
  • You must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.
  • Professional and positive communication skills.
  • Ability and willingness to relocate to the Bay Area, California.

Electrician
Req. ID: 38314
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Electrical Technician

Responsibilities

  • Maintains, trouble shoots, repairs, and installs electrical equipment and systems at the TESLA-Fremont facility utilizing technical, interpersonal and critical thinking skills. 
  • Working as a team with the entire FAC-OPS department, the Electrical Technician performs general maintenance duties, preventive maintenance, trouble calls, and emergency maintenance as needed and assigned.
  • Work on projects throughout the entire facility running conduit, pulling wire and connecting devices, using lifts and ladders.
  • Continues to perform equipment repairs and similar duties that require no oversight or direction. 
  • Uses complex electrical schematics and blueprints to troubleshoot and correct problems. 
  • Displays positive attitudes and practices good work ethics that reflects the mission, philosophy and goals of the company. 
  • Provides excellent customer service.
  • Complete tasks in timely manner and provide feedback.

Requirements

  • Must have current California State General Electrician Certification
  • Must have a minimum of 5+ years related work experience as an Industrial or Commercial Electrician.
  • Knowledge in using hand tools, electrical meter and testing equipment
  • Efficient in sizing conductors, conduits and using NEC Code Book
  • Experienced in handling low to high voltage up to 480 VAC.
  • Strong knowledge in trouble shooting of motor controls, drives and electronic components a plus
  • Ability to interpret electrical prints and schematics
  • Ability to install electrical equipment and circuit modification
  • Ability to work in high elevation up to 80 ft. high
  • Must have strong inter-personal skills, along with the ability to interact with all levels of management; must have high degree of initiative, and the ability to work alone and effectively with other people
  • Good understanding of Drives and PLC is a plus
  • Knowledge to identify electrical hazards and proper safety procedures

Electromechanical Design Engineer – Vehicle Exterior Systems
Req. ID: 41358
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Job Title: Electromechanical Design Engineer – Vehicle Exterior Systems

The Role

As an Electromechanical Engineer within the Vehicle Exterior Engineering group you will be responsible for design, release and launch of Electrically controlled systems on future vehicle lines including, but not limited to:

·        Windshield wiper mechanism

·        Active Louvre (active grille shutters)

·        Side (wing) mirror

·        Windshield washer & tank

·        Glazing

You will be part of the team that creates and executes world class systems in terms of styling, function and customer quality. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering entire systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Engineering Manager of Exterior Systems.

Responsibilities

As part of Tesla’s Vehicle engineering team you will design release and launch Exterior components and subsystems, aligned with program product profile with responsibilities to include:

·        Concept Engineering & feasibility (motor sizing & control)

·        Packaging & layout within vehicle architecture

·        Design to deliver customer-driven Exterior system targets for Craftsmanship, function, cost and weight.

·        Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost.

·        Detail Design including datum & fixation strategy, GD&T

·        Complete and release component & sub system design, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (In-house designs are planned for most major commodities).

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program.

·        Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design

·        Collaborate with key suppliers & tool makers to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.

·        Collaborate with cross functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.

·        Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

Requirements

• Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

• Preferably 5 years of experience in automotive or similar field, but proven evidence of technical aptitude can be a substitute for exposure. Evidence of following the design process from initial concept stages through tooling release and production launch, having completed 3D and 2D CAD in Catia V5. Other CAD experience will be considered but ultimately Catia V5 will be used.

• Automotive Engineering with components in the Exterior environment preferred

• Experience managing suppliers for product development.

• Have a good mix of designing a variety of materials (stamped, injection mold, cast, etc.) and designing kinematics/ mechanisms.

• Understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering between low/high volume, entry/premium vehicle systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.

• Have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.

• Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.

•Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.

• Strong familiarity with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents.

• Demonstrate an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout your career.

Electronic Design Engineer - Power Electronics
Req. ID: 38874
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla is accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy by designing and manufacturing electric vehicles and energy storage systems. Tesla employs more than 13,000 employees across four continents, and manufactures cars at our factory in Fremont, California. We are currently constructing the Gigafactory-the world’s largest lithium ion battery-in Sparks, Nevada, and have begun production of Tesla Energy battery storage products.

Tesla Motors is seeking a power-electronics design Engineer who has had 3-5 years of experience in hands-on design and development, architecting, lab testing, and troubleshooting power-electronics circuits and systems.   Power applications involve high-voltage (230V_AC, 430V_DC) and high-current (80A_AC, 24A_DC) applications.  This Engineer should have a strong background in design and not simply having managed 3rd-party or other’s designs.

Responsibilities:

·      Design of low to medium power Flyback power supplies.

·      Design of instrumentation and current-measuring and voltage-measuring circuits using op-amps, comparators, discrete transistors and digital circuits

·      Knowledge of world AC power distribution systems, single-phase and three-phase using Delta or Wye distribution transformers

Requirements:

·      Bachelor’s in Engineering with minimum 5 years of experience in developing circuits from scratch or equivalent in experience and exceptional ability.

·      Experienced with working in electronic-lab environments and equipment

·      PCB design layout understanding and experience

·      Strength in working collaboratively in Engineering teams

·      Excellent communication skills

Preferred Skills:

·      Knowledge of Lithium Ion battery charger systems and circuits

·      Master Degree and two years of industrial experience

·      Knowledge in writing Firmware code

·      Circuit Simulation and CAD tools experience

<< Back to Search Results

Electronics Design Engineer - Harness
Req. ID: 24271
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a harness/packaging design engineer. This engineer will be responsible for the 3D design of wiring harnesses and for the physical integration of the vehicle 12V electrics/electronics modules and harnesses into the Tesla Motors Model S EV Sedan and other Tesla vehicle programs.

Responsibilities:

  • Interact with all other subsystems teams to determine electrical requirements
    • Power requirements – both output and input
    • Minimum input voltage requirements (or maximum resistance)
    • Work with subsystem engineers / suppliers to fill in blanks when information is incomplete
    • Work with other engineering teams to develop system topology.
  • Generate wiring diagrams based on information provided
  • Evaluate power requirements for entire vehicle as well as subsystems.
  • Evaluate wire sizing based on harness topology and system requirements
  • Work with mechanical engineers to ensure harness partitioning, bundles and routing support overall requirements.
  • Track crimp status and work to minimize crimps by changing wire colors, sizes, terminals.
  • Evaluate DFMEA on critical systems or components when necessary
  • Evaluate optioned circuitry for cost and give-away potential
  • Create ECRs to communicate design change requirements to suppliers
  • Evaluate supplier change/deviation requests for feasibility and compliance with system requirements
  • Trouble-shoot and fix electrical problems in Vehicle Assembly for prototype builds and start of production phases
  • Provide expertise and documentation to Service for publications and vehicle trouble-shooting and repair
  • Determine best balance between forward/backward compatibility for new harness designs to minimize disruption to Manufacturing and Service
  • Determine optimal harness variants to enable all vehicle options/packages in most economical way
  • Create/modify/improve custom and commercially-available design/database tools
  • Maintain database of all BOM components and associated harnesses

Requirements

  • BSEE, MSEE preferred
  • Experience in electrical design for complex systems, automotive preferred but not required.
  • Fluent with a schematic capture program, preferably Mentor Graphics Capital Logic or Integrator
  • Strong Analytical Problem Solving skills
  • Understanding of EMC/EMI impacts on system design
  • Detail-oriented, well organized
  • Some experience with programming is helpful, but not required (PHP, Python, Visual Basic, etc.)

Embedded Application Software Engineer - Energy Software
Req. ID: 25785
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla Motors, headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, develops high-performance electric vehicles and electric powertrain technology.  The mission of Tesla Motors is to increase the efficiency and reduce the environmental impact of transportation energy use by accelerating the spread of electric vehicle technology to as many people as possible.  Electric cars are only as clean as the grids that charge them, and using the same powertrain technology, Tesla has developed a business unit to address the increasing need for stationary storage battery systems, which allow for even higher levels of renewable generation. The suite of grid-connected battery systems developed by Tesla perform a variety of high value functions for utilities, businesses, and residential customers, and the fast-growing team is adding top team members for engineering, business, and sales. 

The Role

Tesla Energy is looking for a Software Engineer to write Energy Storage controller application running on an embedded Linux platform.  The systems are at an early stage, so you will need to be able to contribute to cross functional system architecture, software system design, and rapid prototyping before developing a production solution.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop software that implements control of high voltage systems
  • Specify, design, and implement functionality and behaviors of embedded subsystems.
  • Contribute to overall system architecture
  • Design software system interfaces
  • Evaluate control strategies and algorithms
  • Collaborate with validation teams to develop test strategies and test plans

Requirements

  • Capable of delivering high-quality code in a real-time embedded environment
  • Experience developing embedded software for safety-critical applications in production environments
  • Experience writing unit tests and doing test-driven development
  • Working knowledge of embedded protocols such as CAN, RS-485/UART, and Ethernet
  • Experience writing and understanding technical specifications
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • MS/BS degree in EE/CS or equivalent
  • 3+ years of professional firmware/software development experience
  • Experience in GO a big plus
  • Strong C experience
  • Previous experience developing embedded applications for grid-tie inverters for wind or solar, battery-backup UPS systems, or other high voltage power electronics.
  • Experience with CANbus systems and associated tools.
  • Knowledge of / previous development to work grid inter-tie standards such as IEEE 1547 and UL 174

Embedded Software Security Systems Technical Lead
Req. ID: 40153
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Embedded Software Security Systems Technical Lead – Palo Alto HQ

The Role

Other car companies have talked for years about a future of "connected cars." At Tesla, we make it happen. We regularly send over-the-air software updates to our Model S and Model X fleet, seamlessly delivering new features and improvements to our customers. Our mobile applications allow customers to interact with their cars via real-time, low-latency two-way communication. We also build tools for our internal sales, delivery, and service teams. Today we remotely identify potential vehicle issues before a customer does—and often fix problems remotely too. To this end information and product security is of the utmost importance.

Tesla is looking for a strong technical leader to head up the design of its next generations of embedded software security systems in vehicles, batteries, and charging systems. This is a highly cross-functional leadership role, where you will work collaboratively to agree on a vision of the product's functionality, assess requirements for security controls, architect software systems to achieve those requirements efficiently, and lead development of those systems. In short, you will be responsible for designing the embedded software that keeps all of our products secure, while providing customer-facing connected services and sophisticated remote diagnostics.
 

Responsibilities

  • Set the technology vision and strategy for security in our embedded software systems

  • Lead, and contribute to, technical requirements, architecture, and interface design documents

  • Design and lead development of real-time embedded firmware and embedded Linux software that implements security controls for the system

  • Develop, and lead execution of, test strategies and test plans

  • Collaborate cross-functionally in the following ways:

     

    • Agree on product-level requirements/goals with the Product Management team

    • Develop Threat Model, and design Security Controls & Mitigations with the Product Security team and Connected Services team

    • Develop Software Security Architecture for the entire system, including component-level requirements for all computers/controllers in the system

    • Drive execution across contributing components, with help from the Program Management team
       

Requirements

  • Experience in embedded development in robotics, real-time controls, or system software

  • Proven record of designing and delivering software security systems for internet-connected embedded devices

  • Experience incorporating hardware-based security techniques (Hardware Security modules, TrustZone, Secure Boot, etc) into a robust hardware/software system design

  • Expertise in Cryptography fundamentals and Public Key Infrastructure

  • Extensive experience creating, presenting, and refining clear, compelling technical specifications from top-level system architecture documents down to low-level implementation guides and test plans

  • System-level (kernel/bootloader) software development experience

  • Strong communication skills

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced, collaborative environment

  • Greater than 10 years’ experience designing secure software systems
     

Education

  • BS, MS or PhD in CS or CE, or the equivalent in experience with evidence of exceptional ability

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Engineer - Mass Properties
Req. ID: 42398
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role: Engineer – Mass Properties

The Department: Vehicle Design Integration

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline. Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone.

  • You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles in the world.  Without passion, you would find what we're trying to do too difficult.
  • You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company.
  • We are building real products -- not presentations. This must excite you. You must be a builder.

You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Navigate across multiple Tesla engineering system teams and with suppliers to achieve accurate and complete weight property data of vehicle components, assemblies and subsystems.
  • Interpret results of weight data analysis, identify issues and opportunities for weight optimization and effectively communicate across multi-disciplinary engineering teams and suppliers.
  • Ensure weight data integrity within the program bill of materials, Tesla’s PLM system (ENOVIA) and for requested weight roll ups.
  • Support engineering change requests – gathering appropriate weight data and presenting change implications.
  • Support optimization of the mass/weight management process and drive automation efforts to improve process efficiency and data quality.

 

Requirements

  • 3-4 years of experience in complex product engineering in either mechanical engineering or program management capacities.
  • Extraordinary organizational skill demonstrated by notable success in coordinating at least 1 large-scale, multi-disciplinary engineering project (professional, academic or extracurricular).
  • Excellent technical communication skill (written and verbal presentation).
  • Experience with 3D CAD systems and/or PLM systems is highly preferred.
  • Bachelor’s Degree required – preferably in Mechanical Engineering.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Engineer, Exterior Trim – Vehicle Exterior Systems
Req. ID: 41539
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Title: Engineer, Exterior Trim – Vehicle Exterior Systems

The Role

As an Engineer developing Exterior Trim for the Vehicle Exterior group you will be responsible for design, release and launch of ‘A class’ plastic moldings, including painted, mold in color, chromed components for future vehicle lines including, but not limited to:

·        Roof and Door Appliques

·        Wheel Garnish

·        Door Claddings

·        FRUNK & surrounding trim panels

·        Badges and Ornamentation

·        Rocker Moldings

·        Exterior Chrome Appliques

You will be part of the team that creates and executes world class systems in terms of styling, function and customer quality. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering entire systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Engineering Manager of Exterior Systems.

Responsibilities

As part of Tesla’s Vehicle engineering team you will design release and launch Exterior components and subsystems, aligned with program product profile with responsibilities to include:

·        Concept Engineering & feasibility

·        Packaging & layout within vehicle architecture

·        Design to deliver customer-driven Exterior system targets for Craftsmanship, function, cost and weight.

·        Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost.

·        Detail Design including datum & fixation strategy, GD&T

·        Complete and release component & sub system design, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (In-house designs are planned for most major commodities).

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program.

·        Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design

·        Collaborate with key suppliers & tool makers to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.

·        Collaborate with cross functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.

·        Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

·        Approve tooling, material injection and gating strategy

Requirements

• Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred). Preferably 5 years of experience in automotive or similar field, but proven evidence of technical aptitude can be a substitute for exposure. Evidence of following the design process from initial concept stages through tooling release and production launch, having completed 3D and 2D CAD in Catia V5. Other CAD experience will be considered but ultimately Catia V5 will be used.

• Automotive Engineering with components in the Exterior environment preferred

• Experience managing suppliers for product development.

• Have a good mix of designing a variety of materials (stamped, injection mold, cast, etc.) and designing kinematics/ mechanisms.

• Understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering between low/high volume, entry/premium vehicle systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.

• Have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.

• Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.

•Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.

• Strong familiarity with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents.

• Demonstrate an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout your career.

Engineer, Vehicle Design Integration

Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking an exceptional Mechanical Engineer who is motivated to change the automotive world. This Mechanical Design Engineer reports to the Engineering Manager of Vehicle Integration and Packaging and, in an environment of conflicting interests and requirements, will support integration activities to drive a balanced and coherent product. This role is within the Vehicle Engineering team but the engineer will work closely with the Styling, Program Management, Quality, Service, Manufacturing, Validation, and Purchasing organizations as well as external suppliers to design outstanding vehicles.

Responsibilities

  • Mechanical design and packaging of vehicle components to meet system and vehicle requirements while optimizing for efficiency, cost, weight, manufacturability and serviceability.
  • Support and execution of virtual builds in preparation for physical prototype builds.
  • Supporting the release process with engineering and PLM.
  • Support vehicle programs through the entire life cycle including; design, prototype builds, vehicle test, and production.
  • CAD top level management for all vehicle variants.
  • Using best practices for DMU / CAD clean up.
  • Pilot team member for the roll out of new CAD software and improved release processes.

Requirements

  • BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Outstanding design, packaging and 3D modeling skills - CATIA preferred.
  • Experience with Product Lifecycle Management tools.
  • Passion for electric vehicles and energy efficiency.
  • Demonstrable motivation and ability to solve novel, difficult design problems with tight timing constraints.
  • Flexibility and adaptability in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
  • Proven problem solving and communication skills.
  • Working knowledge of automotive interior, exterior, cabin and underhood packaging preferred.
  • Hands on experience with physical car projects for college graduates preferred. (ie. Formula SAE/EcoCar/Solar competitions)

Engineer- Chassis Systems
Req. ID: 15754
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

 

The Design Engineer – Air Suspension Systems is responsible for technical design and development of air suspension components and systems, in support of future model year vehicle programs. This role will work closely with the rest of the Chassis team to insure the air suspension system performs as expected as a part of the larger overall chassis system. The initial focus of this position will be to design mechanical components within vehicle space for new vehicles. Interface with other engineering teams is critical to insure proper packaging of performance of components. Throughout the development cycle of new vehicles, this role will also become involved in various other activities such as vehicle testing, manufacturing trials, and quality assessments. You will also be exposed to, and be expected to participate in the engineering activities related to the electro-mechanical components of the air suspension system, (valves, compressors, height sensors, etc…).

 

Responsibilities

·             Drive the design of air suspension components and systems that are aligned with best-in-class handling and comfort product profiles

·             Drive the creation and execution of component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods

·             Perform CAD and CAE operations in Catia v5

·             Optimize concepts and designs within the vehicle package space

·             Generate engineering data (models, drawings, specs) to allow manufacture of these designs

·             Participate in the sourcing process and interface with the supply chain team and suppliers as required

·             Insure the proper application of new designs on prototype vehicle builds

·             Establish manufacturing, assembly and service feasibility

·             Complete and release system, sub-system and detail designs

·             Complete component and system validation, ensuring performance targets are met

 

Requirements

 

·         Bachelor of Science in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (ME preferred) or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability

·         Minimum of 2 years of experience in design engineering in an automotive environment

·         Preference for experience with engineering production-level sport/luxury vehicles

·         Proficiency in CATIA v5 3D modeling

·         Experience following product design from cradle to grave

·         Experience in optimization of components for weight reduction, improved NVH, and reduced energy consumption

·         Preference for hands-on experience in suspension system test and development activities

·         Knowledge of and experience with air suspension systems preferred

Engineer- Craftsmanship
Req. ID: 38253
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role

We are looking for a highly motivated Individual to support the Craftsmanship Lead in delivering the highest possible level of vehicle craftsmanship for our products.  You will be part of a team that creates and executes world-class products in terms of form, function, and luxury. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Report to Senior Craftsmanship Engineers

  • Take ownership of Craftsmanship attribute deliverables for defined vehicle systems or areas

  • Benchmarking of competitor’s vehicles and consolidate data in order to define a robust and appropriately competitive Craftsmanship target

  • Creation and development of gap and flush control documents and ownership of target to process delivery alignment

  • Support and represent the Craftsmanship attribute at all relevant meetings with the product design and development activities

  • Develop verification testing methods to ensure all targets are validated

  • Drive closure of Craftsmanship issues through negotiation, quantitative data, influence and constructive alternative solution suggestion

  • Support the craftsmanship deliverables through to development/engineering signoff of the vehicle

  • Work with and support the quality functions to ensure targets are appropriately understood and measureable

 

Requirements:

  • Degree qualified or similar qualification in either an industrial design or engineering discipline  or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

  • An inherent attention to detail and an understanding of the factors that create a perception of exceptional quality in the mind of the consumer

  • An appreciation for the impact and contribution to dimensional variation in assemblies

  • Some understanding of statistical analysis would be advantageous

  • An appreciation of how subjective data can be measured or quantified to develop robust, representative Craftsmanship targets

  • Creative, constructive and positive approach in order to be able to positively contribute to the development of design solutions to meet Craftsmanship targets

  • Strong  communication and influencing skills

  • Good level of numeracy, literacy and logical reasoning skills

  • Five years of automotive or complex product design knowledge experience is preferred

  • Demonstration of knowledge in a variety of production and prototype manufacturing methods

  • Ability to work with local and remote colleagues

  • Flexibility to work across a wide variety of areas of vehicle design

  • Desire to become expert in craftsmanship and build a career within the field

  • Capable of leading, managing and completing projects with appropriate support from senior staff.

Engineer- Interior Systems
Req. ID: 37654
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

As an Engineer – Overhead Systems in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will be responsible for design, release and launch of the complete interior system for future Tesla vehicle product lines.  You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class interiors in terms of form, function and luxury. 

 

You will utilize your expertise in one Overhead Systems and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Manager of Interior Engineering and this position resides in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team.

Responsibilities

  • Design of automotive component parts in CATIA V5.
  • Develop and execute interior system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned interior commodities.
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost
  • Implement processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive interior craftsmanship and fit & finish.
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments.
  • Complete and release interior components, sub-system and detail designs, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (in-house designs are planned for most major commodities).
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design.
  • Collaborate with key exterior system and plastic component suppliers and support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure exterior system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.
  • Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) with a minimum of 4 years of experience in automotive exterior trim component and subsystem engineering, demonstrating technical aptitude from concept through release and launch for production and 3D modeling proficiency in CATIA V5  or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Must understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering of premium luxury trim and systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.
  • Must have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling utilizing CATIA V5 (minimum of 5,000 hours or 3 years) within an automotive product development environment. 
  • Must be self-motivated.
  • Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.
  • Experience with technical documentation in at least 1 full lifecycle vehicle programs to include DVP&R and DFMEA.
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.
  • Demonstrated an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout career.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Engineering Manager - Battery Measurement and Controls
Req. ID: 39921
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla is seeking engineers who understand the underlying physics of challenging problems at a fundamental level, have the experience to work fast and efficiently, and who relentlessly seek alternative solutions. Everyone at Tesla shows leadership and challenges the status quo to deliver truly innovative products. The ability to work quickly and effectively on open ended problems is far more important than familiarity with specific analysis tools. Unrivaled range, ludicrous performance, top-of-the-line comfort and long-term reliability depend on an excellence in design.

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a technical Sr. Engineering Manager who has had 5-10 years of design and release responsibility working with electronics design and component specification. The candidate will manage a team of engineers and will have overall technical responsibility for the battery pack monitoring systems which includes a distributed monitoring system, central battery management and controls, as well as sensors and signal conditioning. This person will oversee day to day operations of sustaining existing product (Model S/X), as well as guide the strategic vision for significant cost reduction through technology development.  Focus is on PCBA level Electrical design, Prototype firmware for board/processor bring-up, FPGA prototyping, custom silicon specifications, and managing outside design resources to produce custom silicon.

 

Responsibilities

·         Develop and maintain product roadmaps and continuously look out for next generation products.

·         Make technical decisions based on information from various sources and from his/her professional experience and areas of expertise.

·         Work with suppliers to negotiate program and part costs, supplier agreements, and supplier program timing (in conjunction with Tesla Supply Chain Mgmt.).

·         Skillful interaction across different groups

·         Strong technical background and design sense

·         Delivering high-quality product in a short amount of time
 

Requirements

·         Passionate about electrical/electronic systems, new technologies, and cars.

·         A quick and flexible approach to team management, information gathering, crisis management, design, synthesis, and collaboration.

·         A good understanding of analog sensor conditioning, high voltage design (450V), communications, processors, PCBA layout and fabrication, ASIC implementation, firmware, and design for safety and redundancy.

·         Solid technical breadth in Electrical Engineering and Firmware design.

·         Has successfully managed suppliers through the specification of requirements, execution, validation, and stabilization of production.

·         Skilled in driving team-members from multiple disciplines toward fact-based decisions.

·         Manage project schedules and budgets

<< Back to Search Results

Engineering Manager, BIW
Req. ID: 15900
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

BIW Engineering Manager

Responsibilities

  • Support the transition of a product from concept to pilot line production and into mass manufacturing.
  • Manage an engineering budget and develop a project pipeline by quantifying the ROIs associated with each investment opportunity to determine its effectiveness in delivering against production cost reduction targets.
  • Drive improvements in quality & throughput by leading a diverse team in the following activities:

Quality

  • Analyze and break down dimensional data and process steps to identify problem root cause (Sub assembly, Tooling, Supplier part, etc).
  • Actively monitor dimensional accuracy of BIW thru various measurement systems (CMM, Laser gage, Perceptron, Faro, Check fixture, etc).
  • Perform inspection and hands on adjustments to jig geometry to improve and sustain quality of product and equipment.
  • Provide day-to-day production support on quality concerns and develop and implement short/long-term countermeasures to quality problems while maintaining operational efficiency.
  • Actively support program specific datum coordination on current and future vehicle models by incorporating lessons learned. 
  • Standardize progress by developing, deploying, and training others on dimensional engineering best practices.

Throughput

  • Analyze, design, and optimize new production processes to ensure safety while maximizing yield, capacity, and cost effectiveness to enable the build of world-class vehicles.
  • Develop and modify existing line layouts, processes, and fixtures to improve material flow, waste reduction, and ergonomics by utilizing Lean Manufacturing best practices.
  • Partner with Equipment Engineering to ensure equipment cycle time objectives are properly balanced by the needs of the production workforce. 
  • Define a project’s scope, manage spend against the budget, coordinate with outside vendors, and oversee the installation of new equipment to ensure all requirements are met.
  • Influence design engineers with recommendations to incorporate alternate vehicle design features or assembly techniques that enhance the manufacturability of the product.
  • Assist in the training of supervisors and operators as needed.

Requirements

Education &Technical Skill-Set

  • B.S. in Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering.
  • Minimally 5-8 years of experience in a Body Shop manufacturing environment with demonstrated leadership of others.
  • Must possess process engineering skills (process development/improvement, troubleshooting, data analysis, constraint analysis, flow optimization, etc.)
  • Strong mechanical intuition and extensive hands on experience modifying jigs, fixtures, and coordinating equipment installations.  Prior CNC or manual machining experience beneficial.
  • Excellent understanding of GD&T and ability to create datum strategies that minimize tolerance stack-up in critical areas.
  • Good understanding of BOMs, manufacturability, process design, process validation, assembly methods, and cost reduction methodologies.
  • Ability to read and interpret mechanical drawings.

Trouble-Shooting Analytical Tools

  • Experienced with CAD design software (Catia, Unigraphics, Solid Works, etc).
  • Experienced using measurement tools for root cause diagnostics (CMM & Perceptron).
  • Strong understanding of statistics to identify critical process parameters.
  • Prior problem solving skills - Green Belt, Black Belt Certifications, KT, RCA, etc.

Communication & Influence

  • Strong communication and team working skills at all levels of an organization
  • Ability to present simple solutions to complex problems and influence key change directives to other engineering teams.
  • Proficient with common office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint , etc).

 

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Engineering Program Manager - Tesla Energy
Req. ID: 40063
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Tesla’s Stationary Storage group is looking for a program manager to manage product change.  This is a cross-functional role that requires coordination between many different groups within tesla.  You will interface with engineering, supply chain and manufacturing to identify and define the key change items.  You will help to define and drive the development, validation, and implementation schedules and timelines.  You will be immersed in the change control process and will shepherd projects to ensure proper PLM, ERP, and MES implementation.  You will use your engineering background to understand the product and effectively drive validation, first article inspection, and manufacturing trial.  You will communicate and present project status, highlight schedule risk, and develop recovery plans in the event of project slip.

Responsibilities

  • Work with Engineering, Supply Chain, Program Management, Manufacturing and other supporting functions in order to identify and scope product change as part of the product development, continuous improvement, and sustaining engineering processes.
  • Create, maintain, communicate, and present schedules for change content.
  • Monitor the process of projects through the change process.
  • Identify creative ways to overcome obstacles and meet the schedule despite setbacks.
  • Advise on best practices for documenting changes on new and existing products.
  • Insure data integrity between systems (PLM, ERP, MES, etc…) throughout the change cycle.
  • Participate in the development and continuous improvement of ECO and other related practices.
  • Monitor material run-out and reorder times related to changes
  • Monitor cost impact of changes.
  • Assist in the communication of Engineering BoM requirements between Supply Chain and Production to facilitate material planning, order fulfillment and execution.
  • Create and release Bill of Material structures based on input from Engineering and Manufacturing to represent appropriate multilevel structuring and groupings.
  • Initiate and manage ECOs to document and communicate changes to previously released parts and BoMs.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in an engineering or manufacturing environment with responsibility for implementing or managing change.
  • Demonstrated experience creating, maintaining and communicating schedules.
  • Demonstrated experience in creating and managing bills of material in engineering and production environments, including ECO processing. 
  • Demonstrated understanding of multilevel Bill of Material hierarchy, including hardware and software components.
  • Demonstrated understanding of product release cycle as it relates to the creation and change management of parts and BOM structures.
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Skills with common workplace software (word processor, spreadsheet, presentation software etc) with the ability to create and maintain metrics.
  • Ability to work cross functionally with engineering, production, and supply chain personnel.
  • BS in an engineering discipline.

 

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Engineering Technician
Req. ID: 18769
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Engineering Technician

About Tesla

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles.  We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

The Role

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated individual to support the Powertrain Test Lab in all technician related tasks. The Engineering Technician will assist Test Engineers in the Powertrain Test Lab as well as members of the design teams with their testing needs.

The desired individual shall be capable of communicating effectively with team members within the Test Lab as well as those from other groups. Balancing multiple tasks is essential to the smooth operation of the Test Lab.

This full time role requires the flexibility to support testing in the lab outside of normal business hours when necessary.

Responsibilities

  • Build, construct, troubleshoot, repair and document mechanical fixtures and electrical harnesses.
  • Troubleshoot and maintain existing electrical, thermal and mechanical test equipment.
  • Maintain lab cleanliness and safety (May include mopping, vacuuming, putting away tools)
  • Perform setup of powertrain engineering tests with focus on efficiency and safety.
  • Perform continuous monitoring of electrical, thermal and mechanical reliability tests.
  • Perform characterization tests of powertrain equipment before, during and after reliability tests.
  • Provide intelligent feedback regarding existing processes with the focus of improving efficiency, throughput and safety.
  • Monitor ongoing tests for faults and failures

Requirements

  • Read electrical schematics and harness drawings.
  • Capable of troubleshooting low voltage electrical systems.
  • Capable of lifting up to 35 pounds.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced environment.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Windows and Office applications.

Desired Skills

  • Experience with vibration tables, thermal chambers or recirculating chillers.
  • Familiar with high voltage DC systems
  • Knowledge in domestic plumbing, copper soldering and brazing.
  • Knowledge of basic carpentry and metal fabrication.
  • Machine tool experience
  • Safety certifications, ERT, CPR
  • Organization

<< Back to Search Results

Engineering Technician
Req. ID: 25965
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated Engineering Technician to tackle projects related to maintaining and improving our existing tooling, automation and processes related to the manufacturing of our electric drive units. Tesla Drive Units integrate an AC Motor, a Gearbox, and an Inverter.

Our Drive Units are critical parts of Tesla electric Drivetrains and at the heart of our company Powertrain business.

This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Responsibilities

In addition to troubleshooting and improving existing equipment, the Equipment Engineering Technician works under the supervision of Equipment Engineers as well as with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product.

He/She works closely with Design Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Quality, Production and Maintenance to support automated production of the drive unit to help drive capacity increases, cost reduction and ensure it is a sustainable process for years to come.

Equipment Troubleshooting and Improvement

·         Design methods and improvements to fix recurring machine issues.

·         Lead investigation into machine unplanned downtime and determine route cause

·         Troubleshoot non-typical machine failures using mechanical and electrical knowledge

·         Work with basic shop tools as well as local machine shops to produce parts

·          Equipment Maintenance and Documentation

·         Creation and revision of detailed Equipment Maintenance Specifications to assist Maintenance Technicians

·         Utilize knowledge of electrical and mechanical assemblies to predict equipment failure modes and proactively plan spare parts supplies

·         Maintain proper revision tracking for electrical schematics and mechanical drawings and ensure upper level machine assemblies contain all correct revision parts in PDMWorks

 

Equipment Validation and Characterization

·              Perform trials to test the effect of equipment improvements

·              Develop metrics to measure success of equipment improvements

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  He/She looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

Requirements

·         Proficiency creating detailed drawings from solid models in CAD (SolidWorks, Catia is a plus)

·         Good knowledge of Global Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)

·         Proficiency assembling per mechanical drawings

·         Comfortable reading electrical and pneumatic schematics

·         Experience creating bid package including design for manufacturing and BOM

·         Experience with or exposure to automation equipment, motion control, PLC programming and HMI is a plus (FANUC 6-axis Robots, PLC programming AB RS Logix5000, HMI Factory Talk)

·         Experience with rotating machines, gearbox and AC motor assembly is a plus

·         Experience creating maintenance documentation

·         Experience transitioning products from prototype to production desired

·         Experience introducing new products and new processes into a production environment

·         Knowledgeable about production quality metrics is a plus

·         Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines

·         Exemplary verbal and written communication skills

·         Experience with drilling, tapping and utilizing basic shop tools (manual milling and lathe turning is a plus)

·         Well organized with meticulous attention to detail

·         Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

  •         AS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)

·         5+ years of hands-on mechanical and electrical experience in a production environment

Description

The Role

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated Engineering Technician to tackle projects related to maintaining and improving our existing tooling, automation and processes related to the manufacturing of our electric drive units. Tesla Drive Units integrate an AC Motor, a Gearbox, and an Inverter.

Our Drive Units are critical parts of Tesla electric Drivetrains and at the heart of our company Powertrain business.

This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Responsibilities

In addition to troubleshooting and improving existing equipment, the Equipment Engineering Technician works under the supervision of Equipment Engineers as well as with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product.

He/She works closely with Design Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Quality, Production and Maintenance to support automated production of the drive unit to help drive capacity increases, cost reduction and ensure it is a sustainable process for years to come.

·         Design methods and improvements to fix recurring machine issues.

Engineering Technician - Power Electronics
Req. ID: 38902
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla


Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

 

JOB SUMMARY:   

  Support engineering group by fabricating and testing electronic circuits, cabling and test fixtures as well as testing of systems.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Construct, test and repair electronic circuits including soldering SMT and through hole circuitry.
  • Fabricate cable harnesses
  • Read electronic schematics and mechanical drawings or work from written / verbal instructions using little or no formally released documentation.
  • Utilize test equipment, oscilloscopes, DVMs, signal generators, power supplies and other standard EE lab equipment.
  • Follow documented test procedures to validate components and system level units.
  • Navigate computer systems and software necessary to perform job function using programs such as Windows, Outlook, Word, Excel and Labview.
  • Experience with high voltage environments extremely useful.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Associate degree or equivalent experience.
  • Electronic Engineering lab experience
  • Strong skills in problem solving, communication, personal effectiveness, quality and common sense, team player
  • Self starter, motivated.
