Engineering Technician - Robotics, Equipment, PLC
Req. ID: 32159
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Engineering Technician – Robotics, Equipment, PLC

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated Engineering Technician to (1) accelerate the development of our cutting edge EV Drive Units assembly processes (Rotor, Stator, Motor, Gearbox and Inverter assembly) and (2) expedite the introduction of new findings into production processes.  Working closely with Drive Unit manufacturing engineers, the ideal candidate will play a key role in reducing cost and increasing capacity on Model S by improving existing factory equipment and introducing new factory equipment.  This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of an incredibly exciting product.

In addition to building manufacturing equipment with manufacturing engineers, the Engineering Technician works daily with senior Technicians, keeping the development area where we build our next-level factory equipment organized, well-stocked, and well-tooled.

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, craftsmanship, organizational skills and attention to detail.  Tesla is an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  The ideal candidate looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job, but also provides guidance to more junior peers as well as being able to work efficiently with minimal guidance.

Responsibilities:

  • Assembly of electrical, mechanical, pneumatic, and hydraulic equipment for production products’ factories in Deer Creek and Fremont.
  • Assembly of prototype manufacturing equipment for Manufacturing Engineering R&D.
  • Rigging and deployment of equipment in the Deer Creek and Fremont factories.
  • Execute technician tasks independently after initial instruction.
  • Execute technician tasks while deployed at a different building than the project’s engineer.
  • Oversee and advise the group’s other technicians’ craftsmanship.
  • Lead other technicians’ work on large assembly projects.
  • Work closely with the Production organization’s maintenance group beyond authoring PMI’s, to collaboratively equip maintenance with the skills necessary to maintain factory equipment.
  • Direct daily interaction with the Drives Systems Engineering engineers responsible for equipment projects, bringing questions and problems to the engineers as necessary.

Requirements

  • Experience reading mechanical drawings and assembly per mechanical drawings
  • Proficient in reading electrical schematics and wiring electrical control panels or equipment remote actuators and inputs and outputs as well plumbing equipment, pneumatic or/and hydraulic lines
  • Experience redlining electrical and fluid schematics for updates
  • Experience in characterizing and validating new equipment and fixtures capability, repeatability and capacity prior to introduction to the production floor
  • Knowledgeable about production quality metrics is a plus
  • Experience introducing new products and new processes into a production environment
  • Capable to open and edit electrical or fluid schematics using AutoCad software
  • Working knowledge of DC/AC electrical systems
  • PLC: troubleshooting or programming equipment (Allen Bradley, Siemens)
  • Robotics troubleshooting or programming (Fanuc, Kuka)
  • Experience and/or exposure to Machining: NC machine tools; mill, lathe, saws, grinding equipment
  • Experience and/or exposure to CNC machines: Haas, DMG, Mazak, Matsuura, Emmegi
  • Experience with conveyor systems: Logomat, Bosch
  • Experience rigging, driving forklift, driving scissor lifts, and using pallet jacks.
  • Ability to purchase made-to-spec parts and assemblies from a variety of local vendors via PO’s.
  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Experience in automotive is highly desired

Engineering Technician - Vehicle Electrics
Req. ID: 29498
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

 

The Role

This position is within the Vehicle Electrics team, supporting multiple PCB and System Developments in a R&D environment. The role requires exceptional technical knowledge with the ability to debug circuits to component level.  Soldering skills are required and the ability to fabricate and connect test fixtures.  Good communication skills are required in order to work with various teams. Also requires organizational skills to manage and streamline tasks to support an engineering lab.

Responsibilities

  • Debug to component level.
  • Provide engineering support.
  • Design and build wiring harnesses to support electrical testing of components. Integrate various inputs based on schematics, wiring diagrams, test requirements, and engineering guidance into testable solutions.
  • Perform repairs and modifications from engineering on electric vehicles.
  • Utilize various test resources (Oscilloscopes, various analyzers, multi-meters, testers, etc.) in order to set up, run and monitor several series of electrical tests.
  • Maintain stock of supplies to support a lean and streamlined development environment.
  • Maintain and expand a clean, safe and organized working environment. Apply workplace organization concepts and methods to improve efficiency.

Requirements

  • BSEE or Associate degree in electronics preferred
  • Proven ability to debug failures to component level
  • Basic understanding of electrical and electronic circuits and components
  • Experience in R&D electronics environment or electrical testing lab
  • Experience working with high voltage products is a plus
  • Knowledge of vehicle electrics and electronics
  • Excellent Soldering and electronics fabrication skills.
  • Mechanical fabrication skills.
  • Strong sense of quality and craft in work.
  • Skilled in using volt meters, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, logic analyzers, programmable power suppliers.
  • Experience with network protocols is a plus: CAN, LIN, I2C, Ethernet, etc.
  • Ability to read and create mechanical drawings and schematics.

Engineering Technician Lead
Req. ID: 31835
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company based in the San Francisco Bay Area.  We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

 

Job Title:

Engineering Technician Lead

 

Department:

Manufacturing Engineering

 

Description:

Tesla is looking for a highly-motivated and experienced Lead Technician to accelerate the assembly of manufacturing equipment. The role is a combination of individual contribution and management of other technicians. The role works closely with manufacturing engineers and plays a key role in reducing cost and increasing capacity on Tesla Energy and Model 3 Battery products. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to Tesla’s world-class manufacturing facility in Nevada. Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of an incredibly exciting product.

 

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Lead Technician’s specific responsibilities include:

 

  • Direct daily interaction with the Engineers responsible for equipment projects.
  • Managing the technicians on the team, including their productivity, priorities, and resolution of their problems.
  • Assembly of electrical equipment for the factory.
  • Assembly of pneumatic and hydraulic equipment for the factory.
  • Rigging and moving of manufacturing equipment.

 

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, craftsmanship, organizational skills and attention to detail. He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility. He/She looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

 

Job Skills:

 

  • Comfortable dealing with factory equipment electrical assemblies, such as high-current/high-voltage AC and high-current/high-voltage DC.
  • Comfortable reading mechanical drawings and assembling per drawings.
  • Comfortable reading electrical/pneumatic drawings and assembling electrical/pneumatic cabinets per drawings.
  • Comfortable promptly and clearly raising questions and problems verbally and via email to the Engineers during the assembly of equipment.
  • Comfortable maintaining an engineering lab area’s allocation of floor space for various capital-equipment projects and its overall cleanliness.
  • Comfortable maintaining stocked bins of commonly used components (e.g. terminal blocks, crimps, wire) by re-ordering as necessary from vendors such as McMaster, Digikey, and Mouser.
  • Capability to work on one’s feet the entire work day is required.
  • Experience driving forklift and rigging heavy equipment is a plus.

 

 

Qualifications:

  • AS or BS in a technical topic.
  • 10+ years relevant experience.

Engineering Technician, Body Center Pilot Team
Req. ID: 41240
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

Support & coordinate daily work activities ensuring high quality/safe operations in Body Center Prototype shop. Engineer Tech will be responsible to lead & direct larger group of Pilot Team Associates supporting New Model pilot + launch schedules & to maintain continuity of operations in prototype shop or newly developed procedures, consistently works to optimize process efficiency from beta builds through Start of Production. Support T/M growth & development to meet; Safety, Quality, Efficiency + Cost/Innovation goals at Tesla Motors.

Responsibilities:

  • Pre-Shift start-up Pass down Communication; confirm area start up condition & build-plan accordingly by project scope.
  • Lead Team huddles (Start of Shift). Coach/Motivate & Inform TMs of Safety, Quality & Pilot build issues.
  • Conduct quality coaching / performance improvement, communication, confirm efficient manpower distribution.
  • Support S/V to develop, delegate training for new operators & replacements, monitor to ensure progress is timely & effective
  • Ensure Work Instruction information is communicated to T/M level & follow up to ensure content applies and is practical.
  • Confirm T/Ms performing; Quality-checks, verify documentation is complete & revision level is accurate
  • Drive T/M accountability in best-safety practices; Process Ergo, Mech. assist checks, take action to address unsafe operating conditions.
  • Confirm start up after breaks /lunch; ensure accurate part inventories & good 5S at Prototype shop sub assembly lines.
  • Communicate & follow up on next-customer dissatisfaction issues, ensure appropriate & timely countermeasure action.
  • Check production plan vs. actual, work with direct supervisor to adjust workload as necessary to meet schedule needs.
  • Practical working knowledge of; Process sheets, Std. Work, Torque checks, weld tip change, Weld stud check, adhesive application patterns , datum pin requirement, sensor verification schedules & Safety (PPE, Manual & Auto cell Lock-Out)..
  • Monitors Pilot Build KPI’s, tracks efficiency &Associate productivity levels to ensure cost effective operation of Pilot Team.
  • Ensures Safety compliance, lock-out/ tag-out practices/procedures, equip. Safety Buy-off & Job Hazard Assessment is desired.
  • Support progressive training plan; Quality & Safety. Maintain satisfactory attendance record per Tesla employee guidelines.
  • Promote & sustain working environment of mutual trust & respect within Pilot Team, Production & Eng. Support Groups.
  • Works cooperatively with direct report Associates & support groups to continuously improve Team performance metrics.

Requirements:

  • Requires working in variable temperature factory setting. Ability to repetitively handle, lift/carry parts weighing up to 60 lbs.
  • Requires working while standing for periods of time = < 2.5 Hrs. throughout the duration of 8 to 12 hr. shift.
  • Requires wearing common protective or unique safety equipment including welding respirator & high-noise hearing protection
    Steel toed boots/shoes, Safety glasses, earplugs, bump cap, safety sleeves, gloves + resistance welding PPE.
  • Potential exposure to high strength magnets & industrial grade bonding agents. Manual operation of suspended weld guns.
  • Must be Shift flexible w/high commitment & ability to work variable schedule including daily/weekend overtime as needed.
  • Pass drug screen and successful background check. Ability to travel to domestic and or international equip. vendor sites.
  • Ability to repeat physical/ mental activities, accuracy of work, including responsible time management & prioritization skills.
  • High school diploma or equivalent, some college or manufacturing -related trade school certification is desired, or evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Previous experience with CMT, MIG and or TIG welding. Ideally working with both steel & aluminum.
  • Has perfunctory understanding of vehicle dimensional / CVIS requirements or experience in body alignment/closures fitting.
  • Training & or practical experience (OJT) in problem solving and root cause identification. + Datum and or shim pack adj.
  • Administrative ability to accurately & effectively format/summarize/complete standard reporting pass down communication.
  • Previous Quality assurance, manual spot gun welding and or knowledge of Automotive aluminum repair work is preferred
  • Experience working with or troubleshooting robot issues and knowledge of robot teaching is a plus.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Engineering Technician-Electronics/HV Battery/Drive Unit
Req. ID: 38845
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The Remanufacturing Engineering Technician reports to the Team Manager. He or She is responsible for determining the root failures of complex electromechanical assemblies, and repairing or remanufacturing those products to specification. This position will involve gaining an understanding of various components and their interaction within the vehicle. The Remanufacturing Engineering Technician tests and analyzes the devices, and then follows provided instructions, schematic diagrams, and mechanical drawings to perform the repairs. They also work with engineers and technicians to identify new failure modes, implement corrective/preventive actions, help develop new repair instructions, and work to hand-written and verbal instructions when necessary. Remanufacturing Engineering Technicians will also use hand tools and computer-based electrical test equipment and databases to analyze and repair product and subassemblies. Equally important responsibility is to help reman production line with continuous improvement, efficiency, quality improvements, and authoring debugging and assembly instructions.

 

Responsibilities

  • Perform complex and precise electro-mechanical debug, repair, and remanufacturing.
  • Pull alerts, analyze and create RCA traveler to give instruction to Reman production line.
  • Write and modify existing SQL queries to get data from different sources.
  • Use some analyze tools in Excel including filter, conditional format, pivot table, and formulas..
  • Keep track of inventory for the team as well as help other team for inventory search.
  • Maintain inventory integrity and repair history through diligent record keeping and adherence to process.
  • Work from complex and detailed manufacturing documentation and/or verbal and written instructions.
  • Work with, and help develop specialized fixtures, test equipment, and procedures for failure analysis.
  • Collect data; update and maintain electronic and written records concisely and accurately.
  • Work with Material Review Board (MRB) to support Manufacturing.
  • Identify discrepant materials/components, both verbally and in writing to supervisor and engineers.
  • Complete tasks within standard times, as directed by your supervisor and per established schedules.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
  • Suggest enhancements to process and department layout, and help implement once approved.
  • Ability to analyze new failures modes.
  • Communicate product failure details to design, product excellence, and reliability departments.
  • Create failure analysis training material and participate in training of production technicians.
  • Ensure proper use and understanding of failure analysis tools and methodologies.
  • Possess the desire and ability to learn, as well as demonstrate personal responsibility.

 

 

 

Requirements

  • High School diploma or equivalent, Associate degree or engineering are preferred..
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in assembly and repair of electro-mechanical components or electric motors.
  • As this position has a steep learning curve, a minimum two years commitment for this positon is required..
  • Previous knowledge analyzing large datasets and graphical representation of data is necessary..
  • Previous experience with Carlogs, RCA, or MRB is required..
  • Knowledge of python or SQL is strongly recommended.
  • Working knowledge of high voltage DC battery systems, basic electronics and DC electrical systems.
  • Proficient with hand tools and computer-based tools, including precision measuring equipment, electrical test equipment, and computer databases.
  • Experience with semi-automated manufacturing equipment is highly desirable.
  • Ability to read and understand manufacturing instructions, electrical diagrams, and mechanical drawings.
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal.
  • Proficient with computer tools, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, WarpRCA, Car logs, Toolbox, and Confluence.
  • Must be reliable, innovative, committed, a self-starter, and quality focused.
  • Ability to perform repetitious duties while standing for long periods.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills across multi-disciplinary teams..
  • Can track multiple assignments and tasks simultaneously.
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment, occasionally requiring extended hours.
  • Can analyze and resolve complex failures of broad scope independently.
  • Can work closely with multiple departments.
  • Have an aptitude to learn and incorporate new technologies.
  • Ability to lift 30-50 lbs..
  • Experience in high voltage systems preferably Model S HV Battery is desired..
  • Experience interpreting vehicle logs and performing vehicle diagnostics is a strong plus..
  • Prior experience assembling and dissembling HV batteries or energized high voltage systems are a plus..

.

Environmental Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 38899
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Position: Environmental Engineer, Gigafactory  

 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide guidance for Federal EPA, State, and Local Environmental regulations. Interact with representatives from these agencies on audits and regulatory inquiries
  • Manage the Nevada Division of Environmental Protection application process for all environmental related permits
  • Ensure hazardous waste management meets all federal, state, and local requirements. Focus on reducing waste generation from production lines.
  • Manage system to control incoming chemicals onto site
  • Ensure compliance with global harmonized system implementation and maintenance
  • Develop, revise, and improve programs for recycling
  • Prepare environmental reports such as emissions test, operational, Tier II, annual emissions estimates, annual waste disposal and treatment, TRI, etc.

Requirements

  • BS in Engineering/related field or evidence of exceptional experience. 
  • 7+ years of experience working in environmental compliance.
  • Management System Lead Auditor Training (ISO14001)
  • Experience permitting complex equipment in a Title 5 or Class I / II industrial environment.
  • Experience developing, managing, and leading projects with aggressive timelines.
  • HAZWOPER 40 certified
  • RCRA certified  
  • CHMM and/or REM certification a plus
  • Excellent written and verbal skills including presentation skills are required
  • Aptitude for documentation and data analysis using MS Office programs, including Project, Excel, Word, and Power Point

Executive Assistant, Engineering
Req. ID: 37640
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

As Executive Assistant, you will support a high-level executive and the Engineering team in numerous administrative and creative responsibilities. This role requires an extremely intellectual, technically minded and ambitious professional. Your primary responsibilities include handling detailed meeting planning, travel arrangements, expense reports, and correspondence. Beyond that, you will become deeply involved in the business. We are looking for a bright and eager professional who is seeking the opportunity of a lifetime, to be part of a mission that is positively changing the future.

Responsibilities

  • LOVE what you do!
  • Manage hectic and complex calendars
  • Coordinate national and international travel arrangements
  • Maintain an advanced degree of confidentiality
  • Constant communication within the Engineering team to sync up on projects and goals
  • Build strong cross-functional relationships between departments
  • Assist with projects, event planning, meetings, and other responsibilities that best assist the team
  • Continually look for ways to best optimize your execs time and elevate the level of administrative support
  • Move at the speed of light (we know that’s not possible, but we try to get as close as we can)

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  • Minimum of 4 years of administrative experience
  • Experience supporting an executive in an engineering or product group within a high-tech company 
  • Excellent computer skills and comprehension of Outlook, PowerPoint and Excel
  • Cross all of your t’s and dot your i’s. Organization and attention to detail is mandatory
  • Strong scheduling and calendar management skills… did we mention attention to detail?
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment
  • Desire to pinpoint problems and find creative solutions
  • Last but not least, a strong passion for Tesla’s mission and the engineering behind it

Equipment Project Manager - Powertrain
Req. ID: 37459
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

Tesla provides a rare opportunity to work for a company with: exciting challenges, great opportunities for broad responsibility, truly beneficial products, high-visibility and name recognition, and competitive salary, stock options, and benefits. This position is in Fremont, California.

  The Role

The Project Engineer is an integral part of the operations,  engineering and equipment maintenance team and will be responsible for executing a broad range of oversight, tracking, and management goals.

  • Direct a variety of engineer projects across Powertrain manufacturing lines; from minor machine upgrades to major capital equipment installations
  • Work collaboratively with design, product excellence, production operations, Manufacturing Engineering and management to set goals and track deliverables.
  • Identify critical path, determine and integrate milestones, control points, imposed dates and go/no-go decision points into the schedule
  • Manage scope, schedule and cost priorities between stakeholder groups and within the project team
  • Provide consistent, timely, and accurate information on project schedules, issues, and deliverables related to Powertrain products and systems
  • Work on various engineering projects, including; safety systems, tooling and fixture design, equipment upgrades, machine relocations, prototype fixtures, and RCCA.
  • Ensure product validation and testing requirements are meet in a timely manner
  • Build quality inspection plans and programs to support product / business needs
  • Ensure safety and ergonomic regulations and best practices are built into the functionality of all assets
  • Participate in lean manufacturing activities, including; Kaizen, 5S, Design for Manufacture, Value Stream Mapping, and Cycle Time Optimization
  • Provide post mortem/root cause analysis for significant issues
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Qualifications/Skills

·         5+ years of experience in project execution, ideally with multiple delivered projects in a medium to high volume industry.  Individual contributor design engineering experience is highly valued.

·         Familiarity with mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, or software development process

·         Experience with automation, material handling, assembly, machining, or process controls

·         Experience in planning activities and cross functional management in an engineering environment.

·         Demonstrated ability to understand complex development projects and identify critical elements.

·         Experience with cost analysis, financial reporting, and budget control

·         Experience with CAD software, PLC programming, systems simulation, project management software (MS Project, Primavera, etc..) highly desirable

·         Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.

·         Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise.


Responsibilities

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Create, modify, and implement PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Design, fabricate, implement, and fully document equipment improvements and modifications.
  • Manage spare part inventory.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of extensive experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or comparable military experience.
  • Expertise in one trade, proficiency in others, and the willingness to learn additional.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Experience in automotive is highly desired.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs.
  • PLC and Robot programming skills. (Preferred)
  • Overtime and weekends as needed
  • Served in the United States Military Strongly Preferred.

Equipment Maintenance Technician -Stamping
Req. ID: 37227
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

The successful candidate will have experience in many facets of Installs and troubleshooting of mechanical and electrical systems for factory automation. Maintenance leadership experience in supporting a production line, as well as new model and/or new equipment introductions is desired. The candidate needs to be well-versed in various maintenance craft skills, troubleshooting, breakdown management, PM development and implementation, and spare parts management.

Responsibilities

  • Lead and conduct the installation, maintenance and repair of factory automation robotics and electrical control systems for manufacturing equipment
  • Provide Troubleshooting of electrical systems in plant manufacturing equipment
  • Provide effective direction, coaching, and OJT to fellow employees on shift to boost their skill sets, and help Production achieve their goals.
  • Lead and manage recoveries from breakdowns, and escalate issues appropriately. Write downtime reports for major breakdowns.
  • Plan and organize between shift and weekend work, including verification, for smooth operations.
  • Assist the Supervisor in developing PMs and procedures for maintaining all of the equipment in the shop.
  • Provide shift- to-shift communication in order to keep all associates up to speed and working toward the same goals.
  • Set an example, and ensure that all associates comply with safety regulations and the plant's safety program.
  • Work with engineers and fellow technicians to resolve technical problems.
  • Assist in candidate selection as requested.
  • Maintain departmental records
  • Maintain spare parts inventory. Identify and order needed parts, maintain tracking system.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Supervisor and Manager.

Requirements

  • Completion of a maintenance apprenticeship or equivalent OJT experience
  • 5+ years of extensive experience with trouble-shooting and correcting industrial equipment breakdowns and failures.
  • Robotic and controls programming skills a strong plus
  • PLC knowledge a big plus
  • Good computer skills, experience with Microsoft Office a plus.

Equipment Maintenance Technician -Powertrain - SDU
Req. ID: 40083
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Powertrain – Small Drive Unit - Rotor 5 PM to 5 AM (3 day / 4 day)

The Role:

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

Responsibilities:

·         Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.

·         Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.

·         Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment

·         Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.

·         Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).

·         Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)

·         Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.

·         Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.

·         Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.

·         Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.

·         Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.

Requirements

·         AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.

·         Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired.

·         Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.

·         Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.

·         Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.

·         Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment

·         Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.

·         Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.

·         Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc).

·         Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.

·         Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.?

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law

Equipment Maintenance Technician -Powertrain - SDU
Req. ID: 38283
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain Manufacturing

 

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company in the San Francisco Bay Area. We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 70,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.  You can learn more about the Model S here:  http://www.teslamotors.com/models

Department:

Powertrain – Large Drive Unit

The Role:

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

Responsibilities:

·         Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.

·         Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.

·         Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment

·         Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.

·         Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).

·         Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)

·         Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.

·         Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.

·         Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.

·         Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.

·         Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.

Requirements

·         AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.

·         Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired.

·         Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.

·         Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.

·         Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.

·         Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment

·         Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.

·         Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.

·         Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc).

·         Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.

·         Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.?

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Seats
Req. ID: 33719
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role:

Equipment Maintenance Technician – Paint 

The successful Maintenance Equipment Technician candidate will have strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to perform daily tasks required to ensure the operational availability of assembly equipment. He/she will have a working knowledge of industrial maintenance, encompassing the following areas:

  • Electrical/Mechanical
  • Assembly Equipment
  • PM and Repair
  • Assist with installation
  • Ergonomic issues

The successful candidate must be dedicated to perform the daily tasks / TPM / PM and follow up actions required.  Moreover, they must be dedicated to conducting the routine actions and documenting any / all abnormalities.  They will be integral to driving equipment OEE improvements to meet the production requirements.

Responsibilities:

  • Small tool repair (pneumatic staplers, hogring guns, riveters etc.) A US Military Gunners Mate is a great small tool repair guy
  • Conveyance and sequencing (currently all manually operated, PLC complexity will not be high and could potentially be served from main plant Controls support) Tekno brand or chain driven, friction roller, elevator system
  • Electric Hoist/Pneumatic Lift Assist maintenance and repair
  • Cart, scissor cart, assembly and repairs
  • Pneumatic tooling and fixturing SMC/FESTO or similar experience
  • Atlas Copco/DC Tools/PF Talk/Powerfocus/Torque Reaction experience
  • VEIT or other Steamer experience, small boilers used to steam in laundry industry, finished goods steaming
  • Industrial Hot Glue Guns
  • I foresee high interaction with production associates/Leads, this is a craftsman manual build and there will be many Ergo issues that could require creative approaches to hand tools and hand tool adaptations. 

Requirements

  • 4+ years of extensive experience maintaining industrial equipment or equivalent.
  • 4+ years of experience on industrial assembly equipment
  • Must have expertise in one trade, proficiency in others, and the willingness to learn additional.
  • Ability to lead others to achieve company goals
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Experience in automotive is highly desired.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs.
  • Overtime and weekends as needed

Description

The Role

Equipment Maintenance Technician – Robotics 

The successful Maintenance Equipment Technician candidate will have strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to perform daily tasks required to ensure the operational availability of assembly equipment. He/she will have a working knowledge of industrial maintenance, with a focus on:

  • Robotics
  • Electrical/PLC

 

Additional skills that are helpful:

  • Mechanical
  • Hydraulics/Pneumatics
  • Conveyor systems

 

The successful candidate must be dedicated to perform the daily tasks / TPM / PM and follow up actions required.  Moreover, they must be dedicated to conducting the routine actions and documenting any / all abnormalities.  They will be integral to driving equipment OEE improvements to meet the production requirements.


Responsibilities

  • Lead the day to day equipment TPM / PM activities to ensure operational availability including but not limited to responses to alarms, breakdowns, and production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Oversee analysis and adjustment of maintenance practices and procedures and Preventative Maintenance Schedules
  • Troubleshoot equipment breakdowns and quality issues
  • Train and develop team members
  • Create, modify, and implement PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Lead continuous improvement processes to improve machine uptime and reduce machine breakdowns when needed
  • Design, fabricate, implement, and fully document equipment improvements and modifications.


Requirements

  • 2+ years of extensive experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or equivalent.
  • Must have expertise in one trade, proficiency in others, and the willingness to learn additional.
  • Ability to lead others to achieve company goals
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Experience in automotive is highly desired.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs.
  • PLC and Robot programming skills is a benefit.
  • Overtime and weekends as needed

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Plastics
Req. ID: 42104
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont

Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

We are looking for an Equipment Maintenance Engineer to join our Plastics team for our Automotive Assembly factory in Fremont, CA.

Responsibilities

  • Testing, optimization, repair, and sustaining of Injection Molding Machines and controls systems in a plastics center
  • Lead, support and assist in equipment repair, construction and some process development
  • Integrate, repair, and use Controls Systems - Siemens
  • Installation and Sustaining Engineering for large scale automotive manufacturing  Injection Molding Machines 
  • Perform process improvement or optimization under dynamic and environmental conditions
  • Act as equipment expert and work closely with the maintenance technicians and manufacturing process engineering team, as well
  • Interact with managers, teams of engineers, and technicians, some working in other disciplines and on other subsystems

Requirements

  • BS or higher degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar manufacturing discipline
  • 5+ years of experience with Injection Molding Machines
  • Manufacturing Equipment installation, optimization, and sustaining as well as  process flow understanding including safety requirements
  • Strong knowledge of Siemens controls systems
  • Strong knowledge of Hydraulics
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills
  • Strong organization and documentation skills
  • Familiarity with plastics manufacturing processes

Previous Applicants:

<< Back to Search Results

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Paint - Plastics
Req. ID: 37225
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

The successful candidate for the Maintenance Technician in our paint/plastics center will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, but, a core skill set in paint maintenance processes and Injection Molding machines, extrusion and mold equipment maintenance. That experience will encompass Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Welding, Machining, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge present itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise.


Responsibilities

  • Day to day coverage of production line injection molding equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Create, modify, and implement PM documents, schedules, and activities under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Design, fabricate, implement, and fully document equipment improvements and modifications.
  • Manage spare part inventory.


Requirements

  • 5+ years of extensive experience maintaining injection molding equipment, or aluminum casting equipment and automation.
  • Must have expertise in one trade, proficiency in others, and the willingness to learn additional.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Experience in hydraulics, pneumatics, electrical is highly desired.
  • PLC and Robot programming skills a big plus.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs.  
  • Overtime and weekends as needed

Previous Applicants:

<< Back to Search Results

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Module
Req. ID: 41261
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Graveyard
Job Type: Full time

Description

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

Position Description:

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. D Shift - 6 PM to 6 AM

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.

Qualifications/Skills:

  • AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.
  • Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired.
  • Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.?

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law

Previous Applicants:

If you do not remember your password click here.

Job Type: Full time

Description

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

Position Description:

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. C Shift - 6 PM to 6 AM

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.

Qualifications/Skills:

  • AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.
  • Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired.
  • Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.?

Job Type: Full time

Description

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

Position Description:

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.

  • AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.
  • Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired.
  • Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.

  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.?

Description

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.

  • Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus.

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Electrics
Req. ID: 40009
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

Position Description

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

 

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.
  • Maintain customer satisfaction when interacting with Production teams and other supporting group

 

Qualifications/Skills

  • 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, email etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.
  • Customer driven to respond to request in a timely and supportive manner, going the extra mile to ensure the success of the OEM programs

Equipment Maintenance Technician - Body
Req. ID: 42417
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Equipment Maintenance Technician – Body 

The successful Maintenance Equipment Technician candidate will have strong interpersonal and communication skills and be able to perform daily tasks required to ensure the operational availability of Body Weld manufacturing equipment. He/she will have skills in industrial maintenance, encompassing the following areas:

  • Electrical / Mechanical
  • Robotics – Kuka, Fanuc, Motoman, ABB or similar
  • PLC
  • Conveyor systems

Other skills that are helpful:

  • Welding
  • Machining
  • Hydraulics/Pneumatics

The successful candidate must be dedicated to perform troubleshooting skills on Automotive manufacturing equipment. He/she must also be dedicated to the daily tasks / TPM / PM and follow up actions required.  Moreover, they must be dedicated to conducting the routine actions and documenting any / all abnormalities.  They will be integral to driving equipment OEE improvements to meet the production requirements.


Responsibilities

  • Lead the day to day equipment TPM / PM activities to ensure operational availability including but not limited to responses to alarms, breakdowns, and production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Oversee analysis and adjustment of maintenance practices and procedures and Preventative Maintenance Schedules
  • Lead continuous improvement processes to improve machine uptime and reduce machine breakdowns
  • Troubleshoot equipment breakdowns and quality issues
  • Train and develop team members
  • Create, modify, and implement PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Design, fabricate, implement, and fully document equipment improvements and modifications.


Requirements

  • 3+ years of extensive experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or equivalent.
  • Must have expertise in one trade, proficiency in others, and the willingness to learn additional.
  • PLC and Robot maintenance skills
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Experience in automotive is highly desired.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs.
  • PLC and Robot programming skills are a plus.
  • Overtime and weekends as needed


Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Equipment Maintenance Technician
Req. ID: 36977
Office Location: NA-US-MI-Grand Rapids
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

Responsibilities

  • Day to day coverage of equipment: respond to breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required)
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Maintenance Manager to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy
  • Participate in small improvement projects to assist in improving the facility
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example

Requirements

  • Associates Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment or technical military experience in lieu of Degree
  • Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired
  • Experience in CNC Machine and repair along with 480 3 phase electrical
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc)
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required

Equipment Maintenance Supervisor - U.S. Military Veteran
Req. ID: 27799
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

The successful candidate needs to have demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Breakdown management & follow up action to prevent repeat occurrences

TPM / PM development and implementation

Equipment spare parts management

OEE % improvement

Training & development

This person must be able to build upon previous successes, and take our Maintenance teams to the next level. He/she must be capable of collaborating with cross-functional teams and department leaders to address concerns and issues that affect part quality, production efficiency, work cell ergonomics, equipment maintenance, etc. The successful candidate will also have exceptional interpersonal, organizational, and management skills, demonstrating the ability to be an innovator and change agent.

Responsibilities:

  • Supervise hourly maintenance technicians. This is a hands-on working supervisor role.
  • Day to day line support; in-house repair work; PTO scheduling; OT & weekend work scheduling
  • Defining daily tasks and setting directions for the team
  • Interaction with Production and Engineering Groups
  • Develop SOP and methods
  • Develop & maintain proper documentation: procedures; periodic maintenance tasks; equipment changes (electrical, spare parts upgrades, mechanical), etc.
  • Assist with budget development and reporting.
  • Maintain spare parts inventory. Identify and order needed parts, maintain tracking system.
  • Training and directing the training of junior maintenance associates

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in supervision and leadership
  • 5+ years of extensive experience with trouble-shooting and correcting industrial equipment maintenance - breakdowns and failures
  • Robotic and controls programming skills
  • Project management experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs
  • Proficient in using a CMMS database
  • Open minded, highly flexible, positive attitude
  • Excellent people management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Service in the United States Military Strongly Preferred.

Equipment Maintenance Manager
Req. ID: 42581
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The successful candidate will have proven experience in all facets of Automotive Vehicle assembly maintenance to support sustainable production as well as new model and/or new equipment introduction is required. The successful candidate needs to have demonstrable skills in the following areas:

·         Equipment Operation Availability / % OEE improvement

o    System development to track current shop conditions

o    Identification of key areas of improvement

·         Breakdown management

o    Understanding of short term vs long term actions

o    Systems used to prevent repeat occurrences

·         PM / TPM development and implementation

o    Reference to past improvement initiatives / % improvements

·         Equipment spare parts management

o    Critical vs non critical parts determination

o    Audit methods to ensure no risk condition

·         Training & development

o    Assessment of current skills sets

o    Training action plans

The successful candidate must be able to build upon previous experiences and take our Assembly Maintenance team to the next level. He/she must be capable of collaborating with cross-functional teams and department leaders to address concerns and issues that affect part quality, production efficiency, work cell ergonomics, equipment maintenance, etc... The successful candidate will also have exceptional interpersonal, organizational, and management skills, demonstrating the ability to be an innovator and change agent.

Responsibilities:

·         Direct leadership of 4 maintenance crews covering a 24/7 operating capability

·         Responsibility for manpower management:

·         day to day line support

·         in-house repair work

·         vacation, OT & weekend work scheduling.

·         Defining daily tasks and setting directions for the team

·         Interaction with Production and Engineering Groups

·         Interaction with customer departments and managers (Production Control, General Assembly, Paint)

·         Standard development and creation of procedures and methods

·         Project management: both internal maintenance projects, and minor contractor projects.

·         Procedures & PMs, develop & maintain proper documentation of: all necessary procedures; periodic maintenance tasks; equipment changes (electrical, spare parts upgrades, mechanical), etc.

·         Assist with budget development and reporting.

·         Maintain spare parts inventory. Identify and order needed parts, maintain tracking system.

·         Training and directing the training of maintenance associates to support production requirements

 Requirements:  The ideal candidate will have/be:

·         8+ years of experience in maintenance / equipment management / leadership role

·         5+ years of extensive experience with trouble-shooting and correcting industrial equipment maintenance - breakdowns and failures

·         Experience in team building, coaching and succession planning for technical and engineering personal

·         Robotic and controls programming skills (Bonus = Fanuc Robotic systems)

·         Maintenance experience in a vehicle assembly shop on a journeyman level. Experience with aluminum car bodies is a plus.

·         Lean manufacturing skills and systems development

·         Project management experience.

·         Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs.

·         Proficient in using a CMMS database

·         Open minded , highly flexible, positive attitude

·         Good overall people management skills.

·         Great communication skills, both verbal and written

·         Engineering degree preferred

The Role

Responsibilities

  • Working on a team that manages construction contractors for installation of the Model 3 body shop
  • Review progress of installation and approve modifications to layout, and quality of installation
  • Ensure safety is planned for all installation activities and being properly executed by contractors
  • Develop new installation standards for use within Tesla

<< Back to Search Results

Lead Materials Engineer - Fasteners
Req. ID: 31912
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Tesla Fastener Engineering – Lead Fastener Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

Part of the Tesla M&P organization is a group of Fastener Engineers.  This team of engineers is responsible for designing every mechanical fastener used by Tesla and consults with design engineers on proper fastener selection.  The role will lead this team as well as providing individual technical contribution. 

Responsibilities:

  • Lead a team of 4-5 Fastener Engineers providing technical guidance, and in collaboration with other engineering and manufacturing organization, work statement prioritization and oversight of execution performance.
  • Design fasteners (2D and 3D) and release them into the Tesla Fastener library.
  • Develop, write and publish fastener design and installation specifications.
  • Provide consultation to design engineering on proper fastener selection considering assembly performance requirements, corrosion, and manufacturing.
  • Perform detailed analysis of fastened joints (e.g. torque vs. clamp load).
  • Establish test requirements necessary to validate fasteners and specific joints.

Requirements :

  • Mechanical or Materials Engineering degree preferred, comparable experience will be considered.
  • Practical experience with fastener selection, fastener design, joint analysis, fastener/joint testing incorporating both design and manufacturing requirements.
  • Ability to create 3D CAD models and 2D design engineering prints of fasteners.  Preferably in Catia v5. 
  • Have authored Fastener design standards and manufacturing quality installation specifications. 
  • Knowledge of both temporary and (e.g. nuts and bolts) as well as permanent fasteners (e.g. SPR).
  • Experience with steel, aluminum and plastic fastener material systems and corresponding anti-corrosion coatings.
  • Strong ability to collaborate across multi-disciplined groups along with exceptional organizational skills and communication (verbal and written).
