Junior Mechanical Design Engineer - Battery Enclosure
Req. ID: 38872
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla is accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy by designing and manufacturing electric vehicles and energy storage systems. Tesla employs more than 13,000 employees across four continents, and manufactures cars at our factory in Fremont, California. We are currently constructing the Gigafactory-the world’s largest lithium ion battery-in Sparks, Nevada, and have begun production of Tesla Energy battery storage products.

Junior Mechanical Engineer

We are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual to join the Battery Engineering Enclosure Team responsible for components which house battery subsystems and provide structure contributing to vehicle performance and reliability.  The mechanical design engineer will participate in the maintenance of Tesla Model S/X platform as well as Model 3. Successful members of the team have a breadth of design engineering interests and capabilities as well as an aptitude for structural mechanics and optimization.

Role

  • Provide engineering support of ongoing/continuous product and process improvement through cross functional collaboration with operational organizations within Tesla
  • Develop detailed component designs in CATIA V5 (soon to be V6).
  • Optimize designs via analytical, numerical and/or empirical tools
  • Coordinate/support component and subsystem design verification efforts
  • Support production tool design and qualification
  • Support production ramp
  • Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, capability and cost optimization

Required Skills

  • Product design experience
  • Understands mechanical structures
  • CAD proficient (software package optional)
  • BS in Mechanical Engineering, MS preferred or equivalent experience and exceptional ability.

Required Soft Skills

  • Product design aptitude and passion
  • Exhibits a ‘project based’ aptitude (Formula SAE, internships, hobbies et al)
  • Can-Do attitude, understands when to get their hands dirty
  • Experience with cross functional team interaction (technical and non-technical)
  • Detail oriented with solid documentation and reporting skills
  • Ambitious

Optional/Bonus

  • CATIA experience
  • Manufacturing experience

Role:

·     Conduct daily inventory transactions in ERP systems to ensure inventory accuracy and provide real time data

·     Assures inventory balances are maintained accurately in all affected systems

·     Ensures overall accuracy of inventory related data, which includes performing inventory audits and cycle counts. Ability to analyze results of counts is a plus

·     Monitor and control inventory integrity in warehouse management system

·     Maintaining product identification and location program

·     Ensuring all labeling requirements are met in a timely manner

·     Must be able to lift 30 lbs as part of the job function

·     Must be able to pass the forklift certification test and drive a forklift on a daily basis

·         Have strong verbal and written skills

·         Self-starter, able to work with minimum supervision

·         High School Diploma

·         Inventory Control experience in fast paced production environment is a plus

All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. << Back to Search Results

Integration Engineer, Powertrain
Req. ID: 34618
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking an Integration Engineer to focus on Electric Vehicle powertrain and high-voltage systems integration. The Integration Engineer is responsible for ensuring product functions are successfully achieved by the integrated subsystems as they interact in the context of the whole vehicle.

 

Responsibilities

  • Hold engineering responsible for the essential interfaces/interactions required for successful implementation of his/her functional area. This includes full product lifecycle responsibility for definition, implementation, and validation of these requirements to demonstrate the system is ready for product build phases and, ultimately, production. In some cases the Integration Engineer will be the subject matter expert and will be the chief technical contributor to aspects of system requirements and design.
  • Collaborate with system architects to ensure the high-level architecture proposals address the detailed constraints from his/her functional area.
  • Manage and lead integration of initial prototype systems, including bring-up, debug, end engineering test of complex systems involving networked microprocessors and software-controlled electrical and electrical-mechanical devices.
  • Work with the cross-discipline development and design engineers throughout the engineering organization to ensure the relevant subsystems are designed with appropriate requirements, interfaces and interactions to achieve specific vehicle functions.
  • Coordinate software and/or hardware releases so elements of the system are ready for integration.
  • Fabricate prototype test setups and hardware-in-the-loop testers to integrate new subsystems with simulated and actual vehicle components.
  • Collaborate with the design, integration, and validation teams to design tests which will validate the functions, interfaces, and interactions of the system. Identify areas of concern, and work with teams to rectify any bugs.
  • Work jointly with the engineering and validation teams to design tests which will validate the functions, the interfaces and interactions.
  • Work with manufacturing and with service to ensure the function(s) for which he/she is responsible will be correct in products in the field. This can include development of processes, diagnostic tools and methods, and root-cause diagnosis for product issues.

Requirements

  • BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Minimum 3 years working on development of complex electro-mechanical products.
  • Exceptional ability to manage simultaneous activities and challenges.
  • Comfortable analyzing data, as well as developing analytical tools to command functions, to monitor responses, to parse data from log files, or to aid in data review.
  • Hands-on technical experience debugging complex systems involving networked microprocessors and software-controlled electrical or electromechanical devices.
  • Creative capacity for developing new ways to integrate complex system better and faster in alignment with the aggressive Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.
  • Experience safely working with high voltage
  • Understanding of battery/charger control in an xEV application
  • Familiarity with Python or other scripting languages
  • CAN tools such as Vector CANape
  • Development of automated test fixtures

Previous Applicants:

Integration Engineer
Req. ID: 42422
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking an Integration Engineer to develop the high-voltage system which includes components such as the Battery Management System and on-board charger as well off-board charging equipment. The Integration Engineer is responsible for ensuring product functions are successfully achieved by the integrated subsystems as they interact in the context of the whole vehicle.

 

Responsibilities

·         Hold engineering responsible for the essential interfaces/interactions required for successful implementation of his/her functional area. This includes full product lifecycle responsibility for definition, implementation, and validation of these requirements to demonstrate the system is ready for product build phases and, ultimately, production. In most cases the Integration Engineer will be the subject matter expert and will be the chief technical contributor to aspects of system requirements and design.

·         Collaborate with system architects to ensure the high-level architecture proposals address the detailed constraints from his/her functional area.

·         Manage and lead integration of initial prototype systems, including bring-up, debug, end engineering test of complex systems involving networked microprocessors and software-controlled electrical and electro-mechanical devices.

·         Work with the cross-discipline design engineers throughout the engineering organization to ensure the relevant subsystems are designed with appropriate requirements, interfaces and interactions to achieve specific vehicle functions.

·         Coordinate software and/or hardware releases so elements of the system are ready for integration.

·         Fabricate prototype test setups and hardware-in-the-loop testers to integrate new subsystems with simulated and actual vehicle components.

·         Collaborate with the design, integration, and validation teams to develop tests which will validate the functions, interfaces, and interactions of the system. Identify areas of concern, and work with teams to rectify any bugs.

·         Work with manufacturing and with service to ensure the function(s) for which he/she is responsible will be correct in products in the field. This can include development of processes, diagnostic tools and methods, and root-cause diagnosis for product issues.

 

Requirements

·         BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or equivalent; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

·         Minimum 3 years working on development of complex electro-mechanical products.

·         Exceptional ability to manage simultaneous activities and challenges.

·         Comfortable analyzing data, as well as developing analytical tools to command functions, monitor responses, parse data from log files, or aid in data review.

·         Hands-on technical experience debugging complex systems involving networked microprocessors and software-controlled electrical or electromechanical devices.

·         Creative capacity for developing new ways to integrate a complex system better and faster in alignment with the aggressive Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.

·         Experience safely working with high voltage

·         Understanding of battery/charger control in an xEV application

·         Familiarity with Python or other scripting languages

·         CAN tools such as Vector CANape

·         Development of automated test fixtures

<< Back to Search Results

Instrumentation Technician
Req. ID: 36264
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Instrumentation Technician (Fremont, CA)

About Tesla                 

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

The Role

This position will work as a member of Tesla’s Vehicle Test Group acquire data from test activities to support data management and analysis for vehicle and component test activities performed in-house and at external test sites. The primary objective of this role is to work alongside the instrumentation application engineer / technician, define the most appropriate instrumentation set ups in order to obtain the correct level of data output, and process the data to produce meaningful results support internal customer requests.

The role will also support the test team in concern and database management, to ensure good visibility of concern and test status with relevant KPIs.

The successful candidate for this position must have a broad background in automotive testing.

Responsibilities

  • Install, verify, document, and maintain sensors and data acquisition as required for vehicle and rig based tests; including accelerometers, potentiometers, pressure/force transducers, thermocouples, timing instruments, and strain gages
  • Operate cameras, computers, diagnostic equipment, electrical meters, hand tools, power tools; including tweezers, soldering iron, amp/ohm/volt meter, oscilloscope, and microscope
  • Complete projects independently from technical verbal/written instructions, schematics, or drawings with a readiness to complete tasks that are within ability
  • Assist in assembly, setup, operation, repair and maintenance of test equipment, vehicles, and rigs
  • Perform preventative, corrective, and emergency maintenance toward 100% data integrity
  • Support development/modifications/repair of DC circuit and signaling devices, prototype concepts, building wiring harnesses, and pin/de-pin connectors

Requirements

  • High School Diploma equivalent completing Algebra; two-year technical degree; prior trade experience preferred; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • A valid driver’s license
  • Working knowledge of PC hardware environment; Windows, Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Working knowledge of handheld amp/ohm/volt meters and oscilloscope
  • Demonstrate experience with soldering; ability to solder according to IPC-J-STD-001 Class 1 (certification is not a requirement)
  • Ability to work precisely with small hand tools on miniature assemblies
  • Ability and willingness to work in extreme hot/cold, moderate noise level, crouch/lean/reach/lift, and use a ladder up to 6’
  • Ability and willingness to travel, work overtime, nights, and weekends (5%-25% anticipated) 

Desirable Attributes

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships with Tesla engineering and test teams, outside test labs, and others within and outside Tesla
  • Possess an eagerness to complete increasingly complex assignments
  • Experience working in laboratory environments ISO9001, ISO17025
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment to achieve common goals
  • Maintain top level professional integrity and appearance
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in vehicle maintenance

Previous Applicants:

<< Back to Search Results

Installation Project Manager - Supercharger
Req. ID: 38168
Office Location: NA-US-TX-Austin-The Domain
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 40,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

The Supercharger Site Development and Installation Manager role entails active program coordination for all phases of Tesla’s Supercharger deployment projects, including feasibility, layout, and design; utility design, easements, permitting, construction, site commissioning, and close-out. The ideal candidate has solid hands-on experience managing infrastructure projects (up to thirty projects at one time across multiple states/provinces); demonstrates initiative, clear-headed problem solving, and mastery of the tactical details for each project. Finally, s/he brings high energy and an optimistic approach towards aggressively driving each project to completion.

 

Responsibilities

  • Manages all phases of design and construction of Superchargers sites within a given territory. Success is measured by the number of sites successfully opened for public use.
  • Attends field site visits for construction, engineering, utility, and cost viability. Provides site reports and sketches as needed.
  • Reviews title reports for ownership, encumbrances, easements, and provides recommendation for construction viability.
  • Plans, coordinates, approves, and reviews legal documents and plans for right-of-way/easement/property acquisitions.
  • Serves as the liaison with utility company personnel to determine the best routing of primary electrical service.
  • Meets with zoning/permitting personnel to understand jurisdictional approval requirements and opportunities for timeline reduction. Represents Tesla and the Supercharger program at public meetings. Tracks and manages status of all needed approvals.
  • Reviews and approves construction bids and change orders. Provides support as needed to the general contractor during all phases of construction.

 

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 - 7 years project management, site acquisition, site development experience. Prior work in telecom as a project manager or site acquisition manager is desirable.
  • Established track record of managing and delivering multiple simultaneous projects ahead of schedule and adhering to the highest quality and standards.
  • Advanced knowledge of site acquisition procedures, including regulatory and permitting process.
  • Working knowledge of power integration and utility design process.
  • Skilled in reading, understanding and red-lining zoning and construction drawings, including utility designs and power distribution details.  Cognizant of cost implications and able to make recommendations which benefit the bottom line.
  • Aptitude in communicating and building relationships with landlords, local jurisdictions, utility companies and other stakeholders throughout the project cycle.
  • Ability to function autonomously, working independent of a support staff, without formal requirements documentation, in a fast-paced environment, ability to manage changing priorities.
  • Acts in a scrappy and entrepreneurial manner to accomplish tasks with far fewer resources than a big company would have.
  • Takes initiative; doesn’t accept the status quo, comes up with good ideas that improve the company as a whole, or our designs, processes, assemblies and/or results in cost reductions.
  • Ability to identify the critical path issues and institute remedies that shorten that critical path.
  • Ability to travel (50%-75%) as required.

Previous Applicants:

Installation Project Manager - Supercharger
Req. ID: 38167
Office Location: NA-US-IL-Chicago-Highland Park
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 40,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

The Supercharger Site Development and Installation Manager role entails active program coordination for all phases of Tesla’s Supercharger deployment projects, including feasibility, layout, and design; utility design, easements, permitting, construction, site commissioning, and close-out. The ideal candidate has solid hands-on experience managing infrastructure projects (up to thirty projects at one time across multiple states/provinces); demonstrates initiative, clear-headed problem solving, and mastery of the tactical details for each project. Finally, s/he brings high energy and an optimistic approach towards aggressively driving each project to completion.

 

Responsibilities

  • Manages all phases of design and construction of Superchargers sites within a given territory. Success is measured by the number of sites successfully opened for public use.
  • Attends field site visits for construction, engineering, utility, and cost viability. Provides site reports and sketches as needed.
  • Reviews title reports for ownership, encumbrances, easements, and provides recommendation for construction viability.
  • Plans, coordinates, approves, and reviews legal documents and plans for right-of-way/easement/property acquisitions.
  • Serves as the liaison with utility company personnel to determine the best routing of primary electrical service.
  • Meets with zoning/permitting personnel to understand jurisdictional approval requirements and opportunities for timeline reduction. Represents Tesla and the Supercharger program at public meetings. Tracks and manages status of all needed approvals.
  • Reviews and approves construction bids and change orders. Provides support as needed to the general contractor during all phases of construction.

 

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 - 7 years project management, site acquisition, site development experience. Prior work in telecom as a project manager or site acquisition manager is desirable.
  • Established track record of managing and delivering multiple simultaneous projects ahead of schedule and adhering to the highest quality and standards.
  • Advanced knowledge of site acquisition procedures, including regulatory and permitting process.
  • Working knowledge of power integration and utility design process.
  • Skilled in reading, understanding and red-lining zoning and construction drawings, including utility designs and power distribution details.  Cognizant of cost implications and able to make recommendations which benefit the bottom line.
  • Aptitude in communicating and building relationships with landlords, local jurisdictions, utility companies and other stakeholders throughout the project cycle.
  • Ability to function autonomously, working independent of a support staff, without formal requirements documentation, in a fast-paced environment, ability to manage changing priorities.
  • Acts in a scrappy and entrepreneurial manner to accomplish tasks with far fewer resources than a big company would have.
  • Takes initiative; doesn’t accept the status quo, comes up with good ideas that improve the company as a whole, or our designs, processes, assemblies and/or results in cost reductions.
  • Ability to identify the critical path issues and institute remedies that shorten that critical path.
  • Ability to travel (50%-75%) as required.

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 40,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

  • Aptitude in communicating and building relationships with landlords, local jurisdictions, utility companies and other stakeholders throughout the project cycle.
  • Ability to function autonomously, working independent of a support staff, without formal requirements documentation, in a fast-paced environment, ability to manage changing priorities.

Installation Manager
Req. ID: 32725
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Tesla Energy team is building a comprehensive suite of in-house resources for customers with Energy Storage needs. The primary function of this role is to coordinate and drive to completion Tesla Energy installations at a customer’s home or light commercial business. Acting as the primary point of contact for the customer, installation contractor, and other relevant parties, this role is at the center of a successful Tesla Energy implementation.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Field Sales Engineering to take the finalized system design and obtain competitive bids for the installation work.
  • Own the customer relationship from bid selection to a fully operational install, keeping them informed and involved at each stage of the process.
  • Ensure all relevant permits and approvals are secured and closed out as required.
  • Coordinate all site visits to minimize disruption for the customer.
  • Authorize and track parts shipments, ensuring the correct hardware arrives on site in time.
  • Survey customers and installers post-installation to ensure a positive experience and work to improve processes over time.

 

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent.
  • High touch sales, customer support, or other relevant end-consumer facing experience.
  • 2-3 years experience managing multiple complex projects simultaneously.
  • Experience with residential or commercial solar or electric vehicle charging installations or strong technical background and willingness to learn quickly.
  • Extensive knowledge of EV and or Energy storage technology and marketplace.

<< Back to Search Results

Infotainment Diagnostics Engineer
Req. ID: 37159
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Title:  Infotainment Diagnostics Engineer

 

The Role

 

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled hardware and software infotainment diagnostics engineer who specializes in developing and programming in Linux-based systems.

 

The candidate will join a growing electronics re-manufacturing engineering team that focuses on troubleshooting, repairing, root-causing, and re-configuring several types of failing and field-return infotainment devices back into original factory configuration, testable and usable states in a manufacturing environment, and in final working condition.

 

The ideal candidate will demonstrate hardware and software engineering skills applied to infotainment and automobile interior cabin instrument panels, center displays, gateways, instrument clusters, and driver-assist systems and technologies.  Programming, development, and experience in Linux-based systems are required, as this position requires highly complex and advanced designing, coding, and debugging in Linux.  The candidate will also demonstrate well-balanced interpersonal, professional, and technical communication both written and oral.  The candidate should have experience with designs of experiments, firmware/code validation, statistics, testing, validation, root-cause methodologies, and writing standardized instructions for manufacturing. 

 

Responsibilities

 

·         Design, code, and debug programs on Linux interfaces and architectures. 

·         Hack into, extract, interpret and analyze system logs data from Linux-based systems – be the “good guy” gateway hacker

·         Troubleshoot, root-cause, and debug an array of infotainment software and hardware, including but not limited to, g                ateways, CAN/LIN, HSD Ethernet, USB, audio input/output DSP, 4G LTE connectivity, Bluetooth, RF, and radar

·         Translate highly complex coding programs into clear, simple, foolproof, and user-friendly interfaces for technicians

·         Develop test code, plans, and experiments for detecting or reproducing new, unusual, or difficult-to-detect/reproduce failure modes

·         Investigate new field failure modes, drive viable root cause theories/mechanisms and countermeasures, and advanced/new testing methods/metrologies on infotainment hardware

·         Leverage cross-organizational subject matter experts, teams, and groups of software, hardware, process engineers, quality assurance, field service/product support, and third-parties to collaboratively solve problems

 

Requirements

·         BS or higher in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent; clearly demonstrates an excellent grasp of computer science fundamentals and principles, traditional and contemporary computer hardware, and programming/coding concepts

·         1-2 years’ minimum experience writing and debugging code and programming in Linux

·         Demonstrate proficiency in scripting tools like bash, python, and/or pearl

·         High standards for code simplicity, quality, maintainability, performance, documentation, and reliability

·         Ability to clarify, understand, isolate/segment, and verify information and key objectives in an ambiguous environment, then prioritize to execute under tremendous pressure and high pace

·         Must quickly learn and adapt to new and changing technologies in response to rapidly evolving hardware, tighter software security, and increasing difficulty/complexity

·         Experience with CAN, LIN, Ethernet/High Speed Digital, USB, audio/DSP, Bluetooth, power management, 3G/4G LTE wireless connectivity, WiFi/networking, and or similar multimedia hardware

·         Experience with radar and self-driving systems and technologies a plus (not a requirement)

·         Experience using lab test equipment in debugging and troubleshooting (e.g., oscilloscope, logic analyzer)

·         Experience writing and understanding technical specifications and procedures

<< Back to Search Results

Information Security Engineer
Req. ID: 37148
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated engineer specializing in network, systems or application security to defend Tesla’s information, infrastructure and products.

Other car companies have talked for years about a future of "connected cars." At Tesla, we make it happen. We regularly send over-the-air software updates to our Model S and Model X fleet, seamlessly delivering new features and improvements to our customers. Our mobile applications allow customers to interact with their cars via real-time, low-latency two-way communication. We also build tools for our internal sales, delivery, and service teams. Today we remotely identify potential vehicle issues before a customer does—and often fix problems remotely too. To this end information and product security is of the utmost importance.

As an Information Security Engineer you will be expected to be skilled at identifying security gaps in infrastructure and process, effectively execute projects/initiatives to address them, demonstrate excellent judgment, prioritization and communication of technical security risks, and act as a security liaison supporting business units.

Responsibilities:

  • Defend the company's information, networks, systems, applications and products.
  • Track and provide project management for ongoing Information Security initiatives.
  • Work with business groups to establish security requirements for projects and operations.
  • Work with engineering teams to implement the right security policies for servers, clients, and network devices.
  • Review and contribute to system architecture throughout the development lifecycle, identify and mitigate security risks.
  • Conduct security assessments and scans to identify vulnerabilities, recommend and prioritize remediation actions.
  • Analyze security data and report on system security status across various platforms and environments.

Requirements:

  • BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • Expert in one or more of: web application security, network security, Windows or Linux system security.
  • Solid experience in enterprise information security in large technology firms.
  • Excellent understanding and experience in multiple security domains such as platform hardening, vulnerability management, penetration testing, applied cryptography, network/application traffic control.
  • Proficient in one or more general purpose development languages such as Python, Ruby and Java.

Equal Employment Opportunity statement (EEO): Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Information Security Analyst
Req. ID: 23488
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated analyst specializing in security monitoring, forensics or incident response to defend Tesla’s information, infrastructure and products.

Other car companies have talked for years about a future of "connected cars." At Tesla, we make it happen. We regularly send over-the-air software updates to our Model S and Model X fleet, seamlessly delivering new features and improvements to our customers. Our mobile applications allow customers to interact with their cars via real-time, low-latency two-way communication. We also build tools for our internal sales, delivery, and service teams. Today we remotely identify potential vehicle issues before a customer does—and often fix problems remotely too. To this end information and product security is of the utmost importance.

As an Information Security Analyst you will be expected to be skilled at detecting, investigating and responding to security threats and attacks. You will have ultimate responsibility to defend Tesla against attack and will participate in the development, deployment and analysis of new detection methods and goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Detect and respond to attacks against the company's information, networks, systems, applications and products.

  • Work with engineering teams to develop threat detection signals and incident response plans.

  • Execute projects to improve security event collection, detection, analysis, correlation and response.

  • Participate in a rotation to analyze and investigate active threats against the company.

  • Perform digital forensics, malware analysis and participate in incident response functions.

  • Analyze security data and report on threats and incidents across various platforms and environments.

Requirements:

  • BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 

  • Expert in one or more of: security monitoring, forensics and incident response.

  • Solid experience in threat analysis or response in large technology firms.

  • Excellent understanding and experience in multiple security domains such as intrusion detection, security logging, malware analysis, and forensics.

  • Proficient in one or more general purpose development languages such as Python, Ruby and Java.

Equal Employment Opportunity statement (EEO): Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Industrial Vision Specialist, Crash Testing and General Assembly
Req. ID: 19030
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Industrial Vision Specialist, Crash Testing and General Assembly

About Tesla

Tesla Motors is breaking the mold and paving the path to change the way the world looks not only at alternative energy vehicles, but also at the paradigm of human transportation.   Our zero tailpipe emission products do not compromise on performance, luxury, nor utility.  Neither do we compromise on the people that make our products happen. Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline.   Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone. You must have a genuine passion for engineering electric vehicles.  Without passion, you would find what we're trying to do too difficult. There are much easier jobs. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products -- not presentations. This must excite you. You must be a builder.  We offer a competitive salary, meaningful stock ownership, health benefits, a fun work environment and the chance to make a real contributory impact on the world. 

 

The Role

In this position you will work as a member of Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Test Group supporting all test facilities. You will be responsible for the professional production of high speed video and still photography in multiple test areas within the Tesla organization. You will provide a level of expertise knowledge and guidance related to lighting, subject preparation, lens selection, camera operation and new equipment acquisition.

Responsibilities

·       To act as Tesla’s high speed imaging and photography expert.

·       To manage all the elements in each facility which contribute to the image quality.

·       To set up high speed camera equipment.

·       To set up lighting appropriate for the views.

·       To position and secure all camera hardware and associated cables for crash and sled test.

·       Processing of still images and videos as required.

·       To maintain all photo-instrumentation equipment.

·       To identify and store all still images and video data in the internal reporting and filing systems.

·       To advise on best equipment and set up to achieve required views.

·       To be familiar with the current camera and high speed video industry products.

·       To prepare information and advice on all photography equipment acquisition and deployment.

·       To develop systems, procedures and checklists to ensure the most efficient practices and highest quality images possible.

·       Operate and maintain safe working practices and environment considering the safety of yourself and other employees at all times.

·       To maintain and operate a clean and tidy working environment.

Requirements

·       A sound working knowledge of photography and high speed videography.

·       Experience in scientific or technical imaging.

·       Experience with high speed camera systems.

·       Experience with high speed event lighting systems.

·       Experience with video and photo editing software.

·       Experience with motion analysis software preferred.

·       Experience with MS office tools Outlook/Excel/Word/PowerPoint/Project.

·       Ability to guide and train test personnel in the use of photography equipment.

Qualifications

·       Degree in photography/imaging.

·       5 years of experience in a related field.

·       Must have valid driver’s license and clean driving record.

·       Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally (Up to 20%).

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

<< Back to Search Results

Industrial Engineer, Lean
Req. ID: 35423
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

The Industrial Engineer working on the Lean team within the Operational Excellence group will be responsible for designing, engineering, and implementing continuous improvement and process refinement, develop plant and equipment layout, capacity plans, provides standardized works, evaluates new techniques and technological developments, and apply lean manufacturing methods. These concepts and technologies will be planned and implemented at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California.  The primary objective is to implement a continuous improvement process solution to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, optimize space, improving labor productivity, accurate inventory, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates.  This position will report to the Sr. Lean Manfacturing Group Leader in the Operational Excellence group.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Assure clear development and implementation plan of projects, spearhead cross-functional team, develops well planned concept and design, coordinate with external/internal vendors, and deliver results on a timely manner.
  • Identify areas for improvement and develop action plan to execute it.
  • Understand future production trend or changes in Tesla and use it as leverage for strategy planning, preparation, and budget proposal.
  • Establish standards for new processes and support continuous improvement activities.
  • Identify areas for improvement in system related issues, propose new and efficient system logics base on the processes implemented.
  • Spearhead automation ideas and/or execution.
  • Identify and support areas for improvement to measure key performance indicators (e.g. efficiency and productivity measurement) and create dashboards.
  • Supports inventory and consumption accuracy through process improvements activities.
  • Develop simulation methods to support immediate data analysis.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Mechanical, Automotive Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 4+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics experience desirable.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with continuous improvement and process improvement .
  • Understanding of lean manufacturing concepts with the ability to lead kaizen efforts for continuous improvement.
  • Experience in project management of capital expenditures.
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills. Ability to manage several complex projects at the same time with high degrees of variation and uncertainty.
  • Natural ability to speak and write effectively at all organizational levels.
  • Ability to materialize concepts into a functional operational model working diligently with the supervisors and operators in the shop floor.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in Engineering, Business or related program preferred.
  • Experience applying and using analysis tools, including simulation, time study analysis (dynamic and static).
  • Strong knowledge of systems in a manufacturing or distribution system environment.
  • Proven experience on implementation of continuous improvement projects.
  • Lean manufacturing principles implementation experience.

Industrial Engineer
Req. ID: 40290
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Operational Excellence

Operational excellence includes many dynamic, exciting, strategic and analytical roles. Operational excellence team members define, track, and work to improve key production metrics in safety, quality, productivity, inventory and delivery. The operational excellence team demands a blend of an in-depth technical understanding of manufacturing equipment and processes, with big-picture business thinking. A successful operational excellence team member will balance short-term tactical improvement with long-term business process and systems improvement. 


The Role

Industrial Engineer

A successful industrial engineer will use his/her process improvement experience to quantitatively assess current production/business system performance and execute change to reduce cost. This role demands excellent communication and interpersonal skills as well as a big-picture understanding of manufacturing operations.  Industrial engineers will not only execute on change, but must prioritize projects based on opportunity.  Industrial engineers will work across departments with production, quality, manufacturing engineering, and sustaining engineering team members to improve factory operations and reduce cost.


Responsibilities

·       Identify, quantify, compare, and execute production process improvements to improve:

o   Quality (yield rate)

o   Availability (uptime)

o   Utilization (efficiency)

o   Safety and ergonomics

·       Create and implement tools to audit efficiency, and identify cost reduction opportunity across Tesla

·       Define and manage operational metrics for current and future production systems

·       Calculate, propose, and implement new methods and processes for existing production systems

·       Educate and engage cross functional teams in importance of continuous improvement


Requirements

·       B.S., IE (M.S. Preferred)

·       Strong critical thinking and communication skills

·       Very high attention to detail

·       Ability to fully comprehend new processes and systems quickly

·       Industrial cost control/reporting/analysis experience

·       High volume manufacturing experience

·       Experience with time/motion study analysis

·       Excellent MS Office skills


Experience (Preferred)

·       Experience with continuous improvement/6 Sigma techniques/Lean Manufacturing/Change management

·       Understanding/awareness of manufacturing systems and methods

·       Leadership/management experience

Health and Safety Engineer, Senior
Req. ID: 36382
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

The Health and Safety Engineer is responsible for complex technical work in a wide range of H&S disciplines. By developing, implementing and maintaining programs, the H&S Engineer will help create and streamline the systems and procedures necessary to ensure the overall health and safety of Tesla employees. The overall charter is achieving compliance within the company’s and regulatory agencies’ standards in each of these disciplines. The candidate must work well on both self-initiated projects and those driven by concerns and issues reported by employees. The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure compliance with Local, State and Federal health and safety regulations.
  • Develop, implement, and maintain H&S policies, plans, and procedures.
  • Interface with Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies on complex permitting, reporting    and related issues.
  • Work with internal teams to provide technical expertise to health and safety procedures in a tool and die manufacturing environment.
  • Lead and document accident/incident investigations to determine root cause, prevention and corrective measures.
  • Design safe work spaces and create policies for employees to follow that minimize job-related hazards.
  • Develop, implement, and manage safety programs such as LOTO, Hazard Communication, Emergency Response, Fall Protection, Respiratory Protection, Hearing Conservation, etc.
  • Conduct trainings on the safety programs listed above.
  • Recommend changes in policies, procedures, work environment and equipment to prevent accidents and illnesses.
  • Analyzes Health and Safety data and reports trends to management. Recommends plans for corrective action.
  • Maintain OSHA injury logs.
  • Incorporate ergonomics in the workplace.
  • Conduct Job Hazard Analysis as required.
  • Drive continuous improvement programs.

Requirements

  • 8+ years of experience in a similar manufacturing/industrial environment.
  • Bachelors degree in Public Health, Industrial Hygiene, or other Safety-related discipline, Engineering, Chemistry, Natural Sciences or similar or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • Superior knowledge of CAL-OSHA policies.
  • Knowledge of Local, State and Federal regulatory agencies and requirements.
  • Practical, hands-on experience with the following:
  1. Equipment Safety
  2. Machine Guarding
  3. Compliance Initiatives
  4. Program/Process Implementation
  5. Root Cause Analysis
  6. Experience with training and education.
  7. Experience with emergency preparedness and crisis management.
  8. Good interpersonal skills.
  9. Ability to work effectively and efficiently under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines.
  10. Well organized with meticulous attention to detail.
  11. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  12. Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio.

Global Supply Manager - Glazing
Req. ID: 39623
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

 

The primary goal of the Global Supply Manager - Glazing is to develop and execute strategies for complex glazing assemblies across a global supply chain. This can include materials and processes for internally manufactured components and externally

procured systems.

 

Responsibilities

  • Pro-actively engage with Engineering and Finance stakeholders to consolidate a 3-5 years strategic investment plan to support Tesla’s aggressive growth

  • Map the supply chain for the assigned commodity, lead the process of data collection (Milestone adherence, Change orders, OEE etc…) and build supplier performance assessments to support sourcing decisions

  • Design, conduct and synthesize supplier, industry and market research for assigned commodities to develop sourcing strategy

  • Drive cost transparency and build Total Cost Of Ownership models to support sourcing decisions

  • Ensure optimal contract coverage for the commodity.

  • Build strategic relationship with key suppliers and act as the lead point of contact for all commercial issues.

  • Work with Engineering to create and issue RFx for sourcing assigned commodities.

  • Review, analyze and clarify quote packages from suppliers.

  • Manage stakeholders to ensure the sourcing process is followed. 

  • Work on “Lean” initiatives and identify other sourcing efficiencies via benchmarking, VA/VE, competitive quotes and resourcing.

    Requirements

     

  • BS, MS, or other advanced degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering preferred or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

  • Excellent skills with Microsoft Excel and Enterprise Resource Management systems (e.g. SAP); database programming experience (Tableau, SQL, etc.) a plus

  • Knowledgeable in strategic sourcing of glazing components (glass, plastics, high-performance films, assembly processes, etc.), high-volume manufacturing processes, and/or relevant fields

  • Ability to develop and maintain key project metrics and assure compliance with international, federal, state, and local standards.

  • Self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.

  • Professional and positive communication skills.

  • Ability to travel as needed to Tesla assembly facilities, including Fremont, CA and Reno, NV

Firmware Validation Engineer
Req. ID: 38035
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

Role 

As a Senior Firmware Engineer you will be responsible to accelerate the delivery and quality of Tesla products to consumer markets. Your primary focus will be testing and validation of Tesla’s battery management systems which we are constantly improving and re-architecting for both current and future models. This is a chance to help advance the most powerful and innovative sustainable battery technology in the electric vehicle world and to directly contribute to a purely electric future of transportation. You will be responsible for designing and implementing methods for validating component firmware (communication, power, and system controllers). You will work within a development team to create automated validation frameworks and systems with particular focus around performance, quality, and safety. Through the combination of hardware and software test infrastructures, you will develop systems that explore and validate the performance capabilities of our systems. You will devise tools, techniques and processes that allow your team to be the most effective and efficient and delivering great products to our customers. 

Responsibilities

  • Identify effective test strategies for a given feature and craft test plans accordingly.
  • Run manual and automated black/white box tests, and analyze and report results.
  • Work alongside the development team to create automated regression tests
  • Understand and deconstruct complicated software systems and devise strategies to test these systems
  • Create and execute test plans designed to expose weakness or faults in components
  • Cohesively work with developers to optimize the acceleration of component validation with the use of metric driven data

Requirements & Qualifications

  • 5-7 years of relevant experience in either firmware development or test automation
  • Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Excellent embedded software design and architecture skills
  • Foundational understanding of electronic systems and circuits
  • Proven track record of delivering products from conception to customer delivery
  • Great troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Strong C or C++, proficiency in a common scripting language like Python
  • Knowledge of source control (git) and continuous integration (Jenkins)
  • Linux working experience desired
  • Experience with low power or high bower battery systems highly desired

Firmware Test Engineer
Req. ID: 34837
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla
Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.
Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.
 
The Role
As a Software Engineer in Test, you have the opportunity to accelerate the delivery and improve the quality of Tesla products. You will be responsible for designing and implementing build and test infrastructure, creating and enforcing good engineering practices for various Tesla products. Your primary responsibility as a Software Engineer in Test will be to work with the development and test engineering teams to create new testing capabilities, to automate testing, implement new automation tools and create innovative automated test systems. These test systems explore and validate the functional correctness and performance capabilities of our hardware and software, as well as their interaction with other Tesla systems and infrastructure.
Responsibilities
  • Build advanced automated test suites.
  • Work with the development and test engineering teams to automate testing.
  • Conduct research on emerging technologies.
  • Analyze and decompose a complicated software system and design a strategy to test this system.
  • Train and mentor other team members.
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
  • 3 years of relevant work experience, including development and/or test automation experience.
  • Excellent coding skill in C, C++.
  • Good scripting skills in at least one common language (Python, Perl, Shell).

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Firmware Engineer
Req. ID: 39760
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role
As a member of the firmware development team, you will be responsible for delivering high quality embedded code running on the processors at the heart of Tesla powertrains, vehicles and energy storage systems.  Come join a team of deeply knowledgeable engineers that strive to build the most robust and reliable embedded systems using cutting edge software development tools and practices.  You will solve some of the most ambiguous and challenging problems in the embedded software space and change the way the world produces electric vehicles and delivers energy.  At Tesla you’ll have the ability to take a lofty goal such as ‘the vehicle will park itself’ into an everyday reality. 
 
Responsibilities
•           Deliver high-quality C code in a real-time embedded environment.
•           Specify, design, and implement functionality and behaviors of embedded subsystems.
•           Design the software architecture and firmware implementation on hardware through integration, test and high volume manufacturing.
•           Hands-on hardware bringup, system debugging and code optimization.
•           Make performance and optimization trade-offs to meet product requirements
 
Requirements
•           Experience in embedded development in robotics, real-time controls, or system software
•           Proficiency in C, familiarity with MISRA C a plus
•           Fluent in software fundamentals including software design and maintainability
•           Experience with the embedded microprocessor tools
•           Test driven development and familiarity with developer driven automated testing
•           Ability to collaborate and communicate complex technical concepts
•           Understanding of physics and basic principles is highly preferred
•           Experience with TI DSPs or NXP microcontrollers a plus
 
Education
•           BS, MS or PhD in EE/CE/CS, or the equivalent in experience with evidence of exceptional ability.

Field Service Technician
Req. ID: 32729
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


The Role
Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced and dynamic Field Service Technician to work in one of the most progressive companies in the world. We are seeking experienced service technicians with excellent oral and written communication skills to work within the Tesla Energy program. Tesla needs a diversely talented and highly mobile technician ready to move quickly in order to keep our systems fully operational. The primary job is to service, troubleshoot, or upgrade stationary battery equipment as needed. Applicants should be self-motivated team players with a positive attitude! As stated, this role will require a significant amount of travel set around the service and upkeep our stationary battery network.

Responsibilities:

  • Troubleshoot and repair equipment as defined by the service engineering team.
  • Be ready to travel for extended periods of time covering multiple locations with minimal notice.
  • Perform complex and precise electro-mechanical debug, rework and repair.
  • Perform tasks requiring a high level of skill and patience.
  • Operate a variety of hand tools, power tools, diagnostic and measuring equipment (including DMMs and oscilloscopes).
  • Develop and follow best practices and procedures for various maintenance activities related to Tesla Energy equipment.
  • Maintain high levels of communication and feedback within the Tesla Energy service organization; prepare daily updates of work completed, problems identified, and future timelines.
  • Have flexibility to provide support outside your region and possibly outside the country as required.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent, Associate degree preferred.
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in assembly and/or repair of electro-mechanical components, including systems with medium or high voltages.
  • Must be able to work from complex and detailed documentation and/or verbal and written instructions depending on situation.
  • Strong computer skills. Comfort with Microsoft office and cloud-based computing programs. Ability to communicate and function well in a mobile office setting.
  • Ability to read and understand manufacturing instructions, electrical diagrams, and mechanical drawings.
  • Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused.
  • Willingness to work outdoors, on the road, at unusual hours.
  • Ability to lift 75 lbs.
  • Valid driver’s license and insurance required.
  • Knowledge of operation and maintenance of a wide variety of hand and power tools, shop tools, test equipment.
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions.
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work, including the public.
  • Ability to perform daily record keeping and reporting.
  • Ability to effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines.
  • Ability to work in a team-based environment and achieve common goals.
  • Ability to maintain and perform top level professional integrity and appearance.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Field Service Engineer
Req. ID: 17650
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The Tesla Energy team is looking to hire a Field Service Engineer to provide diagnostic support during the installation and servicing of our energy storage products.  This person will be responsible for dispatching hardware and personnel to a site as needed to perform maintenance. They will need to review the action items with the service personnel prior to the visit, act as their point of contact, and confirm that the work was performed up to Tesla standards. This position may also require in-person visits industrial facilities with cutting edge Tesla products that may be under construction or is already existing; knowledge of, and comfort with these types of facilities is a must. This person will also be responsible for  developing the knowledgebase to be used by both internal and external parties to troubleshoot issues.  This person must have an engineering mind with a very hands on approach and a great customer and contractor interface. The work will require travel, sometimes on short notice, and may require extended trips; a get-it-done mentality for all of the situations is expected. This position will coordinate with our Fremont center.

Responsibilities

·         Oversee commissioning, service, testing, and verification actions performed by our service provider network, troubleshooting devices as well as entire industrial systems. This will include guiding the work of construction trades such as electricians and professional disciplines such as engineers.

·         Ensure service providers have access to the required hardware.

·         Debug systems and perform remote diagnostics on field failures by reviewing data logged by energy storage devices.

·         Develop processes and documentation for standard service actions.

·         Recognize trends and patterns in field failures and feedback to the development team to drive future designs.

·         Provide technical support in order to minimize system downtime, through day to day coverage of internationally distributed service cases.

·         Work with engineering and manufacturing teams to ensure new issues are fully investigated and that countermeasures are in place.

·         Regular collaboration with worldwide service teams to ensure consistent and stable global service operations. 

·         Continued development of the diagnostics knowledgebase to be used for future troubleshooting.

·         Frequent travel to perform onsite root cause analysis and training is possible.

·         Availability for occasional off-hours calls and work.  

Requirements

·         BS degree in ME, EE, CS, Mechatronics or similar.

·         Minimum 2+ years’ experience as development, diagnostics or field support engineer. Additional experience in construction trades preferred.

·         Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with external service providers.

·         Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with her/ his team and peers within the engineering organization.

·         Strong ability to be self-directed and work independently, with strong organization and documentation skills.

·         Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities and challenges.

·         Strong analytical problem solving skills and hands-on experience with hardware, tools, instruments, CAN or similar protocol analysis.

·         Skilled with common workplace and database software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc).

·         Ability to read and interpret mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.

·         Working knowledge in computer science (PERL, SQL, python, C++, MATLAB) and mechatronic fields.

·         Experience with environmental and safety requirements a plus.

·         Experience in the energy industry preferred.

Field Construction Manager - Supercharger
Req. ID: 38164
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 100,000 electric vehicles to customers in over 30 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.


The Role

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to support the Supercharger deployment team in California and the western United States.  This person must have a construction background; general contractor’s experience is highly valued. The role will oversee multiple construction projects and enforce budget, timeline, fit, finish, and safety requirements. A get-it-done mentality for all situations is expected.


Responsibilities

  • Get the most world-class Supercharger sites built in the shortest amount of time for the least amount of money.
  • Provide related feedback to the deployment, development, and engineering team on how to design equipment and sites for better/faster/cheaper site builds. Help design and implement those improvements.
  • Coordinates the timely processing and approvals of all shop drawings to and from subcontractors and architects/engineers.
  • Coordinate with Project Managers to timely process change requests and change orders
  • Distribute drawing and design revisions, bulletins, etc. to Project Manager, Super and all trades.
  •         Communicate effectively, both orally and written. Prepare weekly construction reports with photos, schedule, etc. 
  • Expedites project close-out requirements including municipal sign offs, as-built drawings, final project photos, etc.
  • Maintain a high level of productivity. Balance a large number of concurrent tasks. Effectively prioritize efforts.
  • Foresee necessary work, and organize and disseminate information as needed. Maintain project schedules.

 


Requirements

·       Any combination of education and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture or a related subject and 4-6 years of increasingly responsible estimating and project management experience, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

·       Thorough understanding of construction administration processes, including contracts, budgets, construction documents, change orders, schedules, RFIs, submittals, and material procurement.

·       Advanced knowledge of construction means and methods

·       Strong understanding of AC and DC power, transformers, circuit protection, single-line electrical and mechanical diagrams, and construction drawings.

·       Excellent written and spoken English. Must have the ability to discuss technical topics with a variety of audiences – contractors, engineers, and members of various divisions within Tesla.

·       Class A general contractor’s license a plus but not required

·       Available for extensive travel (50%+), often on short notice.

·       Ability to obtain an U.S. passport.

·       Must have valid driver’s license and clean driving record

Facilities Operator
Req. ID: 39913
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Position: Facilities Operator

Responsibilities:

  • Inspection/verification of products and/or processes
  • Manage nonconforming material through the MRB process to ensure that nonconforming material is identified, appropriately dispositioned, tracked, and reported
  • Provide/analyze data and output reports to assist in quality improvement activities
  • Coordinate calibration activities, working with outside vendor to ensure that all test and measurement equipment is calibrated prior to use on the manufacturing floor
  • Provide mechanical measurement support to identify or solve potential material issues
  • Work with Quality Engineering in regards to continuous improvement activities, solve problems and improve overall product quality

 

Requirements:

  • HS diploma with a 2-year degree preferred.
  • 2-5 years experience in a Manufacturing Quality Control environment.
  • Previous electro-mechanical inspection background with ability to use basic hand measurement tools (calipers, micrometers, thread gauges etc.) preferred.  
  • Knowledge of ISO 9001:2000 or ISO/TS 16949 a plus.
  • Ability to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings (including GD&T)
  • Ability to read and write basic English

Facilities Mechanical Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 37693
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Position: Facilities Mechanical Engineer, Gigafactory

 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide day to day support of operational and maintenance issues on site
  • Assist/lead in troubleshooting of system operational issues
  • Complete monthly system operational cost analysis
  • Analyze data to predict utility usage
  • Review trends, analyze data, and monitor equipment/systems to identify trends and ensure they are running within specifications
  • Responsible for monitoring current system demands and capacity concerns
  • Investigate ways to reduce the cost of maintenance or improvement projects
  • Create & modify maintenance and standard operating procedures (SOPs)
  • Develop projects based on operational need and/or energy & cost conservation
  • Perform cost/benefit analysis and engineering recommendation / justification
  • Assist with coordinating installation and commissioning
  • Train facilities personnel on new system and proper operations
  • Understand and apply Failure Mode Effects Analysis (FMEA) concepts and root cause failure analysis to open-ended problems
  • Create and track countermeasures to completion
  • Coordinate with Environmental team for any compliance issues

 

Requirements:

  • BS in Mechanical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 4+ years of experience
  • Intermediate knowledge of mechanical engineering principles and systems including pumps, pneumatics, fans, flow meters, air handling systems, industrial chilled water, heating, process piping, rotating equipment, vibration analysis, and heat transfer is a benefit
  • Strong troubleshooting background and issue resolution
  • Strong data and system analysis
  • Strong teamwork and communication skills
  • Intermediate project management skills
  • Proven ability to work in a large, complex environment where you must adapt to meet company needs
