Facilities Mechanical (HVAC/Refrigeration) Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 32747
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla has an immediate opening for a Maintenance Technician to join the Facilities team at the Gigafactory in Reno, NV. We are seeking an energetic, skilled, cost-conscious, team-oriented individual to be responsible for the general maintenance and repairs to Tesla’s battery manufacturing factory. The incumbent will perform maintenance and basic or advanced troubleshooting of plant equipment and utilities in order to determine root cause and best course of action to repair and/ or replace mechanical, electrical, HVAC, utility equipment and other components or infrastructure.

 

Responsibilities:

·         Performs all functions in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, as well as established company policies, procedures, and controls.

·         Troubleshoot and solve maintenance-related problems including mechanical, electrical and individual equipment problems.

·         Maintain and repair manufacturing support equipment and utilities to ensure smooth and continuous operation of production and manufacturing processes.

·         Able to work flexible hours, weekends and respond to plant emergencies on very short notice.

 

Requirements:

·         Minimum of five years’ work experience in mechanical or electrical maintenance repair work.

·         Knowledge of the principles and techniques of building trades or mechanical repair work.

·         Ability to perform routine, scheduled or emergent maintenance work such as mechanical, electrical, HVAC and property repairs.

·         Provide analysis of maintenance problems and determine cause of problems and repair or offer possible solutions.

·         Knowledge of safety procedures required in maintenance and repair work.

·         Ability to work independently; Ability to work various hours to support manufacturing and maintenance environments.

·         Ability to properly and safely use power and manual hand tools.

·         Ability to climb ladders; Ability to work outdoors in a variety of weather conditions; Ability to walk long distances around the property; ability to move up to 50 lbs.; ability to work in elevated heights.

·         Ability to communicate effectively; ability to establish and maintain working relationships with customers.

·         Skill in using personal computers, office equipment and mobile electronics.

·         Read & Interpret diagrams, schematics, and specifications, as applicable.

Experience with the following equipment/process is preferred:

·         High volume CFM air compressors

·         HVAC, evaporative cooling

·         Chillers and controls

·         Pumps and level sensors

·         Docks

·         Man and vehicle doors

·         Power distribution

·         PLC controls a plus

·         WHE: fork truck, man lifts, tugs or carts

·         Software skills, including use of Microsoft Office software and web-based applications.

Facilities Maintenance Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 38935
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Position: Facilities Maintenance Technician, Gigafactory

Responsibilities:

  • Maintains, trouble shoots, repairs, and installs electrical equipment and systems at the TESLA- Gigafactory facility utilizing technical, interpersonal and critical thinking skills. Working as a team with the entire Facilities Operations department, the Electrical Technician performs general maintenance duties, preventive maintenance, trouble calls, and emergency maintenance as needed and assigned.
  • Work on projects throughout the entire facility running conduit, pulling wire and connecting devices, using lifts and ladders. Continues to perform equipment repairs and similar duties that require no oversight or direction. Uses complex electrical schematics and blueprints to troubleshoot and correct problems. 
  • Displays positive attitudes and practices good work ethics that reflects the mission, philosophy and goals of the company. 
  • Provides excellent customer service.
  • Complete tasks in timely manner and provide feedback.

 

Requirements:

  • Must have a minimum of 5+ years related work experience as an Industrial or Commercial Electrician.
  • Knowledge in using hand tools, electrical meter and testing equipment.
  • Efficient in sizing conductors, conduits and using NEC Code Book.
  • Experienced in handling low to high voltage up to 480 VAC.
  • Strong knowledge in trouble shooting of motor controls, drives and electronic components a plus
  • Ability to interpret electrical prints and schematics
  • Ability to install electrical equipment and circuit modification
  • Ability to work in high elevation up to 80 ft. high
  • Must have strong inter-personal skills, along with the ability to interact with all levels of management; must have high degree of initiative, and the ability to work alone and effectively with other people
  • Good understanding of Drives and PLC is a plus
  • Knowledge to identify electrical hazards and proper safety procedures

Facilities Maintenance Technician
Req. ID: 38392
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

FACILITIES TECHNICIAN JOB DESCRIPTION

 

I. Expectations:

The Technician will work within the team for the purpose of achieving a key result or group of aligned results. They must possess a general knowledge of mission critical directives and situations. They must help to develop strategies to meet team and company goals. Reports to the Plant Operations Supervisor and Manager.

 

The Technician must possess a working knowledge of Facility equipment, and systems, be a problem solver, and be communicative and proactive in the execution of daily activities. Contribute to day-to-day operations and create reports to update the company in the event it is required. Must be able to perform under pressure, remain dynamic and understand urgency.

 

The Technician must be able to practice teamwork and team building within our organization.

 

II. Technician Equipment Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Operation and maintenance of facilities responsible plant equipment and utility distribution services.
  • Knowledge of industrial air compressors and supporting equipment including distribution.
  • Understanding of Facilities responsible cranes, hoist and supporting equipment.
  • The coordination or servicing of chemical treatment programs and required documentation for responsible equipment.
  • Support for other departments as required to sustain production needs.
  • Establish or adjust work schedules to meet production requirements.
  • Act as departmental representative in the absence of management.
  • Other as assigned, permanent or temporary to support efficiency in operations.

 

III. Scope of Responsibilities:

Overall, Facilities Technicians responsibilities are to include but not limited to the following:

  • Understand and enforce code compliance throughout the Facilities scope of operations.
  • Operations, maintenance and repair of responsible equipment.
  • Modernization and continuing improvements of responsible equipment.
  • Ensures an adequate on-hand spare parts inventory or lead-time system in place to support responsible equipment.
  • Have an established asset inventory of responsible equipment for reference.
  • Generate failure reports and corrective measures on major incidents to decrease failures.
  • Establish redundancy plans and emergent process support measures.
  • Perform weekly general equipment inspections for readiness and operational capacity.
  • Establish, schedule, execute and document maintenance activities on responsible equipment.
  • Works with maintenance planner to establish reliability centered maintenance (RCM) activities.
  • Performs commissioning of new systems and integrates into existing administrative controls.
  • Direct activities of team or contractors in manageable, effective and cost efficient manner.
  • Establish vendor and contractor support. Generate quotes and request for purchase orders.
  • Works closely with all facets of the Facilities group to provide technical expertise or assistance.
  • Enforce and follow all Safety rules and regulations.
  • Communicative to Facilities group as appropriate the status of responsible equipment and effects to operations.
  • Professional, informative and responsive communication to customers.
  • Interacts with customers to understand requests or concerns.
  • Be proficient in general office PC programs and equipment monitoring systems.
  • Must be able to respond to Plant Emergencies as directed.

 

IV. Desired Skills or Experience:

  • Familiar with or hold an EPA 608 Universal HVAC Certification
  • Familiar with or hold an EPA 410A HVAC certification
  • PLC, BMS or other logic platforms
  • 115kV power distribution and industrial busway
  • Certification or experience with industrial controls such as MODBUS, BACnet, TCP/IP
  • Certification or experience with steam and hot water boilers and humidifiers
  • Knowledge of occupational hazards and safety precautions
  • WHE, Lift and Forklift
  • Experience with overhead bridge cranes a plus
  • Docks and associated safety systems
  • Personal and rolling doors

 

V. Minimum requirements:

  • High School diploma or GED
  • (2) years building maintenance experience, or any equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Work involves moderate to heavy work in all types of weather.
  • There is frequent need to stand, stoop, walk, lift heavy objects (up to 50 pounds) and perform other similar actions during the course of the workday.

Facilities Electrical Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 37378
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Position: Facilities Electrical Engineer, Gigafactory

 

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated individual as a Facilities Electrical Engineer to propose and implement facilities and manufacturing cost savings measures in the areas of energy management at the Gigafactory. This position will be located in Sparks, Nevada.

 

This person should be able to read, edit, and improve upon base design documents and understand how the information conveyed in design documents translates to the physical construction in the field.  This includes drafting and answering RFI’s and fostering the submittal process. 

They should be comfortable working in Microsoft Project, Primavera, or other relationship driven schedule software. 

 

Responsibilities:

·         Perform Energy Audits, Provide Energy Usage Calculations Circuit Analysis for critical load throughout the plant and circuit protection for Voltage Sag for critical loads.

·         Validation, optimization and efficiency analysis for cost savings and reduction of energy throughout the plant.

·         Operate equipment and program/adjust medium voltage relays

·         Prepare engineering specifications for bid invitation, performed bid evaluation and conformed bid evaluations for purchase

·         Short circuit study and over current coordination by using easy power software.

·         Working collaboratively with both internal and external design and construction resources, the Project Engineer will be expected to drive construction strategy and schedule and integrate with other trade leaders. 

·         Should be able to provide base cost estimating services within the electrical scope and work with trades to drive value for Tesla.  This position will be field based and the person should be comfortable working on an operating manufacturing facility with ongoing construction activity

·         Evaluate quotes related to any ongoing maintenance (preventative) activities

 

Requirements:

·         Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

·         8-10 years of direct construction experience building high-tech infrastructure and operational facilities (semiconductor, solar, battery, etc.)

·         Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced environment

·         Ability to interface with multiple engineering disciplines

·         Medium Voltage equipment including – operating/maintaining the equipment, trouble shooting and programming /adjusting medium voltage relays.

·         Working knowledge of OSHA and UBC codes and HAZMAT safety protocols

·         Desire to do the impossible with a positive and professional “never say die” attitude

·         Ability to communicate clearly and interface at an executive level

·         Proven track record of managing budgets and evaluating construction related quotes and contracts.

·         Strong desire to be a part of a world class team focused on achieving amazing results

Facilities Development Project Manager
Req. ID: 37816
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

 

We are looking for a self-motivated and energetic Facilities Development Project Manager to manage capital improvement projects at our 5.7 million square foot industrial plant in Fremont, CA. The successful candidate will supervise projects to support the installation of new production equipment and support modifications to the existing building infrastructure.

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Provide constructive feedback to architects and engineers during design development. Feedback is based on prior construction experience and typical construction practices.
  • Prepare and present ROM pricing estimates to obtain executive management approval to commence projects.
  • Prepare scopes of work and schedules as a basis to obtain competitive contractor pricing.
  • Supervise contractors to ensure quality work and timely work completion.
  • Communicate with affected parties project timing and cost.
  • Work with local City building inspectors and third party inspectors to perform progress inspections and to close out building permits in a timely manner.
  • Work with in-house Environmental, Health and Safety department to ensure a safe construction work environment.

 

Requirements

 

  • Up to 7 years prior work experience in the industrial construction field.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management or Engineering or related degree is strongly preferred or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • General understanding of construction contracts and lien release process.
  • Outstanding construction planning methods and project scheduling ability.
  • Firm grasp of CAL-OSHA construction safety standards.
  • A commitment to excellent quality work.
  • Excellent listening skills, organizational skill and strong communication skills.
  • Ability to identify problems and to patiently work with others to resolve construction issues.
  • Possess a strong work ethic, proven follow-through skills and a “can-do” attitude are a must.
  • Availability to work weekends/nights, as needed, in order to meet schedule demands.
  • Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Suite (Outlook/Excel/Word/Power Point) and Microsoft Project with AutoCAD as a plus.

Fabricator
Req. ID: 35532
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. 

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Fabricator and Welder to create prototype components, assemblies, and vehicles to enhance and shorten the design/build/test process. Join a fast paced and rapidly growing team that works on the most advanced battery, motor, gear box, and drive inverter components. Integrate Tesla’s advanced Powertrain components into new vehicles. Work closely with engineers and technicians.

 

Responsibilities

Perform TIG, MIG, and CMT welding on aluminum, steel, and copper (all alloys)

Weld in all positions: vertical, horizontal, flat, and overhead

Set up welding equipment (amperage, voltage, wire speed, etc) maximizing efficiency and effectiveness per application

Read and interpret engineering drawings, weld symbols, and GD&T

Bend tubes and cope accordingly

Bend and weld sheet metal (aluminum and steel)

Prepare all materials prior to welding

Modify pre-existing structures (bodies, chassis, sub frames, jigs, etc) to accept new components and accommodate design changes

Machine components on a manual mill and manual lathe (mandatory)

Operate and cut material on CNC plasma and oxyacetylene equipment

Work overtime and weekends (if required)

Record the consumption of material and supplies

Record and track daily operations

Maintain a clean, safe, and organized work area

 

 

Qualifications

High school diploma or GED

Weld certification (preferred)

Minimum of 5 years of full time welding experience

Minimum of 5 years of metal fabrication (tube bending, sheet metal, chassis work)

 

 

Skills

Passionate about fabricating and welding

Strong work ethic

Meticulous attention to detail

Highly motivated

Strong verbal communication skills

Flexible, ability to work in a fast pace constantly changing environment with long hours and tight deadlines

Independent

<< Back to Search Results

Materials Associate Manager, Powertrain
Req. ID: 41813
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Associate Materials Manager will be part of the Production Control Team within the Material Handling and Inventory Control group and will be responsible for designing and developing inventory movement and storage systems from storage or staging to production line side locations, for improving productivity and efficiency of operations, and for managing conveyance staff.  These activities will take place primarily at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but can also include operations at our Deer Creek facility.  The primary objective of the Material Handling and Inventory Control Group is to implement an efficient receiving, warehouse, material handling, and conveyance solution to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates. This position will report to the Materials Manager, depending on Warehouse or Conveyance needs.

 

Responsibilities:

·         Design, develop, and implement solutions for dramatically improving material flows through the factory using Lean Principles.  The design includes material arrival at docks through staging for delivery to line-side locations.  The focus will be on developing innovative new solutions for manufacturing that leverage automated systems.

·         Ability to foster and develop a strong team of material handling personnel through selective recruitment, thorough and consistent on-boarding process, training, and coaching, and identification and addressing of competency gaps within team.  Management of team includes proactively planning for labor needs in light of production ramp up, communicating job expectations, performing employee performance and objectives reviews, and managing team in alignment of company policies and procedures.

·         Ability to meet materials operations financial objectives by preparing budgets, forecasting requirements, planning for capital expenditures, securing company property and assets, and analyzing and resolving inventory variances.

·         Capable of defining material  operations systems to include:  developing processes for materials related activities, defining materials related aspects of new production lines, determining equipment needs and utilization, defining storage and material handling requirements, and ability to integrate and align physical processes with systematic processes.

·         Drive improvements within material flow by planning layout and space requirements, reducing line impact, analyzing and reviewing product flow, and evaluating and proposing new equipment options.

·         Maintains safe work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures.  It also requiring coaching and motivating team to proactively address potential safety issues and concerns.

·         Support advanced trouble-shooting and improvement of existing warehouse management, inventory control, and material flow systems.

·         Targeted goals include but not limited to:

·         Safety focus

·         People Management (Systematic and physically)

·         5S standards

·         Line down time / Productivity / hours per car

·         Reduction in material handling waste

·         Reduction of in-house receiving lead-time

·         Significant improvement in labor efficiency

·         Optimized space utilization

·         Highly accurate part selection resulting in inventory accuracy levels above 99%

·         Reduction of information system transactional needs

 

Minimum Requirements:

·         Minimum 4 year degree in related field

·         5+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics experience desirable

·         Minimum of 3 years in a Supervisory/Management role

·         Demonstrated excellent communication skills, including ability to express well-reasoned, independent thought.  Natural ability to speak and write effectively at all organizational levels

·         Demonstrated ability to be a resilient change agent capable of leading organization through paradigm shifts

·         Strong knowledge of Production and Inventory Control within manufacturing environment with the ability to teach and coach others on best practices

·         Strong project management skills

·         Strong knowledge of material flow methodologies including sequencing, kitting, repack, etc.

·         Strong analytical and organizational skills. Ability to manage several complex projects at the same time with high degrees of variation and uncertainty.  Ability to understand and navigate through the intricacies of multiple systems

·         PC proficiency at an intermediate level

·         Understanding of lean manufacturing concepts with the ability to lead 5S and kaizen efforts for continuous improvement

 

Preferred Qualifications:

·         Master’s Degree in Engineering, Business or related program preferred

·         Experience applying and using material flow analysis tools, including simulation, time study analysis (dynamic and static)

·         Understanding of FTZ (foreign trade zone) and how to maintain required control of related inventory

·         Strong knowledge of material handling systems in a manufacturing or distribution system environment

Lean manufacturing principles implementation experience

Materials & Processes Engineering – Tesla Castings Sr. Process Engineer
Req. ID: 38966
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Tesla Castings Sr. Process Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Senior Process Engineer to support the Tesla Structural Aluminum High Pressure Die Casting (HPDC) Foundry in Lathrop, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Defining process architecture, workflow, and equipment requirements necessary to meet engineering and production targets.
  • Supports equipment and tooling engineering on detail equipment specification, vendor selection, design reviews and installation. 
  • Develops production process methods, parameters and control limits collaboratively with production engineers and associates.
  • Completes process prove out to demonstrate capability at the part level.
  • Creates work instructions and provides initial training to production associates. 

Requirements:

  • Materials or Mechanical Engineering degree. 
  • Extensive experience in defining, specifying and developing structural aluminum high pressure die casting manufacturing processes, including Melt Treatment and Transfer, High Vacuum Die Casting, Heat Treatment. Trimming, Straightening, Testing, Surface Treatment, Part Traceability.
  • Familiar with common casting defects such as hot tearing, pre-solidification, gas and shrinkage porosity, inclusions; common causes and corrective actions, and characterization techniques to quantify them.
  • Exceptional organization, cross discipline collaboration and communication skills.

This role will report to the M&P Lead in the Tesla Castings Center who informally reports to the Tesla Casting Center leader, but formally reports to Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering, which is a part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering organization.

Materials & Processes Engineering – Tesla Castings HPDC Simulation Engineer
Req. ID: 38965
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Tesla Castings HPDC Simulation Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a HPDC Simulation Engineer to support the Tesla Structural Aluminum High Pressure Die Casting (HPDC) Foundry in Lathrop, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinates with Vehicle Design Engineering, Materials Engineering, CAE and Production Tool Design Engineering to develop optimal Structural Aluminum HPDC part, die and gating designs using advanced computational tools.
  • Simulates and predicts die temperatures (cooling and heating system plus melt), filling behavior, solidification, defect formation and deformation (part and die). 
  • Translates simulation results to component design recommendations (e.g. wall thickness, rib directions, parting lines, etc.), die designs (runners, gating, overflows, cooling/heating channels, squeeze pins, etc.) and die cast process parameter (e.g. slow shot, fast shot, intensification, vacuum start, etc.) recommendations.
  • Familiar with common casting defects such as hot tearing, pre-solidification, gas and shrinkage porosity, inclusions; common causes and corrective actions, and characterization techniques to quantify them.

Requirements:

  • Materials or Mechanical Engineering degree. 
  • Expert at using advanced casting simulation tools such as MAGMA, Flow3D, ProCast, etc. (ProCast preferred)
  • Working knowledge of 3D CAD software, preferably Catia v5, to manipulate component and tooling design data.
  • Understanding of FEA codes, such as LSDYNA, used by component structural analysis engineers.

This role will report to the M&P Lead in the Tesla Castings Center who informally reports to the Tesla Casting Center leader, but formally reports to Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering, which is a part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering organization.

Materials & Processes Engineering - Castings Sr. Metallurgical Engineer
Req. ID: 37149
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Tesla Castings Sr. Metallurgical Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Senior Metallurgical Engineer to support the Tesla Structural Aluminum High Pressure Die Casting (HPDC) Foundry in Lathrop, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Determining materials used in the foundry, applicable specifications and requirements. 
  • Identification and development of novel alloys and processing techniques to improve performance, cost and quality.
  • Ensuring aspects of the HPDC process, particularly incoming ingot quality, melt handling and quality, and heat treatment parameters are able to produce products that meet engineering requirements.
  • Collaboration with Quality Engineering on control plan definition, materials production test protocols, initial process validation and re-validation. 
  • Performing Failure Analysis and Root Cause Corrective Action for process and part anomalies or Quality check failures. 

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s of Science in Materials Engineering.  Metallurgical Engineering and advanced degrees are preferred.
  • Practical experience working with structural high pressure die casting alloys (e.g. A380, A356, Aural, Castasil and Silafont variants).  Preferably experience with alloy development using computational tools.
  • Deep knowledge of the relationship between chemistry and processing on microstructure and mechanical properties. Knowledge of common casting defects such as hot tearing, pre-solidification, gas and shrinkage porosity, inclusions; common causes and corrective actions, and characterization techniques to quantify them.
  • Experience with design value development, specification writing, supplier/part qualification.
  • Demonstrated skills in statistical analysis of data, root-cause analysis, combined effects analysis and life cycle.
  • Knowledge of DFEMA and PFMEA (Design and Production Failure Mode and Effect Analysis).
  • Exceptional organization, cross discipline collaboration and communication skills.

This role will report to the M&P Lead in the Tesla Castings Center who informally reports to the Tesla Casting Center leader and formally reports to Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering, which is a part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering organization. 

 

Previous Applicants:

Material Project Manager - Manufacturing Introduction Group
Req. ID: 21465
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable Material Planner to work in NPI Powertrain Manufacturing.   The ideal candidate will have experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products.  The Material will work with Manufacturing and Master Scheduling to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals including LEAN manufacturing principals.  This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate supply plans, and executing successfully against those plans.  

Responsibilities

  • Plan, schedule, and manage the materials for delivering time-critical components to support assigned production area.
  • Work with suppliers to establish the appropriate delivery quantity and frequency for Just In Time delivery and line-side kanban; coordinate with Supply Chain Specialist and Logistics as needed.
  • Maintain accurate open Purchase Order lines to define the inbound quantities and due dates from vendors, identify system demand or BOM issues, and resolve inventory discrepancies in SAP.
  • Generate and provide vendor forecasts on a regular basis to support production build plan, minimize freight costs, and optimize inventory levels.
  • Maintain MRP master data parameters to ensure accurate signals for quantity and dates generated by MRP (i.e. lead times, MOQ’s, lot sizing, and safety stock) to minimize excess.
  • Collaborate with Purchasing and Engineering to coordinate Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) to plan for material and product end of life (EoL) and minimize obsolescence.
  • Identify potential supply risks and inventory exposures by aligning supply chain processes with product development project plan milestones.
  • Assist in implementing systematic solutions to control inventory flow, minimize shortages, and maintain accuracy in SAP.
  • Provide ongoing transparency of inventory levels and ensure continuous inventory accuracy
  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as supply chain specialists, manufacturing engineers, and logistics personnel.
  • Assist with inventory control activities.
  • Generate and publish metrics of performance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelors degree.
  • 3 - 5+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company.
  • Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize delivery costs and inventory levels.
  • Proficiency in SAP, MS Excel desired.
  • Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand.
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment.
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude.
  • Strong work ethics.

Material Project Manager - Manufacturing Introduction Group
Req. ID: 20872
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 


The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable Material Planner to support the prototype and preproduction vehicle and powertrain builds. The ideal candidate will have experience in a manufacturing environment, technical background and a passion for electric vehicles.  The Material Planner will work with Manufacturing and Engineering teams to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals while incorporating LEAN manufacturing principals.  This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate supply plans, and executing successfully against those plans.  

You will be a part of world-class team and get to work on exciting new products starting from the development stages.

Responsibilities

  • Plan and schedule various purchased sub-components needed to build prototypes for new programs. Support program/s from prototype phase through start of production until transition to production sustaining team.
  • Work with suppliers to establish the appropriate delivery schedules for individual components, specifying quantity and frequency targeting Just-in-Time delivery; coordinate with Supply Chain Specialist/s and Logistics as needed.
  • Identify potential supply risks and inventory exposures by aligning supply chain processes with product development project plan milestones.
  • Maintain accurate MRP Purchase Order data to reflect confirmed delivery quantities and due dates from suppliers and resolve inventory discrepancies in proprietary MRP system and SAP.
  • Help resolve BOM issues by working with appropriate engineering and manufacturing personnel.
  • Collaborate with Purchasing and Engineering to support material changes resulting from Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) and product end of life; plan for new material and minimize obsolescence of old material.
  • Provide ongoing transparency of inventory levels and ensure continuous inventory accuracy.
  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing, product development teams, supply chain, inventory control and logistics teams.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree. Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical or Industrial) or Operations background is strongly desired.
  • 2-5 years related experience in materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company is required.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, including ability to maintain and enhance Excel-based material shortage reports, is required.
  • Familiarity in SAP is desired.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, including ability to optimize delivery costs and inventory levels, are desired.
  • Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One or inventory management system such as MES is a plus.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand is required.
  • Ability to present material status effectively in weekly executive meetings is required.
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude is required.
  • Self-motivation and resourcefulness are required
  • Ability to solve problems in a fast-paced work environment with minimal supervision is required.
  • Strong work ethics required.

The Role

Material Handler, Gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Perform cycle counts.
  • Ensure accuracy and timeliness of assigned tasks.
  • Communicate with warehouse management to ensure optimal performance.
  • Support warehouse best practices.
  • Follow all safety rules and guidelines.

  • Knowledge of and skill in using Excel based systems.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Previous parts and Material handling experience preferred (3+ years) with Fed-X, DHL, 3PL , etc.

  • Punctuality and a professional, can-do attitude are a must.
  • A commitment to adhering to prescribed safety rules and guidelines.

  • Good organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Goal oriented and driven to succeed.
  • Possesses a “get it done” attitude and an urgency to resolve problems/tasks.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Current forklift certification strongly preferred.
  • A valid U.S. driver’s license and acceptable driving record (subject to review)

Material Dispatch/Expeditor

Description

Job Title:  Materials Dispatch/Expeditor, Manufacturing

 

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated, experienced, and knowledgeable Materials Dispatcher to support our Manufacturing Production Control. The ideal candidate will have experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products.  The Dispatcher/Expeditor will work with Material Planning, Production Planning, Material Conveyance, and Material Warehousing to assure smooth material flow to the line.

 

Primary Responsibilities:

 

  • Respond to urgent material requests from Production, Conveyance, and Warehouse teams by troubleshooting material shortages
  • Full shift coverage
  • Manage the Andon, looking at buffers and priorities for the general assembly line and communicate to Conveyance priorities on hot parts.
  • Manage trailer metering and location tools and provide priority to the docks for unloading hot parts
  • Control the replenishment order monitors
  • Control the replenishment fulfillment
  • Decision making abilities and strong leadership skills

  • Helpful to have MRP/ERP experience
  • Able to manage multiple urgent projects simultaneously with high degrees of variation and uncertainty and prioritize tasks based on demand.
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude
  • Strong work ethics
  • Good communication skills
  • Great customer service skills

<< Back to Search Results

Mastering Associate
Req. ID: 41911
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Los Angeles-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.
 

The Role

As a Mastering Associate at Tesla Motors, you will work as an extension of our Color & Materials and Design Quality teams — responsible for supporting the design of the future of transportation.

Responsibilities

  • Tracking the progress of various materials for the Color and Materials Team and producing them in a standard that is automotive feasible – i.e. considering the multifaceted composition of auto grade materials while focusing on harmonizing for the color and finish of the end product.
     
  • Handling the distribution of material “masters” by concurrently developing the supply base, approving samples, and handling all program management to track timelines, thereby ensuring that standards are getting approved in time for production.
     
  • Facilitation of the supply base relationship including administration of all documents and ongoing partnership
     
  • Understand the process of every material in development and continually guiding/pushing suppliers to further match the target/desired result.
     

Minimum Qualifications

  • Ability to see color and decipher between specific variances in color while fluently articulating differences to internal teams and external vendors.
     
  • Successful completion of the Munsell Hue Test with a perfect score.
     
  • Practical approach to facilitating creative projects exclusive of the design process
     
  • Passion for color, materials, material composition, and the process of manufacturing auto grade materials.
     
  • Strong interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally between Designers, Engineers, and Vendors.
     
  • Bachelor Degree in Fine Arts, Product Development, Design Development, or Textile Design/Development or the equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

Manufacturing Technician
Req. ID: 42551
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

The NPI Assembly Technician will report to the NPI Supervisor and will be responsible for performing electro-mechanical assembly operations as part of a new NPI work cell.  This person is expected to be able to execute against provided manufacturing instructions (if available), validate their own work, check the quality of previous operations, and meet schedules.   The NPI Technician is expected to be able to provide feedback, define standard work, and suggest process improvements.  Experience with hand tools and use of semi-automated manufacturing equipment is necessary.

Responsibilities

  • Perform complex and precise electro-mechanical assembly work and be able to work independently once a task is assigned, make connections with other employees, work fluidly with the team to achieve great results.

  • Typically involves a variety of operations, including troubleshooting and rework, requiring a sufficient understanding of the functional operation of the items assembled as well as the finished product.

  • Must be able to work from complex and detailed manufacturing documentation, drawings, and/or verbal and written instructions and specialized fixtures/test equipment.

  • Have a quick and flexible approach to problem solving, task juggling, and collaboration.

  • Responsible for quality activities, including self inspection, and inspection. Be comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously, interacting with multiple teams.

  • Updates production records and test results, records process improvements, and manufacturability suggestions.

  • Communicates test results, ideas and problems to supervisor and engineers.

  • Identify discrepant materials/components both in writing and verbally to supervisor.

  • Complete tasks as directed by manufacturing schedules and within standard times and maintain a clean and orderly work area.

 

Requirements

  • High School diploma or equivalent.  AS degree preferred. Minimum of 4 years experience in assembly of electro-mechanical components.

  • Basic understanding of electrical systems.

  • Ability to read and understand manufacturing instructions and mechanical drawings with basic understanding of electrical systems.

  • Must have a high level of craftsmanship and attention to detail married with the ability to work quickly.

  • Basic machine shop skills desired with welding skills a plus.

  • Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.

  • Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused and have the ability to manage his/her time to juggle multiple tasks and to prioritize tasks.

  • Ability to perform repetitious duties while standing for long periods of time.

  • Ability to lift 30-50 lbs on a daily basis and to maintain a safe working environment.

Manufacturing Operations Internship / Co-Op (Spring 2017)
Req. ID: 42196
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Intern

Description

The Role

You will help engineer Tesla’s manufacturing processes, design equipment to be used on production lines, and help troubleshoot manufacturing issues to affect production and delivery targets.

Your application to the Manufacturing Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Powertrain Manufacturing, Vehicle Manufacturing, Manufacturing Engineering, Product Excellence, and Manufacturing Operations teams in Fremont, CA.

 

Responsibilities

  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as supply chain specialists, manufacturing engineers, and logistics personnel.
  • Support control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the assembly/production process.
  • Support Lean manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Develop familiarity with and ability to analyze manufacturing and production processes by direct involvement and data analysis, failure analysis, root cause analysis.
  • Provide support to production and manufacturing by improving equipment uptime by troubleshooting, re-design (including automated systems).
  • Identify bottlenecks in production and manufacturing systems and utilize data collected to propose, implement, and execute correction.
  • Support project schedules.
  • Organize and analyze data sets that outline the systemic improvement opportunities.
  • Manage projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Identify areas for cost savings and develop corrective action plans.
  • Develop and implement system support process and documentation.
  • Read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.

 

Requirements

 

  • Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program.
  • You must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.
  • Hands-on experience is a must.
  • Professional and positive communication skills.
  • Previous internship and/or project experience is a plus.
  • Ability to relocate to the Bay Area, California.

You will help engineer Tesla’s manufacturing processes, design equipment to be used on production lines, and help troubleshoot manufacturing issues to affect production and delivery targets.

Your application to the Manufacturing Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Powertrain Manufacturing, Vehicle Manufacturing, Manufacturing Engineering, Product Excellence, and Manufacturing Operations teams in Fremont, CA.

  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as supply chain specialists, manufacturing engineers, and logistics personnel.
  • Support control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the assembly/production process.
  • Support Lean manufacturing and 5S initiatives.

Manufacturing Engineer, Drive Unit
Req. ID: 42107
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated Manufacturing Engineer to develop new processes and automation equipment for Tesla Drive Unit assembly lines from providing input to Product design to hand-off to Production and Maintenance.

The Drive Unit products and assembly lines include:

Stator winding and insertion, Stator Impregnation and robotic handling, Rotor Manufacturing including cleaning, electron-beam welding, CNC Machining, High Speed Spinning and Balancing Motor, Gearbox and Inverter final assembly and testing (hot, cold, static and dynamic)

As part of the Manufacturing Engineering team, candidate responsibility will, after a training period, encompass specific processes on one of the above product manufacturing line.  The candidate will be in charge to design and built new processes as well as manage the procurement, construction and deployment of highly automated Production Equipment for our cutting edge Drive Units.

With significant Automation systems design, build and commissioning experience, the Manufacturing Engineer will be a hands-on contributor to improve our current production equipment productivity as well as develop new high intellectual property processes.

The candidate will mentor Associate Manufacturing Engineers and interns.  Candidate growth will include developing their expertise in a specific manufacturing field or/and manage a team of Manufacturing Engineers.

Drive Units are critical parts of Tesla electric Drivetrains and at the heart of our company Powertrain business.  This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Roles and Responsibilities:

In addition to developing automation equipment and processes, the Manufacturing Engineer works with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product. He/She works closely with Design Engineering, Quality, Production, and Process Sustaining teams to take the Drivetrain components from initial design through prototype development and into full production.

Equipment Development and Implementation

  • Develop process sequence, establish critical process parameters and process recipe
  • In-house development of workstations, manufacturing equipment and fixtures to support early stage prototype builds
  • Design, procurement, construction, animation and deployment of manufacturing automation equipment and fixtures for medium and high volume production
  • Management of suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of manufacturing equipment
  • Characterization and validation of new equipment and fixtures for introduction to the production floor

Process Development and Implementation

  • Participate in early prototype product builds to characterize and develop both product and process critical parameters
  • Provide Design for Manufacturing feed-back to Product Design Engineering team
  • Development of new manufacturing processes
  • Creation of detailed Manufacturing Instructions to support new processes and equipment

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  Candidate appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  Candidate looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

Responsibilities

Proficient in complex electro-Mechanical system design, GD&Ts from concept to detailing

  • Proficiency creating detailed drawings from solid models for various fabrication techniques (CNC/manual machining, welding, sheet metal forming)
  • Proficiency in mechanical assembly and inspection processes (press fits and shrink fits assemblies, adhesive dispensing, vision control, measurement gauge checking, fastener selection and torque assembly, machining processes…etc)
  • Proficient in process characterization and validation using statistical tools
  • Proven track record of data driven methodology to solve complex problems
  • Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment
  • Experience collaborating with Controls Engineer to develop complex servo controlled motion control and PLC driven systems
  • Experience with rotating machines, gearbox and AC motor assembly is a plus
  • Experience creating process documentation
  • Experience transitioning products from prototype to production desired
  • Experience introducing new products and new processes into a production environment
  • Experience with design for manufacturability
  • Knowledgeable about production quality metrics is a plus
  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

Requirements

  • BS/MS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)
  • 3+ years of experience as a hands-on mechanical automation equipment design engineer or project manager working on electromechanical systems.
  • Layout of production workstations and assembly lines for product flow, ergonomics and efficiency. Lines designed for scalability, continuous quality and productivity improvements
  • Specification of hand tools for assembly tasks
  • Performance of process analysis including PFMEA and capacity modeling
  • Implementation of product traceability and shop floor tracking

Manufacturing Engineer, Castings
Req. ID: 37748
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company in the San Francisco Bay Area. We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 20,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

The Role

Job Title:  Manufacturing Engineer - Casting
Department:  Vehicle Manufacturing Engineering

We seek a highly motivated engineer to join our Casting Manufacturing Engineering group.  This group is responsible for developing and implementing the processes and equipment used to produce our advanced, high performance structural castings.  These castings are critical to our advanced body structure and are a key component to our superior crash and handling performance.  This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to building a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of an incredibly exciting product.

The Manufacturing Engineering team employs a combination of team-based and matrix-based organizational structure.  Leadership is responsible for either product lines or specific functions within the team.  The ideal Manufacturing Engineer candidate takes pride in his/her own work and that of those under his/her formal or informal guidance.  Analytical ability, organizational skills and great attention to detail are of paramount importance.  This candidate is familiar with and appreciates an environment where individuals carry tremendous responsibility and where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  This candidate enjoys work, thrives on daily interaction with high-caliber people and has a keen understanding of how to work with and/or motivate them.

Responsibilities

Our new Casting Manufacturing Engineer will begin with a group of existing engineers and significantly contribute to the team within Vehicle Manufacturing Engineering.  He/She will be responsible for developing the processes and requirements to implement new products and/or in-house manufacturing capacity and then leading the team to execute these projects.  He/She will also be responsible for providing design for manufacturing feedback to vehicle design engineers in order to realize superior design efficiency.  The deliverable for this position is the handover to day-to-day production of capable and stable manufacturing processes and equipment.  The successful candidate should be a skilled and experienced engineer and manager with a successful track record of contributing and growing engineering teams. 

Process Development and Implementation:

  • Ensure product designs are feasible for manufacturing including production efficiency and built-in quality capability
  • Performance of process analysis including PFMEA, capacity modeling and line balancing
  • Development of new manufacturing processes
  • Performance of manufacturing process comparative analysis
  • Performance of production process parameter DOE
  • Development of production process definition and documentation, as well as maintaining product life cycle discipline.

Equipment Development and Implementation:

  • Collaboration with product design and quality engineers to create equipment capability requirements
  • Preparing new product internal sourcing costing to support make vs. buy selection
  • In-house development of manufacturing equipment, fixtures, tools, etc. to support early stage prototype builds
  • Specification development of manufacturing equipment for medium- and high-volume production
  • Management of suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of manufacturing equipment
  • Characterization and validation of new equipment and fixtures for introduction to the production floor

Requirements

  • BS/MS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)
  • 7+ years of combined career experience as a leader of engineers, as a manager of engineering projects, and as a hands-on industrial/manufacturing/process engineer working on casting manufacturing processes and/or equipment
  • Proficiency in designing and costing mechanical equipment, fixturing, tooling and facilities
  • Proficiency in creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment
  • Proficiency in utilizing overall project management tools including detailed schedules and budgeting
  • Proficiency in transitioning products from prototype to production desired
  • Proficiency in utilizing statistical process control (SPC)
  • Proficiency in generating detailed drawings from solid models for various fabrication techniques (Casting, Degating, CNC/manual machining, welding, etc.)
  • Proficiency in aluminum Alloys and Metallurgy
  • Proficiency in High Pressure die casting processes and production environment
  • Proficiency in introducing new products and new processes into a production environment - PPAP
  • Proficiency in designing for manufacturability
  • Proficiency in interfacing with manufacturing execution system software (MES)
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment with multiple priorities
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Solidly organized, with meticulous attention to detail
  • Experience in 3D parametric CAD (e.g. SolidWorks, Catia) and 2D layout software (e.g. AutoCAD)
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, & Microsoft Project

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Previous Applicants:

<< Back to Search Results

Manufacturing Engineer, Castings
Req. ID: 37747
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company in the San Francisco Bay Area. We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 20,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

The Role

Job Title:  Manufacturing Engineer - Casting
Department:  Vehicle Manufacturing Engineering

We seek a highly motivated engineer to join our Casting Manufacturing Engineering group.  This group is responsible for developing and implementing the processes and equipment used to produce our advanced, high performance structural castings.  These castings are critical to our advanced body structure and are a key component to our superior crash and handling performance.  This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to building a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of an incredibly exciting product.

The Manufacturing Engineering team employs a combination of team-based and matrix-based organizational structure.  Leadership is responsible for either product lines or specific functions within the team.  The ideal Manufacturing Engineer candidate takes pride in his/her own work and that of those under his/her formal or informal guidance.  Analytical ability, organizational skills and great attention to detail are of paramount importance.  This candidate is familiar with and appreciates an environment where individuals carry tremendous responsibility and where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded.  This candidate enjoys work, thrives on daily interaction with high-caliber people and has a keen understanding of how to work with and/or motivate them.

Responsibilities

Our new Casting Manufacturing Engineer will begin with a group of existing engineers and significantly contribute to the team within Vehicle Manufacturing Engineering.  He/She will be responsible for developing the processes and requirements to implement new products and/or in-house manufacturing capacity and then leading the team to execute these projects.  He/She will also be responsible for providing design for manufacturing feedback to vehicle design engineers in order to realize superior design efficiency.  The deliverable for this position is the handover to day-to-day production of capable and stable manufacturing processes and equipment.  The successful candidate should be a skilled and experienced engineer and manager with a successful track record of contributing and growing engineering teams. 

Process Development and Implementation:

  • Ensure product designs are feasible for manufacturing including production efficiency and built-in quality capability
  • Performance of process analysis including PFMEA, capacity modeling and line balancing
  • Development of new manufacturing processes
  • Performance of manufacturing process comparative analysis
  • Performance of production process parameter DOE
  • Development of production process definition and documentation, as well as maintaining product life cycle discipline.

Equipment Development and Implementation:

  • Collaboration with product design and quality engineers to create equipment capability requirements
  • Preparing new product internal sourcing costing to support make vs. buy selection
  • In-house development of manufacturing equipment, fixtures, tools, etc. to support early stage prototype builds
  • Specification development of manufacturing equipment for medium- and high-volume production
  • Management of suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of manufacturing equipment
  • Characterization and validation of new equipment and fixtures for introduction to the production floor

Requirements

  • BS/MS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)
  • 7+ years of combined career experience as a leader of engineers, as a manager of engineering projects, and as a hands-on industrial/manufacturing/process engineer working on casting manufacturing processes and/or equipment
  • Proficiency in designing and costing mechanical equipment, fixturing, tooling and facilities
  • Proficiency in creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment
  • Proficiency in utilizing overall project management tools including detailed schedules and budgeting
  • Proficiency in transitioning products from prototype to production desired
  • Proficiency in utilizing statistical process control (SPC)
  • Proficiency in generating detailed drawings from solid models for various fabrication techniques (Casting, Degating, CNC/manual machining, welding, etc.)
  • Proficiency in aluminum Alloys and Metallurgy
  • Proficiency in High Pressure die casting processes and production environment
  • Proficiency in introducing new products and new processes into a production environment - PPAP
  • Proficiency in designing for manufacturability
  • Proficiency in interfacing with manufacturing execution system software (MES)
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment with multiple priorities
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Solidly organized, with meticulous attention to detail
  • Experience in 3D parametric CAD (e.g. SolidWorks, Catia) and 2D layout software (e.g. AutoCAD)
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, & Microsoft Project

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Roles and Responsibilities:

This position applies technical knowledge and expertise in the development and implementation of new and improved manufacturing processes, procedures and equipment. Ensure that the design specifications and procurement of manufacturing equipment, tooling, fixtures etc. meet company requirements and objectives . Manufacturing Engineers work with cross-functional teams throughout the entire product lifecycle. You will work closely with Design Engineering, Quality and Production to take design changes and new Seat designs from initial concept through prototype development and into full production .

Design of manufacturing equipment and fixtures

Specification development for manufacturing equipment

Close collaboration with external equipment suppliers on equipment design

Development of new manufacturing processes

Creation of detailed Manufacturing Instructions to define new processes and document new equipment operation

Training of technicians and line operators on manufacturing processes

Specification of hand tools for manual assembly tasks

Design of production workstations for ergonomics and efficiency

Performance of process analysis, DOE, PFMEA, line balancing and capacity modeling

Deployment of statistical control for key processes

Proven Experience in an Automotive JIT environment

Experience in Automotive seating or interiors

Exemplary verbal and written communication skills

Well organized with meticulous attention to detail

Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

 

Qualifications:

BS/MS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)

5+ years of experience as a hands-on mechanical/manufacturing/design engineer working on mechanical and/or electromechanical systems.

Manufacturing Engineer
Req. ID: 38471
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

In addition to developing manufacturing equipment and processes, Manufacturing Engineers work with cross-functional teams throughout the entire product lifecycle. You will work closely with Design Engineering, Quality and Production to take vehicle design changes and new vehicle designs from initial concept through prototype development and into full production.

 

Responsibilities

  • Develop, design and qualify high-precision BIW Process and Tooling
  • Directly responsible for the manufacturability of a world class BIW, from design concept to the mass production ramp
  • Directly responsible for achieving BIW quality targets and leading all activities towards this objective
  • Specify BIW quality targets that support Tesla world class Vehicle build objectives
  • Develop and implement strategy and plan to achieve these targets – Quality control plans, Dimensional improvement plans
  • Develop GD&T strategy to ensure a world class quality level BIW
  • Drive Tooling design and development in accordance with process plan and GD&T strategy
  • Provide detailed assessments and critical Design For Manufacture (DFM) reviews of Product, Process and Tooling designs
  • Develop and implement Processes, Equipment and Tooling for Prototype builds
  • Manage Prototype builds with the goal of identifying and highlighting manufacturability issues during these builds to ensure that established product quality targets are met at the start of production
  • Interact with and manage outside vendors as necessary based on project scope
  • Provide leadership and supervision to manufacturing engineers and cross-functional teams

Requirements

  • 3+ years of related experience developing and launching complex assembly processes or designing high-precision assembly Fixtures
  • Should be able to function independently, be a strong team player, detail oriented, organized, hands-on and able to make strong decisions
  • Must have a solid working knowledge of Design For Manufacturability
  • Strong ability to conceptualize and develop GD&T schemes
  • Work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Maintain flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments, coping with rapidly changing information
  • Results and data driven; able to effect change based on data
  • Proficiency in CATIA and DELMIA
  • Extensive proficiency in documentation of manufacturing processes
  • Communicate clearly using written and verbal skills
  • Willingness to travel to different vendor sites – 5% travel

Manufacturing Engineer
Req. ID: 37036
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable transportation and electricity consumption by designing and manufacturing electric vehicles and energy storage systems. Based in California, Tesla employs more than 13,000 people across four continents, and manufactures cars at our factory in Fremont, California. We are currently constructing the Gigafactory–the world’s largest lithium ion battery factory–in Sparks, Nevada, and have begun production of Tesla Energy battery storage products.

 

Job Title:

Manufacturing Engineer

 

Department:

Powertrain Manufacturing Engineering

 

Description:

Tesla is looking for and committed to hiring highly motivated engineers to create manufacturing equipment and processes for our Tesla Energy Grid-Tie Inverter Podule.  This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to building a world class manufacturing facility in Sparks, Nevada.  Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will be expected to challenge and be challenged, to create, and to innovate while working on critical subsystems of an incredibly exciting product.

 

Roles and Responsibilities:

In addition to developing manufacturing equipment and processes, the Manufacturing Engineer works with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product. He/She works closely with Design Engineering, Quality, Production, and Sustaining to take the assemblies from initial design through prototype development and into full production.

 

Equipment Development and Implementation

  • In-house development of manufacturing equipment and fixtures to support early stage prototype builds
  • Design and realization of manufacturing equipment and fixtures for medium and high volume production
  • Management of suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of manufacturing equipment
  • Characterization and validation of new equipment and fixtures for introduction to the production floor

 

Process Development and Implementation

  • Development of new manufacturing processes
  • Creation of detailed Manufacturing Instructions to support new processes and equipment
  • Layout of production workstations for product flow, ergonomics and efficiency
  • Specification of hand tools for assembly tasks
  • Performance of process analysis including PFMEA and capacity modeling
  • Implementation of product traceability and shop floor tracking

 

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  He/She looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

Skills and Experience:

  • Proficiency designing mechanical equipment, fixturing and tooling in CAD (SolidWorks preferred, Catia is a plus)
  • Proficiency creating detailed drawings from solid models for various fabrication techniques (CNC/manual machining, welding, sheet metal forming)
  • Proficiency in mechanical assembly (press fits, adhesive bonding, fastener selection)
  • Experience with mechanical-electrical/mechatronic systems
  • Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment is a plus
  • Experience creating process documentation
  • Experience transitioning products from prototype to production desired
  • Experience introducing new products and new processes into a production environment
  • Experience with design for manufacturability
  • Experience with programming PLCs is a plus
  • Knowledgeable about production quality metrics is a plus
  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

 

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent)
  • 2 to 5+ years of experience as a hands-on mechanical/manufacturing/design engineer working on mechanical and/or electromechanical systems.

The Role

In addition to developing manufacturing equipment and processes, Manufacturing Engineers work with cross-functional teams throughout the entire product lifecycle. Responsibilities

  • Interface with design engineering to review the BIW product design for Manufacturability
  • Develop, implement and maintain BIW Manufacturing processes
  • Develop GD&T strategy to support Vehicle quality build objectives and drive tooling design
  • Develop and implement improvements to existing manufacturing processes
  • Assess in-house manufacturing capabilities and implement new processes and/or equipment where justifiable to expand those capabilities
  • Implement and expand concepts such as Lean Manufacturing, 5S, Kaizen, etc., to reduce manufacturing cost and increase process quality and throughput
  • Collaborate with all levels of engineering in the development of new ideas; review of current documentation and implementation of changes as required
  • Provide leadership and training to Production Team Members and fellow engineers

  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Maintain flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities and assignments, coping with rapidly changing information
  • Collect, analyze and summarize information to a general understanding; thinking abstractly and separating complex ideas into simple elements
  • Work well in independent and team settings
  • Communicate clearly using written and verbal skills
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Mastery of Excel and PowerPoint
  • Proficiency with CATIA is desired, but not required
