Manufacturing Engineer
Req. ID: 31473
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla is seeking a highly-motivated Mechanical/Electrical Engineer to contribute to innovate, design, and build manufacturing equipment, fixtures, machinery, and testers to remanufacturing of batteries, drive units, chargers, and infotainment systems.   This is an exciting opportunity to join one of the groups with fastest growth within Tesla, while working in cross functional teams and having a direct impact in our mission.  

Role:

  • Interface with design engineering to review product design for Remanufacturing
  • Design  manufacturing equipment and fixtures
  • Interface with manufacturing engineering to adapt production equipment and tooling to specific Reman needs
  • Develop, implement, sustain and maintain reman equipment, tooling, fixtures, and testers.
  • Develop Reman strategy to support growth in multiple locations and product lines
  • Create and standardize RFQ (request for quote) and SOW (scope of work) documents for equipment to be designed and/or manufactured by outside suppliers
  • Interact with and manage outside suppliers from equipment conceptual design through buy off and introduction to Remanufacturing 
  • Sound mechanical and electrical engineering fundamentals
  • Sound understanding of DFM (design for manufacturing) and familiar with a wide array of manufacturing and rapid-prototyping processes and materials
  • Experience with DFMEAs and identifying potential safety risks during the equipment/tool design process
  • Develop and implement improvements to existing manufacturing processes
  • Assess in-house manufacturing capabilities and implement new processes and/or equipment where justifiable to expand those capabilities
  • Capable of providing thorough ROI/cost-benefit analysis of potential manufacturing equipment projects                                                             
  • Implement and expand concepts such as Lean Manufacturing, 5S, Kaizen, etc., to reduce manufacturing cost and increase process quality and throughput
  • Collaborate with all levels of engineering in the development of new ideas; review of current documentation and implementation of changes as required
  • Work with maintenance to create training material for equipment and tooling maintenance

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of related experience developing and launching manufacturing equipment to complex manufacturing enviroment
  • Proficiency designing mechanical equipment, fixtures and tooling in CAD (Solidworks and/orCatia is a plus).
  • Understanding of GD&T (Working knowledge, proficiency preferred)
  • Experience transitioning fully automated equipment to semi-automatic and reducing cost/complexity are strongly desired. 
  • Hands-on experience writing specifications, sourcing, and designing manufacturing equipment 
  • Hands-on experience reducing cost and scaling manufacturing equipment and testers
  • Well organized with meticulous attention to detail
  • Working knowledge of ergonomics standards related to human/machine interactions
  • Familiarity with design of common machine systems- pneumatic/hydraulic, thermal,  servos, safety components, etc
  • Proficiency with 2D/3D CATIA and Solidworks is desired

Manager of Equipment Sustaining Engineering
Req. ID: 38751
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric vehicles— with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

Position Description:

Lead the equipment sustaining engineering teams and maintenance technician groups in the Powertrain factory.

Drive behavior and build management systems to ensure all equipment is safe to operate, with high availability, good reliability and appropriate quality and cycle rate performance. 

Build and maintain preventative maintenance and condition based maintenance strategies for all the equipment on the Powertrain asset register. Direct repairs, overhauls and upgrades on a variety of electro-mechanical, robotic, and pneumatic manufacturing equipment. Develop and maintain maintenance and calibration schedules for all tools, machinery and equipment used in the manufacturing facility.

Drive a culture based on maintenance routines and engineering solutions using training, systematic troubleshooting and root cause corrective actions. Support all factory activities related to safety, engineering and manufacturing including; 5S and Lean manufacturing activities, material handling improvements, production line configuration, and safety procedures.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Establish and/or modify systems to ensure that preventative maintenance on all manufacturing tools and equipment, including robots and other automated and semi-automated manufacturing systems are being done effectively.
  • Work with all cross functional teams including; Design, NPI, Mfg Engineering, Production, Quality and Process Engineering to ensure maintenance instructions and schedules are always available and current.
  • Direct Engineering Team Managers, Maintenance Managers and Maintenance Supervisors  in day to day coverage of production line equipments, including rapid response on broken equipments to minimize downtime and maximize productivity.
  • Investigate and implement countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Maintenance safety program: provide proper training (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, PPE, etc.), tools, and equipment to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, and always lead by example.
  • Work hand-in-hand with the Spare Parts team to ensure the right parts are available in the right quantities to keep the equipment running.
  • Develop, modify, and document repairs/troubleshooting processes. Manage the team to utilize those processes.
  • Manage a wide variety of concurrent projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Manage large workload with positive attitude and proactively help co-workers
  • Leads in the interviewing, hiring, training, and decision making process for all new hires in the Powertrain Engineering and Maintenance Department
  • Partner with all departments in the Fremont factory to build a unified Tesla Performance Maintenance System
  • Actively participate in early phase equipment / production line specification, design, qualification, installation and site acceptance testing

Qualifications/Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree is highly desirable.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Minimum of 10 years of engineering / maintenance technician management experience in a high volume manufacturing/industrial environment is required.
  • Adept at industrial safety practices and policies for high volume, cutting edge technologies
  • Experienced in NFPA 70E, LOTO, and RoHS regulations
  • A demonstrated history of multi-site responsibility is highly preferred
  • Skilled at leading, coaching and developing direct reports across a broad range of engineering and technical disciplines
  • Broad experience with lean manufacturing systems and methodologies, including; Tier Accountability, Layered Auditing, Continuous Improvement and Kaizen Activities
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Experience with budgeting, forecasting and  financial planning for a large technical team (+100 people)
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc).
  • Availability to cover shifts of all schedule for PTO / absences as needed
  • Availability for off-hours calls.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Manager Manufacturing (Small & Large Drive Unit Departments)
Req. ID: 39846
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

Role: The Operations Manager will report to the Senior Manufacturing Manager and will be responsible for meeting the production forecast and driving continuous improvement through the manufacturing process. The Operations Manager provides hands-on support, leadership, and direction to the manufacturing Associate Mangers, Supervisors, and associated teams.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide exemplary leadership in a fast pace environment subject to constant change while dealing with information and resource constraints
  • Drive manufacturing team to achieve established targets for Safety, Quality, and Productivity by using Lean Manufacturing Tools and 6 Step Problem Solving
  • Maintain high product quality and manufacturing yield while ensuring optimal use of resources and adherences to best safety practices.
  • Hire, coach, lead and develop approximately 500 - 600 hourly production team members and 10 to 14 direct reports (Associate Managers / Production Supervisors). Conduct team member training.
  • Monitor metrics and Key Performance Indicator's (KPI's) to assess productivity and cost management.
  • Help with implementation of and continued adherence to Lean manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Assess and analyze current practices and drive improves.
  • Partner and Coordinate with Engineering, Materials, Maintenance, and other internal departments to resolve issues and concerns.
  • Provide program management to short term and long term projects across all areas of the department
  • Support and collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Finance, Engineering, Test and Quality departments. · Lead by example of positive reinforcement and make Tesla a World Class Manufacturing Automotive company.  

Requirements:

  • Prior management experience of similarly sized manufacturing team.
  • Hands-on experience with electro-mechanical assembly.
  • The ideal candidate is analytical, detail-oriented, self-motivated, and able to pro-actively communicate with all employees and works well in a fast-paced multi-cultural environment.
  • Experience with process improvement methodologies to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong interpersonal skills.
  • Committed to continuous improvement through utilization of Lean Manufacturing Tools
  • Well organized.
  • Ability to work well under pressure, manage competing demands and meet tight deadlines with strong follow through.
  • Good understanding of mechanical and standardized processes.
  • Ability to use problem solving methods and techniques to successfully and efficiently resolve problems.
  • Ability to foster a close working relationship with team members and management
  • BSME/BSEE or production engineering degree preferred
  • 10 years related manufacturing experience, 5 years supervisory/management experience
  • High-level leadership and decision making skills
  • Excellent verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills
  • A strong sense of urgency and drive to succeed.
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite

Manager - Failure Analysis
Req. ID: 39112
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Sunnyvale
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Manager – Failure Analysis

 

Tesla is looking for an exceptionally talented Manager to lead the Failure Analysis activities as part of the Reliability Engineering Team. 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Manage the in-house failure analysis team and the failure analysis lab.
  • Own the roadmap for Failure Analysis equipment purchases in order to continue building internal capability.
  • Manage and grow the team of Failure Analysis Engineers and technicians.
  • Facilitate and lead failure analysis activities as part of the reliability engineering team for incidents originating from reliability testing for new product development and from fielded systems. Assure that root cause is identified at the most detailed level.
  • Lead the creation of failure analysis reports with exceptional visualizations and direct the communication and presentation of findings to project teams.
  • Manage the knowledge management system to capture all failure analyses performed and assure that they can be easily retrievable. Work with the reliability team to assure that lessons learned from analyses are captured and incorporated in subsequent product cycles.
  • Drive the priorities of different failure analysis projects; manage the various projects as a project portfolio in order to optimize the value for Tesla.
  • Collaborate with reliability engineering and testing to recreate failure modes that are intermittent or hard to replicate. Utilize environmental testing equipment, HALT and other methods to be able to precipitate failures as a precursor to in depth failure analysis.
  • Create a workflow from HALT failures into failure analysis and provide expert input on root cause, its relevance to the field and the best path in terms of addressing the finding with the design teams.
  • Create strong partnerships with design, manufacturing, quality, and other teams at Tesla to drive Failure Analysis services within the company.
  • Lead executive reviews related to failure analysis results.

 

Desired skills:

 

  • Exceptional management skills
    • Attracting and retaining great talent, growing a team.
  • Experienced in growing engineering talent with feedback, coaching, training and aligning roles with skillset.
  • Knowledge and hands on experience with  failure analysis techniques such as:
    • Electrical testing and characterization, temperature characterization
    • Non-invasive tests (microscopic exam, photo, leak, X-ray, SAM, C-SAM)
    • Invasive tests (decapsulation, die examination, die probing, IR microscopic exam, cross sectioning, SEM, EDS/EDX, FIB, Auger, FTIR, FIB)
  • Hands on experience with equipment such as:
    • Basic meters, microscopes, cross sectioning equipment, power supplies & signal generators, oscilloscopes, SEM, high mag microscope, decapsulating chemicals, X-ray (real time preferred), SEM/EDS, etc.
  • Experience working on failure modes of complex electro-mechanical systems.
  • Deep understanding of fundamental failure mechanism theories.

 

Minimum Requirements: 

 

  • Bachelor of Science in Materials Science, EE, ME, Physics. MS or PhD desired.  
  • Has led a variety of failure analysis projects, with special emphasis on board level electronics
  • Prior management experience in a similar role for minimum of 3 years.
  • Experience with procuring Failure Analysis equipment and managing capital equipment budgets.

Manager - Facilities, Vehicle Engineering Test Group
Req. ID: 26258
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

This position will work as a member of Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Test Group to lead our facilities activities in support of all our component/system/vehicle level testing for tests performed in-house and at external test sites. We are looking for an experienced Facilities Manager to manage capital improvement projects, both on-site at our Fremont, CA location, and globally at all our test locations. The successful candidate will manage and oversee all test facilities projects and related activities from scope inception to physical completion, while maintaining costs according to budget plans and ensuring project completion on-time.

Responsibilities

 Manage the daily activities of the Facilities Team as part of the Vehicle Engineering Test Group

  • Creation and management of annual capital and expense budgets for the test Facilities team
  • Direct and oversee the construction, renovation, and preventative maintenance of all current and future test equipment installations (Dyno’s/Test Rigs/Chambers/Workshops/Test Labs/etc.)
  • Ability to plan, manage, direct and implement all activities related to the real estate site selection and due diligence process, property acquisition process, construction management process, life cycle of occupancy and site operational issues and services, and the disposition of real estate assets
  • Oversee responsibilities for all tenant improvement work, construction modifications and renovations, relocations and expansions of existing in-house test facilities
  • Management of the architectural building design process, including ground up large scale building development
  • Management of architectural, mechanical, electrical design standards with an in depth understanding of mechanical and electrical design practices for test lab environments
  • Oversee contract negotiations and transactions of various types including vendor contracts, service agreements, construction contracts, manufacture materials contracts, lease and sublease contracts, and legal documents of various types
  • Manage relationships with external test facilities and proving grounds globally
  • Management of lease administration process, rent payment process, and landlord relations for off-site facilities usage

Requirements

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships with Tesla test teams, outside test labs and others within and outside Tesla
  • Experience working with various test labs with broad contacts in the field of automotive testing
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Strong leadership skills and experience in real estate matters and facilities operational issues
  • Ability to develop and maintain positive relationships with in-house resources, business groups operations personnel, and senior management
  • Expertise in the management of large scale Tenant Improvement projects and the building development process
  • Expertise in the management of architectural design, construction management, and project management disciplines
  • Firsthand experience working with, and directing the operation and work output of various professionals, such as real estate brokers, attorneys, architects, landlords, general contractors
  • Excellent decision making, problem solving, and problem resolution/negotiation skills
  • Experience managing capital and expense budgets from the budget inception through monthly, quarterly and year-end financial close periods

We are looking for a detail-oriented leader with the proven ability to manage multiple tasks, to produce high quality work, and to consistently meet deadlines.  The successful candidate will possess the following:

  • 7-10 years of prior facilities management experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management or Engineering or related degree is strongly preferred
  • Proven skills in developing plans and specifications for building permit submissions
  • Firm grasp of OSHA 10 and related standards which ensure a safe work environment
  • Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook/Excel/PowerPoint).
  • A strong work ethic, proven follow-through skills, and a “can-do” attitude are a must.
  • Availability to work for weekends/nights as needed in order to meet schedule demand.

Maintenance Technician, Powertrain OEM Manufacturing
Req. ID: 36880
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla Motors OEM Manufacturing

? Tesla designs, manufactures and sells electric cars and electric vehicle powertrain components. Founded in 2003, it was the first company in the world to build a fully electric vehicle in serial production. It has remained ahead of the curve ever since. 

 

Tesla’s know-how has been recognized by other auto manufacturers that subcontracts the development and production of their electric powertrains to Tesla.  The OEM manufacturing team builds batteries and drive-systems that are assembled in third party’s cars, among which some of the most respected name in the industry. Therefore the team operates at the highest standard of quality and customer demand. 

 

Position Description

The successful Maintenance Technician candidate will have broad-based industrial maintenance experience, encompassing Electrical/PLC, Robotics, Mechanical, Welding, Machining, Hydraulics/Pneumatics, Conveyor systems, etc. Must be willing to tackle whatever maintenance challenge presents itself, and be willing to assist and learn from others in their areas of expertise. Entry level candidates will be considered.

 

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime.
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team.
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative  maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads.
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required).
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking)
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime.
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy.
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory.
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example.
  • Maintain customer satisfaction when interacting with Production teams and other supporting group

 

Qualifications/Skills

  • AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation or technical military experience in lieu of Degree.
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining or automation/PLC/robotics.
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, email etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required.
  • Customer driven to respond to request in a timely and supportive manner, going the extra mile to ensure the success of the OEM programs

Maintenance Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 42292
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

About Tesla

 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role 

Maintenance Technician, Gigafactory

Responsibilities:

  • Day to day coverage of production line equipment: respond to alarms, breakdowns, and Production requests quickly and efficiently to minimize downtime 
  • Diagnoses equipment failures, finds root cause and communicates actions taken to the rest of the team 
  • Become Journeyman Level on all machines in assigned area and be responsible for preventative maintenance, troubleshooting/repair, cleanliness and escalation of assigned equipment
  • Takes initiative to improve PM documents and schedules, under the direction of the Maintenance Supervisor and Leads 
  • Perform major equipment repairs and rebuilds, (some weekends and holidays required) 
  • Uses manufacturing systems effectively (MES, Spares Inventory, Issue Tracking) 
  • Work with Process and Equipment engineering and other cross functional groups to resolve maintenance issues, improve equipment reliability, review procedures, and minimize equipment downtime
  • Recommends countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns
  • Organizes and maintains a high degree of cleanliness in the maintenance area as well as performing spares inventory audits to ensure accuracy
  • Participates in TPM team while taking on small improvement projects to assist in improving the factory 
  • Follows all aspects of Maintenance Safety protocol (LOTO, 5-S, Arc Flash, etc.), to ensure that the maintenance team operates safely at all times, always leading by example

Requirements: 

  • AS/BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical Technology is preferred. 3+ years of experience maintaining industrial equipment and automation, or technical military experience in lieu of Degree
  • Strong Allen Bradley PLC experience highly desired
  • Fanuc and or Kuka robot experience a plus
  • Areas of specialization may include one or more of the following: electrical/electronics, mechanical/machining, or automation/PLC/robotics
  • Experience creating & maintaining a positive atmosphere in a collaborative work team
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work
  • Skilled at troubleshooting automation, conveyance and electromechanical systems
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel. PowerPoint etc.
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • Willing to perform shift and overtime as required

Maintenance Supervisor - Powertrain
Req. ID: 35090
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

Maintenance Supervisor, Powertrain Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is an aggressive young company in the San Francisco Bay Area. We design and manufacture the advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. Tesla has delivered over 70,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.  You can learn more about the Model S here:  http://www.teslamotors.com/models

Department:

Powertrain Manufacturing

The Role:

Manage a small group of equipment maintenance technicians that are responsible for equipment availability, and performance.  Perform preventative maintenance and repair on a variety of electro-mechanical, robotic, and pneumatic manufacturing equipment. Develop and maintain maintenance and calibration schedules for all tools, machinery and equipment used in the manufacturing facility. Perform supporting activities for engineering and manufacturing including 5S and Lean manufacturing activities, material handling improvements, production line configuration, and safety procedures.  Manage workload with a positive attitude as a team player in a collaborative work environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish systems to ensure that preventative maintenance is 100% on-time and effectively for all manufacturing tools and equipment, including robots and other automated and semi-automated manufacturing systems.
  • Drive to achieve world class Equipment Availability > 90%, as well as supporting OEE >85%.
  • Day to day coverage of production line equipments, including rapid response on broken equipments to minimize downtime and maximize productivity.
  • Establish a positive work environment for non-exempt workers to be productive, and completely engaged with Tesla Mission, Core Values, and Culture.
  • Investigate and implement countermeasures to prevent repetitive breakdowns.
  • Assist with electrical and mechanical code compliance, safety, and lean manufacturing initiatives.
  • Maintain and help develop up-to-date maintenance and calibration procedures and schedules.
  • Support Lean Manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Work with Engineering and Manufacturing to ensure maintenance instructions and schedules are always available and current.
  • Will support both day and swing shift manufacturing schedule (Some weekends and holiday required).
  • Manage repairs/troubleshooting exactly to instructed process.
  • Manage small projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Drive to reduce cost of ownership for all Equipment in Powertrain
  • Provide clear report for all unscheduled down event on critical equipment
  • Provide support to ensure that all equipment installation and modifications are effective.
  • Manage workload with positive attitude and proactively help co-workers

Requirements

  • BS Degree on Industrial/Mechanical/Electrical is required.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of maintenance technician management experience in a high volume manufacturing/industrial environment is required.
  • Skilled at troubleshooting electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems.
  • Demonstrated experience with 3-phase 480/208 VAC, single-phase 208/120 VAC, and 24 VDC systems.
  • Familiarity with CNC equipment preferred.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools, as well as general machining and welding experience.
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Basic drafting experience preferred. (SolidWorks experience a plus.)
  • Availability off-hours and weekend calls.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Department:

The Role:

Develop and maintain maintenance and calibration schedules for all tools, machinery and equipment used in the manufacturing facility.   • Drive to achieve world class Equipment Availability > 90%, as well as supporting OEE >85%.
  • Day to day coverage of production line equipments, including rapid response on broken equipments to minimize downtime and maximize productivity.

Maintenance Manager (General Assembly)
Req. ID: 39555
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Manager - Maintenance, Vehicle Assembly Division

The successful candidate will have proven experience in all facets of Automotive Vehicle assembly maintenance to support sustainable production as well as new model and/or new equipment introduction is required. The successful candidate needs to have demonstrable skills in the following areas:

  • Equipment Operation Availability / % OEE improvement
    • System development to track current shop conditions
    • Identification of key areas of improvement
  • Breakdown management
    • Understanding of short term vs long term actions
    • Systems used to prevent repeat occurrences
  • PM / TPM development and implementation
    • Reference to past improvement initiatives / % improvements
  • Equipment spare parts management
    • Critical vs non critical parts determination
    • Audit methods to ensure no risk condition
  • Training & development
    • Assessment of current skills sets
    • Training action plans

The successful candidate must be able to build upon previous experiences and take our Assembly Maintenance team to the next level. He/she must be capable of collaborating with cross-functional teams and department leaders to address concerns and issues that affect part quality, production efficiency, work cell ergonomics, equipment maintenance, etc... The successful candidate will also have exceptional interpersonal, organizational, and management skills, demonstrating the ability to be an innovator and change agent.

Responsibilities:

  • Direct leadership of 4 maintenance crews covering a 24/7 operating capability
  • Responsibility for manpower management:
    • day to day line support
    • in-house repair work
    • vacation, OT & weekend work scheduling.
  • Defining daily tasks and setting directions for the team
  • Interaction with Production and Engineering Groups
  • Interaction with customer departments and managers (Production Control, General Assembly, Paint)
  • Standard development and creation of procedures and methods
  • Project management: both internal maintenance projects, and minor contractor projects.
  • Procedures & PMs, develop & maintain proper documentation of: all necessary procedures; periodic maintenance tasks; equipment changes (electrical, spare parts upgrades, mechanical), etc.
  • Assist with budget development and reporting.
  • Maintain spare parts inventory. Identify and order needed parts, maintain tracking system.
  • Training and directing the training of maintenance associates to support production requirements

 Requirements: The ideal candidate will have/be:

  • 8+ years of experience in maintenance / equipment management / leadership role
  • 5+ years of extensive experience with trouble-shooting and correcting industrial equipment maintenance - breakdowns and failures
  • Experience in team building, coaching and succession planning for technical and engineering personal
  • Robotic and controls programming skills (Bonus = Fanuc Robotic systems)
  • Maintenance experience in a vehicle assembly shop on a journeyman level. Experience with aluminum car bodies is a plus.
  • Lean manufacturing skills and systems development
  • Project management experience.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs.
  • Proficient in using a CMMS database
  • Open minded , highly flexible, positive attitude
  • Good overall people management skills.
  • Great communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Engineering degree preferred

Maintenance Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 41192
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

About Tesla

 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role 

Maintenance Engineer, Gigafactory

Responsibilities:

  • Work collaboratively with design, product excellence, production operations, Manufacturing Engineering, Process Engineering, Maintenance and other cross functional teams as the expert to ensure production lines run in a safe, efficient manner producing high quality parts.
  • Lead equipment upgrades with a focus on serviceability, reliability and process capability.
  • Responsible for continuous process optimization of automated lines
  • Become owner / subject matter expert to drive equipment-related process improvement including detailed troubleshooting and root cause analysis.
  • Build training material, maintenance routines, service bulletins, and related documentation related to cradle to grave equipment life cycle management
  • Lead safety and ergonomic improvements to production equipment which meets or exceeds regulations or best practices.
  • Develop and improve equipment validation procedures including calibration and qualification
  • Identify equipment critical spare parts and ensure sufficient coverage to prevent extended downtime situations
  • Participate in supplier and equipment buyoffs
  • Debug and optimize automated processes to maximize cycle time and uptime.
  • Develop and manage FMEA risk assessments to prioritize equipment improvement projects and ensure sufficient repair strategies.
  • Provide hands-on support to maintenance team to troubleshoot and resolve extended downtime situations.
  • Carry out Gauge R&R to validate repeatability of measurement equipment
  • Familiarity with Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP)
  • Familiarity with SPC and development of equipment-related OCAPs

Requirements:

  • BS in an engineering field, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability 
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Good overall computer skills, including Microsoft Office and e-mail programs
  • Structured problems solving methodologies (DMAIC, 8D, etc)
  • ACAD experience in developing electrical schematics.
  • Experience creating various reports and database tools for management
  • Experience with PLC programming, troubleshooting, and configuration
  • Experience with robot programming, backup and restoration
  • Experience in automotive or high volume manufacturing is highly desired

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Lead Test Technician
Req. ID: 34284
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Energy is looking for a Lead Test Technician to support and own the development, implementation and application of a wide variety of test and validation plans/methods with our engineering development team. In this role you will have a broad scope of responsibility from creating electrical and mechanical test fixtures, to executing test plans and writing test reports.

Responsibilities

  • Setup and monitor/log internal and external tests and validation activity. This includes but is not limited to durability, thermal, structural, materials and regulatory testing on a component and system level basis.
  • Build, assemble and setup of test/validation equipment and fixtures
  • Install electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic circuitry and controls or data circuits
  • Installation and use of data acquisition equipment and other instrumentation
  • Record and analyze test data
  • Document and report on issues fund during test and work closely with Test Engineering to address these
  • Conduct component and system tear downs after test completion to discover issues generated during testing, document and report results
  • Support the development of test/validation plans and methods that assure reliability, structural and other engineering targets are met by the component/system tested
  • Maintain test/validation equipment

Requirements

  • AS or BS degree in Electronics Technology, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
  • 5 years + of experience in an engineering development environment
  • 3 years + experience in a Test Technician Role
  • Strong understanding of engineering and reliability fundamentals
  • Ability to operate and maintain a wide variety of hand and power tools, shop tools, and lab equipment
  • Experience with wiring diagrams and harness drawings
  • Experience with oscilloscopes, DMMs and HV power supplies
  • Ability to instrument test samples with thermal couples, accelerometers, strain gauges, pressure sensors, induction probes etc.
  • Experience in the use of a broad variety of test, control and data acquisition equipment and software (i.e. Lab View, MatLab)
  • Experience and demonstrated success in machining, fabrication and welding
  • Experience with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Positive attitude, eagerness to learn and ability to change direction quickly
  • High voltage/power experience
  • Experience with HV battery systems
  • 3D CAD skills(Solidworks / Catia V5 preferred)
  • Experience with operation and repair of pneumatic and hydraulic systems
  • Forklift certification
  • First aid/AED/CPR training

<< Back to Search Results

Motor Controls Engineer
Req. ID: 34707
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

To be considered for this position, please submit your resume AND cover letter to PEControls@teslamotors.com 

Your cover letter should include the following: 

1.            Why are you the right fit for this position at Tesla?  What makes you an exceptional candidate?

2.            Tell us about your favorite achievement.  This could be something you accomplished at work or personal, but should be technical in nature.

About Tesla

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

The Role

As a member of the Powertrain architecture and controls team, you will model, design, implement, test and benchmark the motor controls of current and future Tesla traction motor drives.


Responsibilities

  • Help define requirements for motor control software and interfacing hardware components including voltage and current sensors, power stages, speed sensors
  • Understand, drive design of, and implement motor controller functionality, behaviors, and algorithms
  • Develop, test, and validate motor control algorithms in the laboratory and in-vehicle
  • Maintain awareness of and influence research and development in key component technologies that influence future inverter / motor designs and motor control
  • Advance Tesla Motors intellectual property in electric motor design and motor controls

Requirements

  • In-depth understanding of torque control techniques such as slip-based control, field oriented control, direct torque control
  • Prior experience with flux estimation methods, 3-phase power control, analytical control system theory development and analysis
  • Experience with various PWM schemes such as space vector, discontinuous, and sinusoidal modulation, including data-acquisition methods
  • Capability of delivering high-quality C code in an embedded microcontroller environment
  • Strong communication and preference for working in teams
  • System-oriented understanding of thermal, vehicle-level torque control, high voltage DC-link integration, efficiency optimization, and firmware integration for electric drives
  • Model development and data analysis in Matlab/Simulink
  • Greater than 3 years of experience in implementation of controls in traction motor or other inverter-fed drives
  • BS/MS/PhD in EE/ME/Physics or equivalent

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Modeling Systems Engineer
Req. ID: 38882
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

About Tesla Energy

Tesla Energy is bringing battery technology to the grid to facilitate a renewable energy ecosystem and increase grid reliability in places where it is lacking.  Tesla is leveraging its breakthrough powertrain technology and manufacturing scale to develop and deploy grid connected storage at residential, industrial, and utility scales. The Energy team is small, committed, and fast moving.  As a member of our team, you will help to shape the direction of our products.  You must have a genuine passion for engineering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. 

 

Role

The Tesla Energy Modeling Systems Engineer will be tasked with the development and ownership of Tesla Energy system models. Using them to establish the performance and functional goals for Tesla Energy's battery energy storage systems. You are the design leadership that defines and leads Tesla’s strategy to meet those goals by leveraging your technical experience, physical intuition, common sense, and simulation tools.

Responsibilities

·       Developing, validating, and maintaining simulation models of all TE products including but not limited to: power electronics, thermal, controls and battery systems.

·       Be the owner and gate keeper of all models and libraries

·       Developing and maintaining regression testing to ensure model validity at all times

·       Use the model to inform or lead design engineering through analysis and trade studies

·       Develops system and component requirements, distributes function and performance to components within systems, defines system hardware and software architecture, defines electrical, mechanical, and communication interfaces for components to meet those goals. 

·       Collaborates tightly with firmware, hardware, and validation teams to ensure efficient implementation and validation of new features, components, and systems.


Essential Skills:

·       Strong background in modeling of complex mechanical, electrical and thermodynamic systems in Matlab and Simulink

·       Experience in model validation and regression testing

·       Familiarity with system-level design tools, including state machines, flow-charts, functional specification systems, fault tree analysis, and failure mode and effect analysis

 

Desired Skills:

·       Awareness and interest of Tesla Energy product and market applications for grid storage

·       First-hand understanding of communication systems and software development in embedded microcontrollers

·       Previous engineering experience with grid-connected power electronics for Solar, Wind, or other renewable power generation, or grid-connected batteries

 

Qualifications

·       Greater than 4 years of engineering or academic experience on multiple products that have entered production

·       MSc., PhD. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, or equivalent

Mechanical Engineering Internship / Co-Op (Spring 2017)
Req. ID: 42200
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Intern

Description

The Role

You will design, test, and prototype mechanical components and systems for current and future Tesla vehicle and product programs. Your scope of work will be electromechanical in nature and will challenge you to come up with creative solutions to affect rigorous quality and cost-down targets. Additionally, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional partners and external vendors and suppliers.

Your application to the Mechanical Engineering Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Battery Engineering, Power Electronics, Mechanical Drive Systems, Charging, and Research and Development.

Responsibilities

  • Mechanical wrenching, basic fabrication, machining, wiring, general electronics, debugging, and parts chasing.
  • Automotive component/system testing including environmental and safety testing.
  • Design, fabricate and program test equipment for the validation of mechanical and electromechanical parts.
  • Model components and assemblies in CAD (Solidworks, CATIA V5).
  • Solve electronics packaging issues: isolation, EMC, heat sinking and cooling, tolerances, materials, fastening, and machine design elements.
  • Further develop understanding of thermodynamics and heat transfer, high voltage and low voltage DC circuits.
  • Utilize understanding of thermal and mechanical modeling to test various components.

Requirements

Specific project assignments and required technical aptitude will vary based on the needs of the individual hiring team.

  • Currently working towards a BS, MS, or advanced degree in a relevant engineering program.
  • Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes and a variety of engineering materials.
  • Working knowledge of Matlab, Labview, and Python ; GD&T required, proficiency preferred.
  • Hands-on experience, previous internship and/or project experience is preferred.
  • Experience with automotive environmental, reliability, and safety requirements is a plus.
  • Knowledge of lithium-ion battery technology and electrochemistry a plus.
  • Professional and positive communication skills.
  • You must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to relocate to the Bay Area, California.

Mechanical Engineering Internship / Co-Op (Fall 2016)
Req. ID: 39717
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Intern

Description

The Role

You will design, test, and prototype mechanical components and systems for current and future Tesla vehicle and product programs. Your scope of work will be electromechanical in nature and will challenge you to come up with creative solutions to affect rigorous quality and cost-down targets. Additionally, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional partners and external vendors and suppliers.

Your application to the Mechanical Engineering Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Battery Engineering, Power Electronics, Mechanical Drive Systems, Charging, and Research and Development.

Responsibilities

  • Mechanical wrenching, basic fabrication, machining, wiring, general electronics, debugging, and parts chasing.
  • Automotive component/system testing including environmental and safety testing.
  • Design, fabricate and program test equipment for the validation of mechanical and electromechanical parts.
  • Model components and assemblies in CAD (Solidworks, CATIA V5).
  • Solve electronics packaging issues: isolation, EMC, heat sinking and cooling, tolerances, materials, fastening, and machine design elements.
  • Further develop understanding of thermodynamics and heat transfer, high voltage and low voltage DC circuits.
  • Utilize understanding of thermal and mechanical modeling to test various components.

  • Experience with automotive environmental, reliability, and safety requirements is a plus.
  • Knowledge of lithium-ion battery technology and electrochemistry a plus.
  • Professional and positive communication skills.
  • You must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment.

Mechanical Engineer, Structures and Absorbers – Vehicle Exterior Systems
Req. ID: 41328
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Title: Mechanical Engineer, Structures and Absorbers – Vehicle Exterior Systems

The Role

As a Mechanical Engineer developing Structures and Absorbers for the Vehicle Exterior group you will be responsible for design, release and launch of components for future vehicle lines including, but not limited to:

·        Front End Module

·        Wheel Liners

·        Sound Absorbers

·        Front End Integration (Ensure craftsmanship fit and finish; Front Fascia, Headlamps, Fender, Hood)

You will be part of the team that creates and executes world class systems in terms of styling, function and customer quality. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering entire systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Engineering Manager of Exterior Systems.

Responsibilities

·        As part of Tesla’s Vehicle engineering team you will design release and launch Exterior components and subsystems, aligned with program product profile with responsibilities to include:

·        Concept Engineering & feasibility

·        Packaging & layout within vehicle architecture

·        Design to deliver customer-driven Exterior system targets for Craftsmanship, function, cost and weight.

·        Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost.

·        Detail Design including datum & fixation strategy, GD&T

·        Complete and release component & sub system design, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (In-house designs are planned for most major commodities).

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program.

·        Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design

·        Collaborate with key suppliers & tool makers to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.

·        Collaborate with cross functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.

·        Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

Requirements

·        Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

·        Preferably 5 years of experience in automotive or similar field, but proven evidence of technical aptitude can be a substitute for exposure. Evidence of following the design process from initial concept stages through tooling release and production launch, having completed 3D and 2D CAD in Catia V5. Other CAD experience will be considered but ultimately Catia V5 will be used.

·        Automotive Engineering with components in the Exterior environment preferred

·        Experience managing suppliers for product development.

·        Have a good mix of designing a variety of materials (stamped, injection mold, cast, etc.) and designing kinematics/ mechanisms.

·        Understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering between low/high volume, entry/premium vehicle systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.

·        Have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.

·        Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.

·        Strong familiarity with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents.

·        Demonstrate an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout your career.

Mechanical Engineer - SuperCharging Systems
Req. ID: 38884
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

 

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline. Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone.   

You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles and equipment in the world. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products. This must excite you. You must be a builder. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.

This roll will involve working on the next generation of Supercharging equipment--providing faster charging and easier use. The work will require complex and innovative designs, with high likelihood for IP generation along the way. Mechanical engineering within the Power Electronics Team requires and offers a very high level of collaboration with electrical engineers and firmware engineers.

Responsibilities

  • Design and development of components for Tesla's Supercharger equipment.
  • CAD design of plastics, sheet metal, extrusions etc.
  • Work with Electrical engineers and PCBA designers to integrate components into electromechanical systems.
  • Thermal and mechanical modeling and testing of components.
  • Validation of components in bench and vehicle configuration.
  • Collaboration with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to transition concepts to production. 

Requirements

  • Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering within a product design and manufacturing environment.
  • Experience with product and process validation.
  • Detail oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills.
  • Minimum of 2 year mechanical engineering experience.
  • Experience with designs for regulatory code compliance a plus.
  • Proficiency in CAD modeling, CATIA v5 experience highly valued but not required.
  • BS in Mechanical Engineering.  MS preferred.

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Mechanical Engineer - Motor Drive Inverter
Req. ID: 38883
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

 

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline. Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone.   

You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles in the world. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products. This must excite you. You must be a builder. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.

Mechanical engineering within the Power Electronics team requires and offers a very high level of collaboration with electrical engineers and firmware engineers.  Our systems typically deliver very high currents to enable our vehicles to go faster and charge faster than any other car ever developed in the mass market.  Power electronics is the core of every EV.  Our systems control the flow of electrons from the wall to the battery and eventually to the motor.  

 

Responsibilities

  • Design and development of components to charge and drive Model S and future Tesla vehicles.
  • CAD design of plastics, sheet metal, die castings, etc.
  • Work with Electrical engineers and PCBA designers to integrate components into electromechanical systems.
  • Thermal and mechanical modeling and testing of components.
  • Validation of components in bench and vehicle configuration.
  • Collaboration with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to transition concepts to production. 

Requirements

  • Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering within a product design and manufacturing environment.
  • Experience with product and process validation.
  • Detail oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills.
  • Minimum of 4 years mechanical engineering experience.
  • Proficiency in CAD modeling, CATIA v5 experience highly valued but not required.
  • BS in Mechanical Engineering, MS preferred, or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Mechanical Engineer - Engineering Test and Analysis
Req. ID: 25707
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer for our Powertrain Engineering Hardware Test and Analysis Team.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement test programs for electric vehicle powertrain technologies and stationary storage applications.
  • Work directly with design engineers to create design validation test plans.
  • Design and fabrication of test equipment for mechanical, thermal and electrical systems.
  • Perform component validation under dynamic and environmental conditions.
  • Work with design engineers to validate and refine models.
  • Support vehicle testing and manufacturing launch as required.
  • Analyze test data and write test reports.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering preferred.
  • 2+ years of experience in physical testing and analysis of mechanical, thermal, or electrical systems.
  • Automotive component/system testing experience, including certification testing.
  • Experience with Labview and Matlab, or other data acquisition and analysis software.
  • Design of test setups for mechanical and thermal performance testing, such as fixtures for shock and vibe testing.
  • Experience creating and executing design validation plans and test methods to validate performance to requirements.
  • Experience creating analytical and numerical models of mechanical, thermal or electrical systems.
  • Working knowledge of heat transfer and thermal management.

·         Experience with CAN bus.

Mechanical Design Engineer- Chassis Dynamics
Req. ID: 29310
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

A Design Engineer - Chassis Dynamics is responsible for technical design, development and product launch of suspension, steering, brake, and structural subframe components and associated systems in support of current and future vehicle programs. 

Responsibilities

  1. Drive the design of chassis components and systems aligned with best-in-class handling and ride comfort.
  2. Technically contribute to the design, architecture, component selection, and optimization activities of the chassis systems relying on analytical and physical test methodologies and robust assessment strategies
  3. Perform CAD layout, CAE analysis, and dynamic suspension modeling.
  4. Research and implement new techniques and technologies in chassis design including alternative materials and improved component designs to achieve lighter weight and optimized structural performance.

Work with the Tesla project teams and system suppliers in order to:

  • Establish chassis system architecture and functional feasibility
  • Optimize concepts and designs
  • Establish manufacturing, assembly and service feasibility
  • Complete and release system, sub-system and detail designs
  • Complete component and system validation, ensuring performance targets are met
  • Participate in sourcing process and interface with supply chain team and suppliers as required.
  • Drive the creation and execution of component design verification plans and test methods.
  • Drive the creation of component specification, component DFMEA, and other technical design documents.
  • Manage component design and validation schedules in association with overall vehicle program schedules.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science of Mechanical Engineering, Master’s Degree or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Hands-on experience in chassis system test and development activities
  • Proficiency in 3D CAD modeling software (CATIA, Pro-Engineer, Unigraphics) –
  • Minimum of 2 years experience, CATIA v5 preferred
  • Knowledge of and experience with vehicle dynamics lab and vehicle testing methods (preferred)

Mechanical Design Engineer- Body Systems
Req. ID: 36482
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla Motors is breaking the mold and paving the path to change the way the world looks not only at alternative energy vehicles, but also at the paradigm of human transportation.   Our zero tailpipe emission products do not compromise on performance, luxury, nor utility.  Neither do we compromise on the people that make our products happen.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline.   Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone.

  • You must have a genuine passion for engineering electric vehicles.  Without passion, you would find what we're trying to do too difficult. There are much easier jobs.
  • You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company.
  • We are building real products -- not presentations. This must excite you. You must be a builder. 

We offer a competitive salary, meaningful stock ownership, health benefits, a fun work environment and the chance to make a real contributory impact on the world. 

The Role

The Design Engineer for Body-in-White is responsible for engineering best-in-class body structure architectures and systems for Tesla’s premium vehicle programs. You will Conceptualize, Design, Engineer, Release, Develop and Launch Body Structure components and systems.

 Responsibilities

  • Create and develop Body-in-White component and system requirements and specifications to achieve best-in-class structural, NVH and crash performance.
  • Create vehicle-aligned component and system targets for function, cost, weight and investment.
  • Establish system architecture and functional feasibility.
  • Develop design concepts and production designs in both CATIA V5 and CATIA V6.
  • Optimize the concepts and designs with analytical and physical assessments, ensuring conformation to federal regulations governing assigned systems.
  • Complete and release system, sub-system and detail designs.
  • Deliver world-class craftsmanship and fit/finish.
  • Support creation of component specification, component DFMEA, DVP&R and other technical design documents.
  • Release parts for production in the PLM system.
  • Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, validation, and other engineering activities as specified for the assigned commodity. Note that in most cases, Tesla Vehicle Engineering will design commodities for the Model S in-house.
  • Create (with component/system supplier) component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods.
  • Complete component and system validation as required, insuring system targets are met and optimized.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science or higher in mechanical engineering; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 3 years minimum experience in automotive body design and engineering
  • Minimum of 1 full development BIW life cycle through design, development, release and launch
  • Proficiency in both CATIA V5 and CATIA V6.
  • Understanding of GD&T in design engineering
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs
  • Ability to interpret CAE results and integrate recommendations into product designs
  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects with tight timing constraints
  • Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes and lightweight, recyclable and sustainable materials (aluminum preferred)
  • Ability to flexibly work in vague and constantly changing design direction and conditions.
  • Experience in DFSS highly preferred.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Mechanical Design Engineer, Infotainment
Req. ID: 34990
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. 

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a mechanical design engineer with a minimum of 5-10 years of experience designing products for high-volume production. This engineer will have design and release responsibility for electro-mechanical assemblies in Tesla’s world-leading production EV’s.

Will be responsible for design and release of enclosures for Instrument Cluster, Media Control Unit, custom modules, brackets, user controls (switches, buttons, actuating mechanisms), etc., using your breadth in packaging of electronics devices and equipment and in selection of hardware.

Responsibilities

  • Assessing and documenting the requirements for a particular system.
  • Gathering input from team members and synthesizing inputs into a preferred concept.
  • Developing in CAD: system interfaces, master model and detailed part models, (Catia v5 preferred but not required).
  • Designing metal and plastic parts (formed, injection molded or die cast, machined, extruded, etc).
  • Creating 2-d part documentation appropriate for high-volume production methods and inspection methods (including GD&T).
  • Working with product lifecycle management software for managing and releasing structured bills-of-materials.
  • Fabricating proof-of-concept prototypes to validate feasibility of new designs.
  • Managing prototype vendors for parts fabrication.
  • Assembling prototype systems and testing these to validate design.

 

Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of materials properties and applications, fabrication methods.
  • Basic sense for thermal issues and cooling flow and methods.
  • Experience includes multiple projects taking parts from initial concept and design through to production.
  • Have a passion about electro-mechanical product design, inventing solutions, and finding better and simpler ways to meet product requirements.
  • Be able to perform required analysis to ensure a successful design (stress, strain, thermal, tolerance, coast and mass optimization, etc) or to direct resources for this work.
  • Have experience designing mechanical control outline drawings for PCBA’s, in specifying electrical connectors, in considering wiring and EM shielding, in managing heat within electronic assemblies, and in creating enclosures and structures to make a physical module which can be deployed into real-world customer applications.
  • Be able to present data/trade-offs to management to facilitate the making of decisions.
  • Have had primary technical and design responsibility for all aspects of small mechanical or electro-mechanical assemblies which were successfully produced in moderate to high volume.
  • Experience in safety critical industries (automotive, medical, aero-space) and in cost/weight critical applications is preferred.

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
