Mechanical Design Engineer, Infotainment
Req. ID: 29056
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a mechanical design engineer with a minimum of 5-10 years of experience designing products for high-volume production. This engineer will have design and release responsibility for electro-mechanical assemblies in Tesla’s world-leading production EV’s.

Will be responsible for design and release of enclosures for Instrument Cluster, Media Control Unit, custom modules, brackets, user controls (switches, buttons, actuating mechanisms), etc., using your breadth in packaging of electronics devices and equipment and in selection of hardware.

Responsibilities

  • Assessing and documenting the requirements for a particular system.
  • Gathering input from team members and synthesizing inputs into a preferred concept.
  • Developing in CAD: system interfaces, master model and detailed part models, (Catia v5 preferred but not required).
  • Designing metal and plastic parts (formed, injection molded or die cast, machined, extruded, etc).
  • Creating 2-d part documentation appropriate for high-volume production methods and inspection methods (including GD&T).
  • Working with product lifecycle management software for managing and releasing structured bills-of-materials.
  • Fabricating proof-of-concept prototypes to validate feasibility of new designs.
  • Managing prototype vendors for parts fabrication.
  • Assembling prototype systems and testing these to validate design.

 

Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of materials properties and applications, fabrication methods.
  • Basic sense for thermal issues and cooling flow and methods.
  • Experience includes multiple projects taking parts from initial concept and design through to production.
  • Have a passion about electro-mechanical product design, inventing solutions, and finding better and simpler ways to meet product requirements.
  • Be able to perform required analysis to ensure a successful design (stress, strain, thermal, tolerance, coast and mass optimization, etc) or to direct resources for this work.
  • Have experience designing mechanical control outline drawings for PCBA’s, in specifying electrical connectors, in considering wiring and EM shielding, in managing heat within electronic assemblies, and in creating enclosures and structures to make a physical module which can be deployed into real-world customer applications.
  • Be able to present data/trade-offs to management to facilitate the making of decisions.
  • Have had primary technical and design responsibility for all aspects of small mechanical or electro-mechanical assemblies which were successfully produced in moderate to high volume.
  • Experience in safety critical industries (automotive, medical, aero-space) and in cost/weight critical applications is preferred.

Mechanical Design Engineer, Bumper Fascia & Underbody Aeroshields – Vehicle Exterior Systems
Req. ID: 41360
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Engineer, Bumper Fascia & Underbody Aeroshields – Vehicle Exterior Systems

The Role

As an Engineer developing Front and Rear Fascia assemblies for the Vehicle Exterior group you will be responsible for design, release and launch of ‘A class’ plastic moldings, including painted, mold in color, chromed components for future vehicle lines including, but not limited to:

·        Front & Rear Fascia Moldings, including all decorative trims, chromes, painted, mold in color

·        Integration to vehicle

·        Ultrasonic parking sensor brackets

·        Fog lamp mounting brackets & ducting

·        Underbody Aero Shields

You will be part of the team that creates and executes world class systems in terms of styling, function and customer quality. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering entire systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.  You will report to the Engineering Manager of Exterior Systems.

Responsibilities

As part of Tesla’s Vehicle engineering team you will design release and launch Exterior components and subsystems, aligned with program product profile with responsibilities to include:

·        Concept Engineering & feasibility

·        Packaging & layout within vehicle architecture

·        Design to deliver customer-driven Exterior system targets for Craftsmanship, function, cost and weight.

·        Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form vs. function vs. cost.

·        Detail Design including datum & fixation strategy, GD&T

·        Complete and release component & sub system design, utilizing a mix of in-house design and supplier engineering where required (In-house designs are planned for most major commodities).

·        Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program.

·        Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design

·        Collaborate with key suppliers & tool makers to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events.

·        Collaborate with cross functional teams within the Tesla Vehicle Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Procurement groups to ensure system manufacturing and assembly feasibility and serviceability.

·        Responsible for technical documentation to include DFMEAs, DVP&R’s.

·        Approve tooling, material injection and gating strategy

Requirements

• Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred) or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

• Preferably 5 years of experience in automotive or similar field, but proven evidence of technical aptitude can be a substitute for exposure. Evidence of following the design process from initial concept stages through tooling release and production launch, having completed 3D and 2D CAD in Catia V5. Other CAD experience will be considered but ultimately Catia V5 will be used.

• Automotive Engineering with components in the Exterior environment preferred

• Experience managing suppliers for product development.

• Have a good mix of designing a variety of materials (stamped, injection mold, cast, etc.) and designing kinematics/ mechanisms.

• Understand the fundamental differences in design and engineering between low/high volume, entry/premium vehicle systems and have examples or a portfolio of completed programs.

• Have in-depth technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets.

• Strong working knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including familiarity with GD&T and dimensional engineering.

•Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the programs.

• Strong familiarity with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents.

• Demonstrate an ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints and provide examples of such scenarios throughout your career.

Mechanical Design Engineer - Roof Systems
Req. ID: 37680
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 15,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role: Mechanical Design Engineer – Roof Systems

As a Design Engineer of Closures Systems in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will have the opportunity to work in diverse areas of automotive body and closure system development for revolutionary Tesla vehicle product lines. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class closure systems terms of form and innovative functionality.  In this position, you will be responsible for the successful developments and launches of our products’ movable roof systems. You will utilize your expertise in roof systems in addition to one or more of our closures commodities (door handles, power litigate systems, dynamic sealing, and closures hardware) to develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.

 

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, design, engineer, release, develop and launch closures systems components, specifically our current and future products’ roof systems
  • Develop and execute closure system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned closure commodities
  • Achieve innovation-driven closure system targets for appearance, function, quality, cost and weight
  • Establish closure system architecture and functional feasibility
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form, function and quality
  • Support manufacturing processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive exterior craftsmanship and fit & finish
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design
  • Manage/ collaborate with key suppliers (both internal and external) to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events

 

Requirements

  • B.S in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred), or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in roof systems components and subsystem engineering for serial production
  • Demonstrated technical aptitude, creativity in design, and the ability to execute feasible solutions to complex design engineering challenges
  • Technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets
  • Experience in design for six sigma (DFSS) – preferably with six sigma certification or have used DFSS methodology in design, validation and/or launch of closures components and systems
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling utilizing CATIA V5 is essential (minimum of 5000 hours or 3 years) within an automotive product development environment
  • Knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including GD&T and dimensional engineering principles in design
  • Experience with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents
  • Ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints

 

 

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 15,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

Mechanical Design Engineer – Glass

As a Design Engineer of Closures Systems in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will have the opportunity to work in diverse areas of automotive body and closure system development for revolutionary Tesla vehicle product lines. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class closure systems terms of form and innovative functionality.  In this position, you will be responsible for the successful developments and launches of our glass panel systems. You will utilize your expertise in glass design, and one or more of our closures commodities (door handles, power litigate systems, dynamic sealing, and closures hardware) to develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.

 

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, design, engineer, release, develop and launch closures systems components, specifically our current and future products’ glass panel roof components
  • Develop and execute closure system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned closure commodities, in addition to glass panel systems
  • Achieve innovation-driven closure system targets for appearance, function, quality, cost and weight
  • Establish closure system architecture and functional feasibility
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form, function and quality
  • Support manufacturing processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive exterior craftsmanship and fit & finish
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design
  • Manage/ collaborate with key suppliers (both internal and external) to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events

 

Requirements

  • B.S in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred), or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in glass components and subsystem engineering for serial production
  • Expertise in automotive glazing (float glass, panoramic designs, etc.)
  • Demonstrated technical aptitude, creativity in design, and the ability to execute feasible solutions to complex design engineering challenges
  • Technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets
  • Experience in design for six sigma (DFSS) – preferably with six sigma certification or have used DFSS methodology in design, validation and/or launch of closures components and systems
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling utilizing CATIA V5 is essential (minimum of 5000 hours or 3 years) within an automotive product development environment
  • Knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including GD&T and dimensional engineering principles in design
  • Experience with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents
  • Ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Tesla has delivered over 15,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult

 

The Role: Closures Design Engineer – Door Handles

As a Design Engineer of Closures Systems in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will have the opportunity to work in diverse areas of automotive body and closure system development for revolutionary Tesla vehicle product lines. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class closure systems terms of form and innovative functionality.  In this position, you will be responsible for the successful developments and launches of our products’ door handle systems. You will utilize your expertise in closures design, specifically focusing on door handles and one or more of our closures commodities (power litigate systems, dynamic sealing, movable roof systems, glass, and closures hardware) to develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry.

 

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, design, engineer, release, develop and launch closures systems components
  • Develop and execute closure system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned closure commodities, in addition to door handles
  • Achieve innovation-driven closure system targets for appearance, function, quality, cost and weight
  • Establish closure system architecture and functional feasibility
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form, function and quality
  • Support manufacturing processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive exterior craftsmanship and fit & finish
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design
  • Manage/ collaborate with key suppliers (both internal and external) to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events

 

Requirements

  • B.S in Mechanical Engineering (MSME preferred), or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in automotive door handles components and subsystem engineering for serial production in one or more of the following commodities: door panels, power lift gate systems, dynamic sealing, closures hardware, glass, movable roof systems, structures, or closure sheet metal
  • Demonstrated technical aptitude, creativity in design, and the ability to execute feasible solutions to complex design engineering challenges
  • Technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets
  • Experience in design for six sigma (DFSS) – preferably with six sigma certification or have used DFSS methodology in design, validation and/or launch of closures components and systems
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling (ideally utilizing CATIA V5) is essential within an automotive product development environment
  • Knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including GD&T and dimensional engineering principles in design
  • Experience with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents
  • Ability to manage difficult projects with tight timing constraints

Mechanical Design Engineer - Closures Systems
Req. ID: 37642
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Req - 37642 - Mechanical Design Engineer - Closures Systems

About Tesla

Tesla needs engineers who understand the underlying physics of challenging problems at an exceptional level, have the experience to work fast and efficiently, and who relentlessly seek alternative solutions. Everyone at Tesla shows leadership and challenges the existing to get our products to the next level. The ability to work quickly and effectively on open ended problems is far more important than familiarity with specific analysis tools. Unrivaled range, ludicrous performance, top-of-the-line comfort and long-term reliability depend on an excellent systems-level architecture.

The Role:

As a Design Engineer of Closures Systems in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team, you will have the opportunity to work in diverse areas of automotive body and closure system development for revolutionary Tesla vehicle product lines. You will be part of the team that creates and executes world-class closure systems terms of form and innovative functionality. 

Closure commodity development of particular focus include door handles, power litigate systems, dynamic sealing, and closures hardware including the integration of these commodities into the vehicle architecture. You will utilize your expertise in one or more of these commodities and develop as a full vehicle engineer – designing and delivering systems rather than just components as you work with a lean and agile team of the best automotive engineers in the industry. You will report to the Manager of Closures Systems Engineering and this position resides in Tesla’s Vehicle Engineering Team.

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, design, engineer, release, develop and launch closures systems components
  • Develop and execute closure system requirements for one or more of the aforementioned closure commodities
  • Achieve innovation-driven closure system targets for appearance, function, quality, cost and weight
  • Establish closure system architecture and functional feasibility
  • Participate in the iterative process with the Tesla design/styling studio to deliver the optimal balance of form, function and quality
  • Support manufacturing processes and material selections to achieve world class execution of automotive exterior craftsmanship and fit & finish
  • Optimize designs with the appropriate analytical and physical assessments
  • Utilize DFSS methodologies as appropriate during the design, validation and launch of the program
  • Interpret CAE simulation results and integrate recommendations into product design
  • Manage/ collaborate with key suppliers (both internal and external) to support overall vehicle development milestones and prototype/production build events

 

Requirements

  • B.S. in Mechanical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • 3 years experience working in closure components and subsystem engineering for serial production in one or more of the following commodities: door modules, power lift gate systems, dynamic sealing, closures hardware and closure sheet metal
  • Demonstrated technical aptitude, creativity in design, and the ability to execute feasible solutions to complex design engineering challenges
  • Technical expertise with the latest manufacturing technologies and feasibility execution to achieve systems requirements and world-class craftsmanship/performance targets
  • Experience in design for six sigma (DFSS) – preferably with six sigma certification or have used DFSS methodology in design, validation and/or launch of closures components and systems
  • Proficiency in 3D modeling utilizing CATIA V5 is essential within an automotive product development environment (CATIA V5 experience ideal, similar or related CAD experience is acceptable in lieu of CATIA experience)
  • Knowledge of Design for Manufacturing, including GD&T and dimensional engineering principles in design
  • Experience with the development of specifications, DFMEAs, DVP&R’s and other technical documents

 

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Mechanical Design Engineer
Req. ID: 38873
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla
 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. In Q1 of 2013 Tesla has delivered more than 10,000 electric vehicles to customers in 31 countries. Tesla’s Model S is the world’s first premium sedan designed and engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle and was named Automobile Magazine’s 2013 Automobile of the Year® and Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year®.



The Role

 

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline. Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone.


You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles in the world. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products. This must excite you. You must be a builder. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.


Mechanical engineering within the Battery Module Team requires strong engineering skills, a passion to push the boundaries of technology and the drive to make your designs successful. The Battery Team collaborates closely with other departments, requiring a team player mentality. Our team requires each individual to be self-motivated and disciplined.

 


Responsibilities

·         Develop the core technology of Tesla Motors, make design improvements to Model S and X vehicles, and push our technology further for the next generation vehicles.

·         Use CAD to develop new concepts.

·         Develop and fabricate functional prototypes and test methods to vet out new concepts.

·         Collaborate closely with suppliers to develop parts.

·         Complete design cycles from concepts to fully validated production designs.

Requirements

·         Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering from concept through production release with a focus on DFM.

·         A detail oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills.

·         Proficient in CAD modeling, CATIA v5 experience a plus but not mandatory.

·         Experience with various manufacturing processes such as plastic injection molding, metal stamping, thermoforming, welding/brazing, plating, heat treating, bonding, and direct machine shop skills a plus.

·         Test experience, including knowledge of sensors, DACs, data collection and data analysis.

·         New grad to 5 years mechanical engineering experience.

·         BS in Mechanical Engineering.  MS beneficial but not required.

·         Experience with student formula vehicle competition beneficial.

Mechanical Design Engineer
Req. ID: 25113
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description


The Role

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing the top engineers in any given discipline. Our world-class engineering teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, to innovate.  These jobs are not for everyone.   

You must have a genuine passion for engineering the best electric vehicles in the world. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company. We are building real products. This must excite you. You must be a builder. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.

Mechanical engineering within the Power Electronics team requires and offers a very high level of collaboration with electrical engineers and firmware engineers.  Our systems typically deliver very high currents to enable our vehicles to go faster and charge faster than any other car ever developed in the mass market.  Power electronics is the core of every EV.  Our systems control the flow of electrons from the wall to the battery and eventually to the motor.  

Responsibilities

  • Design and development of components to charge and drive Model S and future Tesla vehicles.
  • CAD design of plastics, sheet metal, die castings, etc.
  • Work with Electrical engineers and PCBA designers to integrate components into electromechanical systems.
  • Thermal and mechanical modeling and testing of components.
  • Validation of components in bench and vehicle configuration.
  • Collaboration with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to transition concepts to production. 

Requirements

  • Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering within a product design and manufacturing environment.
  • Experience with product and process validation.
  • Detail oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills.
  • 0-2 years mechanical engineering experience.
  • Proficiency in CAD modeling, CATIA v5 experience highly valued but not required.
  • MS or BS in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent in experience and exceptional ability

<< Back to Search Results

Mechanical Design Engineer
Req. ID: 19667
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The mechanical design engineer is responsible for designing and delivering components and systems for the Tesla Model S and Model X platform as well as future Tesla product programs.  We are looking for a highly motivated and talented individual to join the Battery Engineering Interfaces Team.  This team is responsible for a wide range of components and systems that unite the pack internally as well as connect it with the rest of the vehicle electrically and thermally.  Successful members of the team will generally have a breadth of design engineering interests and capabilities as well as an area of more focused expertise in order to conceptualize, specify, develop, design, release, and launch thermal, electrical, and mechanical components and systems for Tesla’s cutting-edge battery packs.

 

This position reports to the Battery Engineering Interfaces Team Manager.

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Create and develop component and system requirements and specifications.
  • Support creation of component specifications, component DFMEA, and other technical design documents.
  • Develop design concepts and production designs in CATIA V5.
  • Optimize the concepts and designs with analytical and physical assessments.
  • Complete and release system, sub-system and component designs in the PLM system.
  • Collaborate with a variety of engineers within and beyond the battery engineering group to achieve integrated and optimized system designs.
  • Interface with suppliers for manufacturing feasibility, validation, and other engineering activities, as necessary.
  • Deliver specifications, designs, analyses, and prototypes on time and within budget.
  • Insure designs are compatible with high volume, high quality manufacturing and assembly processes and are appropriately serviceable.
  • Create (with component/system supplier and/or internal validation testing teams) component and subsystem design verification plans and test methods.
  • Complete component and system validation as required, insuring system targets are met and optimized.
  • Support subsystem and battery pack prototype builds as well as production introductions.

Requirements

  • Bachelor of Science or higher in mechanical engineering, or equivalent in experience and exceptional ability.
  • Work efficiently and productively in independent and team settings
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills.
  • Demonstrated talent for conceiving efficient design solutions to complex engineering challenges.
  • Proficiency in CATIA V5, or similar 3D CAD software (Solidworks, ProE, Unigraphics, etc).
  • Working knowledge of GD&T required, proficiency preferred.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and ability to integrate state-of-the-art design and manufacturing methods into product concepts and designs.
  • Experience with medium to high volume (40k-250k units/year) production.
  • Knowledge of relevant manufacturing processes and a variety of engineering materials.
  • Familiarity with and experience designing any or all of the following: electrical interfaces, electrical insulators, electrical conductors, thermal interfaces, thermal management systems, fluid management systems, and sealing systems is desired.

Mechanical Design Engineer
Req. ID: 18679
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


The Role

Tesla’s Energy group is looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer.  The role will involve concept generation, analysis, detailed design, validation, release, and maintenance of parts and assemblies.    

Responsibilities

  • Part and assembly design, from concept to detail design to manufacturing introduction.
  • Detailed mechanical design for a wide range of production fabrication processes in order to optimize performance and cost. 
  • Create, manage, release, and maintain BOM’s.
  • Thermal and mechanical modeling and testing of components.
  • Validation of components in bench and system configuration.
  • Coordinate with system and firmware engineers to ensure that all requirements are met.
  • Work with engineers from other groups to integrate components and electromechanical systems.
  • Collaborate with manufacturing engineers and suppliers to transition concepts to production.

Requirements

  • Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering within a product design and manufacturing environment.
  • Experience bringing a product or assembly through its entire lifecycle from initial concept through to production manufacturing.
  • Ability to design for a wide range of fabrication and manufacturing processes.
  • Experience with product and process validation.
  • Detail oriented personality with solid documentation and reporting skills.
  • 3-5 years mechanical engineering experience.
  • Proficiency in CAD modeling, CATIA experience highly valued but not required.
  • Strong analysis skills, including structural and thermal.
  • BS in Mechanical Engineering.  MS preferred.

 

Previous Applicants:

<< Back to Search Results

Materials Test Lab Technician
Req. ID: 31631
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

This position will work as a member of Tesla’s Materials Test Lab to support materials and part level testing for the wider Vehicle Engineering Test Group. The primary objective of this role is to ensure all laboratory assets are calibrated, serviced and maintained. In addition, the successful candidate for this position must have a broad background in materials science, failure analysis, the characterization of materials and extensive knowledge in the operation of key pieces of laboratory apparatus.

Responsibilities

  • Manage all laboratory assets. Ensuring all equipment is maintained, calibrated and serviced on time.
  • Operate and train new technicians and engineers on all apparatus.
  • Manage, develop, review and ensure conformance to all Laboratory risk assessments and best practices.
  • When required, perform a wide variety of tests on a broad spectrum of materials. Test competence should include the following aspects:
    • Mechanical - torque, tension, compression, adhesion, peel and fatigue etc.
    • Environmental - corrosion, UV, thermal, humidity, chemical and cyclical testing etc.
    • Characterization - SEM (with EDS), XRF, Hardness, DSC, TGA and FTIR etc.
  • Support engineering staff in the root cause analysis of test failures.
  • Exhibit competence in the preparation of test samples. Expert knowledge of grinding, polishing and etching a variety of materials.
  • Support laboratory management in the procurement, purchase and installation of capital expenditure.
  • Intrinsic knowledge of materials and automotive test standards.
  • Knowledge, understanding and a track record of conformance to ISO 17025.
  • Support the Laboratory Manager in the identification and planning of future resources and laboratory facility requirements.

 

Requirements

  • Excellent organization skills with an eye for detail.
  • Demonstrable team leading skills in a dynamic and fast paced environment.
  • Experience with MS office tools (Outlook/Excel/Word/PowerPoint/Project) and Adobe products
  • Experience of working with vendors and external test labs. A broad list of contacts in the field of automotive materials testing is advantageous.
  • Ability to follow oral, written, email, and text message instructions.
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines.
  • Work in a team-based environment to achieve common goals.
  • Maintain top level professional integrity and appearance as an experienced Laboratory Technician.
  • Extensive knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and fixtures used in the testing of automotive materials.
  • Ability to operate and maintain a wide variety of hand tools and power tools for the maintenance of laboratory apparatus.
  • Ability to operate and use diagnostic performance monitoring tools
  • An Associate Degree in Materials Engineering, Materials Science, Metallurgy, Polymer Technology or an appropriate equivalent.
  • A minimum of 5 years of automotive experience as an Laboratory Test Technician
  • Highly experienced candidates without a degree may also be considered.
  • Must have valid driver’s license

Previous Applicants:

If you do not remember your password click here.

<< Back to Search Results

Materials Supervisor
Req. ID: 41150
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Livermore-201-Discovery-Dr-Warehouse
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

The Materials Supervisor will be part of the Production Control Team within the Materials Group and will be responsible for designing and developing inventory movement and storage systems from dock to storage or staging to production line side locations, for improving productivity and efficiency of operations, and for managing conveyance or warehouse staff.  These activities will take place primarily at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California. The primary objective of the Material Handling and Inventory Control Group is to implement an efficient receiving, warehouse, material handling, and conveyance solutions to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates. This position will report to the Associate Manager - Conveyance or Warehouse.

 

Responsibilities:

·         Design, develop, and implement solutions for dramatically improving material flows through the factory using Lean Principles.  The design includes material arrival at docks through staging for delivery to line-side locations.  The focus will be on developing innovative new solutions for manufacturing that leverage automated systems.

·         Ability to foster and develop a strong team of material handling personnel through selective recruitment, thorough and consistent on-boarding process, training, and coaching, and identification and addressing of competency gaps within team.  Management of team includes proactively planning for labor needs in light of production ramp up, communicating job expectations, performing employee performance and objectives reviews, and managing team in alignment of company policies and procedures.

·         Ability to meet material conveyance or warehouse operations financial objectives by participating in budget preparation, forecasting requirements, planning for capital expenditures, securing company property and assets, and analyzing and resolving inventory variances.

·         Capable of defining material conveyance operations systems to include:  developing processes for conveyance- or warehouse-related activities, defining materials related aspects of new production lines, determining equipment needs and utilization, defining storage and material handling requirements, and ability to integrate and align physical processes with systematic processes.

·         Drive improvements within material flow by planning layout and space requirements, reducing line impact, analyzing and reviewing product flow, and evaluating and proposing new equipment options.

·         Maintains safe work environment by establishing, following, and enforcing standards and procedures.  It also requiring coaching and motivating team to proactively address potential safety issues and concerns.

·         Support advanced trouble-shooting and improvement of existing warehouse management, inventory control, and material flow systems.

·         Targeted goals include:

·         Safety focus

·         People Management (Systematic and physically)

·         5S standards

·         Line down time / Productivity / hours per car

·         Reduction in material handling waste

·         Reduction of in-house receiving lead-time

·         Significant improvement in labor efficiency

·         Optimized space utilization

·         Highly accurate part selection resulting in inventory accuracy levels above 99%

·         Reduction of information system transactional needs

·         KPI deployment from Top to Bottom

·         5S ownership

·         Inventory focus (Transactions and overall process)

·         Standardized work deployment

·         Versatility matrix for cross training

·         Job rotation practices implementation

 

Requirements:

·         Minimum 4 year degree in related field or equivalent years’ experience with evidence of exceptional ability.

·         5+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics experience desirable.

·         Minimum of 3 years in a Supervisory/Management role.

·         Demonstrated excellent communication skills, including ability to express well-reasoned, independent thought.  Natural ability to speak and write effectively at all organizational levels.

·         Understanding of lean manufacturing concepts with the ability to lead 5S and kaizen efforts for continuous improvement.

·         Demonstrated ability to be a resilient change agent capable of leading organization through paradigm shifts.

·         Strong knowledge of Production and Inventory Control within manufacturing environment with the ability to teach and coach others on best practices.

·         Strong project management skills with the ability to multitask and still execute despite changes to project scope, scale, or deadline.

·         Strong knowledge of material flow methodologies including sequencing, kitting, repack, etc.

Previous Applicants:

If you do not remember your password click here.

Materials Planner, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 40305
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

Position: Materials Planner, Gigafactory

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Plan, schedule, and monitor movement of materials through the production cycle to determine required material purchases and optimal inventory levels
  • Determine safety stock level for each part, working with manufacturing and storeroom manager
  • Confirm lead times for MRP, standard price, MOQ, EOQ, and delivery lot sizes
  • Issue production forecasts to suppliers
  • Request Purchase Req approval and create PO's for materials with 'stable' design and supplier
  • Confirm delivery schedules with suppliers
  • Maintain accurate PO dates and quantities in system of record
  • Coordinate with logistics to consolidate shipments to minimize freight costs
  • Ensure suppliers ship on schedule and monitor supplier performance
  • Communicate anticipated materials shortages to manufacturing and material planning and expedite or escalate as appropriate to resolve
  • Ensure accuracy of inventory in system of record by identifying and helping to resolve BOM inaccuracies, demand issues, and transactional errors
  • Resolve receipt and invoicing discrepancies with logistics and accounting
  • Work with quality to return non-conforming materials to vendor
  • Collaborate with manufacturing, purchasing, and Engineering to determine effectivity date for new changes for smooth transition and minimum obsolescence

 

Requirements:

  • B.S. degree in Engineering/technical discipline or equivalent in exceptional experience 
  • 3+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material delivery scheduling, or purchasing
  • Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize deliveries and inventory levels
  • Proficiency in MS Excel desired (advanced)
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude
  • Strong work ethics

Materials Planner
Req. ID: 42399
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated, experienced, and knowledgeable Material Planner to work in Powertrain Manufacturing.   The ideal candidate will have experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products.  The Material will work with Manufacturing and Master Scheduling to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals including LEAN manufacturing principals.  This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate supply plans, and executing successfully against those plans. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Plan, schedule, and manage assigned critical spare parts.
  • Review coverage and execute orders as needed.
  • Issue RFQ for Sourcing/Purchasing assigned materials.
  • Review, analyze and clarify quote packages from suppliers.
  • Process Purchase order Requisitions.
  • Track status of open orders to insure on time deliveries.
  • Identify and negotiate cost reduction opportunities.
  • Respond to supply shortages.
  • Support of emergency orders outside of normal office hours as needed.
  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as supply chain specialists, manufacturing engineers, and logistics personnel.
  • Generate and publish metrics of performance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

 

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree.
  • 3+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company.
  • Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize delivery costs and inventory levels
  • Proficiency in MS Excel desired
  • Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One
  • Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand.
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude
  • Strong work ethics

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

This is a great opportunity to grow your career with Tesla!

·       Enter FA data into RCA to support documentation of FA results

·       Help with simple sample prep

·       Support 5S in FA labs

Materials Engineer - Welding
Req. ID: 35435
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Welding

The purpose of the Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering functions with materials & processes expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Welding specialist to lead the identification, development and implementation of new joining methods for Tesla’s current and future product lines.  Primary function will be support Vehicle Design Engineering, which includes Body, Chassis, Closures and Power Train, but support to other areas such as Power Train and Battery will also be needed.  Interfacing with other functions, organizations and disciplines, such as Quality, Purchasing, Supplier Industrialization, Manufacturing, etc. will also be required.

Knowledge and experience in relevant welding processes, which include Gas Metal Arc Welding (aka MIG or GMAW), Resistance Spot Welding, Laser Welding and Friction Stir Welding in both Aluminum and Steel Alloys.  An ideal candidate will have knowledge and experience with joining method selection based on structural requirements, materials, and cost.  Additionally, definition of test matrices to establish mechanical design values, creation of process specifications to ensure production processes meet engineering design intent, production issue trouble shooting and failure analysis.  Candidate must have a strong understanding of weld process to joint metallurgy and performance relationships. 

Responsibilities

·         Assist design engineering in identification and selection of welding processes.

·         Develop new welding processes to meet design needs current processes are incapable of.  

·         Define and execute test programs for establishing design values for given processes and materials.

·         Create/maintain welding process specifications.

·         Provide consultation to design engineering and manufacturing as necessary.

Qualifications

·         Bachelor’s degree in Welding Engineering is preferred.  Degrees in other engineering disciplines, such as Materials or Mechanical Engineering, or sufficient relevant experience will also be considered.  Advanced degrees, Masters or PhD, with relevant research are preferred. 

·         A senior engineer, with 5-10+ years of relevant experience is desired, but exceptional talent of all experiences levels will be considered.

·         Automotive experience is not a pre-requisite.  Experience in the specific technical fields described previously is the requirement, regardless of what sector or industry that experience was obtained.

·         Willingness and dedication to working in a fast paced, results oriented environment focused on fundamental engineering excellence.

Previous Applicants:

Materials Engineer - Vehicle Interior Systems
Req. ID: 31911

Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Materials Engineer, Interior Systems

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Materials Engineer to support Tesla Interior Systems and Seating Engineering in Palo Alto, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide material solutions for the Interiors and Seating Engineering Teams
  • Select and develop new materials (polymers, decorative finishes, textiles, soft trim, faux leather, authentic leather, paint, chrome, PVD)
  • Determine material properties necessary to support Interiors and Seating Engineering specific applications
  • Characterize application relevant material properties
  • Write specifications for new materials
  • Perform failure analysis on materials

Requirements:

  • Engineering, Polymer Science, or Chemistry Degree
  • 5+ years practical experience directly related to Interior or Seating systems.  Automotive experience preferred.  Experience in other industries is acceptable if relevant to our work.  (eg. home furnishings, consumer goods, consumer electronics, material suppliers)
  • Good understanding of typical A-surface appearance requirements
  • Good understanding of potential material or process defects that can impact part appearance
  • Good understanding of relevant test protocols for interior and seating materials
  • Exceptional organization, cross discipline collaboration and communication skills.

This role will report to the Materials and Processes Manager for Plastics, Coatings, and Adhesives who is part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering Organization.

Materials Engineer - Stamping
Req. ID: 41286
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Stamping Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Materials & Processes Engineer to support the development of advanced stamping materials and manufacturing techniques. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provides guidance to design engineering on stamped part material selection and design.
  • Defines stamping process architecture, workflow, and equipment requirements necessary to meet engineering and production targets.
  • Utilizes simulation tools to optimize stamped part, equipment and tooling designs.
  • Translates simulation results into design recommendations and effects on material properties for use by structural analysis engineers.
  • Identifies and develops novel alloys and forming processes, also using computational materials engineering tools, to improve capability, performance, cost and quality of stamped parts. 

Requirements:

  • Materials or Mechanical Engineering degree, or comparable experience. 
  • Practical industrial, design and manufacturing, experience with sheet metal forming. Both from a design engineering and manufacturing perspective.
  • Design Experience: Ability to characterize and develop design values for formed materials and parts.  Has developed material and process specifications for sheet metal forming. 
  • Manufacturing Experience: Hands on experience in a production manufacturing environment with sheet metal forming equipment and tooling.  Is able to identify tooling and equipment requirements, develop forming parameters and transition methods to production. 
  • Expert at using advanced casting simulation tools such as PAM-STAMP.
  • Working knowledge of 3D CAD software, preferably Catia v5, to manipulate component and tooling design data.
  • Understanding of FEA codes, such as LSDYNA, used by component structural analysis engineers.

Materials Engineer - Metals - Powertrain/Electronics
Req. ID: 37154
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Powertrain Metallurgical Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The team is seeking a Metallurgical Engineer to be dedicated to metallic materials associated with Powertrain (Battery Module, Inverter, Motor, etc.) design and manufacturing. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide direction to Powertrain Design Engineers on relative to appropriate and optimal Materials & Processes selection.
  • Identify needs not addressed by current material solutions and lead development of new materials technologies for Powertrain Engineering. 
  • Determine properties and appropriate design values for design and analysis.
  • Establish test plans when necessary to characterize application specific material properties.
  • Develop, author and publish material and process specifications.

Requirements:

  • Materials Engineering degree preffered.  Metallurgical Engineering focus and advanced degrees are preferred. Comparable experience will be considered
  • Fundamental knowledge of process-structure-property relationships in electrical grade copper, aluminum and steel as well as magnetic steels for motor applications.
  • Practical experience of alloy selection, application specific characterization and specification development for metallic materials used in EV Powertrain, or similar, components.

Materials Engineer - Metals - Corrosion
Req. ID: 37155
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Sr. Corrosion Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Corrosion Engineer to support all Vehicle Engineering functions. 

Responsibilities:

  • Evaluate part and assembly designs for corrosion risk in all areas of the vehicle taking into account materials, joint designs, coatings/paint/sealers and service environment.
  • Identify corrosion mitigation strategies to address corrosion risks.
  • Establish test procedures and requirements in order to validate corrosion mitigation solutions when necessary (i.e. cannot be done via first principles evaluations).
  • Collaborate closely with design, reliability, test and manufacturing on corrosion related topics. 

Requirements:

  • Materials Engineering degree with specific emphasis on Corrosion.  Advanced degrees preferred.
  • Experience with corrosion of aluminum, steel and mixed material structures prone to galvanic corrosion.  Understand the implications of the galvanic series and Pourbaix diagrams.
  • Familiar with corrosion mechanisms and role of microstructure and environment, including crevice corrosion, pitting corrosion and stress corrosion. 
  • Proven ability to evaluate the corrosion risk if a design, identify mitigation strategies and analytically and/or experimentally validating those strategies.  

Previous Applicants:

Materials Engineer:  Vehicle Exterior Systems

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Materials Engineer to support Vehicle Exterior Systems in Palo Alto, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide material solutions for vehicle exterior systems.
  • Select and develop new materials for exterior trim, glass systems, chrome plate decorative parts, structural plastic parts, plastic underbody parts, and painted components
  • Determine material properties necessary to support specific vehicle exterior applications
  • Characterize relevant material properties
  • Write specifications for new materials
  • Perform failure analysis on materials

  • Fundamental understanding of standard exterior polymers and coating systems.
  • Fundamental understanding of weathering and exterior exposure conditions and how they affect materials for exterior applications
  • Good understanding of relevant test protocols for exterior components
  • Good understanding of potential failure mechanisms of exterior components
  • Exceptional organization, cross discipline collaboration and communication skills.

This role will report to the Materials and Processes Manager for Plastics, Coatings, and Adhesives who is part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering Organization.

Materials Engineer - Drivetrain Metallurgy
Req. ID: 41287
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering – Drivetrain Metallurgical Engineer

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The team is seeking a Metallurgical Engineer to be dedicated to metallic materials associated with Drivetrain design and manufacturing. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide direction to Drivetrain Design Engineers on relative to appropriate and optimal Materials & Processes selection.
  • Identify needs not addressed by current material solutions and lead development of new materials technologies for Drivetrain Engineering. 
  • Determine properties and appropriate design values for design and analysis.
  • Establish test plans when necessary to characterize application specific material properties.
  • Develop, author and publish material and process specifications.

Requirements :

  • Materials Engineering degree.  Metallurgical Engineering focus and advanced degrees are preferred. 
  • Fundamental knowledge of process-structure-property relationships in case and through hardened steels used in bearings and gears.
  • Familiar with tribology, wear and contact fatigue as well as lubrication in terms of engineering principles as well as surface characterization methods.
  • Knowledge of plating processes and other surface modification techniques. 
  • Practical experience with alloy and process selection, application specific characterization and specification development for metallic materials used in automotive drivetrain, or similar, components.

Previous Applicants:

Materials Engineer - Adhesives & Coatings
Req. ID: 41289
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Tesla Materials & Processes Engineering

Materials Engineer, Adhesives & Coatings

The purpose of the Tesla Materials Engineering organization is to facilitate the Tesla mission of accelerating the world to sustainable transportation via identification, development and insertion of advanced materials and processes while supporting other Tesla Engineering and Manufacturing functions with materials expertise. 

The Tesla Materials Engineering team is seeking a Materials Engineer to support Tesla Adhesives and Coating systems in Palo Alto, California. 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide material solutions for structural body adhesives, glass bonding adhesives, tapes, sealers, body pre-treatment systems, e-coat, and finish coat systems.
  • Select and develop new materials for adhesive and coating applications
  • Determine material properties necessary to support specific adhesive and coating applications
  • Characterize relevant material properties
  • Write specifications for new materials
  • Perform failure analysis on materials

Requirements :

  • Materials Engineering, Polymer Science, or Chemistry Degree (PhD preferred); comparable experience will be considered
  • 5+ years practical experience directly related to adhesive or coating systems.  Automotive or Material Supplier experience preferred.
  • Fundamental understanding of basic chemistry for epoxy, polyurethane, and acrylic adhesive systems
  • Fundamental understanding of standard paint chemistries
  • Good understanding of relevant test protocols for adhesives and paint
  • Good understanding of potential failure mechanisms of adhesives and paint
  • Exceptional organization, cross discipline collaboration and communication skills.

This role will report to the Materials and Processes Manager for Plastics, Coatings, and Adhesives who is part of the SpaceX/Tesla Materials Engineering Organization.

Prototype Vehicle Technician
Req. ID: 41755
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Position

The Prototype Engineering and Fabrication team is looking for a Vehicle Technician to support our engineering teams with development of current and future prototype vehicles.

 

This is a highly technical position that requires in depth knowledge of various complex electrical and mechanical subsystems that are combined to create cutting edge vehicles. Strong problem solving abilities are needed to work alongside with our Engineers to identify and resolve challenging issues.

 

Role

  • Retrofit/modify prototype vehicles to accept new hardware designs.
  • Diagnose and repair failures found with prototypes.
  • Provide failure analysis and design concerns back to Engineering.
  • Electrical and Mechanical fabrication as designed and specified by Engineering.
  • General fleet maintenance and repair.

  

Requirements

  • 3+ years’ experience working in an automotive dealership.
  • Technical certification from accredited automotive training institution.
  • Equipped with own tools.
  • Ability to operate and maintain various hand and power tools.
  • Ability to operate and maintain shop tools and equipment.
  • Willing to work a flexible schedule.
  • Ability to travel
  • Work independently and/or collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.
  • Show attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Have the ability to work well under pressure and adapt to changing priorities/schedules.
  • Excellent communication and written skills.
  • Outlook, Excel and MS Office

Prototype Fabrication Shop Supervisor
Req. ID: 38693
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla is seeking a leader for our Prototype Fabrication shop.  This group is part of a larger Prototype Engineering and Fabrication team focused on building quick prototypes of leading edge technologies and products.

You and your team will work closely with design engineers and vehicle technicians to rapidly build system-level prototypes to answer fundamental engineering integration questions.

The ability to turn ideas into hardware with maximum speed and precision is central to the Tesla product development process.  

 

Responsibilities

  • Serve as a player/coach, leading a team of welders and machinists by spending over half of your time performing hands-on work yourself
  • Setup and coordinate the shop workflow, including managing new project work requests
  • Build a motivated, strong team through positive relationships, professional development, and effective hiring
  • Identify opportunities to expand our capabilities with new equipment and processes
  • Serve as the representative & advocate for the fabrication shop to other teams
     
  • Your team will occasionally be asked to deliver the "impossible", and you must guide them to a solution

Requirements

  • 5+ years of technical leadership experience with evidence of exceptional results
  • 10+ years of hands on fabrication and/or machining experience
  • Ability to personally operate nearly all the equipment in the shop
  • Strong engineering intuition
  • Some formal engineering background preferred
  • Some professional vehicle experience preferred
  • Experience running multiple projects in parallel
  • Experience building functional products with some technical or measurable objectives (e.g. racing, product development)
  • Proficiency with common software tools (e.g. CAD/CAM, Outlook, Excel, Word, Project)

<< Back to Search Results

Project Manager, New Product Introduction- B Shift
Req. ID: 42587
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Swing
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The New Product Introduction Project Manager is responsible for managing component changes into the production lines and supporting the production launch of new products for specific engineering systems, e.g. Body, Chassis, Charger, Battery, etc. This requires the project manager to lead a cross-functional team to ensure engineering and manufacturing validation targets have been met for each change.  As well, the project manager is responsible for the tactical implementation for the change and ensuring factory readiness for change execution.

 

Responsibilities

  • Drive change implementation activities to meet or exceed program timing milestones.
  • Support the Program Manager in driving Production Launch activities.
  • Participate in and lead (as necessary) project milestone reviews.  Provide clear updates on status and recovery plans as necessary.
  • Clear, frequent communication between cross-functional teams to achieve Material, Hiring/training, Process Development/Implementation, and Equipment Implementation targets for changes, including trials and implementation.
  • Drive material procurement handoff from New Product Introduction Planning to the Production Planning organization.
  • Drive implementation of material flow from warehouse to line including conveyance, pedigree segregation, consumption, and bill of material validation.
  • Work with Design Engineering teams to create and maintain Bills-of-Material.
  • Communicate changes to the cross-functional team for integration into launch preparation activities

 

Qualifications

  • 2 – 5 years working in an Operations role.
  • Project Management experience preferred.
  • BA/BS or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability
  • Excellent organizational skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Team player, ability to work in a fast-paced environment and with cross-functional teams.

<< Back to Search Results

Project Engineer, Manufacturing - Module Pilot
Req. ID: 31849
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Tesla is looking for a highly motivated engineer to help drive the state of the art manufacturing processes for one of the most complex and challenging components of the electric car - our next generation of Battery Modules. As you can imagine, Battery development is at the heart of our company, and this is an exciting opportunity to take manufacturing to the next level, as we continue the development of one of the largest manufacturing facilities in the world – GigaFactory1 in Sparks, Nevada.

The Tesla Battery Module Manufacturing Engineering Team is not for the faint of heart, after all, changing the world isn’t easy. It is however, an opportunity to work along-side some of the industry’s top experts on some of the most stimulating challenges of the 21st Century.

This specific role is responsible for working with cross-functional teams throughout the entire product lifecycle. This newest member of Manufacturing Engineering will be in lockstep with Design Engineering, Product Excellence (Quality), and New Product Integration (NPI) to take new Battery designs and manufacturing process from initial concept, through prototype development, and into full production. As such, we expect this person to take pride in their hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail. 

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Drive Module Level Design for Manufacturability

  • Collaborate with Design Engineering to understand and document:

    • module design changes

    • build schedules and requirements

    • test requirements

    • specialty builds

  • Develop and understand line level manufacturing requirements

    • Time Studies

    • Equipment/Line Utilization

    • Line Capacity

    • Man Power

    • Layout

    • Ergonomics

  • Understand, Document, and help drive module level assembly process flow

  • Maintain detailed module level process documentation, progress, and findings

  • Responsible for Day-to-Day Build Activities

  • Maintain line level open items list

  • Drive DFMEA and PFMEA

  • Drive Validation Documentation

  • Drive common templates and schedule for individual process deliverables. 

Requirements

  • Experience with Early R&D/Pilot Manufacturing Engineering

  • Experience developing manufacturing processes for new and unique products

  • Experience with Design for Manufacturability

  • Knowledge of DFMEA and PFMEA execution

  • Knowledge of OSHA, CAL-OSHA, and work place Manufacturing Best Practices / Ergo

  • Experience with equipment and process validation testing

  • Experience transitioning products from prototype to production

  • Proficiency designing mechanical equipment, fixturing and tooling in CAD (SolidWorks preferred, Catia is also a plus)

  • Proficiency creating detailed drawings from solid models for various fabrication techniques (CNC/manual machining, welding, sheet metal forming)

  • Proficiency in mechanical assembly (tolerance analysis, adhesive bonding, mechanical pressing)

  • Experience developing technical specifications

  • Experience developing automated manufacturing equipment

  • Experience with mechanical-electrical/mechatronic systems

  • Experience with adhesive dispense

  • Experience with automation, motion control, PLC programming and HMI design

  • Experience introducing new equipment and new processes into a production environment

  • Able to work under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines

  • Knowledgeable about production quality metrics

  • Exemplary verbal and written communication skills

  • Exemplary analytical ability, organization skills, and attention to detail

  • Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

  • BS/MS Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering or equivalent

  • 2-5+ years of manufacturing engineering experience

 

.
