<< Back to Search Results

Project Developer - Supercharger Southeast
Req. ID: 41993
Office Location: NA-US-GA-Atlanta-Decatur
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Project Developer – Supercharger

 

About Tesla

The Tesla Supercharger network is the most advanced electric vehicle charging system in the world, and relies on sophisticated electromechanical systems designed to supply large amounts of power to Tesla vehicles.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for a Project Developer to drive all phases of Tesla’s Supercharger installations, including site diligence, contract negotiation, approvals, construction and close out.  The ideal candidate will have impeccable interpersonal skills, work tirelessly to find solutions, easily adapt to external factors and internal guidance and be able to manage 20+ projects at a given time.

The responsibilities of this position may change over time—this role requires flexibility and the ability to adapt to the evolving needs of the project and the organization. There will be opportunities for career growth based on performance and interest.

 

This is a remote position that will require frequent travel throughout the region.

                                                              

Key Responsibilities

·        Develop, refine and manage comprehensive site due diligence.

·        Lead efforts to obtain all necessary approvals from utilities , and permitting authorities.

·        Work with attorneys to draft, negotiate and close landlord agreements.

·        Work closely with installation partners to assess and manage installation costs and timeline.

·        Create proposed site schematics and work closely with design engineers to optimize site layout and gain counterparty approval.

·        Build and maintain relationships with key deployment partners.

 

Requirements

·        3-7 years of project management experience, dealing with property owners of all types, permitting authorities, utilities and building contractors.

·        Willingness to travel up to 80%, as needed.

·        Understanding of site due diligence and installation design processes, and experience working with engineers and architects to refine and optimize drawings and plans.

·        Understanding of permitting and grid connection processes, and experience working with the relevant authorities to ensure a smooth path and expedited schedule.

·        Experience working with private and public property owners to negotiate and sign agreements.

·        Ability to anticipate challenges, take initiative and solve before they become costly to correct.

·        Ability to accelerate counterparty timelines which may otherwise seem inflexible.

·        Ability to function autonomously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.

·        Proven track record of managing many concurrent projects on time and on budget, while adhering to the highest quality and standards.

·        Familiarity with energy technologies including solar and stationary storage.

·        Bachelor's degree in a relevant field of study. 

·        Able to communicate effectively with people from all walks of life .

·        Proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Project.

Previous Applicants:

If you do not remember your password click here.

<< Back to Search Results

Production Supervisor-Seat Manufacturing
Req. ID: 41826
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role: Production Supervisor
 

The Production Supervisor is a member of the Manufacturing Production Team. 

He/she will lead the development, implementation and application of Tesla’s Production System for the production of the Tesla Model S.  The ideal candidate has a proven record of success in the implementation and application of production systems in a manufacturing environment. He/she must have a broad background with the ability to work with engineering, production associates, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues/ corrective actions identified in production and field performance. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla and outside.

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop & maintain Standardized Work Instructions used in production by the production associates.
  • Support the development of Process Failure Modes Effects Analysis (PFMEA) to identify critical risks in the production processes with the Manufacturing Process Engineers.
  • Develop training programs and hire plans for production associates.
  • Support of control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the production process.
  • Manage production associates and develop the team structures used in the Tesla Factory.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.

 

Requirements:

  • Preferred - BS or higher degree
  • 5+ years’ experience working in a manufacturing environment
  • Experience or knowledge of world class production systems
  • Thorough knowledge of and experience with a variety of manufacturing processes
  • Experience managing teams of people in a production environment
  • Experience in new product development and launch activities
  • Experience with broad variety of measurement and inspection techniques.
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs)
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Experience in hiring and developing new team members in a production environment.
  • Work efficiently and productively in independent and team settings
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project)

Production Supervisor, Production CNC Machining
Req. ID: 41658
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


The Role

Production Supervisor - CNC Machining – AWS (Alternate Work Schedule)

·         Provide effective supervision and coaching to assigned shift/employees to achieve the required quality and production goals. Maintain department records and inventories.  Manage the movement of product through the production area.

·         Ensure that product is in the process at all times. Plan and organize work for smooth operations.

·         Ensure that standard operating procedures and engineering procedures are current, accurate and that all work is done in compliance to ensure maximum quality.

·         Monitor to ensure that all employees comply with safety regulations and the plant's safety program.

·         Work with employees to resolve technical and personnel problems.  Schedule employees to effectively meet production needs and to ensure vacation and other time off consistent with plant policies. Assist in candidate selection as requested.

·         Provide the shift to shift communication link in order to keep all team members working toward the same goals.  Communicate to employees all issues that affect the plant.

·         Implement and manage continuous improvement projects in the area.

·         Perform other duties as assigned by the Section Manager.

·         Operate HR management systems (Ex; Kronos, Workday, Performance Review, etc.) for personnel management and development.


Required Skills

Industrial engineering degree with 3-5 years of manufacturing management

 

Equivalent background would involve a minimum of three years supervisor experience with progressive responsibility.

·         Ability to meet deadlines and be accountable for quality / quantity.

·         Able to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, establish and achieve goals.

·         Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

·         One to three years of industrial supervisory or similar leadership experience preferred.

·         Able to work a flexible schedule, including weekday and weekend overtime, day or night shift.

·         Excellent computer skills, experience with Microsoft Office a must.

·         Able to create and execute production plans.

·         Strong Leadership qualities.

·         Decision making and trouble shooting.

·         Results interpretation, reporting and communication.

Production Supervisor, Gigafactory - U.S. Military Veteran
Req. ID: 39766
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The ideal candidate has a proven record of success creating and leading motivated teams. He/she must have a broad background with the ability to work with engineering, production team members, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues. He/she will use these relationships to facilitate the implementation of production team recommended process improvements. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required.

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Build a strong, motivated production team capable of consistently delivering high quality products against aggressive production targets.
  • Empower the production team to collaborate with engineering to improve product manufacturability and line productivity.
  • Develop training programs and hiring plans for assembly team members.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.
  • Develop & maintain Standardized Manufacturing Instructions used in production assembly by the assembly team members.

Requirements

  • 3+ year experience managing teams of people
  • Experience in selecting and developing new team members
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs)
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Served in the United States Military Strongly Preferred.

Production Supervisor, General Assembly
Req. ID: 35783
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

This Production Supervisor will report to an Associate Manager of General Assembly and will be responsible for meeting production demand for the line by addressing bottlenecks, balancing manpower and developing countermeasures on quality and equipment issues. The Production Supervisor provides hands-on support, leadership, and direction to their direct reports including Technicians, Leads and Associates. The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Provide effective supervision and coaching to assigned shift/employees to achieve the required quality and production goals. Maintain department records and inventories.  Manage the movement of product through the production area.
  • Ensure that product is in the process at all times. Plan and organize work for smooth operations.
  • Ensure that standard operating procedures and engineering procedures are current, accurate and that all work is done in compliance to ensure maximum quality.
  • Monitor to ensure that all employees comply with safety regulations and the plant's safety program.
  • Work with employees to resolve technical and personnel problems.  Schedule employees to effectively meet production needs and to ensure vacation and other time off consistent with plant policies. Assist in candidate selection as requested.
  • Provide the shift to shift communication link in order to keep all team members working toward the same goals.  Communicate to employees all issues that affect the plant.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Associate Manager.

Requirements

  • Associates or B.S or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.. 
  • 5+ years of experience in fast paced, high volume manufacturing environment.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and be accountable for quality/quantity.
  • Able to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, establish and achieve goals.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • One to three years of industrial supervisory or similar leadership experience preferred.
  • Able to work a flexible schedule, including weekday and weekend overtime.
  • Good computer skills, experience with Microsoft Office a must.

The Role

The ideal candidate has a proven record of success creating and leading motivated teams. He/she must have a broad background with the ability to work with engineering, production team members, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues. He/she will use these relationships to facilitate the implementation of production team recommended process improvements. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required.

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Build a strong, motivated production team capable of consistently delivering high quality products against aggressive production targets.
  • Empower the production team to collaborate with engineering to improve product manufacturability and line productivity.
  • Develop training programs and hiring plans for assembly team members.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.
  • Develop & maintain Standardized Manufacturing Instructions used in production assembly by the assembly team members.

  • Experience in selecting and developing new team members
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs)

  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail

Production Supervisor (Powertrain)

Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description


Production Supervisor

 

The Production Supervisor is a member of the Manufacturing Production Team. 

He/she will lead the development, implementation and application of Tesla’s Production System for the production of the Tesla Model S.  The ideal candidate has a proven record of success in the implementation and application of production systems in a manufacturing environment. He/she must have a broad background with the ability to work with engineering, production associates, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues/ corrective actions identified in production and field performance. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla and outside.

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail.  He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded. 

Responsibilities:

  • Develop & maintain Standardized Work Instructions used in production by the production associates.
  • Support the development of Process Failure Modes Effects Analysis (PFMEA) to identify critical risks in the production processes with the Manufacturing Process Engineers.
  • Develop training programs and hire plans for production associates.
  • Support of control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the production process.
  • Manage production associates and develop the team structures used in the Tesla Factory.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.

Requirements:

  • Preferred - BS or higher degree or exceptional work equivilant
  • 5+ years’ experience working in a manufacturing environment
  • Experience or knowledge of world class production systems
  • Thorough knowledge of and experience with a variety of manufacturing processes
  • Experience managing teams of people in a production environment
  • Experience in new product development and launch activities
  • Experience with broad variety of measurement and inspection techniques.
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs)
  • Strong analytic problem solving skills
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Remain engaged, proactive and positive in tough circumstances, owning assignments and taking full accountability for their success
  • Experience in hiring and developing new team members in a production environment.
  • Work efficiently and productively in independent and team settings
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project)

Production Process Engineer - Model S/X Battery Pack
Req. ID: 38644
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

  • You can learn more about Tesla here:  http://www.teslamotors.com/

     

    Department:

    Powertrain Production Process Engineering

     

    The Role:

    Production Process Engineer for Model S/X Battery Pack

     

    Responsibilities:

  • Develop an expertise of battery manufacturing processes.  Understand process and equipment capabilities through critical data analysis and in depth understanding of the product.
  • Responsible for diagnosing issues found during the manufacturing process and drive corrective action back to source.
  • Analyze data from various sources to identify trends in build quality, efficiency, and testing.  Develop robust and clear data collection, visualization, and analysis tools.
  • Mechanical design, test, and implementation of battery production equipment and fixtures.
  • Evaluate new technologies and designs to continuously improve battery production and testing.
  • Analyze and optimize designs using thermal and mechanical modeling.
  • Collaborate with design engineering, supply chain, vendor, and manufacturing engineers.
  • Assume ownership of components from concept, design, testing, validation, production release, and support.
  • Manage workload with a positive attitude as a team player in a collaborative work environment.

  •  

    Requirements:

  • Demonstrated successful experience in mechanical engineering within a product design and manufacturing environment.
  • Data collection and analysis experience.  Ability to develop data driven root cause analyses and solutions.
  • Strong problem solving skills and an aptitude for learning systems quickly.
  • Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities and challenges.
  • Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with team and peers within a manufacturing and engineering organization. This includes excellent communication skills: written and verbal.
  • Creative capacity for developing new ways to do things better, cheaper, and faster in alignment with the aggressive Tesla approach to revolutionary product development.
  • Passion for making fantastic new products and using data as a means to achieve outstanding quality, reliability, and production excellence.

  • Qualifications:
    *   BS degree in mechanical engineering or related field.  Proficiency in CAD modeling.
    *   Industry experience preferred.

<< Back to Search Results

Production Planner
Req. ID: 40074
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla Motors is seeking a motivated and knowledgeable individual to work on our Production Planning team within the larger Production Control department. The ideal candidate will have experience in a fast-paced manufacturing environment, preferably working with medium to high volume products. The Production Coordinator will work with Manufacturing and both the Materials and Demand Planning teams to fully understand demand and supply needs and balance those against operational goals including LEAN manufacturing principals. This position will require a person that is capable of understanding the details of manufacturing processes, translating those into appropriate production plans, coordinating the necessary functional pieces and executing successfully against those plans. Additionally, this role will involve working in a developing electronic-build-signal environment and contributing to the expansion of the e-signal JIT program.

Responsibilities

  • Support manufacturing by managing production output and delivering time-critical components to execute on master schedule as well as respond to unanticipated changes in production schedule.
  • Work with manufacturing teams to establish the appropriate production quantity and frequency for Just In Time delivery and line-side kanban; coordinate with Material Planner and Materials Conveyance teams as needed.
  • Maintain accurate open Work Order lines to define target build quantities, identify system demand or BOM issues, and resolve inventory discrepancies.
  • Support maintenance of MRP master data parameters to ensure accurate signals for quantity and dates generated by MRP (i.e. production lead times, lot sizing, and safety stock) to minimize excess.
  • Monitor KPIs for assigned areas of production in order to track materials and prevent excess inventory.
  • Collaborate with Purchasing and Engineering to coordinate Engineering Change Orders (ECOs) to plan for material and product end of life (EoL) and minimize obsolescence.
  • Identify potential production risks to align processes with production plan milestones.
  • Assist in implementing systematic solutions to control inventory flow, minimize shortages, and maintain inventory accuracy.
  • Provide ongoing transparency of inventory levels and ensure continuous inventory accuracy.
  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as material planners, manufacturing engineers, and conveyance personnel.
  • Assist with inventory control activities.
  • Generate and publish metrics of performance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, or a related field OR equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 2 - 5+ years related experience in production control, materials management, production planning, material scheduling, or purchasing in a manufacturing company.
  • Experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment subject to rapid changes.
  • Analytical capabilities including data analysis to optimize delivery costs and inventory levels.
  • Experience in transitioning from a manual to automated production planning environment.
  • Proficiency in MS Excel required (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, etc.).
  • Maintains critical attention detail despite changes in work scope or focus.
  • Proficiency in SAP or other ERP system desired.
  • Working experience with Tableau a huge plus.
  • Knowledge of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software, particularly Enovia Matrix One.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks based on demand.
  • Proficient in operations and/or project management.
  • Ability to strategically plan on a high level and execute on tactical implementation while solving for the challenge at hand.
  • Problem solving ability in cross-functional and multi-cultural environment.
  • Open-minded, collaborative and team-oriented attitude with the ability to think outside the box for solutions to complex challenges.
  • Self-motivating and strong work ethics with a passion for being hands-on in their work.

Production Control Internship / Co-op (Spring 2017)
Req. ID: 42197
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Intern

Description

The Role

Interns working on the Production Control team within the Material Handling and Inventory Control group will be responsible for designing, engineering, and implementing concepts for quick and efficient flow of parts from dock to warehouse to point of consumption. These concepts and technologies will be planned and implemented at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California. The primary objective of the Material Handling and Inventory Control Group is to implement an efficient receiving, warehouse, material handling and conveyance solution to support the overall vehicle manufacturing operation, while optimizing space, improving labor productivity, and creating a more ergonomic work environment for Tesla’s associates.

Your application to the Manufacturing Internship will be considered for all opportunities across Powertrain Manufacturing, Vehicle Manufacturing, Manufacturing Engineering, Product Excellence, and Manufacturing Operations teams in Fremont, CA.

Responsibilities:

Specific project assignments will vary based on technical aptitude.

  • Work fluidly in a highly cross-functional team environment involving manufacturing and product development teams, as well as supply chain specialists, manufacturing engineers, and logistics personnel.
  • Support control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the assembly/production process.
  • Support Lean manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Organize and analyze data sets that outline the systemic improvement opportunities.
  • Manage projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Develop and implement system support process and documentation.
  • Design, develop, support, and implement solutions for an effective information material flows throughout the factory to help improve consumptions and inventory accuracy
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Support advanced trouble-shooting, updates and improvement of existing material flow concepts.
  • Work with the material flow engineering team on concept development, prototype testing, engineering design, integration testing, project management, and handoff for implementation to support the production operations.

Requirements 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, Automotive engineering, Economic or similar.
  • Experience and/or knowledgeable in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics are desirable.
  • Strong knowledge and/or experience with material flow strategies and dynamic manufacturing systems.
  • Understanding of lean manufacturing concepts and continuous improvement.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Natural ability to speak and write effectively at all organizational levels.
  • Ability to materialize concepts into a functional operational model working diligently with the supervisors and operators in the shop floor.
  • Professional and positive communication skills.
  • Previous internship and/or project experience is a plus.
  • Ability to relocate to the Bay Area, California.

Production Associate-Seat Manufacturing
Req. ID: 30512
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

The Production Associate will report to the Production Supervisor and will be responsible for performing seat assembly.   This person is expected to be able to execute against the provided manufacturing instructions, validate their own work, check the quality of previous operations, and meet the output requirement.   Experience with small hand tools a must with some experience using semi-automated equipment highly desirable.

Responsibilities

  • To work on a production/prototype basis.
  • Perform complex seat assembly work.
  • Tasks require a high level of skill with a variety of hand tools, precision measuring equipment, and machinery.
  • Typically involves a variety of operations, including troubleshooting and rework, requiring a sufficient understanding of the functional operation of the items assembled as well as the finished product.
  • Must be able to work from complex and detailed manufacturing documentation and/or verbal and written instructions and specialized fixtures/test equipment.
  • Assemblers are also responsible for quality activities, including self inspection, and inspection .
  • Updates production records and test results.
  • Communicates test results, ideas and problems to technicians and engineers.
  • Clean-up production areas as required.
  • Identify discrepant materials/components both in writing and verbally to supervisor.
  • Complete tasks as directed by manufacturing schedules and within standard times.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.

Requirements

  • High School diploma or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience in assembly environment.
  • Ability to read and understand manufacturing instructions.
  • Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.
  • Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused.
  • Ability to perform repetitious duties while standing for long periods of time.
  • Ability to lift 30-50 lbs. on a daily basis
  • Ability to maintain a safe working environment

Production Associate - U.S. Military Veteran
Req. ID: 19941
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

Tesla is looking for U.S. Military Veterans with technical, hands-on technical experience to join our Production team in Fremont, California.

The Production Associate is a member of the Manufacturing Production Team, and will be responsible for contributing to the hands-on production of Tesla’s world class vehicles and/or electric vehicle powertrains. Excellent attendance is crucial for team to achieve success. He/she must have the ability to work with various teams in assembly including engineering, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues/ corrective actions identified in production and field performance. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla and outside.

Responsibilities:

  • Physical work including but not limited to pushing, pulling, gripping, twisting, reaching, etc.
  • Ability to follow a required specific sequence of steps in a process repetitively for an extended period of time.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform standardized work process and defined work instructions.
  • Working for extended periods of time.
  • Lifting objects up to 30 pounds.
  • Use of tools that may produce vibration during use.
  • Use of complex tooling that requires specialized training.
  • Wearing Personal Protective Equipment: safety glasses, vests, shoes, hard hats.
  • Evaluates the assembly processes and equipment to look for continuous improvement opportunities.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and people skills, comfortable presenting ideas and issues to peer groups and leaders.
  • Escalates functional and process failures to the appropriate support groups and leaders.
  • Positive energy and attitude

Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent.
  • Must have the ability to work quickly while maintaining a high level of craftsmanship and attention to detail.
  • Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.
  • Must be reliable, have good initiative, be committed, and be quality focused.
  • Flexibility to support both day and swing shifts, as needed. Weekend and holiday work may be required.
  • Fabrication and/or body work (e.g. body repair, metal finishing, etc.) experience is a plus.
  • Service in the United States Military Strongly Preferred.

Product Security Software Engineer
Req. ID: 26376
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated engineer specializing in product security to work on Model S, X and future R&D projects.

Other car companies have talked for years about a future of "connected cars." At Tesla, we make it happen. We regularly send over-the-air software updates to our Model S and Model X fleet, seamlessly delivering new features and improvements to our customers. Our mobile applications allow customers to interact with their cars via real-time, low-latency two-way communication. We also build tools for our internal sales, delivery, and service teams. Today we remotely identify potential vehicle issues before a customer does—and often fix problems remotely too. To this end information and product security is of the utmost importance. 

As a Product Security Engineer for Tesla you will be expected to analyze system services, operating systems, networks and applications from a security perspective. You will be expected to be skilled at discovering security issues and recommending patches. You will participate in security audits, risk analysis, vulnerability testing and security reviews. 

Responsibilities:

  • Help ensure Tesla's products are implemented to a high security standard: Model S / Model X / Powerwall / infrastructure.
  • Work with teams to implement, identify and advance security at Tesla Motors.
  • Conduct penetration tests and risk assessments in an automotive environment.
  • Work with Tesla teams and external suppliers to drive remediation.
  • Help to design a secure connected vehicle architecture.
  • Audit embedded code to identify security vulnerabilities.
  • Lead security initiatives and serve as a point of contact.
  • Work with vendors, partners, and other Tesla teams to drive remediation.
  • Conduct risk assessments to prioritize threats and compare mitigation strategies.
  • Assist design teams in developing secure automotive systems.

Requirements:

  • BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, Information Systems, Electrical Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. 
  • Strong investigative and analytical problem solving skills.
  • Strong experience with secure architecture design.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and spoken.
  • Security expertise in one or more of: C, C++, x86, ARM, CAN, cryptography, exploit development.
  • Strong penetration testing experience.
  • Strong experience auditing code and features.
  • Experience with software development.
  • Automotive experience a plus but not required.
  • Hardware experience a plus but not required.

Equal Employment Opportunity statement (EEO): Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

<< Back to Search Results

Product Manager - Diagnostic Content & Editing
Req. ID: 40890
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Employee

Description

Role

As the product manager for diagnostic content & editing you are responsible for designing the architecture and technical infrastructure for Tesla's diagnostic knowledge repository. Tesla rapidly iterates its vehicle designs and continuously makes product changes. The vehicles we build this week maybe unique from the vehicles we build the following week. Tesla has embraced the challenge of providing highly technical content to support an essentially infinite number of vehicle configurations. To meet the challenge, Tesla has developed a highly flexible, collaborative knowledge base of diagnostic articles organized in a cause and effect relational structure. The collaborative approach distributes content generation effort and smart use of data analytics allows the content complexity to scale with product complexity yet still provide the most relevant information to the user. The objective of this role is to develop the infrastructure required for fostering the growth, accuracy, and usefulness of the contained content. 

Responsibilities

  • Provide overall vision, strategy, and architecture to manage a crowd sourced knowledge base for a growing product line with a growing number of configurations.
  • Evangelize vision and strategy across relevant departments in the company; collecting feedback and suggestions along the way.
  • Identify and prioritize features and tools to foster curation and content moderation tools for technical editors and subject matter experts.
  • Identify and prioritize features and tools to encourage contributions through gamification, socializing, rewards, and other forms of credit.
  • Develop strategies and workflow for how and when to translate content into other languages. 
  • Generate requirements for malicious, inappropriate, or offensive content review, both text and image, and scope what additional resources may be required.  
  • Define and/or use measurement tools that monitor the usage of the knowledge base and how it impacts diagnosis times, diagnosis accuracy, data completeness, and data accuracy.
  • Manage a team of technical editors responsible for reviewing and monitoring content updates.
  • Foster the community of content contributors by creating a sense of belonging through regular collaboration, interaction, and common interests & goals.    

 

Objectives

  • Identify how to encourage and grow the community of content contributors, both in the field but also in other parts of the company like engineering or manufacturing.
  • Increase content generation rate.
  • Improve content accuracy and reader’s trust of the content.
  • Improve content creation, edit, review, and translation processes.
  • Improve the ways in which users can find the information they are looking for.
  • Continually improve the organization of information to simplify the diagnostic flow that users follow.

 

Requirements

  • #1 Requirement: a passion for collaborative writing platforms
  • BS in computer science, MS preferred. 
  • Minimum 5 years experience creating and/or using complex crowd sourced content management systems.
  • Experience with various communications media and advanced formatting and presentation skills
  • Machine learning and/or big data experience/interest a plus
  • Excellent ability to understand complex systems and engineering documents and then relay the important details to a non-engineering audience
  • Demonstrated ability to work with multiple customers and reach a consensus
  • Strong capacity for both logical and creative thinking
  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Proven track-record for delivering on schedule with an exceptional ability to interact and communicate with people at various levels
  • Must be organized, detail-oriented, able to multi-task, and evaluate priorities
  • Positive attitude toward change and inevitable mid-project course corrections
  • Self-directed and able to work independently with minimal supervision

Product Engineer
Req. ID: 37809
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

Product Engineer

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

Tesla Motors seeks a product engineer to provide diagnostic and field support for a range of products. The role, based in Palo Alto, CA demands strong abilities diagnosing complex, safety-critical, electromechanical systems. An ideal candidate would be capable of deep technical understanding of complex systems, able to exercise sound engineering judgement, and able to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences

Responsibilities

  • Remote and on-site technical support for powertrain and other systems
  • Direct customer communication about technical and business inquiries
  • Coordination with design teams to help understand new failure modes
  • Coordination with quality and manufacturing teams to investigate root cause and develop countermeasures
  • Recognize and communicate trends and patterns in field failures
  • Develop and document procedures for use, handling, charging, storage, shipment of high voltage batteries and powertrain components
  • Develop and deliver technical training materials to technicians and other audiences
  • Occasionally travel to perform field diagnosis or repair

Requirements

  • Flexible, growth-oriented, continuous improvement mindset
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills 
  • Confidence and professionalism working in a customer-facing role
  • Strong analytical skills and engineering judgement 
  • Ability to perform well both independently and in close collaboration with others

Tesla is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical??? condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or ?expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Process Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 42289
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

About Tesla

 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role 

Process Technician

Responsibilities:

  • Disposition of all non-conformance materials that produced by the manufacturing line.
  • Day to day coverage of production line process, including rapid response on out-of-control processes to minimize cost and maximize productivity.
  • Investigate and implement countermeasures to improve process Cpk and product yield.
  • Maintain and help develop up-to-date maintenance and calibration procedures and schedules.
  • Support Lean Manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Work with Engineering and Manufacturing to ensure manufacturing instructions and qualification schedules are always available and current.
  • Must be flexible to support both day, swing and alternative work week of manufacturing schedules (Some weekends and holiday required depending on production line    support).
  • Responsible with parts and tools inventory.
  • Responsible for writing rework procedure and training associate on new processes
  • Manage repairs/troubleshooting exactly to instructed process.
  • Manage small projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Manage workload with positive attitude and proactively help co-workers

Requirements:

  • Associate’s Degree on Electronic or some technical certificate is a plus.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • 5-8 years’ experience in a manufacturing/industrial environment.
  • Skilled at troubleshooting electrical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems a plus.
  • Skilled with the use of a variety of hand and portable tools.
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc).
  • Able to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.
  • Availability for occasional off-hours calls.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Process Technician - Seat Manufacturing
Req. ID: 30411
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Process Technician - Seat Manufacturing

About Tesla Motors: Tesla Motors is a small, aggressive, well-funded start-up in the San Francisco Bay Area that is making advanced electric vehicles, batteries, and drive systems a reality and working to change the future of the transportation industry. We are building a technically strong, fast-moving team that prides itself on superior execution.

 

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance; highly efficient electric sports cars — with no compromises. Tesla Motors cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy-efficient cars on the road.

 

Position Description:

Perform process sustaining for the manufacturing line on variety of seat assembly operations, tasks including disposition of non-conformance materials that come from the manufacturing line, response to out-of-control process, training production associates, work on yield improvement projects, and qualify new equipment and process that being introduced into the manufacturing line. Manage workload with a positive attitude as a team player in a collaborative work environment.

 

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Able to train and lead a group of production seats builders/associates on how to assemble a seat meeting/exceeding Tesla quality standards utilizing hands on leadership and written work instructions
  • Identifying the educational needs of others team members, developing formal training programs
  • Able to write work instructions and display best practice in seat building
  • Ability to assemble production seats to meet/exceed Tesla quality standards
  • Production process development to ensure repeatability
  • Manufacturing liaison to ensure production buy in and approval of new designs
  • Ability to identify build issues and produce a workable solution
  • Interface with Design and Engineering groups, discussing build issues and potential fixes
  • Interface with Design Trim Development group to set up seat builder training program
  • Disposition of all non-conformance materials that produced by the manufacturing line.
  • Day to day coverage of production line process, including rapid response on out-of-control processes to minimize cost and maximize productivity.
  • Investigate and implement countermeasures to improve process Cpk and product yield.
  • Maintain and help develop up-to-date maintenance and calibration procedures and schedules.
  • Support Lean Manufacturing and 5S initiatives.
  • Work with Engineering and Manufacturing to ensure maintenance instructions and schedules are always available and current.
  • Will support both day and swing shift manufacturing schedule (Some weekends and holiday required).
  • Responsible with parts and tools inventory.
  • Manage repairs/troubleshooting exactly to instructed process.
  • Manage small projects involving multiple departments and/or outside contractors.
  • Manage workload with positive attitude and proactively help co-workers

 

Qualifications/Skills:

  • Associate’s Degree on Electronic or some technical certificate is a plus.
  • Ability to manage workload while contributing to a positive, team oriented work environment
  • 5-10 years of experience in seat assembly
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills
  • Skilled with common workplace software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc.).
  • Availability for occasional off-hours calls

 

Additional skills a plus but not required:

  • Proficient within a trim development facility, utilizing sewing machines for R&D trim solutions
  • Operate Gerber/Lectra cutting tables including scanning of patterns
  • Development of Production Trim covers
  • Production of Master Trim Patterns

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Process Engineering Manager - GA
Req. ID: 39629
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role:

Process Engineering Manager for technical support of vehicle assembly operations

 

Responsibilities:

Leadership

Provide day to day leadership to a process engineering team consisting of 3 – 5 direct report salary engineering leaders, 15- 20 engineers and 20+ hourly technicians in a fast pasted, high volume 24/7 vehicle assembly environment.  

 

  • Plan and schedule work assignments for the team.
  • Review the accuracy and completeness of assignments. 
  • Define individual accountability and milestones to meet project objectives.
  • Communicates performance expectations and provides assistance to resolve problems encountered by the team
  • Mentor or serve as a resource to share specialized knowledge with others.
  • Maintain leadership and technical capabilities through continued education or training.
  • Recruit, train and develop new engineering, supervisory and technician talent as required to meet department staffing needs.
  • Actively participate and provide leadership for Lean Vehicle assembly initiatives across the Vehicle assembly department.
  • Actively provide safety leadership including, Job Hazard Analysis, Safety Training, Chemical Safety, Safety Audits and Safety Incident Reviews

Technical

Interact with internal and external process development partners to define robust assembly processes.

 

  • Define and execute process development studies to create, characterize, and optimize vehicle assembly processes
  • Utilize SPC data and tools to characterize all equipment processes for operating limits, robustness, and action limits.
  • Ensure consistency of process engineering methodology to all processes
  • Use leadership, technical, and business system skills to drive process improvements throughout all vehicle assembly
  • Monitor project schedules, timelines and deliverables using standard project management tools and engineering systems. 
  • Generate and/or review engineering and qualification protocols to support equipment qualification 
  • Generate documentation for change controls, as required.
  • Optimize work content to achieve a safe work environment, meet budget expectations, exceed build quality standards for all vehicles produced in Fremont.

Business

Actively participate as part of the senior management team for all Vehicle assembly operations on a day to day basis

 

  • Partner with production, engineering and maintenance managers to build a cohesive leadership team for the Vehicle assembly department
  • Provide periodic communications via reports, presentations and meeting to various stakeholders across the Vehicle assembly organization, including;
  • First Pass Yield Reports, Scrap Cost Report, Project Activity & Achievements, Change Controls Tracking Reports, RCCA Reports
  • Generate and execute business improvement ideas for cost reduction, labor savings, material flow and safety

Requirements:

Progressive career growth demonstrating a path to senior management in a technical organization

  • Hands-on skills with diagnostics software, hardware, tools, instruments, general electromechanical systems, measurement techniques
  • Experience with ergonomic process design, part variation control, and human factors effects on product
  • Data collection and analysis experience, ideally in a Test or Quality capacity
  • Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with team and peers within a vehicle assembly and engineering organization. This includes excellent communication skills: written, verbal, and email.
  • Strong problem solving skills and an aptitude for learning systems quickly
  • Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities and challenges
  • Creative capacity for developing new ways to do things better, cheaper, faster in alignment with the aggressive Tesla approach to revolutionary product development

Qualifications:
*   BS degree in CS, EE, ME or equivalent
*   Electronics, consumer goods, or vehicle assembly experience

Process Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 37625
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla

 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role 

 

Process Engineer, Gigafactory

 

Implement, develop, and optimize production methodologies in the manufacturing operations of Tesla. Optimize product flow though the factory though process optimization that may include tool /fixture selection,  line layouts, ergonomic study, material presentation, and other relevant factors.  Interface with design, test, and quality engineering to solve problems, improve manufacturability, and implement continual improvement.  Sustain products with cost reduction and yield improvements.  Work with quality to compile and evaluate data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications.

 

Responsibilities

 

·         Analyze and optimize production processes to ensure safety while maximizing yield, capacity, and capability in cost effective means while driving to achieve world-class quality levels.

·         Develop and modify line layouts, including material flow, waste reduction, and ergonomics, utilizing Lean Manufacturing best practices.

·         Monitor and audit manufacturing processes to ensure product specifications and standards are achieved.

·         Create and maintain Manufacturing Instructions, routings, and associated processes.

·         Participate in the transition of a product from concept to pilot line production and into mass manufacturing.

·         Apply technical knowledge to innovate, design and develop processes, tooling, assembly fixtures and procedures.

·         Participate in the development and maintenance of FMEAs and Control Plans.

·         Monitor and reduce process variation using Statistical Process Control.

·         Implement and support Lean manufacturing and 5S initiatives.

·         Analyze, develop, process, and implement Engineering Change Orders.

·         Work with production staff and engineers to develop, validate, and improve processes used in manufacturing and manufacturability of designs.

·         Disposition Non-Conforming Material

·         Develop and train sustaining technicians

·         Assist in the training of operators as needed.

 

Requirements

 

·         B.S. in Mechanical, Manufacturing, or Electrical Engineering; or equivalent or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.

·         Minimally 3 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment preferred.

·         Must possess process engineering skills (process development/improvement, troubleshooting, data analysis, constraint analysis, flow optimization, root cause analysis, etc.)

·         Strong team working skills at all levels of an organization, especially skilled at working with direct labor to understand challenges and work on developing optimal solutions using structured methods.

·         Good understanding of BOMs, manufacturability, process design, process validation, assembly methods, design reviews and cost reduction methodologies.

·         Previous experience with Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) desired.

·         Experience breaking down high-level (e.g. device level) performance issues into addressable action items.

·         Capable of identifying critical process parameters and applying statistics to process measurement and control.

·         Strong skills with common workplace software (word processor, spreadsheet, database, etc).

·         Ability to read and interpret basic mechanical and electrical drawings.

 

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Dynamometer Engineering Technician

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

Responsibilities

·        Setting up and executing test procedures, recording data and reporting results on dynamometers

·        Assist in debugging problems test setups or dynamometers

·        Preparing vehicles/systems for test (e.g., installing instrumentation, replacing a component)

·        Testing systems in varying environments on the road and in the dynamometer lab

 

Essential Skills:

·        Fundamental understanding of software and electrical principles

·        Ability to understand, test, and troubleshoot complicated system interactions

·        Ability to drive solutions to problems across different groups in the org-chart

·        Ability to organize and manage data as directed

·        Ability to work with high voltage systems

·        Ability and passion to do hands on work

·        Good communication skills

·        Clean driving record

 

Desired Experience:

·        Experience with CAN bus

·        Experience with vehicle instrumentation

·        Experience working in an automotive environment

·        0-3+ years’ work experience

·        Experience soldering and machining

 

Desired Qualification:

·        AS or BS degree in ME/EE/CS or equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

We offer a competitive salary, meaningful stock ownership, health benefits, an exciting work environment and the chance to make a real difference in the environment by changing the paradigm of human transportation.

Power Electronics Controls Engineer
Req. ID: 37656
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

To be considered for this position, please submit your resume AND cover letter to PEControls@teslamotors.com 

Your cover letter should include the following: 

1.            Why are you the right fit for this position at Tesla?  What makes you an exceptional candidate?

2.            Tell us about your favorite achievement.  This could be something you accomplished at work or personal, but should be technical in nature.

 Power Electronics Controls Engineer

To work as a member of the Power Electronics Simulation and Controls team –

The Power Electronics Simulation and Controls team  is responsible for the development of computer simulations of power electronic systems and subsystems to support analysis required in the course of power electronics hardware design and control software development, validation, and troubleshooting. 

The primary responsibility of this role is to develop control algorithms for power electronic systems, to implement these algorithms in embedded software, and to test and validate proper functionality in a laboratory or field setting.  In support of this development, as necessary, the role also includes development or enhancement of computer simulations of power electronic hardware or control circuitry, and also may include investigations that may be conducted strictly within the simulation environment.

 Requirements: 

3+ years' experience (or equivalent) developing, implementing, and testing power electronics controls, and strong analytical skills are required. 

A strong background in control theory and embedded programming experience are highly valuable.

PC Analyst
Req. ID: 41815
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Newark-Parts Distribution
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

Production Control Analyst

Position Description

Assure inventory balances are maintained accurately in all affected systems. Conduct daily cycle count activities and reporting them appropriately to Inventory Control Management.  Performs inventory reconciliation and investigates inventory discrepancies.  Assist Inventory Control Management in implementing Inventory Control process and procedures, enforcing guidelines, and monitor inventory levels for accuracy and traceability.  Assist in inventory audits and provides necessary support to Finance.  Conduct daily inventory transactions in the ERP/MRP/MES systems to ensure inventory accuracy and provide real time data.  These transactions are performed in various internal Tesla systems. The transactions include but are not limited to inventory receipts and cost center issues, production orders, inventory location movements, and authorized adjustments. Individual will work with cross functional teams to ensure inventory control practices are being followed and assist in continuous improvement initiatives.  Interaction with Quality, Engineering, Warehouse, Production, Logistics, and Purchasing is imperative and Inventory Control management to develop and/or refine all processes related to inventory control processing and accuracy.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • Monitoring and controlling inventory integrity. 
  • Maintaining product identification and location program.
  • Researching inventory discrepancies and making necessary corrections.
  • Managing the inventory control function at the site.
  • Responsible for overseeing physical inventories/cycle counts/random or receipt audits/reconciliations.
  • Tracking, and reporting non-conforming product.
  • Resolving inventory problems in a timely manner.
  • Documenting and controlling aged & damaged product.
  • Ensuring all labeling requirements are met in a timely manner.
  • Maintaining Inventory Accuracy Metrics and associated reports for management (and client as appropriate).
  • Coordinate and Integrate efforts across operational departments to enhance inventory accuracy.
  • Regularly training site staff in proper inventory control techniques and practices.

Qualifications/Skills

  • This position requires blend of skills and experience that are specifically focused on the inventory management of several hundred manufacturing parts.
  • Inventory Control experience is required. .
  • JIT and Kanban knowledge is a plus.
  • Strong working knowledge of computerized systems (MS Office a must,)
  • Self-starter, able to work with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to lift up to 25lb.
  • Experience in utilization of the most up-to-date warehousing and inventory management methods and processes is a plus.
  • The successful candidate will possess a proven track record of successful inventory control management in a fast-pace and growing environment and will have excellent analytical, problem solving and math skills, ability to multi-task and possess a high degree of organizational, analytical, problem solving, communications, customer service and interpersonal skills.

Paint Process Manufacturing Engineer
Req. ID: 41274
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

The paint manufacturing team is within the overall manufacturing engineering group. The purpose of the team is to assess the current manufacturing capabilities of Tesla paint processes, determine the most effective methods to implement equipment capacity and capability upgrades, and successfully implement these activities.

Responsibilities

  • Use a data-based approach to identify and quantify paint process modifications that are necessary to reach given production requirements.
  • Provide technical solutions and lead engineering sub-contractors in the process design, layout, and construction of new paint equipment.
  • Seek out, investigate, trial, and evaluate new paint equipment technologies. Focus on non-standard solutions and equipment that has not been used in production environments.
  • Support capital cost, schedule, and labor planning.

Requirements

  • 5 years of experience with automotive painting processes: Pre-Treatment, Electro-Deposition, Prime, Paint, Curing, Sealer Application etc..
  • Detailed understanding of paint related process variables and their impact on throughput, quality, and yield rate.
  • Ability to apply engineering fundamental principles to identify and drive non-standard solutions to solve manufacturing constraints.
  • Comfortable providing clear and focused technical guidance to outside engineering resources.
  • Ability to work in rapidly changing environment with minimal guidance, self-starter.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills when working with internal groups and outside vendors.

Packaging Engineer
Req. ID: 41596
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role

The Packaging Engineer will be responsible for doing a first principles based understanding, evaluating, and specifying and prototyping packaging requirements for Tesla’s parts that may be sourced from external Suppliers as well as other Tesla manufacturing locations. The engineer will work with General Assembly Parts Requirements (Presentation, QPC, Quality, etc.) and work in conjunction with the rest of the Material Flow, Logistics and New Product Introduction teams to define, specify the Packaging requirements. The location will be based in between Fremont, with frequent travel to the Palo Alto location.

 

Responsibilities

  • Specify Packaging Requirements for Tesla parts from external Suppliers and Tesla manufacturing locations.

  • Interface with Vehicle Engineering, New Product Introduction, Packaging and Logistics team to intercept and design new Package(s) for ongoing changes.

  • Proactively monitor ensure that existing packaging solutions are meeting specified KPI’s.

  • Communicate Engineering requirements between Supply Chain and Purchasing to facilitate material planning.

  • Consolidate inputs from across Tesla into executive reviews highlighting risks and opportunities. 

  • Other duties as assigned

  • Designs and develops protective packaging containers, dunnage and unique shipping racks – domestic and international.

  • Creates drawings, specifications, samples, and written analyses of packaging for approvals.

  • Analyzes engineering drawings and specifications to determine physical requirements, quality, safety and materials needs.

 

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Manufacturing, Engineering, Packaging or equivalent work experience with evidence of exceptional ability.

  • 5-7 years’ Packaging experience preferred.

  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and able to accommodate change to scope, timeline, or focus without sacrificing execution.

  • Adept at communicating technical information to non-technical audiences.

  • Capable of creating written reports, proposals and project documentation that speaks to all levels of audience.

  • Knowledge of logistics, transportation alternatives and customer expectations.

  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes, product designs, safety, quality and workflow needs.

  • Knowledge of / experience in packaging testing related to automotive.

NPI Trials Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 36400
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Position: New Product Introduction (NPI) Trials Engineer, Gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Lead and conduct manufacturing line trials for new products or processes
  • Manage quality assurance and procedures by testing and validating systems and parts
  • Assist in establishing and implementing new validation standards, and procedures
  • Conduct Trial Preparation: Ensure part availability, line readiness, and pre-requisite data obtained and consolidated
  • Complete Trial Report: Document observations, analysis, and results, Make recommendations as needed and drive solutions. Record all issues found during trials and help drive to closure
  • Manage Trial Recovery: Ensure manufacturing lines are validated and/or restored to prior condition post-trial(s).  Evaluate the success of each trial (yield, downtime, cost, safety, etc.)
  • Serve as subject matter expert (SME) on trials to ensure proper validation procedures are followed
  • Team with cross-functional teams to evaluate the best processes roll-out
  • Maintain and follow-up on action plan(s)
  • Track all trial details in PCA tracking system for approvals
  • Participate in and provide feedback in change control meetings

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Engineering or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • 2-3 years working in a manufacturing environment
  • Skillful with electrical and computer-based tools, including precision measuring equipment, electrical test equipment, and computer databases
  • Experience with semi-automated manufacturing equipment a plus
  • Must be reliable, innovative, committed, and quality focused
  • Understands and appropriately applies principles, procedures, requirements, and policies related to specialized projects
  • Excellent written and verbal skills; Ability to communicate across cultures and geographic regions
  • Ability to communicate and coordinate activities
  • Proven ability to operate under pressure with rigid time constraints
  • Can track and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment, occasionally requiring extended hours
  • Can work closely with cross-functional departments
  • Have an aptitude to learn and incorporate new technologies
  • Ability to identify issues and make corrective measures to resolve
  • Makes well-informed, effective, and timely decisions
  • Writes in a clear, concise, and  organized manner for the intended audience
  • Able to lift 30-50 pounds

NPI Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 42005
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

NPI Technician, Gigafactory

 

The Role

 

The NPI Technician will report to the Gigafactory NPI Manager and will be responsible for performing NPI Builds, line trials and maintaining the NPI area.  This person is expected to be able to execute against provided manufacturing instructions (if available), validate their own work, check the quality of previous operations, and meet schedules.   The NPI Technician is expected to be able to provide feedback, define standard work, and suggest process improvements.  Experience with hand tools and use of semi-automated manufacturing equipment is necessary.

 

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

 

·          Perform complex and precise electro-mechanical assembly work and be able to work independently once a task is assigned, make connections with other employees, work fluidly with the team to achieve great results.

·          Typically involves a variety of operations, including troubleshooting and rework, requiring a sufficient understanding of the functional operation of the items assembled as well as the finished product.

·          Must be able to work from complex and detailed manufacturing documentation, drawings, and/or verbal and written instructions and specialized fixtures/test equipment.

·          Have a quick and flexible approach to problem solving, task juggling, and collaboration.

·          Responsible for quality activities, including self inspection, and inspection. Be comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously, interacting with multiple teams.

·          Updates production records and test results, records process improvements, and manufacturability suggestions.

·          Communicates test results, ideas and problems to supervisor and engineers.

·          Identify discrepant materials/components both in writing and verbally to supervisor.

·          Complete tasks as directed by manufacturing schedules and within standard times and maintain a clean and orderly work area.

 

Qualifications/Skills

 

·          High School diploma or equivalent.  AS degree preferred. Minimum of 4 years experience in assembly of electro-mechanical components.

·          Basic understanding of electrical systems.

·          Ability to read and understand manufacturing instructions and mechanical drawings with basic understanding of electrical systems.

·          Must have a high level of craftsmanship and attention to detail married with the ability to work quickly.

·          Basic machine shop skills desired with welding skills a plus.

·          Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.

·          Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused and have the ability to manage his/her time to juggle multiple tasks and to prioritize tasks.

·          Ability to perform repetitious duties while standing for long periods of time.

·          Ability to lift 30-50 lbs on a daily basis and to maintain a safe working environment.

NPI Supervisor, Gigafactory
