Job Type: Employee

Description

The Role - NPI Supervisor, Gigafactory1

The ideal candidate has a proven record of success creating and leading motivated teams. He/she must have a broad background with the ability to work with engineering, production team members, quality, and suppliers across a wide variety of issues. He/she will use these relationships to facilitate the implementation of production team recommended process improvements. Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required.

The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on and analytical abilities, organization skills and attention to detail. He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded.

Responsibilities

  • Build a strong, motivated production team capable of consistently delivering high quality products against aggressive production targets.
  • Empower the production team to collaborate with engineering to improve product manufacturability and line productivity.
  • Develop training programs and hiring plans for assembly team members.
  • Support issue resolution including root cause investigation & corrective action tracking.
  • Ensure quality standards are being met throughout the entire production process and support no defects from leaving a station or team area.
  • Develop & maintain Standardized Manufacturing Instructions used in production assembly by the assembly team members.

Requirements

  • 3+ year experience managing teams of people
  • Experience in selecting and developing new team members
  • Ability to work with and develop production performance metrics (efficiency, quality, safety, throughput, costs)
  • Able to work well under pressure while managing competing demands and tight deadlines
  • Communicate clearly using excellent written and verbal skills
  • Strong organization skills with meticulous attention to detail
  • Fluent with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

NPI Program Manger, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 42284
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

 

 

About Tesla

 

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

The Role

 

NPI Program Manager

 

The NPI Program Manager will be responsible for the introduction of new products/processes into the Tesla Energy product lines at the Gigafactory in Reno, NV.  This includes managing the project from early prototype builds through to the launch of the production line, and requires an exceptional capacity for cross functional interaction and leadership.

 

The NPI Program Manager will manage a cross functional team to develop program schedules, track their progress against these plans, and ensure new products are brought to market on time with exceptional quality, performance and cost.  Items critical to the success of the NPI Program Manager include: 

  • Knowing what and who your resources are and how to effectively utilize them
  • Understanding how decisions in one area impact other departments and operational goals
  • Meeting with smaller groups to make sure everyone is making progress against the plan and on specific actions
  • Ensuring resources are allocated where needed
  • Tracking details and managing actions to closure

 

Responsibilities

  • Manage the cross functional team to ensure successful launches of new products into the Gigafactory
  • Lead Change Control Meetings to coordinate all engineering changes and new product launches
  • Drive material readiness with supply chain and material planners
  • Set build plans and evaluate constraints
  • Provide direction to trial engineers for priorities and trial requirements
  • Perform cost analyses to reduce product cost and manage inventory
  • Aid in the development and roll-out of NPI structure and processes
  • Coordinate with process and quality engineers to support new product roll outs

Requirements

  • B.S. in Engineering, M.S or MBA preferred but not required
  • Min. 4-5 yrs. Experience in mix of engineering and Project Management fields
  • Experience in Production/Manufacturing environment
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Can communicate with technical and non-technical team members effectively
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and manage large teams
  • Works well under pressure and can manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Ability to adapt to changes quickly

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Description

Position: NPI Program Manger

The NPI Program Manager will be responsible for representing operations during the engineering design phase of new Tesla products and managing early new product builds in Palo Alto, CA.  This includes managing the project from initial design through early prototype builds and transferring learning to the production sites.  The NPI Program Manager requires an exceptional capacity for cross functional interaction and leadership.

 

The NPI Program Manager will manage a cross functional team to develop program schedules, track their progress against these plans, and ensure new products are brought to market on time with exceptional quality, performance and cost.  Items critical to the success of the NPI Program Manager include: 

  • Knowing what and who your resources are and how to effectively utilize them
  • Understanding how decisions in one area impact other departments and operational goals
  • Meeting with smaller groups to make sure everyone is making progress against the plan and on specific actions
  • Ensuring resources are allocated where needed
  • Tracking details and managing actions to closure

 

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the cross functional team to ensure successful early prototype builds of new products and transferring learnings to production facilities
  • Lead build meetings to coordinate all aspects of prototype builds, set build plans and evaluate constraints
  • Drive material readiness with supply chain and material planners
  • Provide direction to trial engineers for priorities and trial requirements
  • Perform cost analyses to reduce product cost and manage inventory
  • Aid in the development and roll-out of NPI structure and processes
  • Coordinate with process and quality engineers to support new product roll outs
  • Work with production facilities, both internal and suppliers, to transition to production rate builds (some travel will be required)

 

Requirements:

  • B.S. in Engineering, M.S or MBA preferred but not required, or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • Min. 4-5 yrs. Experience in mix of engineering and Project Management fields
  • Experience in Production/Manufacturing environment
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Can communicate with technical and non-technical team members effectively
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and manage large teams
  • Works well under pressure and can manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Ability to adapt to changes quickly

Senior Data Platform Site Reliability Engineer
Req. ID: 38202
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla 

Tesla's mission is to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable transportation. Our Model S is the world’s first premium sedan engineered as an electric vehicle from the ground up. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of highly inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and strong technical contribution at all levels. We hire and develop top talent from across the world.

Role 

At Tesla, rapid, data-driven innovation is a way of life and we're not just optimizing CTRs, we're optimizing miles per kWh and kWh per dollar. We rely on data – lots of data – to improve autopilot, to optimize the design of future platforms (e.g. Model 3), to proactively detect faults, and to optimize load on the electrical grid (Tesla Energy). Data is collected from each of our cars, superchargers and stationary batteries and used to make these fleets better and our customers safer.

We're the small but fast growing team which owns the platform for fleet time-series data, and the core analysis that needs to be run on that data. Our stack is used by hundreds of engineers daily and supports a range of customer-facing data services. We're looking for a highly skilled devops engineer to join us as a foundational member of the team and to provide leadership in all areas that relate to operations and reliability. You'll be integrated within the data platform team and work directly with data engineers and data scientists to address the challenges we face now, and to prepare for the scale that Model 3 will bring.

 

Responsibilities

  • manage infrastructure, both cloud and in-house
  • lead architectural changes that improve uptime and operational efficiency (e.g. containerization)
  • build tools that streamline development and deployment
  • develop monitoring and alerting, both technically and culturally 
  • define capacity management and scaling strategies


Requirements

  • have built and maintained highly-available distributed applications
  • have worked with diverse stacks, including both state-full and stateless services
  • strong predilection for automation (Chef, Puppet, Ansible)
  • strong scripting and experience building diverse, robust tooling
  • kick-ass sys admin
  • smart but humble, with a bias for action


Plus

  • have designed and built diverse and highly-available distributed services from the ground up
  • experience building, scaling and supporting Hadoop clusters
  • cloud experience (AWS)
  • proficiency in Java and Python
  • experience in data-driven capacity planning
  • experience defining and supporting continuous integration and deployment

<< Back to Search Results

Senior Controls Engineer
Req. ID: 26674
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: N/A
Job Type: Full time

Description

About Tesla Motors:

Tesla Motors is a fast-moving and constantly-innovating young company in the San Francisco Bay Area.  We design and manufacture advanced electric vehicles, battery packs, and drive systems that are changing the future of transportation. We are building technically strong, fast-moving teams that pride themselves on superior execution.

 

Our Mission:

Tesla Motors designs and sells high-performance, highly efficient electric sports cars.  Our cars combine style, acceleration, and handling with advanced technologies that make them among the quickest and the most energy efficient cars on the road.

 

Department:

Powertrain Manufacturing Engineering

 

Job Title and Description:

 

Senior Controls Engineer

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated Senior Controls Engineer to contribute to the design and development of new automation equipment and assembly lines for our advanced electric Powertrain production.  These are critical components of the Tesla electric drivetrain and contribute greatly to our powertrain business.  This is an exciting opportunity to build a world class manufacturing facility right here in the Bay Area.  Tesla Motors is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Roles and Responsibilities:

The Senior Controls Engineer will work to develop machine and process concepts along with several Manufacturing Engineering peers. Candidate will create a robust system architecture to support the concept, and then layout electrical/pneumatic schematics. Once the electrical panel is built, he/she will program all controls components such as PLC, safety devices, HMI, servo drives, process hardware and robots from power-on to debug, and finally to process fine tuning and validation.

The Senior Controls Engineer will also work with cross-functional teams throughout the entire lifecycle of the product and processes.  He/She will work closely with Design Engineering, Quality and Production to bring Drivetrain components from initial design, through prototype development and finally into full production.

 

In-house equipment development:

 

  • Participate in initial equipment conceptual development and carefully balance product specifications, process requirements, layout complexity, cost, and lead-time limits.
  • Lay out new industrial electrical control panels which are NFPA79/NEC/UL508A compliant, and create electrical, pneumatic and fluid schematics.
  • Architect, write, and debug PLC ladder logic with an emphasis on generating code that is organized, structured, documented, maintainable and reusable. PLC code will interact with subsystems such as conveyors, robots, Manufacturing Execution System (MES), LabView, machine vision, and 3rd party equipment.
  • Implement (ANSI/RIA15.06/OSHA compliant) control reliable safety systems for safeguarding robots, gantries, conveyors, and other high volume manufacturing equipment.
  • Generate aesthetically simple HMI screens for complex machinery while providing sufficient feedback for troubleshooting.
  • Manage electrical cabinet builds, field wiring, pneumatic and fluid plumbing.
  • Select and size electrical and electromechanical components such as servos.
  • Introduce automated processes into production, and train and equip Sustaining Team to support automated equipment after deployment into production
  • Create machine interactions with plant-wide Manufacturing Execution System (MES) to communicate product acceptability, machine status, and process variables.

 

Outsourced automation equipment development:

 

  • Participate in specification creation, release to Vendor and quote technical evaluation
  • Manage suppliers during specification, design, buyoff and installation of automated manufacturing equipment
  • Establish test plans and control test plan execution
  • Characterize and validate new automated equipment and fixturing for deployment into production

 

Existing automation equipment refinement:

 

  • Debug and optimize automated processes to maximize cycle time and uptime.
  • Characterize and validate automated processes using a data driven statistical approach such as Capacity test, Capability test (Gage Repeatability and Reproducibility test, Cpk, etc),

 

Assembly Line Development and Implementation

 

  • Create detailed utility layouts for entire assembly lines and interface with facilities teams for implementation
  • Create data management and tracking communications network architecture and interface with cross-functional teams for product, porocesses and quality traceability control implementation

 

The ideal candidate takes pride in his/her hands-on work, analytical ability, organizational skills and attention to detail.  He/She appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed and rewarded and where individuals carry tremendous responsibility.  He/She looks forward to learning an incredible amount on the job.

 

 

Skills and Experience:

  • Proficiency with process integration and electromechanical / mechatronic systems
  • In depth knowledge of Electrical Standards (NFPA79, National Electric code, UL508A).
  • In depth knowledge of Safety standards (ANSI/RIA15.06, OSHA).
  • Advanced proficiency programming industrial equipment:
    1. Ladder logic PLCs (Allen Bradley ControlLogix, Mitsubishi Q series, GE Fanuc) and RSLogix 5000
    2. Safety PLCs (Allen Bradley ControlLogix, SmartGuard, Omron, Pilz)
    3. Human Machine Interface (HMI / GUI - AB Panelview, Mitsubishi GOT, LabView)
    4. Field bus Networks (AB DeviceNet, Ethernet IP, Safety rated field bus networks)
    5. Serial communication  (RS-232) between PLCs and instruments
    6. Ethernet communications between machine PLCs and database systems
  • Demonstrated excellence in programming PLCs. Must have a well-defined methodology for maintaining code structure and organization. Ability to program state machines for complex processes which involve multi-station parallel processing, pick and place automation, data acquisition, and PID control.  Proven ability to design fault-tolerant systems with error handling and recovery.
  • Proficiency selecting appropriate circuit protectors, wire and cable, sensors, safety hardware, PLC hardware, remote I/O, VFD and servo systems.
  • Proficiency creating detailed electrical and fluid schematics in CAD (AutoCAD Electrical preferred)
  • Proficiency programming variable frequency drives
  • Exposure to a wide variety of production machinery, industrial sensors, and equipment (LVDT and pressure transducers, dispense systems, temperature controllers, DC nutrunner torque controllers, current and power meters, etc)
  • Experience programming Cartesian, SCARA and Articulated robots is highly desired (Fanuc, Kuka, Motoman, Epson)
  • Experience with Vision systems (Cognex, Keyence, Fanuc)
  • Experience creating technical specifications for automated manufacturing equipment is highly desired
  • Experience transitioning products and processes from prototype to production desired
  • Knowledge of production quality metrics is a plus
  • Proficiency with 3D CAD packages such as with SolidWorks and CATIA is a plus

 

Qualifications:

  • BS/MS Electrical Engineering (or equivalent – Majors in: Controls and Computer Control Systems, Mechatronic Engineering, Automation Engineering, etc.)
  • 5+ years of experience as a hands-on Controls Engineer or Applications Engineer working on automation and/or electromechanical systems.

 

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

To be considered for this position, please submit your resume AND cover letter to MechanicalDriveSystems@tesla.com

2.            Tell us about your favorite achievement.  This could be something you accomplished at work or personal, but should be technical in nature.  If possible, please include a small portfolio of work in your email.    

-          Perform sensitivity analysis to manufacturing, production, and EOL validation
-          Perform mass, CG, and inertia tradeoff analysis

Senior Automation System Design Engineer
Req. ID: 34828
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Position Description:

As part of the Material Flow Engineering team, the Sr. Automation Systems Design Engineer will be responsible for designing new automated material handling solutions for quick and efficient flow of parts from the receiving dock to point of consumption at the manufacturing/assembly line. These solutions will initially be planned and implemented at the Tesla Factory located in Fremont, California, but will eventually be implemented in all factories built by Tesla globally.  Tesla is looking for an individual that has the ability to apply different technologies into highly automated material handling solutions that support the reduction of vehicle build cycle time while optimizing space utilization and increase the delivery speed to the line.  This position will be based in Fremont, California at the Tesla Model SX and 3 manufacturing location and will report to the System Design Manager of the Material Flow Engineering team.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

  • Develop automated material handling solutions that support Tesla's goal of creating highly automated manufacturing facilities.

  • Initiate the development of new innovative applications that push the limits of current technologies to meet Tesla's requirements for operating speed and density

  • Compare different possible solutions based on first principle reasoning starting with only physical limitations.

  • Lead and guide the data analysis that is required to establish system design criteria (Excel and Access knowledge is important).

  • Develop material flow charts that serve as the core design tool and serves as the plan of record for the design and budget, ROI calculations, manual labor content, equipment capacity and throughput requirements.

  • Provide inputs, guidance and validation to simulate and prove the validity of the concept

 

Qualifications/Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Industrial, Mechanical, or similar

  • 6-10 years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics experience desirable.

  • In depth knowledge of material handling technologies such as conveyor systems, automated storage and retrieval systems (crane and shuttle based systems), robotics, automated guided vehicles, mobile robots, etc.

  • Strong working knowledge of and experience with material flow strategies, material handling and dynamic manufacturing systems

  • Understanding of material flow methodologies including sequencing, kitting, repack, etc.

  • Ability to work cross functionally between engineering, production, and supply chain personnel.

  • Experience in the project management of moderately sized capital equipment systems

  • Strong analytical and organizational skills. Ability to manage multiple ambiguous projects at the same time with a moderate degree of variation and uncertainty.

  • Natural ability to speak, write and communicate effectively at all organizational levels, and present to senior management

  • Ability to perform well and grow under limited supervision

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in Engineering, Business or related program preferred

Senior Antenna Engineer, Infotainment
Req. ID: 34984
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Antenna Engineer, Infotainment

About Tesla
Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role
Tesla Motors is seeking an RF Engineer who has had 3-5 years of design, test and release responsibility for Radio, Cellular, Wifi and Bluetooth antennas. This engineer should have a strong understanding of the design of antennas, RF testing, and definition and specification of requirements for automotive antennas. This engineer will also be a technical and process mentor for other engineers in the team and the company. This engineer must thrive in a start-up company environment with great opportunities for growth and spectacular achievement.

Responsibilities
• Previous experience in RF product development
• Responsible for RF antennas from inception to end of life
• Work with suppliers on design and testing of Infotainment related RF antennas
• Technical and Product Management skills and interface with suppliers
• Testing of RF systems for Tesla vehicles and different markets
• System and vehicle integration experience
• Ability to plan, execute, interpret, and document validation testing
• Component and system level troubleshooting skills
• Interpret and manage drawings and specifications

Requirements
• Bachelors, Masters or PhD. in Engineering with minimum 5 years of experience with developing products from scratch.
• Have solid technical depth in RF products
• Be skilled working with cross functional team-members from multiple disciplines to reach fact-based decisions
• Ability to communicate and drive suppliers
• Strong problem solving skills and desire to work in fast paced environment
• Hands-on experience designing and debugging products
• Previous CAD exposure
• Have experience with environmental constraints (temp, humidity, and vibration), regulatory compliance and product debug (EMC/EMI, ESD, transients, etc).
• Have solid technical depth and breadth in analog and digital circuit analysis
• Be able to work closely with design, software, firmware, testing and manufacturing teams

Seating Development Trimmer / Master Trimmer? 901 Page
Req. ID: 36953
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont-901 Page
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Seating Development Trimmer / Master Trimmer–  901 Page

 

About Tesla

Palo Alto, California-based, Tesla Motors uses proprietary technology, world-class design, and state-of-the-art manufacturing processes to create a new generation of highway capable electric vehicles. We utilize an innovative distribution model based on Company-owned sales and service centers. This approach allows us to maintain the highest levels of customer experience and benefit from short customer feedback loops to ensure our customer needs are fulfilled. We believe our operational infrastructure provides us with a competitive advantage compared to traditional automobile manufacturers.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

 

Responsibilities

  • Ability to produce highest quality Master Trim patterns
  • Development of production Trim Covers
  • Able to work from Concept Drawings, CAD data, and prototype foams/frames
  • Production of First off Samples to help develop style intent and establish feasibility. 
  • Liaise with suppliers to communicate, discuss, validate and implement new trim designs and concepts
  • Manufacturing liaison to ensure production buy in and approval of new designs
  • Production Process Development to ensure repeatability (care points etc.)
  • Resolution of Open issues arising from production builds, testing etc
  • Check/Balance of digitized Trim Patterns vs Master Patterns.
  • Communication of trim patterns / data to external suppliers + internal customers. 

 

Skills / Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of trim development process and best practices
  • Knowledge of trim limitations and production constraints when establishing feasibility
  • Knowledge of Trim retention methods and best practices
  • Ability to use sewing machines + associated equipment
  • Knowledge of different types of threads + Applications (join, decorative, airbag)
  • Ability to use different types of sew seams (single, twin, top stitch etc.)
  • Knowledge of Leather (material characteristics, processing and production techniques)
  • Knowledge of other trim materials (Foams, laminates, cloth, alcantara, PVC, carpet)
  • Knowledge and understanding of adhesives + bonding techniques
  • Ability to sculpt 3D foams to support production of initial samples
  • Ability to read Prototype CAD drawings
  • Knowledge of pattern digitisation process + equipment 
  • Evidence of exceptional ability

Sales Engineer
Req. ID: 38006
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

Tesla Energy Sales Engineer, Various Locations

 

Tesla Motors, headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, develops high-performance electric vehicles and electric powertrain technology.  The mission of Tesla Motors is to increase the efficiency and reduce the environmental impact of transportation energy use by accelerating the spread of electric vehicle technology to as many people as possible.  Electric cars are only as clean as the grids that charge them, and using the same powertrain technology, Tesla has developed a business unit to address the increasing need for Tesla Energy battery systems, which allow for even higher levels of renewable generation. The suite of grid-connected battery systems developed by Tesla perform a variety of high value functions for utilities, businesses, and residential customers, and the fast-growing team is adding top team members for engineering, business, and sales.

The Tesla Energy team is small, committed, and fast moving. As a member of our team, you will help to shape the success of our projects with various customers worldwide.  You must have a genuine passion for engineering products that will fundamentally change the world’s energy infrastructure and must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. 

 

The Role

Be a key technical member of the commercial team that focuses on evaluating and defining new Tesla Energy sales opportunities, and working to deploy product against them.  

 

The Sales Engineer will:

  • Work with prospective customers to identify best commercial and technical fit of Tesla’s battery systems by creating and defining the business case
  • Work closely with Jr. Solutions/Sales Engineer to complete the financial and preliminary site design for customers
  • Work with the customer and sales team to negotiate contracts
  • Understand regional energy markets and utilities, define and disseminate functional requirements with internal business and engineering colleagues
  • Work with the sales team to evaluate new market segments and perform analysis of storage potential.
  • Participate in on-going proceedings related to tariffs and market mechanisms to inform / update modeling processes.
  • Evaluate integration context for battery systems and work with internal team members to make integration recommendations
  • Maintain responsible control over preliminary design activities pertaining to the opportunity/ project, including engineering, quality control, and code compliance
  • Provide guidance to internal stakeholders on customer construction logistics, site preparation, material and labor costs to ensure high value design

 

This is multi-faceted role where strong knowledge of engineering fundamentals – mechanical, electrical, and thermal – is expected. Besides a rock-solid work ethic and a strong team oriented personality, members of our team display creativity, passion, and a desire to break new ground in a constantly shifting technology landscape.

 

Background

  • Top-tier academic background (electrical engineering preferred)
  • Demonstrated experience in analysis to solve complex problems
  • Demonstrated experience related to energy markets and utilities
  • Demonstrated experience working with utilities on generation development and interconnection
  • Demonstrated experience working on energy solutions for commercial and industrial customers
  • Ability to review contracts and technical scopes of work
  • Ability to breakdown complex engineering ideas for customers new to storage
  • Ability to execute many projects and tasks in parallel
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills
  • Deep passion for changing the way we use energy on the electric grid

 

Requirements

  • BS/MS
  • 7+ years work experience in the energy industry
  • Superior knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel, Work, & Powerpoint), CRM (Salesforce.com)
  • Ability to keep track of quickly-changing market conditions regarding storage funding, product development, and competitive landscape.
  • Ability to prioritize and execute many tasks in parallel
  • Familiarity with financial analyses
  • Professional fluency in English and the language(s) of the assigned region, additional languages a plus
  • Knowledge of battery systems, power conversion, and grid systems

Return to Work Specialist
Req. ID: 40215
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Full time

Description

 

 

THE ROLE

The Return to Work Specialist will provide partnership and leadership to various business units at Tesla Motors, Inc. including HR, EH&S & Tesla’s benefits team.  The successful candidate will assist in administering a stay at work program as well as programs to support employees returning to work after a work-related or personal injury. The Return to Work Specialist is the focal point for all contact and review, particularly with the injured worker, their supervisor, treating doctor, and rehabilitation provider if necessary.  This role will be responsible for supervising, defining and creating the modified duty production schedule, partnering with employees to meet work restrictions and educating employees and managers on the requirements of the return to work process. This role will also work closely identifying new projects to build effective plans to mitigate risk by analyzing data trends. This role is based in Fremont, CA.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop and directs the strategic implementation plans to assist managers and employees with work modification and transitional return to work plans for work-related or personal injuries and illnesses

  • Acts as liaison between benefits, EH&S, employees, workers compensation vendor and onsite medical staff

  • Provide supervision to employees in light duty positions to hit daily and monthly targets, including time management and performance management

  • Monitor employees progress at work and trigger review of work modifications

  • Meet with HR, managers, Integrated Disability Analyst and workers compensation carriers to review, evaluate and discuss specific problems and concerns

  • Coordinate and manage job duty evaluations; make recommendations to EH&S with concerns regarding work-place hazards

  • Develop and deliver training to managers, supervisors, HR and employees on the Return to Work program and process.

  • Collect data and prepare reports

 

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years’ experience in a human resources role in the workers’ compensation field with a good understanding of workers’ compensation insurance and claims or evidence of exceptional ability and experience.

  • Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability

  • Project management experience

  • Experience developing and rolling out a return to work/stay at work program

  • Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills

  • Proficient understanding and knowledge of Microsoft Office products including Access, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.  Familiarity with other data management systems is a plus

  • Must possess excellent written and verbal communication abilities, including effective presentation skills to all levels of the organization

  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to multi-task are required

  • Ability to work independently as well as perform in a strong team environment

Reliability Engineer - Field Reliability
Req. ID: 35551
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Reliability Engineer – Field Reliability (various levels)

We’re looking for exceptional Reliability Engineers that will focus on the Field Reliability activities for Tesla Products.

Responsibilities:          

  • Utilize reliability statistics to identify reliability trends in the field and provide a clear snapshot of risk.
  • Develop and maintain a meaningful set of KPIs for field Reliability performance.
  • Drive focus and priorities for cross functional teams that work on resolving field reliability issues.
  • Create warranty and end of life forecasts to provide visibility to finance, service, manufacturing, re-manufacturing, purchasing, supply chain and other teams that are impacted from field replacements.
  • Identify the most appropriate data metric to create meaningful reliability analyses, ranging from simple time or miles analysis to big data physics of failure driven metrics
  • Facilitate root cause investigations for reliability issues, with major focus on a data driven approach.
  • Set Reliability goals for products and their subsystems in the field and measure against progress.
  • Analyze usage and environmental conditions from the field in order to improve requirement setting and testing methods.
  • Create Fault Trees and reliability block diagrams to assess system reliability.
  • Collaborate with failure analysis to understand root cause and drive resolution for failures originating from the field. Work with manufacturing quality, service engineering, supplier quality and design teams to facilitate field failure resolution.
  • Conduct in-depth Life Data Analyses (e.g. Weibull) in order to support investigations.
  • Provide reliability design and process guidelines based on field findings and maintain a knowledge base of reliability lessons learned to enable continuous improvement.
  • Facilitate Design FMEA sessions in cases where reliability improvement for an existing product is required.
  • Set up Designed Experiments (DOE) to support field issue replication and countermeasure efforts.

Desired skills:

  • Good understanding of reliability statistics including Weibull Analysis.
  • Knowledge of the ReliaSoft Synthesis Platform, including Weibull++, BlockSim, ALTA, RGA, and xFMEA.
  • Knowledge of Fault Trees and reliability block diagram theory for to system reliability modeling.
  • Working knowledge of a coding language, preferably Python.
  • Knowledge of database structures and practical understanding and use of SQL. Experience in working with large data sets.
  • Knowledge of reliability warranty analysis and reliability prediction methods, including parametric and non-parametric methods.
  • Understanding of fleet reliability monitoring metrics and reliability KPIs.
  • Working knowledge of applied statistics and experience with statistical software such as JMP.
  • Knowledge of reliability growth techniques, such as Duane, Crow-AMSAA and Crow Extended.
  • Working knowledge of failure analysis techniques such as optical microscopy, SEM, CT, X-Ray, EDS.
  • Basic understanding of physics of failure.
  • Understanding of Monte Carlo Simulation.
  • Experience and ability to lead cross-functional teams and communicate clearly.
  • Good understanding of Designed Experiments theory and application.
  •  Experience with facilitating FMEAs.
  • ASQ Certified Reliability Engineer preferred.
  • Minimum requirement is a Bachelor of Science in Engineering. Preferably one or more years of industry experience in a reliability engineering role. Master’s or PhD degree in Reliability Engineering or related discipline desired. Level of Role depends on experience and qualifications (Associate, Senior, Staff etc) 

Previous Applicants:

Job Type: Employee

Description

Position: Recycling Specialist, Gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets.
  • Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others, and support team to reach common goals.
  • Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards.
  • Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures.
  • Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to Supervisor.
  • Complete safety training and certifications.
  • Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.
  • Physical activities: Work may require lifting up to 50 pounds, stooping, climbing, prolonged standing, and prolonged sitting. Employee use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is required in certain areas. Such PPE includes but is not limited to head, foot, hand, torso, respiratory, vision and hearing protective devices.
  • Operating heavy equipment including cardboard bailers.

Requirements

  • 1 year or more prior recycling, custodial or grounds maintenance experience
  • Ability to move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing up to 50 pounds.
  • Clean background check.
  • Previous forklift operating experience preferred.

Recruiting Manager (High Volume), Gigafactory
Req. ID: 39086
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role

A great recruiter stands apart by excelling at talent identification, attraction and assessment, and by developing deep partnerships with the business and within HR. An extraordinary recruiter stands out by doing all of the above combined with strong business savvy, a passion for their craft, and a genuine commitment for providing an unforgettable candidate experience.

You’ll thrive at Tesla by striking the right balance between flexibility and efficiency, project management and influencing. One hire at a time, we are finding the talent responsible for changing the world of energy and transportation and moving us forward to a more sustainable future.

When you’re doing something nobody has ever done before, the old ways can frequently come up short. At Tesla, you’ll get the opportunity to be creative, to try, to fail, to learn and to succeed. You will have an appetite for risk, for taking that big bet, because that’s how we leap ahead together.

In this role, you will partner with our Manufacturing & Operations functions at our Gigafactory as we develop and produce batteries for significantly less cost using economies of scale, innovative manufacturing, reduction of waste, and the simple optimization of locating most manufacturing process under one roof. Tesla broke ground on the Gigafactory in June 2014 outside Sparks, Nevada, and we expect to begin cell production in 2017. By 2020, the Gigafactory will reach full capacity and produce more lithium ion batteries annually than were produced worldwide in 2013. Our Gigafactory is growing quickly, and you will help us seek the best talent in: Supply Chain, Product Excellence, Production, Materials, Process/Equipment Engineering, New Product Introduction, Facilities and EPC (Engineering, Procurement & Construction).

Read more about the Gigafactory here: https://www.teslamotors.com/gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy

  • Shepherding the time and resources at your disposal effectively and keeping your business partners up to speed on a regular basis

  • Using a variety of techniques to discover and attract the best passive talent– we’re looking for a lot of unicorns

  • Conducting thorough behavioral based interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline as well as skills be successful in the Tesla environment

  • Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity

Requirements

  • High Volume Recruiting experience

  • 5+ years of experience managing teams

  • BS/BA or equivalent exceptional business experience 

  • Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing talent

  • Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and business partners, helping them navigate the sources of talent and assisting them with assessment

  • A genuine interest in technology as shown by continuous learning throughout your career

  • Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation and employment market trends

  • The ability to lead projects to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality

  • A combination of corporate and agency/executive search experience is preferred

Real-time Rendering Engineer - Maps & Navigation
Req. ID: 38670
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

The Role:

We are looking for a motivated real-time rendering engineer to help us advance our maps and navigation rendering in our cars. Maps and navigation already play a crucial role in turn-by-turn navigation.  But this is just the first step. We are aiming to build the world’s best in-car maps and navigation experience by taking full advantage of our 17-inch display, graphics hardware, and recent advances in map data. The ideal candidate is self-driven and looks forward to solving challenging problems. In-car maps and navigation relies heavily on rendering technologies like OpenGL. The ideal candidate is an expert with OpenGL/DirectX and can use it to create real-time rendering techniques such as deferred rendering, shadow mapping/volumes, HDR, ambient-occlusion, particle systems for snow, rain, etc. We are looking for engineers that can write rendering engines like Unity and Unreal, not simply those engineers that use them as a black box.

 

Responsibilities:

 

 

  • Write GLSL shaders to implement specific real-time rendering effects for maps
  • Design and implement real-time rendering techniques.
  • Design, code, and debug software running on Linux-based development platforms.
  • Diagnose and fix performance issues related to memory/disk footprint, frame rate, and network bandwidth.
  • Work with a cross-functional team of hardware engineers, application/UI software engineers, QA/Validation, and designers.

Requirements:

 

 

  • Proficient in C and C++.
  • Proficient in OpenGL and OpenGL ES2.
  • Experience writing and shipping real-time rendering techniques, like shadow maps, etc.
  • Good understanding of the rendering pipeline, from the perspective of an engineer building a game rendering engine.
  • High standards for code quality, maintainability, and performance.
  • Experience with video game rendering architectures is a plus.

R&D Shop Processor
Req. ID: 38877
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Palo Alto-Deer Creek-Office
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

R&D Shop Processor

The Role

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated Shop Processor to provide support to the Powertrain R&D and Engineering Team. Join a fast paced and rapidly growing team that works on the most advanced battery, motor, gear box, and drive inverter components. Integrate Tesla’s advanced Powertrain components into new vehicles. You will be working closely with some of the best engineers, fabricators and machinists.  This is an entry level position with a lot of room for growth.

 

Responsibilities

  • Support the R&D Machine and Fabrication Shop Team as needed.
  • Saw Material
  • Use power tools to deburr or finish parts
  • Grind welds and hand finish parts
  • Operate CNC Machines when needed
  • The successful candidate for this position takes pride in his/her hands-on capabilities, sense of urgency, and attention to detail. 
  • He/she appreciates an environment where superior work is encouraged, noticed, and rewarded. 
  • Excellent attendance is crucial for the team to achieve success.
  • The ideal candidate has a proven record of success in a hands-on manufacturing environment. 
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla.

Requirements

  • High School diploma or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.
  • The candidate should have hands-on experience and proven track record in production in any high quality cutting edge products.
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Manual machining is a plus
  • Production environment with team involvement
  • Use of assembly equipment and tooling (power tools, automated equipment)
  • Possible weekend work and overtime required

Mental Attributes

  • Ability to learn quickly and self-motivated
  • Positive energy and attitude
  • Poise when confronted with sudden setbacks or stressful situations
  • Willingness to operate in a dynamic environment and team structure

Communication

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and people skills, comfortable presenting ideas and issues to peer groups and leaders
  • Escalates functional and process failures to the appropriate support groups and leaders
  • Capable to develop and follow non-verbal communication (visual management: signs, work place organization, and pictures)

Physical Attributes

  • Ability to perform physical work for extended periods of time
  • Use of complex tooling that requires specialized training
  • Wearing Personal Protective Equipment: safety glasses, vests, shoes, hard hats

Quality

  • Understands and ensures adherence to required procedures and processes
  • Evaluates the manufacturing processes and equipment to look for continuous improvement opportunities

Continuous Improvement

  • Assist in the process design and tooling improvements – comfortable in suggesting and implementing new ideas that improve quality, reduce cost, support production work environment
  • Understands that there are always new opportunities for improvement and eliminating waste

Req. ID: 36928

Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

ROLE

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated Additive Manufacturing Programmer/Operator to program and operate SLA/SLS/FDM equipment in our highly advanced Rapid Prototyping operation.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Blend power, add resin and change material canisters on the Additive Manufacturing equipment
  • Break-out parts from builds, remove supports, and finish parts as required
  • Perform daily maintenance on machines
  • Turn machines and prepare for the next build

SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITES

  • Program/operate 3D Systems SLA and SLS machines
  • Program/operate Fortus 450 FDM machines
  • Operate, control, and optimize multiple Rapid Prototyping processes from CAD file to finished part

REQUIREMENTS

  • 1+ years operating and working in Rapid Prototyping / machining / fabrication environments
  • Ability to lift 50-80 lbs. without assistance
  • Ability to work with limited supervision
  • Willingness to learn new processes and procedures
  • Willingness to work overtime and/or weekends as required, with little to no advance notice, and at times for extended periods

SKILLS

  • Passionate about rapid prototyping and hardware development
  • Positive work ethic
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Flexible, ability to work in a fast pace constantly changing environment with long hours and tight deadlines
  • CAD experience a plus
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook

R&D Fabricator
Req. ID: 39775
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

R&D Entry Level Fabricator

The Role:

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated and inherently talented Fabricator and Welder to assist the prototyping fabrication department. The role is designed to both benefit the fabricator with hands on experience and aid other senior fabricators in an advanced prototyping facility. Join a fast paced and rapidly growing team that works on the most advanced battery, motor, gear box, and drive inverter components.  Work closely with experienced fabricators in accomplishing difficult goals on tight deadlines.

 

Responsibilities

  • Assist the shop with general upkeep
  • Aid in unloading and loading of material and project storage
  • Material preparation, grinding / sanding
  • Assist in material acquisition and cutting material for projects
  • Weld in all positions: vertical, horizontal, flat, and overhead
  • Set up welding equipment (amperage, voltage, wire speed, etc) maximizing efficiency and effectiveness per application
  • Work overtime and weekends (if required)
  • Record the consumption of material and supplies
  • Record and track daily operations
  • Maintain a clean, safe, and organized work area
  • Report to, and provide feedback to senior fabricators on design and process improvement

 

Requirements

  • High school diploma or GED
  • Formal fabrication or welding training
  • Minimum of 1 year of full time welding experience
  • Minimum of 1 year of metal fabrication (tube bending, sheet metal, chassis work)
  • Proficient with a forklift
  • Proficient with hand tools (Drills, air tools, angle grinders)
  • Proficient with basic machines (Shears, saws, belt sander, grinding wheel)
  • Strong work ethic
  • Remain humble and teachable
  • Excel in a team based environment
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Highly motivated
  • Positive energy and attitude
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Flexible, ability to work in a fast pace constantly changing environment with long hours and tight deadlines

Mental Attributes

  • Ability to learn quickly and self-motivated
  • Positive energy and attitude
  • Poise when confronted with sudden setbacks or stressful situations
  • Willingness to operate in a dynamic environment and team structure

Communication

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and people skills, comfortable presenting ideas and issues to peer groups and leaders
  • Escalates functional and process failures to the appropriate support groups and leaders
  • Capable to develop and follow non-verbal communication (visual management: signs, work place organization, and pictures)

Physical Attributes

  • Ability to perform physical work for extended periods of time
  • Use of complex tooling that requires specialized training
  • Wearing Personal Protective Equipment: safety glasses, vests, shoes, hard hats

Quality

  • Understands and ensures adherence to required procedures and processes
  • Evaluates the manufacturing processes and equipment to look for continuous improvement opportunities

Continuous Improvement

  • Assist in the process design and tooling improvements – comfortable in suggesting and implementing new ideas that improve quality, reduce cost, support production work environment
  • Understands that there are always new opportunities for improvement and eliminating waste

R&D Fabricator
Req. ID: 38876
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

R&D Fabricator

Description

The Role

Tesla is seeking a highly motivated and skilled R&D Fabricator and Welder to provide Powertrain R&D and Engineering with prototype components, assemblies, and vehicles to enhance and shorten the design/build/test process. Join a fast paced and rapidly growing team that works on the most advanced battery, motor, gear box, and drive inverter components. Integrate Tesla’s advanced Powertrain components into new vehicles. Work closely with engineers and technicians.

Responsibilities

·         Perform TIG, MIG, and CMT welding on aluminum, steel, and copper (all alloys)

·         Weld in all positions: vertical, horizontal, flat, and overhead

·         Set up welding equipment (amperage, voltage, wire speed, etc) maximizing efficiency and effectiveness per application

·         Read and interpret engineering drawings, weld symbols, and GD&T

·         Bend tubes and cope accordingly

·         Bend and weld sheet metal (aluminum and steel)

·         Prepare all materials prior to welding

·         Modify pre-existing structures (bodies, chassis, sub frames, jigs, etc) to accept new components and accommodate design changes

·         Be able to operate Manual Mills and Lathes

·         Operate and cut material on CNC plasma and oxyacetylene equipment

·         Work overtime and weekends (if required)

·         Record the consumption of material and supplies

·         Record and track daily operations

·         Maintain a clean, safe, and organized work area

         Provide feedback to engineers on design

·         High school diploma or GED

·         Weld certification (preferred)

·         Strong work ethic

Excel in a team based environment

·         Meticulous attention to detail

Positive energy and attitude

·         Strong verbal communication skills

·         Flexible, ability to work in a fast pace constantly changing environment with long hours and tight deadlines

  • Positive energy and attitude

  • Escalates functional and process failures to the appropriate support groups and leaders
  • Capable to develop and follow non-verbal communication (visual management: signs, work place organization, and pictures)

  • Evaluates the manufacturing processes and equipment to look for continuous improvement opportunities

  • Assist in the process design and tooling improvements – comfortable in suggesting and implementing new ideas that improve quality, reduce cost, support production work environment
  • Understands that there are always new opportunities for improvement and eliminating waste

Quality Technician, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 37819
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

 

Position: Quality Technician, Gigafactory

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with manufacturing and suppliers to establish processes and procedures that will ensure consistent high quality.
  • Maintain product quality plans and control plans.
  • Maintain quality performance metrics and drive issues to root cause solutions.
  • Work with Manufacturing Engineering to determine product specifications and tolerances.
  • Audit manufacturing line against released manufacturing processes and procedures.
  • Assist in the identification and resolution of manufacturing quality issues, contain parts or products as needed, sort parts for quality requirements.
  • Monitor quality, determine root cause of problems, and implement corrective actions and countermeasures.
  • Process and implement Engineering Change Orders (ECO’s) as required.
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities, with manufacturing and external suppliers.
  • Work with Supply Quality Engineering and Suppliers to develop specifications that support production requirements.
  • Take part in ongoing optimization of the products with respect to both cost and production technology.
  • Support FMEA activities to ensure design and manufacturing issues are identified and risks mitigated.
  • Provide Design for Manufacturability feedback to Engineering as well as participate in DFM reviews.
  • Analyze and disposition component and product defects as member of the Material Review Board.
  • Analyze and interpret data independently.
  • Anticipate potential problems and take preventative action.  

 

Requirements

  • Experience within quality systems in a high volume manufacturing environment.
  • Experienced in QS-9000, ISO/TS 16949, APQP, PPAP, FMEA, DFMEA, PFMEA preferred. 
  • Strong aptitude with electronic test and measurements systems.
  • Proficiency at reading and interpreting mechanical drawings and wiring diagrams.
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, ability to lift and sort parts of up to 30 pounds as needed.
  • Detail oriented with strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
  • Ability to use technological tools and business system applications to manage, synthesize, and interpret data.
  • Ability to operate relevant personal computing hardware and standard software. 
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing practices, 5S, TPS, TQM, etc highly desire

Quality Radiologist
Req. ID: 42024
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Lathrop-Manufacturing
Job Shift: Day
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role

Highly motivated individual needed full time for an industrial x-ray technician role. Applicant must have strong mechanical and computer skills, must be dependable and available to travel occasionally as needed. Must be a team motivator with acceptable communication skills. Highly organized and confident with an ability to manage projects within set deadlines. Ability to assist in the administration and smooth operation of the NDT function of the quality engineering team will be key as well as on-going cooperation with other departments and occasionally a range of internal and external stakeholders.

This full time role requires the flexibility of being able to champion training and coaching of NDT inspection of various shifts and split shifts. Additionally this role will primarily be in Lathrop, but must be willing to support in Fremont 25% of the time.

Responsibilities

  • Inspection of parts in accordance with manufacturing’s or engineering’s specifications for the interpretation of nonconformance’s found.
  • Conducting tests to ensure quality, or to detect discontinuities (defects) accurately.
  • Establish techniques for proper examination of objects under inspection.
  • Ensuring strict adherence to safety regulations of all inspection methods.
  • Set-up, calibration, and utilization of nondestructive testing equipment within department.
  • Work closely with NDT Level II & III, Design, Materials, Reliability, and Quality Engineering to evaluate and interpret indications.
  • Follow through specified test or validation criteria from quality engineering in accordance to standards, and evaluate results.
  • Organize and or audit or report personnel test results and radiation reports.
  • Perform specialized inspections and other job related tasks as assigned by quality engineering or other management.  
  • Promote and protect Tesla’s reputation as a cutting-edge company producing the world’s most exciting cars and shifting the paradigm of personal transportation worldwide.
  • Keep photo database and report archives.
  • Create and maintain equipment contacts lists for all regions.

Requirements

  • College degree or equivalent preferred but not required.
  • Experience and comfort creating spreadsheets, instructions, and presentation summaries – on deadline.
  • Excellent written and spoken English. Additional Spanish language a plus.
  • Demonstrated management skills in time, people, tasks, or resources.
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work in an extremely fast-paced environment.
  • Willing and able to travel occasionally as needed with in the USA.
  • Ability to work during other shift hours, including nights and weekends.
  • Clean, valid driving license.
  • Photoshop experience and skills with Microsoft Office packages.

Tesla Motors is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Quality Engineer, Gigafactory
Req. ID: 42349
Office Location: NA-US-NV-Sparks-Electric Avenue
Job Shift:
Job Type: Full time

Description

Responsibilities:

  • The successful candidate for this position must have a broad technical background with the ability to work with engineering, manufacturing, service and suppliers across a wide variety of issues.  Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships within Tesla and outside.
  • Development of manufacturing requirements, quality standards and product quality plans to assure products will meet expectations of our target customers.
  • Deployment of manufacturing level requirements to subsystems, assemblies & components to assure clear focus on design needs. 
  • Identification of critical requirements to assure proper supplier and production focus on critical needs.
  • Leading development of FMEAs (Design & Process) for development teams to identify critical risks to be addressed.
  • Support development of manufacturing equipment test plans to address risks identified in DFMEA.
  • Participate in design reviews to assure product subsystem quality, manufacturability, inspectability, reliability, etc.
  • Assist development with statistical tolerancing, Monte Carlo analysis and other methods to investigate the effects of part and process variability on system performance.
  • Design effective experiments through DOE or other methods to support design teams in investigation of various alternatives or in design validation testing.
  • Support process capability analyses to investigate the ability of suppliers and production processes to meet defined specifications and quality standards.
  • Manage and facilitate the root cause & corrective actions system through tracking and validation of issues and support in root cause analysis through facilitating brainstorming, use of lean methodologies, hypothesis testing, design of experiments, etc.

Requirements:

  • A Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or exidence of exceptional experience 
  • MS degree in engineering is preferred
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience
  • Experience working with complex electro-mechanical systems.
  • Specific training and demonstrated success in applying design for quality and problem solving methodologies, FMEA, process capability analysis, hypothesis testing, DoE, SPC, etc.
  • Strong background and demonstrated success applying statistical methods:
  • Minitab or other statistical software capabilities are preferred.
  • Six Sigma Black Belt certification is preferred, especially in DFSS.
  • Excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills.

Quality Engineer - Seat Manufacturing
Req. ID: 33605
Office Location: NA-US-CA-Fremont-901 Page
Job Shift:
Job Type: Employee

Description

About Tesla:

Tesla’s goal is to accelerate the world’s transition to electric mobility with a full range of increasingly affordable electric cars. California-based Tesla designs and manufactures EVs, as well as EV powertrain components for partners such as Toyota and Daimler. Model S is the world’s first premium sedan to be engineered from the ground up as an electric vehicle. Model S was named Motor Trend’s prestigious 2013 Car of the Year, achieved the best safety score of any car ever tested by the NHTSA, and Consumer Reports is calling it the best car it has ever tested.

Tesla Motors is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels.  You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate. These jobs are not for everyone, you must have a genuine passion for producing the best vehicles in the world. Without passion, you will find what we're trying to do too difficult.

The Role:

This position you will work as a member of Tesla’s Seat Manufacturing organization. The primary objective of this role is to support the production of high quality seats through the continual improvement of process and product quality and the systems that surround them.  The successful candidate for this position must be a problem-solver at his/her core, have a strong quality & customer-focused mindset, and have the personal drive and stamina for relentless, continual improvement (personally and professionally).

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate must have the ability to meet tight deadlines, have strong interpersonal and communication skills, be detail oriented, and have the ability to work independently.  He/she must establish and maintain a professional working relationship with external and internal teams at all levels across the company.  Typical job duties may include but are not limited to the following:

  • Lead cross-functional teams to drive process and product improvements.
  • Lead problem-solving teams; use of QA methodologies to manage and facilitate issue resolution including root cause investigations and the development, implementation and monitoring of effective corrective and preventive actions.
  • Develop and implement quality standards as part of the Tesla Product Excellence System to assure products meet expectations of our target customers.
  • Support the development of Design and Process FMEAs.
  • Establish and maintain control plans to assure critical features are controlled through the assembly/production processes.
  • Lead/facilitate review and disposition of discrepant materials identified for control of nonconforming product.
  • Work closely with Operations, Manufacturing Engineering, Product Engineering, Design Engineering, Suppliers, Supplier Quality, and Service teams.
  • Establish quality performance metrics and drive issues to true root cause solutions.
  • Work with Manufacturing and Design Engineering to determine product specifications and tolerances.
  • Audit manufacturing line against released manufacturing processes and procedures.
  • Assist in the identification and resolution of manufacturing product excellence issues.
  • Provide problem solving support to manufacturing and Tesla customers; assist Product Excellence department peers as requested.
  • Perform on-site analysis of product excellence-related issues; lead/perform product containment activities and arrange for disposition.
  • Assist in the development and improvement of the Product Excellence Management System.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area; follow daily housekeeping and 5S standards.
  • Promote and maintain a culture and attitude of continuous improvement, working within the Tesla team to make it more efficient, safer and an enjoyable place to work.

Essential Skills:

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills are an absolute requirement to establish effective working relationships throughout the Tesla organization.
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment to achieve common goals
  • Maintain top level professional integrity
  • People Management
  • Must have the ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Detail oriented
  • Customer focused
  • Ability to work independently
  • Strong quality mindset
  • Highly adaptable
  • Ability to establish and maintain a professional working relationship with external and internal teams at all levels across the company.

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • A Bachelor of Science degree in engineering or other technical discipline.
  • 5-10 Years of experience in JIT Seat Manufacturing facility.
  • Quality systems experience in a manufacturing environment (automotive preferred). 
  • Experienced in QS-9000, ISO/TS 16949, APQP, PPAP, FMEA, DFMEA, PFMEA required.
  • Familiarity with compliances and Legal requirement of automotive seating regulation
  • Specific training and demonstrated success in applying quality problem solving methods such as fishbone diagrams, FMEA, process capability analysis, hypothesis testing, DoE, SPC, etc.
  • Experience with various reliability test techniques including HALT and HASS testing.
  • Experience with broad variety of measurement and inspection techniques.
  • Must be very comfortable with common MS office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project) 
  • Excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills.
  • Ability and willingness to travel domestically and internationally (5% to 10%)
